original: @296b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @296b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: bi bri tti gu hy'a rtha pinda by'a khy'a /
analyzed: bi bri tti gu hy'a rtha pinda by'a khy'a /
translated: Viv·πõti-guhyƒÅrtha-pi·πá·∏çavyƒÅkhyƒÅ.

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: don gsang ba rnam par phye ba bsdus te bshad pa /
analyzed: don gsang ba rnam par phye ba bsdus te bshad pa /
translated: The concise explanation that opens the secret meaning.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.üîΩThe Bodhisattvabh≈´mi

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa ni /üîΩnyan thos la sogs pa dang / thun mong dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i yang dbang du mdzad nas mdzad do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa ni / nyan thos la sogs pa dang / thun mong dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i yang dbang du mdzad nas mdzad do //
translated: was composed by the venerable Maitreya.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i tshig gi don bcus theg pa chen po mtha' dag bsdu bar bzhed nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i tshig gi don bcus theg pa chen po mtha' dag bsdu bar bzhed nas brtsams te /
translated: This chapter is composed with ten topics that are not shared with the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so forth, intending to include the entire MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: gzhi gcig gis kyang ma yin /
analyzed: gzhi gcig gis kyang ma yin /
translated: It is not by one basis,

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa dang gnyis kyis kyang ma yin /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa dang gnyis kyis kyang ma yin /
translated: not by the two truths of conventional and ultimate,

original: brtags pa la sogs pa gsum gyis kyang ma yin /
analyzed: brtags pa la sogs pa gsum gyis kyang ma yin /
translated: not by the three of imagined and so forth,

original: dus gsum dang 'dus ma byas dang bzhis kyang ma yin /
analyzed: dus gsum dang 'dus ma byas dang bzhis kyang ma yin /
translated: not by the four of the three times and unconditioned,

original: ming la sogs pa lngas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: ming la sogs pa lngas kyang ma yin no //
translated: It is not by the five, name, etc.

original: theg pa chen po la shin tu zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la shin tu zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúWell-established in the universal vehicle‚Äù means

original: brtags pa'am yon tan phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: brtags pa'am yon tan phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: that he is either a beginner or one who is endowed with the excellences.

original: theg pa chen po nyid ni der 'gro bas na de bzhin nyid ces bya ba'i dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po nyid ni der 'gro bas na de bzhin nyid ces bya ba'i dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The universal vehicle itself is the reality that is the goal of that vehicle.

original: der zhugs pa ni sa dang po nyid la'o //
analyzed: der zhugs pa ni sa dang po nyid la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWell-established‚Äù is on the first spiritual level.

original: shin tu zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: shin tu zhugs pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúWell-advanced‚Äù is

original: kun du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir sa bcu pa la yin no //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir sa bcu pa la yin no //
translated: on the tenth spiritual level, because the obstructions to the universal vehicle are eliminated.

original: rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba'i bdag nyid kyi theg pa chen po ni mi bzung ste /
analyzed: rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba'i bdag nyid kyi theg pa chen po ni mi bzung ste /
translated: The universal vehicle, which is the subject matter of the scriptures, is not to be grasped,

original: mthar ma phyin pa yang de la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthar ma phyin pa yang de la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one who has not reached the goal is also well-established in it.

original: gzhan yang chos kyi dbyings la zhugs pa kho nas de la legs par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang chos kyi dbyings la zhugs pa kho nas de la legs par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, one is well-established in it only by being established in the reality realm.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not the reality of the transcendences,

original: de la 'jug pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the means of entering into it.

original: gzhan yang de dag kyang de rtogs pa kho nas rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dag kyang de rtogs pa kho nas rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, they are purified only by the realization of that.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature of a result, because this is the context of the bodhisattva.

original: de ltar na shin tu zhugs pa zhes smos pa yang gzhan du mi smra ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar na shin tu zhugs pa zhes smos pa yang gzhan du mi smra ba'i phyir te /
translated: Thus, the statement ‚Äúhe is one who has entered well‚Äù is not spoken of anyone else.

original: yang dag par ma zhugs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar yang brgya byin bzhin du log par yang smra ste /
analyzed: yang dag par ma zhugs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar yang brgya byin bzhin du log par yang smra ste /
translated: One who has not entered well speaks falsely even in the presence of the Lord, like ≈öatakratu.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: brgya byin gyis /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis /
translated: ≈öatakratu said:üîΩIn the end, I was ruined

original: mjug tu bdag ni nyams gyur nas //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa lta bu'o //üîΩgal te rdzas gcig bstan pa mdzad na ni de 'ba' zhig bcu pa ston nus par yid ces kyis /
analyzed: mjug tu bdag ni nyams gyur nas // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa lta bu'o // gal te rdzas gcig bstan pa mdzad na ni de 'ba' zhig bcu pa ston nus par yid ces kyis /
translated: and so on.

original: sa bcu'i dbang phyug gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sa bcu'i dbang phyug gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: If he were to teach a single substance, he would be able to teach only that, and not the other ten stages, because he would not have the power over the other ten stages.

original: spyir brjod na ni de 'dra ba'i phyir gzhan la yang yid ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyir brjod na ni de 'dra ba'i phyir gzhan la yang yid ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if he teaches in a general way, then because of that, he would be believed in regard to the other stages as well.

original: @297a * // byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: @297a * // byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The bodhisattva is one who has entered the stages.

original: byang chub dang sems can la dmigs pas na tha snyad du btags te /
analyzed: byang chub dang sems can la dmigs pas na tha snyad du btags te /
translated: It is designated conventionally as the thought of awakening because it focuses on awakening and sentient beings.

original: mi sdug pa la sogs pa bzhin no //üîΩrnam pa gcig tu na 'di la byang chub tu sems dpa' yod pa ste /
analyzed: mi sdug pa la sogs pa bzhin no // rnam pa gcig tu na 'di la byang chub tu sems dpa' yod pa ste /
translated: It is like the meditation on the impurity of the body, etc.üîΩIn one sense, the word bodhisattva refers to one in whom the thought of awakening exists.

original: sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i sgra bsam pa yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'o ;
analyzed: sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i sgra bsam pa yin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'o ;
translated: The word sattva is a nominal suffix indicating intention.

original: ; theg pa chen po'i bdag nyid brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dir theg pa chen po smos pa ni /üîΩrjod pa dang brjod par bya ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang de bzhin nyid dang / 'bras bu la yod pa yongs su bzung ste /
analyzed: ; theg pa chen po'i bdag nyid brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dir theg pa chen po smos pa ni / rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang de bzhin nyid dang / 'bras bu la yod pa yongs su bzung ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúgreat vehicle‚Äù is used here to indicate the greatness of the self of the Great Vehicle.

original: 'di thams cad kyi che ba'i bdag nyid ni zab pa dang rgya che ba bdag gis bla na med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyi che ba'i bdag nyid ni zab pa dang rgya che ba bdag gis bla na med pa nyid do //
translated: The great vehicle is the subject matter of the treatise, and the greatness of the self of the Great Vehicle is its profundity and its magnitude.

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i tshig tu grags te /
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'i tshig tu grags te /
translated: The word ‚Äúself‚Äù is known to be a word for nature and result.

original: dper na me ni tsha ba'i bdag nyid /
analyzed: dper na me ni tsha ba'i bdag nyid /
translated: For example, fire is hot by nature.

original: dug ni gsod pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dug ni gsod pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Poison is the nature of killing.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the presence of the Lord means

original: sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba nyid kyis yid ches pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba nyid kyis yid ches pa nyid du ston te /
translated: that it is taught to be credible by the very approval of the Buddha,

original: ston pa dang nyen gzhan du mi smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa dang nyen gzhan du mi smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not taught elsewhere, and because it is not far from the teacher.

original: ston pa dang mi nye ba ni sgrib pa'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir log par smra bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ston pa dang mi nye ba ni sgrib pa'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir log par smra bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it were far from the teacher, it would be false, because it would have a remainder of obscuration.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshig gi don bcu po nye bar dgod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshig gi don bcu po nye bar dgod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word thus is used to introduce the ten topics.

original: 'dir yang theg pa chen po zhes smos pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir yang theg pa chen po zhes smos pa ni /
translated: Here, the word Mahayana is used

original: brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi theg pa chen chen po la bsnyag ste /
analyzed: brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi theg pa chen chen po la bsnyag ste /
translated: in the sense of the vehicle of expression,

original: 'chad par 'gyur pa'i khyad par rnam pa bcus tha dad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' theg pa chen po gang yin pa de'i dbang du mdzad pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur pa'i khyad par rnam pa bcus tha dad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' theg pa chen po gang yin pa de'i dbang du mdzad pa yin pas /
translated: because it refers to the Mahayana scriptures of the Tathagata, which are different in ten ways from those of the disciples, as will be explained.

original: de bas na 'dir ni tshig gi rang bzhin gyi theg pa chen po la bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir ni tshig gi rang bzhin gyi theg pa chen po la bya bar mngon no //
translated: Therefore, here the Great Vehicle is understood to be the one that has the nature of words.

original: 'on kyang ci'i phyir yang theg pa chen po zhes bya ba smos she na /
analyzed: 'on kyang ci'i phyir yang theg pa chen po zhes bya ba smos she na /
translated: But why is the Great Vehicle mentioned again?

original: tshig gi don bcus thun mong ma yin par bsdu par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gi don bcus thun mong ma yin par bsdu par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is taught that it is included in the uncommon sense of the word.

original: gal te de ni don gyi bdag nyid la yang mtshungs pas 'on kyang smos par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gal te de ni don gyi bdag nyid la yang mtshungs pas 'on kyang smos par mi bya ste /
translated: If that is the same in terms of the meaning, then it should not be mentioned,

original: theg pa chen po'i bdag nyid brjod na gdon mi za bar bcu pa yang de sdud pa yin pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i bdag nyid brjod na gdon mi za bar bcu pa yang de sdud pa yin pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: because if the nature of the Great Vehicle is expressed, then it must include the ten topics.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'bras bu'i sgo nas kyang che ba'i bdag nyid du sems so //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i sgo nas kyang che ba'i bdag nyid du sems so //
translated: The greatness of the Great Vehicle is also considered in terms of its result.

original: 'di ltar theg pa chen po'i 'bras bu ni rnam pa bcu la ma gtogs pa nyan thos kyi theg pa mu stegs can dang thun mong ma yin pa zhig yod la des khyad par du 'phags so zhes bya bar yang 'dzin pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar theg pa chen po'i 'bras bu ni rnam pa bcu la ma gtogs pa nyan thos kyi theg pa mu stegs can dang thun mong ma yin pa zhig yod la des khyad par du 'phags so zhes bya bar yang 'dzin pas /
translated: Thus the result of the Great Vehicle is not shared with the listeners and the extremists, and it is superior to them.

original: nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin par @297b nges par 'chad par 'gyur bas theg pa chen po kho na bsdus so zhes bya bar de'i don du yang theg pa chen po zhes smos par bya ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin par @297b nges par 'chad par 'gyur bas theg pa chen po kho na bsdus so zhes bya bar de'i don du yang theg pa chen po zhes smos par bya ste /
translated: It is included in the Mahayana alone, since it is explained as being unshared with the sravakas.

original: de bsdus par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bsdus par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it should be called the Mahayana Abhidharma, in order to indicate that it is included in the Mahayana.

original: chos mngon pa theg pa chen po'i mdo las zhes bya ba 'dis ni tshig gi don bcu po lung dang ldan pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: chos mngon pa theg pa chen po'i mdo las zhes bya ba 'dis ni tshig gi don bcu po lung dang ldan pa nyid du ston te /
translated: This shows that the tenth topic is scriptural.

original: gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi gzhi'i bdun pa yin no //üîΩ'di ltar gsung rab las mdo ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du grags la /
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi gzhi'i bdun pa yin no // 'di ltar gsung rab las mdo ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du grags la /
translated: It is the seventh topic in terms of commonality.

original: chos mngon pa yang smos pa'i don ston par byed pa nyid du grags so //
analyzed: chos mngon pa yang smos pa'i don ston par byed pa nyid du grags so //
translated: Thus, a sutra is renowned as the word of the Buddha, and the Abhidharma is renowned as that which teaches the meaning of the scriptures.

original: gal te de ltar na mdo zhes smos pa kho nas chog mod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na mdo zhes smos pa kho nas chog mod ce na /
translated: If that is so, then it is sufficient to simply say sutra.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: mdo rnams ni drang ba'i don gyi phyir yang yin pas tshig gi don bcu po yang de bzhin du gdul ba'i dbang gis dgongs pa can gyi don ston pas drang ba'i don nyid yin par 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdo rnams ni drang ba'i don gyi phyir yang yin pas tshig gi don bcu po yang de bzhin du gdul ba'i dbang gis dgongs pa can gyi don ston pas drang ba'i don nyid yin par 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The sutras are also interpretable in meaning, so the ten topics of the words are also held to be interpretable in meaning, since they teach a meaning that is intended in accordance with the disciples.

original: chos mngon pa ni smos pa'i don ston pa lhur len pa'i phyir nges pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: chos mngon pa ni smos pa'i don ston pa lhur len pa'i phyir nges pa'i don yin no //
translated: Abhidharma is definitive in meaning, because it is intent on teaching the meaning of the words as they are stated.

original: gal te de lta na chos mngon pa zhes smos pa kho nas chog mod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na chos mngon pa zhes smos pa kho nas chog mod ce na /
translated: If that is so, it is sufficient to say ‚ÄúAbhidharma‚Äù alone.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: ye shes la 'jug pa la sogs pa bzhin du gtsug lag ma yin pa nyid du thal par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ye shes la 'jug pa la sogs pa bzhin du gtsug lag ma yin pa nyid du thal par 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would not be a treatise, like the Entry into Wisdom.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na gang gi phyir chos mngon pa zag pa med pa'i shes rab yin pa de'i phyir chos mngon pa ni phyi'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na gang gi phyir chos mngon pa zag pa med pa'i shes rab yin pa de'i phyir chos mngon pa ni phyi'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: In one sense, because the Abhidharma is uncontaminated wisdom, the Abhidharma is classified by its external characteristics.

original: zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi yul ni phyi'i mtshan nyid de bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi yul ni phyi'i mtshan nyid de bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of uncontaminated wisdom is the suchness of external characteristics.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba gang yin pa de ni mdo yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba gang yin pa de ni mdo yin te /
translated: The sutra is that which is distinguished by its own characteristics.

original: gdul pa'i dbang gis thun mong ma yin pa yang gtso bor bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul pa'i dbang gis thun mong ma yin pa yang gtso bor bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it primarily teaches the unshared Dharma for the sake of disciples.

original: de bas na chos mngon pa'i mdo ni gnyi ba'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin la /
analyzed: de bas na chos mngon pa'i mdo ni gnyi ba'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin la /
translated: Thus the Abhidharma is distinguished by both characteristics,

original: de dang 'brel pas rab tu byed pa yang gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pas rab tu byed pa yang gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: and the chapters are also of both natures because they are related to that.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na chos mngon pa ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pas rab tu phye ba yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na chos mngon pa ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pas rab tu phye ba yin la /
translated: In one sense, the Abhidharma is distinguished by the training in wisdom because it thoroughly differentiates.

original: de yang gtso bor mya ngan las 'das pa 'dren par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang gtso bor mya ngan las 'das pa 'dren par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: And that primarily leads to nirvana.

original: bslab pa gzhan gnyis ni /
analyzed: bslab pa gzhan gnyis ni /
translated: The other two trainings

original: gtsor 'dren par byed pa nyid ma yin no //üîΩmdo ni bslab pa gsum char gyis rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: gtsor 'dren par byed pa nyid ma yin no // mdo ni bslab pa gsum char gyis rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: are not primarily that which leads.üîΩThe sutra is distinguished by all three trainings

original: gdul pa'i dbang gis gsum char bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul pa'i dbang gis gsum char bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all three are taught for the sake of disciples.

original: de bas na de ni chos mngon pa dang mdo zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyi gas tha snyad gdags kyi 'dul pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de ni chos mngon pa dang mdo zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyi gas tha snyad gdags kyi 'dul pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is designated by both the terms Abhidharma and s≈´tra, but not by the term Vinaya.

original: de ni gcig @298a * //
analyzed: de ni gcig @298a * //
translated: It is one

original: tu lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems kyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: tu lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems kyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it is distinguished by superior morality and superior mind.

original: tshul khrims kyis ni rang gi dngos su yin la /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni rang gi dngos su yin la /
translated: Morality is superior in its own nature,

original: mnyam par gzhag pas ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas yin gyi bar du chod pa'i phyir shes rab kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pas ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas yin gyi bar du chod pa'i phyir shes rab kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but concentration is superior in its result, not in wisdom, because wisdom is obstructed.

original: de bas na rab tu phyed pa 'di ni chos mngon pa'i mdo dang 'brel gyi /
analyzed: de bas na rab tu phyed pa 'di ni chos mngon pa'i mdo dang 'brel gyi /
translated: Therefore, this distinction is related to the Abhidharma S≈´tra,

original: 'dul pa'i sde snod dang 'brel pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dul pa'i sde snod dang 'brel pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: but it is not related to the Vinaya Pi·π≠aka.

original: theg pa chen po zhes smos pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po zhes smos pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚ÄúGreat Vehicle‚Äù is mentioned in order to show that it is not shared with the ≈örƒÅvakas and so on.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa bcu po 'chad par 'gyur bas de dag nyid khyad par du zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa bcu po 'chad par 'gyur bas de dag nyid khyad par du zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Because it is not common to the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc., it is distinguished by the ten aspects that will be explained.

original: de dag gi khyad par du 'phags pa'i gsung ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi khyad par du 'phags pa'i gsung ngo //
translated: It is the speech that is distinguished by them.

original: brjod par bya ba med pa'i brjod pa ni thams cad khyad par med de /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba med pa'i brjod pa ni thams cad khyad par med de /
translated: The expression of the inexpressible is not distinguished in any way.

original: de lta bas na shes bya'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa don rnams kyis khyad par du byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na shes bya'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa don rnams kyis khyad par du byed do //
translated: Therefore, it is distinguished by the meanings of the statements ‚Äúthe basis of cognition,‚Äù etc.

original: shes bya ni yongs su grub pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: shes bya ni yongs su grub pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Cognition is threefold by the distinctions of the consummate, etc.

original: yongs su grub pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The consummate is also twofold:

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'o //
translated: permanent and impermanent.

original: rtag pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: rtag pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
translated: That which is permanent is called thusness.

original: de ni chos can gyi chos nyid yin pa'i phyir gnas ni chos can no //
analyzed: de ni chos can gyi chos nyid yin pa'i phyir gnas ni chos can no //
translated: Because it is the reality of the dharmin, the basis is the dharmin.

original: chos can du 'dra yang brtan pa'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kho nas gnas su rnam par gzhag gi //
analyzed: chos can du 'dra yang brtan pa'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kho nas gnas su rnam par gzhag gi //
translated: Although similar as dharmins, the basis is established only by the foundation consciousness because it is stable.

original: mi brtan pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no //üîΩde lta bas na 'dis ni de bzhin nyid ni chos can gyi chos nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi brtan pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no // de lta bas na 'dis ni de bzhin nyid ni chos can gyi chos nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not the active consciousnesses, because they are unstable.

original: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa bzhin dug gtan med pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa bzhin dug gtan med pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this passage explains that suchness is not utterly nonexistent, like the son of a barren woman, etc., because it is the reality of the basis.

original: mi rtag pa gang yin pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa gang yin pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Impermanence is also twofold:

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid dang sa bon gyi bdag nyid do //üîΩyang dag pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la rag las te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid dang sa bon gyi bdag nyid do // yang dag pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la rag las te /
translated: the nature of correct knowledge and the nature of seeds.

original: 'byung ba'i phyir gnas kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i phyir gnas kho na yin no //
translated: Correct knowledge is the basis of suchness, because it arises in dependence on the consciousness that is the store of all the seeds.

original: sa bon gyi bdag nyid kyang rang bzhin du gnas pa dang yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sa bon gyi bdag nyid kyang rang bzhin du gnas pa dang yang dag par bsgrubs pa dang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The nature of seeds is twofold: naturally existing and acquired.

original: gnyis ka yang len pa'i rnam par shes pa dang ltan cig 'jug pa'i phyir de dag gi gnas yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang len pa'i rnam par shes pa dang ltan cig 'jug pa'i phyir de dag gi gnas yin pa nyid do //
translated: Both are the basis of suchness, because they occur together with the appropriating consciousness.

original: gzhan gyi dbang yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The other-dependent pattern is also twofold:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang dag pa 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang dag pa 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: the defiled and the pure mundane.

original: @298b dag pa 'jig rten pa ni len pa'i rnam par shes pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir de'i gnas yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: @298b dag pa 'jig rten pa ni len pa'i rnam par shes pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir de'i gnas yin pa kho na'o //
translated: The pure mundane is the basis of the other-dependent pattern only because it is associated with the appropriating consciousness.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The defiled is also twofold:

original: rnam par shes pa bdun gyi tshogs kyis bsdus pa dang / kun gzhi rnam pa shes pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdun gyi tshogs kyis bsdus pa dang / kun gzhi rnam pa shes pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: that subsumed in the group of the seven consciousnesses and that subsumed in the store consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa bdun gyi tshogs kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdun gyi tshogs kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That subsumed in the group of the seven consciousnesses is the basis of the other-dependent pattern only when it is associated with the appropriating consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dag phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dag yin yang len pa'i rnam par shes pa ni brtan pa'i phyir /üîΩlen pa'i rnam par shes pa kho na gnas yin gyi rnam par shes pa gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dag phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dag yin yang len pa'i rnam par shes pa ni brtan pa'i phyir / len pa'i rnam par shes pa kho na gnas yin gyi rnam par shes pa gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Even though the store consciousness and the actual consciousnesses are in a reciprocal relation of cause and effect, the appropriating consciousness is stable,üîΩbut the other consciousnesses are not stable.

original: mi brtan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi brtan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore the other consciousnesses are not the basis.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yang sa bon dang rnam par smin pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yang sa bon dang rnam par smin pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The storehouse consciousness is also divided into two kinds, according to the distinction between seeds and results.

original: de gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig gnas nyid du rnam par gzhag la cig shos ni de la brten par rnam par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig gnas nyid du rnam par gzhag la cig shos ni de la brten par rnam par brtag par bya'o //
translated: Either one of these two is established as the support, and the other is considered to be supported.

original: yang na skad cig ma snga phyi 'jug pa'i sgo nas gnas dang brten pa nyid dang / rgyu nyid dang / 'bras bu nyid kyis tha dad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang na skad cig ma snga phyi 'jug pa'i sgo nas gnas dang brten pa nyid dang / rgyu nyid dang / 'bras bu nyid kyis tha dad pa nyid yin no //
translated: Or else, the distinction between support and supported is made on the basis of the earlier and later moments of the storehouse consciousness, and the distinction between cause and result is made on the basis of the seeds and actual states of the proclivities.

original: sems las byung ba gang dag rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa de dag gi gnas kyang rnam par shes pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: sems las byung ba gang dag rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa de dag gi gnas kyang rnam par shes pa kho na yin te /
translated: Those mental activities that are associated with consciousness are supported by consciousness.

original: des nye bar bstan pa'i yul la khyad par 'dzin pa nyid du zhugs pas de dag gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir dang de ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des nye bar bstan pa'i yul la khyad par 'dzin pa nyid du zhugs pas de dag gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir dang de ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Consciousness is their support because it is the principal factor in the apprehension of the special object revealed by the sense bases, even though the mental activities also participate in that apprehension.

original: de bas na brten pa yin pa'i phyir de dag kho nas de la bsgo par byed kyi /
analyzed: de bas na brten pa yin pa'i phyir de dag kho nas de la bsgo par byed kyi /
translated: Therefore, the mental activities are said to be supported by consciousness because they are supported by consciousness.

original: des ni de dag la ma yin no //üîΩkun brtags pa yang kun brtags par bya ba'i dngos po'i gzhi can nyid yin pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i gzhi gang la brtags pa de ni dngos su de'i gnas nyid yin no //
analyzed: des ni de dag la ma yin no // kun brtags pa yang kun brtags par bya ba'i dngos po'i gzhi can nyid yin pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i gzhi gang la brtags pa de ni dngos su de'i gnas nyid yin no //
translated: But that is not so for them.üîΩAlso, the imagined is based on the foundation of the object to be imagined, and thus the foundation of the store consciousness is the actual basis of that.

original: rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi gzhi can gyi gnas su yang brtan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir brgyud pa'i sgo nas de nyid rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi gzhi can gyi gnas su yang brtan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir brgyud pa'i sgo nas de nyid rnam par gzhag go //
translated: And since it is also the basis of the other consciousnesses, it is also the basis of the other consciousnesses.

original: 'dir rnam pa bcu po dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rnam pa bcu po dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the analysis of the ten aspects:

original: 'jug dang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dang de dag bsgom pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / bslab pa gsum zhes bya ba rnam pa 'di drug ni theg pa chen po'i spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'jug dang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dang de dag bsgom pa'i rab tu dbye ba dang / bslab pa gsum zhes bya ba rnam pa 'di drug ni theg pa chen po'i spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: The essence of the practice of the Great Vehicle is these six aspects: the practice of the perfections, the practice of the aids to enlightenment, the practice of the immeasurables, the practice of the liberations, the practice of the superknowledges, and the practice of the doors to liberation.üîΩThe objective supports of the Great Vehicle are the bases of the knowable and the characteristics of the knowable.

original: de yi dmigs pa ni shes bya'i gnas dang shes bya'i mtshan nyid do //üîΩde la yang shes bya'i mtshan nyid ni gdon mi za bar shes par @299a * //
analyzed: de yi dmigs pa ni shes bya'i gnas dang shes bya'i mtshan nyid do //üîΩde la yang shes bya'i mtshan nyid ni gdon mi za bar shes par @299a * //
translated: The characteristics of the knowable are the bases of the knowable.

original: bya ba yin pa nyid kyis dngos su rang gi ngo bos dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba yin pa nyid kyis dngos su rang gi ngo bos dmigs pa yin no //
translated: It is directly perceived by its very nature as an object, by the act of perception.

original: shes bya'i gnas ni de'i gnas yin pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: shes bya'i gnas ni de'i gnas yin pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The basis of cognition is the basis of that perception, by its very nature as a basis.

original: spyod pa de nyid kyi 'bras bu ni spangs pa dang ye shes kyi khyad par gyi rnam pa dag yin pas de'i phyir tha mar bstan to //
analyzed: spyod pa de nyid kyi 'bras bu ni spangs pa dang ye shes kyi khyad par gyi rnam pa dag yin pas de'i phyir tha mar bstan to //
translated: The result of that practice is the special forms of abandonment and knowledge, and therefore it is taught last.

original: de lta bas na 'di las ni theg pa chen po'i dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / theg pa chen po gang yin pa dang / theg pa chen po'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de dag bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di las ni theg pa chen po'i dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / theg pa chen po gang yin pa dang / theg pa chen po'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de dag bstan to //
translated: Thus, this chapter has taught the object of reference of the universal vehicle, the universal vehicle itself, and the result of the universal vehicle.

original: dkyus ma nyid dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: dkyus ma nyid dpyad par bya ste /
translated: The actual text will now be analyzed.

original: shes bya'i mtshan nyid ni ngo bo nyid gsum mo //
analyzed: shes bya'i mtshan nyid ni ngo bo nyid gsum mo //
translated: The characteristic of the knowable is the three natures.

original: de la yongs su grub pa ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de la yongs su grub pa ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Among them, the perfected is the reality that is both permanent and impermanent, the nature of suchness and of correct direct knowledge.

original: don dam pa dang rang rig pa'i sgo nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa dang rang rig pa'i sgo nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: It is to be known by supramundane wisdom through the ultimate and self-cognition.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyis shes par bya ba dang so so'i skye bo'i shes pas kyang rang rig pa'i sgo nas shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyis shes par bya ba dang so so'i skye bo'i shes pas kyang rang rig pa'i sgo nas shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: The dependent is to be known by the supramundane wisdom that is attained subsequently and also by the consciousness of ordinary beings through self-cognition.

original: 'o na yongs su grub pa de ma mthong bar gzhan gyi dbang mi mthong ngo zhes 'byung ba gang yin pa de ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩde ni gzhan gyi dang ma lus par mngon sum pa dgag pa lhur bya ba yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'o na yongs su grub pa de ma mthong bar gzhan gyi dbang mi mthong ngo zhes 'byung ba gang yin pa de ji lta bu zhe na / de ni gzhan gyi dang ma lus par mngon sum pa dgag pa lhur bya ba yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: Well then, what about the statement, ‚ÄúThe dependent is not seen without seeing the consummate?‚ÄùüîΩThat is not a problem, because it is primarily concerned with the negation of the direct perception of the dependent in its entirety.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na kun brtags pas dpen par nges par mi bzung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na kun brtags pas dpen par nges par mi bzung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Or, it is because the dependent is not ascertained as being separate from the imputed.

original: gzhan gyi dbang rang rig pa yod kyang gcig tu nges par ma zin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang rang rig pa yod kyang gcig tu nges par ma zin pa'i phyir /
translated: Even though the dependent is self-cognizing, it is not ascertained as being one.

original: yongs su grub pa 'di ma mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa 'di ma mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The root text says, ‚ÄúThe perfected is not seen by that.‚Äù

original: kun brtags pa ni so so'i skye bo'i shes pas shes par bya ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: kun brtags pa ni so so'i skye bo'i shes pas shes par bya ba kho na yin te /
translated: The imagined is the object of the consciousness of ordinary beings.

original: de ni gcig tu mngon par zhen pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gcig tu mngon par zhen pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the object of the conception that is the extreme of imputation.

original: rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdus pa las /
analyzed: rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdus pa las /
translated: The Compendium of Ascertainments says,

original: brtags pa ni shes pa gang gi dmigs pa yang ma yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa ni /
analyzed: brtags pa ni shes pa gang gi dmigs pa yang ma yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe imagined is not the object of any consciousness.‚Äù

original: med pa'i phyir gang gi rten du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don yin gyi /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir gang gi rten du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don yin gyi /
translated: This means that because it does not exist, it is not the basis of anything.

original: sgro brtags par yang yul du mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sgro brtags par yang yul du mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that it is not the object of imputation.

original: 'di ltar de nyid las so so'i skye bo'i shes pa'i dmigs pa'o zhes 'byung ba de'i phyir yang de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de nyid las so so'i skye bo'i shes pa'i dmigs pa'o zhes 'byung ba de'i phyir yang de lta bu yin no //
translated: Because that text also says, ‚ÄúIt is the object of the consciousness of ordinary beings,‚Äù it is like that.

original: theg pa chen po'i skabs ma yin nam /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i skabs ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt this the context of the MahƒÅyƒÅna?

original: so so'i skye bo'i skabs su ci 'bab ce na /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i skabs su ci 'bab ce na /
translated: What is the relevance of the context of ordinary beings?

original: zhar la smos pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: zhar la smos pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault because this is a digression.

original: rnam pa gcig tu @299b mos pas spyod pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dang / zag pa med pa'i ye shes las langs pa'i sems dang ldan pa rnams kyi yang dam pa'i chos nyan pa la sogs pa na yul nyid du nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir skabs su 'bab ste 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu @299b mos pas spyod pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dang / zag pa med pa'i ye shes las langs pa'i sems dang ldan pa rnams kyi yang dam pa'i chos nyan pa la sogs pa na yul nyid du nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir skabs su 'bab ste 'gal ba med do //
translated: In one way, it is the domain of the stage of faithful practice, and in another way, it is the domain of those who have arisen from uncontaminated transcendent wisdom, because it is the domain of those who listen to the true Dharma and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas skabs na ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa'i yul yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas skabs na ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa'i yul yang ma yin te /
translated: In the context of the TathƒÅgata, it is not the domain of transcendent wisdom subsequent to that which is transcendent to the world,

original: mngon par zhen par thams cad spangs pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: mngon par zhen par thams cad spangs pa'i phyir la /
translated: because he has abandoned all clinging,

original: brtags pa yang mngon par zhen pas bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags pa yang mngon par zhen pas bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because he has no conceptualized clinging.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang gi tshe gzhan gyi sems kyis bzung ba'i kun brtags pa yongs su gcod pa de'i tshe yang phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nyid kyi bdag nyid yul du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang gi tshe gzhan gyi sems kyis bzung ba'i kun brtags pa yongs su gcod pa de'i tshe yang phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na nyid kyi bdag nyid yul du 'gyur gyi /
translated: When the TathƒÅgata eliminates the imagined nature that is apprehended by the minds of others, at that time, it becomes the domain of the essence of nonerroneous reality.

original: ji ltar brtags pa de ltar ni yul du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar brtags pa de ltar ni yul du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It does not become the domain in the way it is imagined.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yang gang zag gi gnas skabs kyi rim pa dang bsgrub pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rim pa'i sgo nas tha dad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yang gang zag gi gnas skabs kyi rim pa dang bsgrub pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rim pa'i sgo nas tha dad do //
translated: The bodhisattva practice is also differentiated from the point of view of the stages of the person and the stages of the accomplishment of the practice.

original: gang zag gi gnas skabs kyi rim pa'i sgo nas ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gang zag gi gnas skabs kyi rim pa'i sgo nas ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: From the point of view of the stages of the person, there are three:

original: 'jug pa dang de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dang bsgom pa'i bar du dbye ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dang bsgom pa'i bar du dbye ba'o //
translated: the entry, the cause and effect of that, and the cultivation.

original: de la yang dang po gnyis ni nye bar len pa yin la gsum pa ni nye bar blang ba yin te /
analyzed: de la yang dang po gnyis ni nye bar len pa yin la gsum pa ni nye bar blang ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, the first two are the appropriator, and the third is the appropriated.

original: 'di ltar gang zag zhugs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu dag la gnas pa gang yin pa ni de la brten nas sa bcu rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zag zhugs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu dag la gnas pa gang yin pa ni de la brten nas sa bcu rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the person who has entered and abides in the cause and effect is the basis for the differentiation of the ten stages.

original: bsgrub pa'i rim pa ni bslab pa gsum gyis bstan te /
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i rim pa ni bslab pa gsum gyis bstan te /
translated: The stages of accomplishment are taught by the three trainings.

original: bsgrub pa'i rim pa 'dis ni gang zag gi gnas skabs gsum po 'di dag rab tu 'byed do //
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i rim pa 'dis ni gang zag gi gnas skabs gsum po 'di dag rab tu 'byed do //
translated: By this stage of accomplishment, these three stages of the person are differentiated.

original: de la yang ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas skabs na shes bya la 'jug pa phyin ci ma log pa yin mod kyi ;
analyzed: de la yang ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas skabs na shes bya la 'jug pa phyin ci ma log pa yin mod kyi ;
translated: Moreover, in the state of a tathƒÅgata, the engagement with knowable objects is indeed unerring.

original: 'dir ni 'jug pa dang po la dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'jug pa dang po la dgongs pa yin no //
translated: However, here the intention is the initial engagement.

original: phyin ci ma log pa de yang gang du yongs su rdzogs she na /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa de yang gang du yongs su rdzogs she na /
translated: In what state is that unerring engagement perfected?

original: 'di ltar bzod pa 'bring gi gnas skabs na ni kun brtags pa'i phyogs gcig po gzung ba'i rnam pa yang dag par rtogs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bzod pa 'bring gi gnas skabs na ni kun brtags pa'i phyogs gcig po gzung ba'i rnam pa yang dag par rtogs so //
translated: Thus, in the state of middling acceptance, one realizes the aspect of the apprehended, which is one part of the imaginary nature.

original: chen po dang chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs dag na ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: chen po dang chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs dag na ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: In the states of greater acceptance and the supreme mundane state, one realizes the aspect of the apprehender.

original: de'i mjug thogs su mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma dang po la ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de'i mjug thogs su mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma dang po la ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Immediately after that, in the first moment of the path of seeing, one realizes suchness.

original: de las gzhan pa'i sa rab tu dga' ba la ni 'jug pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sa rab tu dga' ba la ni 'jug pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: From that point on, in the first bh≈´mi, Perfect Joy, the engagement is perfected.

original: 'jug pa de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /üîΩmos pas @300a * //
analyzed: 'jug pa de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te / mos pas @300a * //
translated: The words ‚Äúcause and result‚Äù should be applied to that engagement.üîΩOn the level of earnest aspiration,

original: spyod pa'i sa la ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: spyod pa'i sa la ni rgyu'o //
translated: it is the cause.

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The state of supreme joy, etc. is the result.

original: de yi rgyu dang 'bras bu sgom pa rab tu dbye //
analyzed: de yi rgyu dang 'bras bu sgom pa rab tu dbye //
translated: The cultivation of its cause and result is distinguished.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is

original: gtso bo yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu kho na'i rab tu dbye ba mdzad do //
analyzed: gtso bo yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu kho na'i rab tu dbye ba mdzad do //
translated: because it is the principal one, he makes a distinction of the result alone.

original: zhar la bskal pa grangs med pa rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba bstan par rgyu'i rnam par dbye bar mdzad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhar la bskal pa grangs med pa rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba bstan par rgyu'i rnam par dbye bar mdzad par 'gyur ro //
translated: In addition, he makes a distinction of the cause in order to demonstrate the distinction of the incalculable eons.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir bslab pa gsum smos so //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir bslab pa gsum smos so //
translated: He mentions the three educations, morality, etc. because they are principal.

original: zhar la ni gzhan pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyang smos te /
analyzed: zhar la ni gzhan pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyang smos te /
translated: In addition, he mentions the other perfections,

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra'i bye brag gis de skad du bstan to //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra'i bye brag gis de skad du bstan to //
translated: as is indicated by the words generosity, morality, etc.

original: gang gi tshe sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa smos pa de'i tshe ni dngos kho nar yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa smos pa de'i tshe ni dngos kho nar yin no //
translated: When he mentions morality, etc. for the sake of sentient beings, then it is the actual.

original: lhag pa'i sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The superior mind, etc.

original: sa dang po gsum la ni theg pa chen po rab tu snang ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: sa dang po gsum la ni theg pa chen po rab tu snang ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: On the first three stages, it is the samadhi called the illumination of the great vehicle.

original: sa bzhi pa dang lnga pa dang drug pa dang bdun pa dag la ni bsod nams thams cad sdud pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: sa bzhi pa dang lnga pa dang drug pa dang bdun pa dag la ni bsod nams thams cad sdud pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: On the fourth, fifth, sixth, and seventh stages, it is the samadhi called the collection of all merits.

original: dgu pa dang brgyad pa la ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po bzang skyong ngo //
analyzed: dgu pa dang brgyad pa la ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po bzang skyong ngo //
translated: On the eighth and ninth stages, it is the samadhi called the king of samadhis.

original: bcu pa la ni dpa' par 'gro ba dang nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcu pa la ni dpa' par 'gro ba dang nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'o //
translated: On the tenth stage, it is the samadhi called the heroic advance and the sky treasury, etc.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The superior wisdom, etc.

original: gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dngos gzhi smos te /
analyzed: gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dngos gzhi smos te /
translated: The basic stage is mentioned because it is the principal one.

original: sbyor ba po dang rjes kyi dag ni phyis ston to //
analyzed: sbyor ba po dang rjes kyi dag ni phyis ston to //
translated: The preparatory and subsequent stages are taught later.üîΩThe distinctive abandonment, etc.

original: spangs pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mya ngan las 'das pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: spangs pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mya ngan las 'das pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Nirvana is of four kinds:

original: phung po dang bcas pa dang phung po med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa dang de bzhin du mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: phung po dang bcas pa dang phung po med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa dang de bzhin du mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: with aggregates and without aggregates, and the nirvana that is natural and the nirvana that is nonabiding.

original: de la 'dir ni gsum ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong yin pa'i phyir mi gzung gi / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de bzhin nyid sgrib pa gnyis dang bral ba kho na thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir gzung ngo //üîΩye shes kyi khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la chos ni stobs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dir ni gsum ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong yin pa'i phyir mi gzung gi / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de bzhin nyid sgrib pa gnyis dang bral ba kho na thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir gzung ngo // ye shes kyi khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la chos ni stobs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, three of these are not accepted because they are common to sravakas and others, but the nirvana that is nonabiding, which is suchness free from the two obstructions, is accepted because it is not common to sravakas and others.üîΩThe Distinctive WisdomüîΩThe distinctive wisdom is the Dharma body, which is the support of the powers, etc.

original: de dag gi sku ste rten ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de dag gi sku ste rten ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The distinctive wisdom is the Dharma body, which is the support of the powers, etc.

original: de nyid de bzhin nyid yongs su dag pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid de bzhin nyid yongs su dag pa yin te /
translated: That itself is the pure suchness,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni de la rag las te 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni de la rag las te 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the qualities of the Buddha arise in dependence on it.

original: kun zhes bya ba'i sgra yang rten du grags te /
analyzed: kun zhes bya ba'i sgra yang rten du grags te /
translated: The word ‚Äúall‚Äù is known as a support,

original: lus kyi dbang po bzhin te /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po bzhin te /
translated: like the sense organ of the body.

original: bsags pa nyid yin yang mig la sogs pa'i rten yin pa'i @300b phyir ro ;
analyzed: bsags pa nyid yin yang mig la sogs pa'i rten yin pa'i @300b phyir ro ;
translated: and it is a body because it is the support of the eye, etc.

original: ; rnam pa gcig tu na sku ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin la rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir chos so //
analyzed: ; rnam pa gcig tu na sku ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin la rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir chos so //
translated: Alternatively, body is just the intrinsic reality of the TathƒÅgata, and because it is the intrinsic reality, it is the Dharma.

original: 'di ni sku yang yin la chos kyang yin pas chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sku yang yin la chos kyang yin pas chos kyi sku ste /
translated: It is the Dharma Body because it is both a body and the Dharma.

original: de yang de bzhin nyid yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin nyid yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: And that is the purification of suchness.

original: sku zhes bya ba ni sgra yang rang gi mtshan nyid du yang grags te /
analyzed: sku zhes bya ba ni sgra yang rang gi mtshan nyid du yang grags te /
translated: The term body is also known as the intrinsic reality of sound,

original: rnam par shes pa'i lus bzhin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i lus bzhin te /
translated: like the body of consciousness.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la bsags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la bsags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For those that are not material do not have accumulation.

original: chos kyi sku de ni ye shes kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ye shes kyi khyad par te /
analyzed: chos kyi sku de ni ye shes kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ye shes kyi khyad par te /
translated: That Dharma Body is the special intuition because it is the cause of intuition.

original: de nyid ngo bo nyid kyi sku yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ngo bo nyid kyi sku yin no //
translated: And that is the essential body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes thams cad ni nyid kyi longs spyod rdzogs par dgongs pa'i phyir longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes thams cad ni nyid kyi longs spyod rdzogs par dgongs pa'i phyir longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin no //
translated: The TathƒÅgata‚Äôs all-knowledge is the beatific body because it is the enjoyment of that very Dharma Body.

original: stobs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa dang / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ye shes kyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: stobs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa dang / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ye shes kyi khyad par yin no //
translated: The essence of the powers and so forth, and whatever is the nature of the major and minor marks, are also the essence of the Tathagata's gnosis, and thus are the special qualities of gnosis.

original: de'i dbang gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la so sor mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po la sogs par snang ba sems dang sems las byung ba dag la khyab pa gang yin pa de yang gzhan longs spyod rdzogs par dgos pa'i phyir long spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin
analyzed: de'i dbang gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la so sor mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po la sogs par snang ba sems dang sems las byung ba dag la khyab pa gang yin pa de yang gzhan longs spyod rdzogs par dgos pa'i phyir long spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin
translated: The appearance of the major and minor marks and so forth to the Bodhisattvas by the power of that is the Sambhogakaya, because it is the pervasion of the mind and mental factors of others, which is necessary for the enjoyment of the Dharma.

original: no // de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi dbang kho nas byang chub sems dpa' mos pa spyad pa spyod pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i rgyud la so sor mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po la sogs par snang ba'i sku ni yun thung ngur gnas pa'i phyir sprul pa ste /
analyzed: no // de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi dbang kho nas byang chub sems dpa' mos pa spyad pa spyod pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i rgyud la so sor mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po la sogs par snang ba'i sku ni yun thung ngur gnas pa'i phyir sprul pa ste /
translated: The body of the bodhisattva who practices the practice of the stage of devotion appears in the continua of the sravakas, etc. as having the major and minor characteristics, etc. due to the power of the Tathagata's intuition alone. It is an emanation because it lasts for a short time.

original: ye shes kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ye shes kyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: ye shes kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ye shes kyi khyad par yin no //
translated: It is a special intuition because it is the result of intuition.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams zhes bya ba bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams zhes bya ba bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: The Bhagavat Buddhas, etc.

original: theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du brjod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du brjod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The Great Vehicle is the word of the Buddha.

original: ji lta zhe na gang dag nyan thos kyi theg pa nyid theg pa chen po yin no zhes bya bar rtogs pa de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung de theg pa chen po yin par yang brjod do //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na gang dag nyan thos kyi theg pa nyid theg pa chen po yin no zhes bya bar rtogs pa de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung de theg pa chen po yin par yang brjod do //
translated: How is that? Those who think that the Great Vehicle is the sravaka vehicle alone, they say that the word of the Buddha is the Great Vehicle.

original: de'i phyir nyan thos kyi theg pa ni theg pa chen po nyid du sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyan thos kyi theg pa ni theg pa chen po nyid du sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the Listeners‚Äô Vehicle is not the word of the Buddha in the Great Vehicle,

original: rnam pa bcu bstan pa dang bral pa'i phyir grangs can la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu bstan pa dang bral pa'i phyir grangs can la sogs pa'i bstan bcos bzhin no //
translated: because it lacks the ten aspects that are taught, like the treatises of the Enumerators and so forth.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa las khyad par du byas pa zhes bya ba ni /üîΩgsung khyad par rnam pa bcus khyad par du @301a * //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa las khyad par du byas pa zhes bya ba ni / gsung khyad par rnam pa bcus khyad par du @301a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdistinguished from the Listeners‚Äô Vehicle‚Äù

original: 'phags pa zhes bya ba de ston te /üîΩgang gi phyir nyan thos kyi theg pa las ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa zhes bya ba de ston te / gang gi phyir nyan thos kyi theg pa las ni /
translated: teaches that the speech of the Great Vehicle is superior through ten distinctive features.

original: shes bya'i gnas la sogs pa yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan la /
analyzed: shes bya'i gnas la sogs pa yongs su ma rdzogs par bstan la /
translated: Because the Listeners‚Äô Vehicle teaches the bases of knowledge and so forth in an incomplete way,

original: 'di las ni shes bya'i gnas la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad bstan pa de'i phyir nyan thos kyi theg pa las khyad par du bya ba rnam pa bcus de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung khyad par du spog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di las ni shes bya'i gnas la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad bstan pa de'i phyir nyan thos kyi theg pa las khyad par du bya ba rnam pa bcus de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung khyad par du spog pa yin no //
translated: while this Great Vehicle teaches all aspects of the bases of knowledge and so forth, the speech of the TathƒÅgata is distinguished from the Listeners‚Äô Vehicle through ten distinctive features.

original: mchog nyid kyi phyir yang khyad par du 'phags so //
analyzed: mchog nyid kyi phyir yang khyad par du 'phags so //
translated: It is also superior because it is supreme.

original: ji ltar mchog nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mchog nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is it supreme?

original: mchog nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is taught as supreme.

original: mchog nyid du bstan pa nyid ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: mchog nyid du bstan pa nyid ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it taught as supreme?

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams las brtsams nas bstan pa yin pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams las brtsams nas bstan pa yin pas so //
translated: Because the Lord taught it beginning with the bodhisattvas.

original: 'dis ni gdul ba mchog nyid kyi phyir mchog nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dis ni gdul ba mchog nyid kyi phyir mchog nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is supreme because of the supremacy of the disciples.
