analyzed: 'di ltar gdul ba'i dbang gis kyang bstan pa dman pa dang mchog nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, the teaching is inferior or supreme due to the disciples.

original: dper na so so'i skye bo yin pa'i phyir tshong pa ga gon dang mdzes ldan dag gi ched du ni dman pa bstan /
analyzed: dper na so so'i skye bo yin pa'i phyir tshong pa ga gon dang mdzes ldan dag gi ched du ni dman pa bstan /
translated: For example, the inferior teaching was taught for the sake of the merchants GavƒÅ·πÉpati and Subh≈´ti, because they were ordinary persons.

original: 'phags pa'i skabs yin pas lnga sde'i dbang du mdzad nas ni 'bring /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i skabs yin pas lnga sde'i dbang du mdzad nas ni 'bring /
translated: The middling was taught for the sake of the group of five, because it was the occasion for the noble ones.

original: byang chub sems rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas ni /
translated: The supreme was taught for the sake of the bodhisattvas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa brgyad bstan te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa brgyad bstan te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom was taught in eight parts.

original: brtags pa'i rnam pa dgag pa'i sgo nas mchog go //
analyzed: brtags pa'i rnam pa dgag pa'i sgo nas mchog go //
translated: It is supreme because it is taught by way of the negation of the imagined aspect.

original: rnam pa brgyad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sum brgya pa dang / lnga brgya ba dang / bdun brgya pa dang / nyis stong lnga brgya pa dang / brgyad stong pa dang / khri brgyad stong pa dang / nyi khri lnga stong pa dang /üîΩ'bum pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sum brgya pa dang / lnga brgya ba dang / bdun brgya pa dang / nyis stong lnga brgya pa dang / brgyad stong pa dang / khri brgyad stong pa dang / nyi khri lnga stong pa dang / 'bum pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The eight types are the Perfection of Wisdom in Three Hundred Lines, in Five Hundred Lines, in Seven Hundred Lines, in Two Thousand Five Hundred Lines, in Eighteen Thousand Lines, in One Hundred Thousand Lines, in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines, and in One Hundred Thousand Lines.

original: dam pa'i chos padma dkar po la sogs pa bstan pa ni rab kyi mchog yin te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos padma dkar po la sogs pa bstan pa ni rab kyi mchog yin te /
translated: The Lotus Sutra and so on are the highest of the highest.

original: 'di ltar de las ni theg pa gcig bstan pas ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams kyang de las 'dren to //
analyzed: 'di ltar de las ni theg pa gcig bstan pas ma nges pa'i rigs can rnams kyang de las 'dren to //
translated: Because in that sutra the single vehicle is taught, those of unfixed lineage are also led to it.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo la sogs pa bstan pa ni rab kyi phul yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo la sogs pa bstan pa ni rab kyi phul yin te /
translated: The Great Nirvana Sutra and so on are the best of the best.

original: 'di ltar de las ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs shing sems can gyi don mdzad par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ltar de las ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs shing sems can gyi don mdzad par bstan to //
translated: Because in that sutra it is taught that the tathagatas remain for as long as samsara exists and act for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo bstan pa ni rab kyi phul gyi mchog yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas phal po che'i mdo bstan pa ni rab kyi phul gyi mchog yin te /
translated: The Buddh√¢vata·πÉsaka Sutra is the best of the best of the best.

original: 'di ltar mdo de ni de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring po ma lon par phyogs bcu na gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu'i dbang phyug rnams la lan cig @301b rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo de ni de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring po ma lon par phyogs bcu na gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu'i dbang phyug rnams la lan cig @301b rab tu bstan to //
translated: Thus, that sutra was taught only once to the bodhisattvas who were lords of the ten stages and who were dwelling in the ten directions, not long after the Tathagata had fully attained enlightenment.

original: gong du nyan thos kyi theg pa chen po nyid du sangs rgyas kyi gsung yin pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir gtan tshigs rnam pa bcu bstan pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de ni ma grub ste /
analyzed: gong du nyan thos kyi theg pa chen po nyid du sangs rgyas kyi gsung yin pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir gtan tshigs rnam pa bcu bstan pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de ni ma grub ste /
translated: The reason that was stated above, ‚Äúbecause it is devoid of the ten aspects,‚Äù is not established, in order to refute the fact that the vehicle of the ≈õrƒÅvakas is the Mahayana and the word of the Buddha.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa las kyang kun du dga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas shes bya'i gnas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa las kyang kun du dga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas shes bya'i gnas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the bases of the knowable are taught in the vehicle of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, such as in the statement, ‚ÄúThe world is delighted by the world.‚Äù

original: sems can rdzus te skye ba yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas kun brtags pa yang bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rdzus te skye ba yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas kun brtags pa yang bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the imaginary is also taught, such as in the statement, ‚ÄúThere are sentient beings who are born supernaturally.‚Äù

original: 'di las sems can med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas yongs su grub pa yang bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las sems can med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas yongs su grub pa yang bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the perfect is also taught, such as in the statement, ‚ÄúThere are no sentient beings here.‚Äù

original: chos 'di dag ni rgyu dang bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi dbang yang bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni rgyu dang bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi dbang yang bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The dependent nature is also taught by the statement these phenomena have causes and so on.

original: shes bya ba la 'jug pa yang mig dang gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i rgyu dang 'bras bu bstan pa yang yod de /
analyzed: shes bya ba la 'jug pa yang mig dang gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa'i phyir ro // de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu bstan pa yang yod de /
translated: The engagement of objects of knowledge is taught by the statement eye, form, and so on and so forth.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching of its causes and effects is also taught by the statement the six perfections and so on.

original: bsgom pa rab tu dbye ba yang dge 'dun phal chen sde'i de ba las sa'i rnam par dbye ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa rab tu dbye ba yang dge 'dun phal chen sde'i de ba las sa'i rnam par dbye ba'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The classification of meditation is taught by the statement the characteristics of the divisions of the stages in the MahƒÅsƒÅ·πÉghika-vinaya.

original: bslab pa gsum yang bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bslab pa gsum yang bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The three trainings are also taught by the statement the three trainings and so on.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang zad pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang zad pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: NirvƒÅ·πáa is also taught by the statement exhaustion, separation from attachment, and so on.

original: chos kyi sku mi slob pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mdzad pa dang / des skye ba sprul pa'i sku bstan pa'i phyir sku gsum yang bstan to snyam pa'i bsam pa 'di ji ltar na 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: chos kyi sku mi slob pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mdzad pa dang / des skye ba sprul pa'i sku bstan pa'i phyir sku gsum yang bstan to snyam pa'i bsam pa 'di ji ltar na 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The thought, How is this? and so on is stated.

original: 'di ltar gnas bcu po 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni gtan tshigs sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas bcu po 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni gtan tshigs sgrub par byed do //
translated: By this, he establishes the reason, saying, Because it is devoid of the teaching of the ten aspects that are complete.

original: rnam pa bcu rdzogs par bstan pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu rdzogs par bstan pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He shows the reason, saying, Because it is devoid of the teaching of the ten aspects that are complete.

original: 'di ltar nyan thos kyi theg pa las ni shes bya'i gnas kyang rgyu'i bye brag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bye brag dang / dmigs pa bstan pa dang bag chags kyi rten nyid la sogs pa'i dbye bsam bstan no //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyan thos kyi theg pa las ni shes bya'i gnas kyang rgyu'i bye brag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bye brag dang / dmigs pa bstan pa dang bag chags kyi rten nyid la sogs pa'i dbye bsam bstan no //
translated: Thus, in the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle, the basis of knowledge is taught with distinctions of cause, distinctions of concomitance, distinctions of object, distinctions of the basis of habitual tendencies, and so on.

original: kun brtags pa yang gzugs la sogs pa'i bye brag dang yongs su grub pa yang chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid dang gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po yang rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid rab tu rnam par ma phye'o //üîΩshes bya la 'jug pa yang ji skad bstan pa'i kun brtags pa la sogs pa la @302a * //
analyzed: kun brtags pa yang gzugs la sogs pa'i bye brag dang yongs su grub pa yang chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid dang gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po yang rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid rab tu rnam par ma phye'o // shes bya la 'jug pa yang ji skad bstan pa'i kun brtags pa la sogs pa la @302a * //
translated: The imagined is not distinguished as having the characteristic of the particular of form, etc. The perfected is not distinguished as having the characteristic of the reality of the selflessness of dharmas. The relative is not distinguished as having the characteristic of the totality of the eight consciousnesses.

original: 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ma bstan to //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ma bstan to //
translated: Nor is the engagement with the knowable taught as having the characteristic of engagement with the imagined, etc., as has been explained.üîΩNor is the perfection of the purity of the three sectors taught.

original: de med pas 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dag kyang rnam par ma phye la sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa yang ma bstan to //
analyzed: de med pas 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dag kyang rnam par ma phye la sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa yang ma bstan to //
translated: And the morality, etc., for the sake of sentient beings is not taught.

original: dge 'dun phal chen sde rnams la sa'i dbye ba bstan pa gang yin pa de yang phyogs kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun phal chen sde rnams la sa'i dbye ba bstan pa gang yin pa de yang phyogs kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of the divisions of the stages belongs to the MahƒÅsƒÅ·πÖghika.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yang sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims kyi mtshan nyid rnam par ma phye'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yang sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims kyi mtshan nyid rnam par ma phye'o //
translated: The training in superior morality is not distinguished by the characteristic of morality which benefits sentient beings.üîΩSuperior mind is not distinguished by the divisions of meditative stabilization, etc., which are characterized by the illumination of the Great Vehicle.

original: lhag pa'i sems kyang theg pa chen po rab tu snang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyang bdag med pa gnyi ga rtogs pa'i dbye ba dang / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yang ji skad 'chad par 'gyur pa dang /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyang theg pa chen po rab tu snang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyang bdag med pa gnyi ga rtogs pa'i dbye ba dang / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yang ji skad 'chad par 'gyur pa dang /
translated: Superior wisdom is not distinguished by the divisions which realize the two types of selflessness, and non-abiding nirvana is not distinguished as it will be explained.

original: sku gsum yang ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin rnam par ma phye'o //üîΩbyang chub chen po kun du sgrub par byed pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rang gi phyogs sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: sku gsum yang ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin rnam par ma phye'o // byang chub chen po kun du sgrub par byed pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rang gi phyogs sgrub par byed do //
translated: The three bodies are not distinguished as they will be explained.üîΩThe establishment of one's own position is done by the passage beginning with the establishment of great enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i mdo ni theg pa chen po nyid du sangs rgyas kyi gsung yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i mdo ni theg pa chen po nyid du sangs rgyas kyi gsung yin te /
translated: The sutras of the perfection of wisdom, etc. are the speech of the Buddha in the Great Vehicle.

original: byang chub chen po kun du sgrub par byed pa'i don ston pa'i phyir gnyi ga la grags pa skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde la sogs pa bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub chen po kun du sgrub par byed pa'i don ston pa'i phyir gnyi ga la grags pa skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde la sogs pa bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of the universal vehicle, the Jataka tales, etc. are taught, which are well known to both parties.üîΩThe word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù in the verse is explained by the word ‚Äúdesire‚Äù in the commentary.

original: 'dod do zhes bya ba'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa las 'byung ba 'chad par 'gyur ba dang / sbyor ba'i phyir ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod do zhes bya ba'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa las 'byung ba 'chad par 'gyur ba dang / sbyor ba'i phyir ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the universal vehicle is unestablished, because it is not the case that it is not accepted.

original: byang chub chen po kun du sgrub par byed pa'i don ston par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub chen po kun du sgrub par byed pa'i don ston par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is accepted because it is desired to demonstrate the meaning of the universal vehicle.

original: byang chub chen po ni 'dir de bzhin nyid dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub chen po ni 'dir de bzhin nyid dri ma med pa'o //
translated: Here, the universal vehicle is the stainless reality.

original: de kun du sgrub pa ni mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de kun du sgrub pa ni mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: Its universal practice is its realization.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to attain the knowledge of the Omniscient One.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang sku gsum po byang chub chen po'i gnas skabs kho na yin na ji ltar byang chub chen po kun du sgrub par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang sku gsum po byang chub chen po'i gnas skabs kho na yin na ji ltar byang chub chen po kun du sgrub par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: If nonabiding nirvana and the three bodies are only the state of great enlightenment, how do they cause the accomplishment of great enlightenment?

original: rgyud gzhan dag la chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa thos pa'i bag chags kyi rim gyis so //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan dag la chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa thos pa'i bag chags kyi rim gyis so //
translated: They cause the accomplishment of great enlightenment in other continuums through the stages of the imprints of hearing the concordant cause of the dharmadhatu.

original: yong ni byang chub ye shes yin mod kyi /
analyzed: yong ni byang chub ye shes yin mod kyi /
translated: Although enlightenment is wisdom,

original: 'on kyang tshig phye nas sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang tshig phye nas sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: nevertheless, it should be applied by analyzing the words.

original: gang gi phyir 'di dag byang chub chen po kun du sgrub par byed pa de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di dag byang chub chen po kun du sgrub par byed pa de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par byed pa yin no //
translated: Because these cause the accomplishment of great enlightenment, they cause the attainment of omniscient wisdom.

original: byang chub chen po kun @302b du sgrub par byed pa de yang shin tu 'thad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum gyis khyad par du byed de /
analyzed: byang chub chen po kun @302b du sgrub par byed pa de yang shin tu 'thad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum gyis khyad par du byed de /
translated: That cause of the accomplishment of great enlightenment is very reasonable, etc.

original: de la shin du 'thad pa ni dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi theg pa chen po gang yin pa shes bya'i gnas dang / shes bya'i mtshan nyid de phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la shin du 'thad pa ni dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi theg pa chen po gang yin pa shes bya'i gnas dang / shes bya'i mtshan nyid de phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The extremely reasonable is the Mahayana of the nature of the object of observation because it is the basis of objects of knowledge and the unmistaken character of objects of knowledge.

original: mthun pa ni spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi theg pa chen po gang yin pa shes bya la 'jug pa la sogs pa rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: mthun pa ni spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi theg pa chen po gang yin pa shes bya la 'jug pa la sogs pa rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The concordant is the Mahayana of the nature of practice because it is the six aspects of engagement in objects of knowledge and so forth.

original: 'bras bu'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is concordant with the result.

original: 'gal ba med pa ni 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid kyi theg pa chen po gang yin pa spangs pa dang / ye shes kyi khyad par gyi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa ni 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid kyi theg pa chen po gang yin pa spangs pa dang / ye shes kyi khyad par gyi ngo bo ste /
translated: The noncontradictory is the Mahayana of the nature of the result because it is the nature of the special abandonment and special exalted wisdom.

original: rgyu dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is noncontradictory with the cause.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na rnam pa bcu po ngo bo nyid gsum gyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid gsum gyi dbye bas shin tu 'thad pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na rnam pa bcu po ngo bo nyid gsum gyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid gsum gyi dbye bas shin tu 'thad pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Or, in one way, the ten aspects are included in the three natures, and therefore the extremely reasonable and so forth are the divisions of the three natures.

original: de la shin tu 'thad pa ni yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: de la shin tu 'thad pa ni yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: The extremely reasonable is the thoroughly established nature.

original: tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩmthun pa ni gzhan gyi dbang ste /
analyzed: tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro // mthun pa ni gzhan gyi dbang ste /
translated: because it is not contradicted by valid knowledge.

original: rnam par byang ba dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'gal ba med pa ni kun brtags pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba dang mthun pa'i phyir ro // 'gal ba med pa ni kun brtags pa ste /
translated: It is compatible, because it is compatible with purification.

original: tha snyad dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is non-contradictory, because it is not contradicted by conventional usage.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na rnam pa bcu char mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang ldan pa'i phyir shin tu 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na rnam pa bcu char mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang ldan pa'i phyir shin tu 'thad pa'o //
translated: In one sense, it is very reasonable because it is endowed with the valid knowledge of direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa dang ldan pa'i phyir mthun pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang ldan pa'i phyir mthun pa'o //
translated: It is compatible because it is endowed with inference.

original: sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyi lung dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir 'gal ba med pa'o ;
analyzed: sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyi lung dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir 'gal ba med pa'o ;
translated: It is non-contradictory because it is not contradicted by the scriptures of the Buddhas of the past.

original: ; rnam pa gcig tu na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir shin tu 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: ; rnam pa gcig tu na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir shin tu 'thad pa'o //
translated: In one sense, it is very reasonable because it is endowed with direct perception, inference, and scripture.

original: rnam par byang ba dang mthun pa'i phyir mthun pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba dang mthun pa'i phyir mthun pa'o //
translated: It is compatible because it is compatible with purification.

original: 'gal ba kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dgra bor gyur pa'i phyir 'gal ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dgra bor gyur pa'i phyir 'gal ba med pa'o //
translated: It is non-contradictory because it is non-contradictory with the enemy of affliction.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na bden pa gsum gyi skabs kyi mtshan nyid kyi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas shin tu 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na bden pa gsum gyi skabs kyi mtshan nyid kyi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas shin tu 'thad pa'o //
translated: In one sense, it is quite reasonable from the point of view of the reality of characteristics in the context of the three realities.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa'i dbang du byas nas mthun pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa'i dbang du byas nas mthun pa'o //
translated: It is compatible from the point of view of ultimate reality.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas 'gal ba med pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i dbang du byas nas 'gal ba med pa'o //
translated: It is noncontradictory from the point of view of conventional reality.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na rnam pa bcu po bskal pa grangs med pa dang pos bsdus pa ni shin tu 'thad pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na rnam pa bcu po bskal pa grangs med pa dang pos bsdus pa ni shin tu 'thad pa ste /
translated: In another sense, the ten aspects included in the first incalculable eon are quite reasonable,

original: sa gong ma dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa gong ma dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are compatible with the higher stages.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis pas bsdus pa ni mthun pa ste /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis pas bsdus pa ni mthun pa ste /
translated: Those included in the second incalculable eon are compatible,

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are pure in their superior intention.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum pas bsdus pa ni 'gal ba med pa ste /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum pas bsdus pa ni 'gal ba med pa ste /
translated: Those included in the third incalculable eon are noncontradictory,

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug pa'i phyir @303a * //
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug pa'i phyir @303a * //
translated: because they are engaged without deliberate effort.üîΩIn another sense, those included in the naturally existing potential are quite reasonable,

original: ro ; / rnam pa gcig tu na rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs kyis bsdus pa ni shin tu 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: ro ; / rnam pa gcig tu na rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs kyis bsdus pa ni shin tu 'thad pa'o //
translated: because they are the basis of the other two potentials.

original: yang dag par bsgrub pa'i rigs kyis bsdus pa ni mthun pa'o //üîΩ'bras bu'i gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa ni 'gal ba med pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrub pa'i rigs kyis bsdus pa ni mthun pa'o // 'bras bu'i gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa ni 'gal ba med pa'o //
translated: The ten topics are included in the three natures.üîΩThe three natures are included in the three natures.üîΩThe three natures are included in the three natures.üîΩThe three natures are included in the three natures.

analyzed: de la 'dir gnas bcu po 'di dag gi go rims ni bstan zin pa nyid de /
translated: The three natures are included in the three natures.üîΩThe three natures are included in the three natures.üîΩThe three natures are included in the three natures.üîΩThe three natures original: dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang por bstan to //üîΩdmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin shes bya la 'jug pa la sogs pa drug ni de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir phyis so //üîΩspangs pa dang ye shes kyi khyad par dag ni de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de bas kyang phyis so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang por bstan to // dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin shes bya la 'jug pa la sogs pa drug ni de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir phyis so // spangs pa dang ye shes kyi khyad par dag ni de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de bas kyang phyis so //
translated: The three natures are included in the three natures.üîΩThe three natures are included in the three natures.

original: dmigs pa dag la yang snga phyi ni shes bya'i gnas ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dag la yang snga phyi ni shes bya'i gnas ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The three natures are included in the three natures.

original: shes bya'i mtshan nyid ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya'i mtshan nyid ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The three natures are included in the three natures.üîΩThe three natures are included in

original: shes bya la 'jug pa la sogs pa drug la yang gsum tshan dang po gang yin pa de ni gang zag gi gnas skabs kyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir dang por bstan to //
analyzed: shes bya la 'jug pa la sogs pa drug la yang gsum tshan dang po gang yin pa de ni gang zag gi gnas skabs kyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir dang por bstan to //
translated: The six beginning with engagement in knowable objects are taught first because the first three are distinguished by the states of the person.

original: gsum tshan gnyis pa spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid ni de la brten pa yin pa'i phyir phyis bstan to //
analyzed: gsum tshan gnyis pa spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid ni de la brten pa yin pa'i phyir phyis bstan to //
translated: The second three are taught later because the nature of practice is based on those.

original: gsum tshan dang po la yang rnam pa dang po gnyis gang yin pa de ni nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir sngar bstan to //
analyzed: gsum tshan dang po la yang rnam pa dang po gnyis gang yin pa de ni nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir sngar bstan to //
translated: Also, in the first three, the first two are taught first because they are the appropriated.

original: rnam pa gsum pa gang yin pa de ni nye bar blang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir phyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum pa gang yin pa de ni nye bar blang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir phyis so //
translated: The third is taught later because it is that which is to be appropriated.

original: rnam pa dang po gnyis la yang shes bya la 'jug pa ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang por ro //
analyzed: rnam pa dang po gnyis la yang shes bya la 'jug pa ni rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang por ro //
translated: Also, in the first two, engagement in knowable objects is taught first because it is the cause.

original: rnam pa gnyis pa ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir phyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis pa ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir phyis so //
translated: The second is taught later because it is the result.

original: sgrub pa la yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs ji ltar rags pa bzhin go rims yin te /
analyzed: sgrub pa la yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs ji ltar rags pa bzhin go rims yin te /
translated: Also, in the practice, the order is that of the coarsest to the most subtle discordances.

original: 'di ltar 'chal pa'i tshul khrims ni brtag sla ba'i phyir ches rags pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'chal pa'i tshul khrims ni brtag sla ba'i phyir ches rags pas /
translated: Thus, immorality is very gross because it is easy to discern.

original: de'i gnyen por lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'o //
translated: The training in superior morality is the antidote to that.

original: de bzhin du rgod pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba la sogs pa rags pa de dag gi gnyen por lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgod pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba la sogs pa rags pa de dag gi gnyen por lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the training in superior mind is the antidote to those very gross things such as excitement and distraction.

original: de bzhin du gnas ngan len gyi sa bon rjes su 'brel pa ni phra bas de'i gnyen por lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas ngan len gyi sa bon rjes su 'brel pa ni phra bas de'i gnyen por lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the training in superior wisdom is the antidote to the subtle, i.e., the seeds of negative reflex actions.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na sa'i rim pas go rims su bslab pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na sa'i rim pas go rims su bslab pa yin te /
translated: In one aspect, the trainings are sequential in terms of the stages of the grounds.

original: 'di ltar sa gnyis pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pas rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa gnyis pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pas rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: Thus, the second ground is distinguished by the training in superior morality,

original: de la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the perfection of morality is fulfilled on that ground.

original: sa gsum pa ni lhag pa'i sems kyi @303b bslab pas rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: sa gsum pa ni lhag pa'i sems kyi @303b bslab pas rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: The third ground is distinguished by the training in superior mind,üîΩbecause the perfection of patience is fulfilled on that ground.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they abide in mundane meditative stabilization, concentration, and meditative equipoise.

original: bzhi pa la sogs pa ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pas rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: bzhi pa la sogs pa ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pas rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: The fourth and so on are distinguished by the training in superior wisdom,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa la sogs pa rab tu rnam par 'byed bas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa la sogs pa rab tu rnam par 'byed bas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they abide in the differentiation of the factors conducive to awakening and so on.

original: spangs pa dang ye shes dag kyang bden pa ji ltar bstan pa bzhin go rims yin te /
analyzed: spangs pa dang ye shes dag kyang bden pa ji ltar bstan pa bzhin go rims yin te /
translated: Abandonment and wisdom are in order according to the way the truths are taught.

original: 'di ltar mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pas bsdus pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pas bsdus pa yin la /
translated: Thus, nonabiding nirvana is subsumed by the truth of cessation,

original: de'i 'bras bur gyur pa ye shes ni lam gyi bden pas bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bur gyur pa ye shes ni lam gyi bden pas bsdus pa yin te /
translated: and the wisdom that becomes its result is subsumed by the truth of the path.

original: ye shes kyi khyad par ni spangs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir go rims de ltar bstan to //
analyzed: ye shes kyi khyad par ni spangs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir go rims de ltar bstan to //
translated: The distinctive wisdom is taught in that order because it is preceded by abandonment.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas ni go rims gzhan du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas ni go rims gzhan du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The treatise author taught in a different order.

original: chos rnams kyi rgyu la mkhas pa la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rgyu la mkhas pa la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase based on expertise regarding the causes of entities and so on.

original: rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyu yongs su spangs pa'i phyir rgyu la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyu yongs su spangs pa'i phyir rgyu la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Expertise regarding causes is because the notion that entities arise without a cause or from a discordant cause has been abandoned.

original: de'i ched du shes bya'i gnas bstan te /
analyzed: de'i ched du shes bya'i gnas bstan te /
translated: The bases of the knowable are taught for the sake of that expertise.

original: chos thams cad ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all entities are dependent on the storehouse consciousness.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas par zhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'gro ba rnam par 'byed pa dang nye bar spyod pa pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas par zhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'gro ba rnam par 'byed pa dang nye bar spyod pa pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase expertise regarding dependent origination is stated because dependent origination is taught in terms of the differentiation of the pleasant and unpleasant destinies and the enjoyment of their results.

original: rgyu la mkhas pa zhes bya ba smos pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu la mkhas pa zhes bya ba smos pa ni /
translated: The phrase expertise regarding causes is stated

original: ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: because dependent origination is taught in terms of the differentiation of entities.

original: 'dir yang gzhan la mkhas pa ni ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir yang gzhan la mkhas pa ni ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, too, expertise in other topics is preceded by expertise in the dependent origination of the differentiation of the entities of things.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas par phyis bstan to //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas par phyis bstan to //
translated: Therefore, expertise in dependent origination is taught later.

original: de'i 'og tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas na chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la 'jug par nus pas shes bya'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas na chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la 'jug par nus pas shes bya'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: After that, since one who is expert in dependent origination is able to engage the characteristics of phenomena, the characteristics of objects of knowledge are taught.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa'i mtha'i nyes pa yongs su spangs pa zhes bya ba de la kun brtags la sgro 'dogs pa ni bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa'i mtha'i nyes pa yongs su spangs pa zhes bya ba de la kun brtags la sgro 'dogs pa ni bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pa lta bu ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúcompletely abandoning the faults of the extremes of superimposition and denial‚Äù means that superimposition with regard to the imaginary is like the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika and so on,

original: gzugs la sogs pa la de kho na nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la de kho na nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they assert form and so on to be reality.

original: gzhan gyi dbang la skur pa 'debs pa ni bdag nyid thams cad du gdags pa'i gzhi spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang la skur pa 'debs pa ni bdag nyid thams cad du gdags pa'i gzhi spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Denial with regard to the dependent is like the VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´ya, because they completely abandon the basis of imputation of all things.

original: yongs su grub pa la skur pa 'debs pa yang kha @304a * //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa la skur pa 'debs pa yang kha @304a * //
translated: Also, it is nihilism with regard to the consummate.

original: cig tu med par rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: cig tu med par rtogs pa'am /
translated: Some, by understanding the thoroughly established nature as nonexistent,üîΩundermine it.

original: kun rdzob tu yod par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Others, by understanding it as existent in the relative,üîΩundermine it.

original: re zhig gcig tu med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig gcig tu med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not nonexistent in one sense,

original: de bzhin nyid rdzas kyi chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid rdzas kyi chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because suchness is a substantial phenomenon.

original: gdags pa'i nye bar len pa med par ni btags pa'i ngo bos stong pa'i de bzhin nyid nges par gzung bar mi nus so //
analyzed: gdags pa'i nye bar len pa med par ni btags pa'i ngo bos stong pa'i de bzhin nyid nges par gzung bar mi nus so //
translated: Without the appropriation of the imputed, suchness, which is empty of the imputed nature, cannot be ascertained.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bzhin du btags pa'i yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bzhin du btags pa'i yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it imputedly existent, like impermanence and so on,

original: de dag ni gnas skabs kyi bye brag la btags pas 'khrul pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de dag ni gnas skabs kyi bye brag la btags pas 'khrul pa'i phyir la /
translated: because those are imputed in terms of specific states and are thus mistaken,

original: de bzhin nyid ni gnas skabs thams cad du mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni gnas skabs thams cad du mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: whereas suchness is not mistaken in any state.

original: de bas na bstan pa'i phyir rdzas yin la /
analyzed: de bas na bstan pa'i phyir rdzas yin la /
translated: Therefore, because it is taught to be substantial,

original: rdzas kyi chos yin pa'i phyir med pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas kyi chos yin pa'i phyir med pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: it is not nonexistent, because it is a substantial phenomenon.

original: de ltar na brtags pa la sgro 'dogs par mi byed pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa dag la skur pa 'debs par mi byed pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa'i nyes pa spangs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar na brtags pa la sgro 'dogs par mi byed pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa dag la skur pa 'debs par mi byed pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa'i nyes pa spangs pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, because one does not reify the imagined, and because one does not deprecate the relative and the perfect, one abandons the errors of reification and deprecation.üîΩOr else, the abandonment of the errors of reification and deprecation should be applied to each of the three natures.

original: yang na ngo bo nyid re re la yang sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba'i nyes pa spangs pa nyid sbyar te de la brtags pa la sgro 'dogs pa nyid snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na ngo bo nyid re re la yang sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba'i nyes pa spangs pa nyid sbyar te de la brtags pa la sgro 'dogs pa nyid snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Reification of the imagined is as before.

original: skur pa 'debs pa ni thams cad kyi thams cad du kun rdzob tu yang sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa ni thams cad kyi thams cad du kun rdzob tu yang sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Deprecation is the total and complete denial of the relative.

original: gzhan gyi dbang la sgro 'dogs pa ni mdo sde pa la sogs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang la sgro 'dogs pa ni mdo sde pa la sogs pa lta bu ste /
translated: Reification of the relative is like the Sautrantikas,

original: de kho na nyid kho nar khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kho nar khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they accept it as reality.

original: 'di ltar sems dang sems las byung ba rnams rigs mthun pa'i dngos po dang bral ba'i phyir de kho na'i bdag nyid du ni bsgrub par ni mi nus kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems dang sems las byung ba rnams rigs mthun pa'i dngos po dang bral ba'i phyir de kho na'i bdag nyid du ni bsgrub par ni mi nus kyi /
translated: Thus, since mind and mental factors are devoid of a real entity that is of a homogeneous kind, they cannot be established as just thatness.

original: de ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis gzhi med par ma brtags pas rten cing 'brel pa nyid du khas blang ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis gzhi med par ma brtags pas rten cing 'brel pa nyid du khas blang ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: That is merely accepted as dependent origination, without being examined as to whether it has a basis or not, by means of mundane conventions.

original: gzugs ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis sems dang sems las byung ba las gud na yod par brtags te /
analyzed: gzugs ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis sems dang sems las byung ba las gud na yod par brtags te /
translated: Form is imagined to exist apart from mind and mental factors by means of mundane conventions.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa la 'khrul pa'i phyir dang / shin tu brtags mi bzod pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid yin pa bsal lo //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa la 'khrul pa'i phyir dang / shin tu brtags mi bzod pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid yin pa bsal lo //
translated: Since it is deceptive in dreams and so on, and since it is utterly incapable of withstanding analysis, it is excluded from being dependent origination.

original: skur pa 'debs pa ni snga ma bzhin sbyar ro //
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa ni snga ma bzhin sbyar ro //
translated: Denigration is to be applied as before.

original: yongs su grub pa la sgro 'dogs pa ni ji ltar brjod pa de kho na bzhin du de kho na nyid du yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa la sgro 'dogs pa ni ji ltar brjod pa de kho na bzhin du de kho na nyid du yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Exaggeration with regard to the consummate is to apprehend it as just thatness in accordance with what is said.

original: skur pa 'debs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The denial is as before.

original: gzhan dag ni gzhan gyi dbang la sgro 'dogs pa bzhin du 'chad de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gzhan gyi dbang la sgro 'dogs pa bzhin du 'chad de /
translated: Others explain that the superimposition is like the other-dependent,

original: ji ltar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid du grags pa de ltar mngon par zhen pa'i @304b phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid du grags pa de ltar mngon par zhen pa'i @304b phyir yin gyi /
translated: because it is the object of the conception that conceives it to exist in the way it is renowned to exist.

original: yod pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pas dben pa'i bdag nyid du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pas dben pa'i bdag nyid du ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the nature that is devoid of the apprehended and apprehender, because it exists.

original: de ltar sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa yin no zhes so //
analyzed: de ltar sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa yin no zhes so //
translated: Thus, because it is superimposed in that way, it is a superimposition.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos de dag la zhes bya bas 'dir brgal ba /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos de dag la zhes bya bas 'dir brgal ba /
translated: With regard to those phenomena that are dependently arisen,

original: gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dag la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa spangs pa nyid kyis mtshan nyid la mkhas pa yin na brtags pa dang yongs su grub pa dag la mkhas pa go skabs su ci 'bab ste /
analyzed: gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dag la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa spangs pa nyid kyis mtshan nyid la mkhas pa yin na brtags pa dang yongs su grub pa dag la mkhas pa go skabs su ci 'bab ste /
translated: if being skilled in the characteristics is just the abandonment of superimposition and denial in relation to dependent origination, then what opportunity is there for being skilled in the imputed and the thoroughly established?

original: gcig ni med pa nyid kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: gcig ni med pa nyid kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: One does not exist, because it is not dependently arisen.

original: cig shos de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyang rtag pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: cig shos de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyang rtag pa'i phyir ro /
translated: The other is the characteristic of thusness, because it is permanent.

original: zhe na de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: zhe na de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so, because

original: mtshan nyid la mkhas pa zhes bshad pa mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid la mkhas pa zhes bshad pa mtshan nyid ni /
translated: it is explained that one who is skilled in the characteristicsüîΩis skilled in the three natures.

original: 'dis mtshon pas na gzhan gyi dbang la kun brtags pa dang yongs su grub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis mtshon pas na gzhan gyi dbang la kun brtags pa dang yongs su grub pa yin te /
translated: The dependent is the imagined and the perfected, because it is characterized by them.

original: 'di ltar sems can ma dag pa rnams kyis ni brtags pa'i bdag nyid du dag pa rnams kyis ni bdag med pa'i bdag nyid du mtshon to //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can ma dag pa rnams kyis ni brtags pa'i bdag nyid du dag pa rnams kyis ni bdag med pa'i bdag nyid du mtshon to //
translated: Thus, impure sentient beings are characterized by the imagined nature, and pure sentient beings are characterized by the nature of selflessness.

original: gzhan gyi dbang rang nyid ni mtshon par bya ba yin pas na mtshan nyid de de nyid sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang rang nyid ni mtshon par bya ba yin pas na mtshan nyid de de nyid sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The dependent itself is that which is characterized, and thus it is characterized.

original: 'di la thams cad kyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa bzhi dang / don dam pa'i bden pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di la thams cad kyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa bzhi dang / don dam pa'i bden pa bzhi'o //
translated: Here, there are four conventional truths and four ultimate truths for all.

original: de la 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu ni brtags pa la sgro yang mi 'dogs skur pa yang mi 'debs so //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu ni brtags pa la sgro yang mi 'dogs skur pa yang mi 'debs so //
translated: In the conventional of the world, one does not superimpose or deprecate the imagined.

original: rigs pa'i kun rdzob tu ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid gzhan gyi dbang la sgro yang mi 'dogs skur ba yang mi 'debs so //
analyzed: rigs pa'i kun rdzob tu ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid gzhan gyi dbang la sgro yang mi 'dogs skur ba yang mi 'debs so //
translated: In the rational conventional, one does not exaggerate or depreciate the other-dependent which is the reality of mind and mental functions.

original: rtogs pa'i kun rdzob tu ni bden pa'i lugs ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa la mngon par zhen pa nyid kyis sgro yang mi 'dogs la /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i kun rdzob tu ni bden pa'i lugs ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa la mngon par zhen pa nyid kyis sgro yang mi 'dogs la /
translated: In the realized conventional, one does not exaggerate by adherence to the way things are established in truth,üîΩand one does not deprecate by denying the absence of realization.

original: mngon par rtogs pa dang mthun pa med par skur pa yang mi 'debs so //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa dang mthun pa med par skur pa yang mi 'debs so //
translated: In the ultimate conventional, one does not exaggerate or depreciate the accomplished which is described as follows:

original: don dam pa'i kun rdzob tu ni ji skad brjod pa'i yongs su grub pa la /
analyzed: don dam pa'i kun rdzob tu ni ji skad brjod pa'i yongs su grub pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe ultimate is the object of the ultimate wisdom.

original: sgro yang mi 'dogs skur pa yang mi 'debs te /
analyzed: sgro yang mi 'dogs skur pa yang mi 'debs te /
translated: It is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones, not of the non-noble ones.üîΩIt is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones, not of the non-noble ones.üîΩIt is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones, not of the non-noble ones.üîΩIt is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones, not of the non-noble ones.üîΩIt is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones, not of the non-noble ones.üîΩIt is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones, not of the non-noble ones.üîΩIt is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones, not of the non-noble ones.üîΩIt is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones, not of the non-noble ones.üîΩIt is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones, not of the non-noble ones.üîΩIt is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones, not of the non-noble ones.üîΩIt is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones, not of the non-noble ones.üîΩIt is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones, not of the non-noble ones.üîΩIt is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones, not of the non-noble ones.üîΩIt is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones, not of the non-noble ones.üîΩIt is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones, not of the non-noble ones.üîΩIt is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones, not of the non-noble ones.üîΩIt is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones, not of the non-noble ones.üîΩIt is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones, not of the non-noble ones.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi don dam pa dang rigs pa'i don dam pa dang / rtogs pa'i don dam pa dang / don dam pa'i don dam pas de kho na bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa spangs pa nyid sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi don dam pa dang rigs pa'i don dam pa dang / rtogs pa'i don dam pa dang / don dam pa'i don dam pas de kho na bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa spangs pa nyid sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones, not of the non-noble ones.üîΩIt is the object of the wisdom of the noble ones, not of the non-noble

original: gzhan dag ni phung po la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams la bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang rmongs pa yongs su 'gyur ba la sogs pa nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni phung po la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams la bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang rmongs pa yongs su 'gyur ba la sogs pa nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Others are reifications because they reify the aggregates and so on, which are dependently arisen, as pleasure, pain, or confusion.

original: @305a * // bdag nyid thams cad du med par rtogs pa'i phyir skur pa 'debs pa'o zhes brjod de /
analyzed: @305a * // bdag nyid thams cad du med par rtogs pa'i phyir skur pa 'debs pa'o zhes brjod de /
translated: They are denigrations because they are understood to be nonexistent in every way.

original: brtags pa la sogs pa ngo bo nyid gsum dang sbyor bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brtags pa la sogs pa ngo bo nyid gsum dang sbyor bas ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not applied to the three realities such as the imagined reality and so on.

original: rtogs par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rtogs par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone should understand‚Äù and so on.

original: mkhas pa dang po la ni phan yon rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa yin la /
analyzed: mkhas pa dang po la ni phan yon rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa yin la /
translated: The first expert is skilled in dependent origination.

original: gnyis pa la yang mtha' gnyis spang ba la mkhas pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gnyis pa la yang mtha' gnyis spang ba la mkhas pa ma yin nam /
translated: The second is skilled in the avoidance of the two extremes.

original: khas pa ni shes pa yin pas de nyid rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khas pa ni shes pa yin pas de nyid rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Since expertise is knowledge, it is the understanding of reality.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: mkhas pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba zag pa dang bcas pa yin par bzhed la /
analyzed: mkhas pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba zag pa dang bcas pa yin par bzhed la /
translated: The wise are those who have the contaminated wisdom arisen from hearing, contemplation, and meditation of the stage of earnest aspiration.

original: rtogs pa ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes yin no //
translated: Realization is uncontaminated transcendent wisdom.

original: des sgrib pa rnams las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: des sgrib pa rnams las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey are liberated from obscurations‚Äù and so on.

original: de la dro ba'i gnas skabs na ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa rnam par gnon pa'i spong bas kun du mi 'byung ba tsam rnam par grol ba yin te /
analyzed: de la dro ba'i gnas skabs na ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa rnam par gnon pa'i spong bas kun du mi 'byung ba tsam rnam par grol ba yin te /
translated: At the stage of heat, they are liberated by the abandonment that suppresses the factors incompatible with the perfections, such as stinginess, and so on, and they are merely not manifest.

original: de dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: rtse mo dang bzod pa dang chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs na ni /
analyzed: rtse mo dang bzod pa dang chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs na ni /
translated: At the stages of peak, patience, and supreme attribute,

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa kun brtags pa rnam par gnon pa rnam par grol ba yin no //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa kun brtags pa rnam par gnon pa rnam par grol ba yin no //
translated: they are liberated by the suppression of the afflictive obscurations and the imaginary part of the knowable obscurations that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs na ni sgrib pa rnam pa de gnyi ga'i sa bon yang dag par bcom pa rnam par grol ba yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs na ni sgrib pa rnam pa de gnyi ga'i sa bon yang dag par bcom pa rnam par grol ba yin no //
translated: At the time of the path of seeing, one is liberated by the complete destruction of the seeds of both obscurations.

original: de yan chad rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon lhan cig skyes pa rim gyis yang dag par 'joms te /
analyzed: de yan chad rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon lhan cig skyes pa rim gyis yang dag par 'joms te /
translated: From that point on, up to the vajra-like samadhi, one gradually and completely destroys the innate seeds of the obscurations to omniscience.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba lhan cig skyed pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni sa bzhi pa la thams cad kyi thams cad du rnam par mnan to //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba lhan cig skyed pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni sa bzhi pa la thams cad kyi thams cad du rnam par mnan to //
translated: The innate views of the transitory collection and extreme views, which are concomitant with the mental consciousness, are completely suppressed on the fourth ground.

original: de las gzhan pa 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams rnam pa thams cad du rnam par mnan pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni sa brgyad pa la rnam par mnan to //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams rnam pa thams cad du rnam par mnan pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni sa brgyad pa la rnam par mnan to //
translated: Other than that, attachment, anger, and ignorance are completely suppressed, and the afflicted mind is suppressed on the eighth ground.

original: thams cad kyi sa bon dang nyon mongs pas 'phangs pa'i bag chags ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis cig car kun nas 'joms so //
analyzed: thams cad kyi sa bon dang nyon mongs pas 'phangs pa'i bag chags ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis cig car kun nas 'joms so //
translated: The seeds of all and the instinct projected by the addictions are simultaneously and totally destroyed by the diamond-like meditative concentration.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa la brten nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa la brten nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Based on the purity of the will means

original: sa bcu pa las bstan pa drang po'i bsam pa nyid la @305b sogs pas so //
analyzed: sa bcu pa las bstan pa drang po'i bsam pa nyid la @305b sogs pas so //
translated: based on the straightforward will taught in the Ten Stages.

original: sngar sbyor ba can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: sngar sbyor ba can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Those who have previously practiced and so on.

original: rgyun gcig pa'i phyir de skad brjod de /
analyzed: rgyun gcig pa'i phyir de skad brjod de /
translated: This is said because of the continuity.

original: rgyur gyur pa gang dag yin pa de dag rtogs pa'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa gang dag yin pa de dag rtogs pa'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: Those who are causes are to be accomplished by realization.

original: rtogs par bsgrub pa yang pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa'i sa bon bcom pa dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas yongs su zin pa'i sgo nas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams gags med par 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs par bsgrub pa yang pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa'i sa bon bcom pa dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas yongs su zin pa'i sgo nas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams gags med par 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of realization is the unobstructed engagement in the transcendences, by the destruction of the seeds of the resistances to the transcendences, stinginess, etc., and by the possession of the purity of the three sectors, as taught in the Ten Stages.

original: de'i 'og tu lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i rgyu can sa bcu'i mtshan nyid bsgom pa rab tu dbye ba yin pas de bstan to //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i rgyu can sa bcu'i mtshan nyid bsgom pa rab tu dbye ba yin pas de bstan to //
translated: Then, after that, the cultivation of the characteristics of the ten stages, which are caused by the purity of superior intention, is the division. Therefore, that is taught.

original: de yang yong ni bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis kyis yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de yang yong ni bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis kyis yin mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, it is indeed by two incalculable aeons,

original: 'on kyang gsum nyid ni der yongs su rdzogs pa yin pas grangs med pa gsum du zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang gsum nyid ni der yongs su rdzogs pa yin pas grangs med pa gsum du zhes bshad do //
translated: but since it is completely perfected in three, it is explained as three incalculable aeons.

original: bslab pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni sa la brten pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bslab pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni sa la brten pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the complete training is based on the stages,

original: de'i 'og tu bslab pa gsum ste /üîΩ'di dag gi nang go rims ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bslab pa gsum ste / 'di dag gi nang go rims ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: after that, there are three trainings.üîΩThe order of these is the same as before.

original: lhag ma'i go rims kyang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma'i go rims kyang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The order of the rest is also the same as before.

original: theg pa chen po thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: theg pa chen po thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The entire Great Vehicle is completely perfected means

original: dmigs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag ci skad bshad pa'i sgo nas so //üîΩ'di ni bcu po mdor bsdus nas rnam par bshad pa yin te //
analyzed: dmigs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag ci skad bshad pa'i sgo nas so // 'di ni bcu po mdor bsdus nas rnam par bshad pa yin te //
translated: by the distinctions of object and so on, as explained.üîΩThis is a brief explanation of the ten.

original: rgyas par ni 'di man chad nas ston to //
analyzed: rgyas par ni 'di man chad nas ston to //
translated: The extensive explanation is taught from here on.

original: der yang rnam grangs dang rang gi mtshan nyid dang rigs pa dang rab tu dbye ba dang rnam pa bzhi rnam par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: der yang rnam grangs dang rang gi mtshan nyid dang rigs pa dang rab tu dbye ba dang rnam pa bzhi rnam par bshad par bya ste /
translated: There, the four topics are the enumeration, the characteristic, the reason, and the division.

original: nyan pa po rnams kyis bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dang por rnam grangs tsam zhig bsnyad do //
analyzed: nyan pa po rnams kyis bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dang por rnam grangs tsam zhig bsnyad do //
translated: First, the enumeration is stated in order that the listeners may understand the distinctions.

original: de'i 'og tu brjod par bya bar 'dod pa rnams la mtshan nyid brjod do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu brjod par bya bar 'dod pa rnams la mtshan nyid brjod do //
translated: Then, the characteristics are stated for those who wish to speak about them.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir rigs pa rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir rigs pa rgyas pa'o //
translated: The reason is extensive in order to establish the characteristics.

original: rigs pas bsgrubs pa rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la rnam par gnas par bya ba'i phyir rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: rigs pas bsgrubs pa rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la rnam par gnas par bya ba'i phyir rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: The division is in order to establish the tenets that are established by reason.

original: rnam grangs la yang khyad par rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs la yang khyad par rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of enumeration:

original: theg pa chen po'i thun mong ma yin pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa dang theg pa chen po thun mong pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i thun mong ma yin pa dang / de'i brtsad pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i thun mong ma yin pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa dang theg pa chen po thun mong pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i thun mong ma yin pa dang / de'i brtsad pa'o //
translated: the uncommon enumeration of the Mahayana, the common enumeration of the ≈õrƒÅvaka vehicle and the Mahayana, the uncommon enumeration of the ≈õrƒÅvaka vehicle, and the debate about that.

original: de la brtsad pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la brtsad pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The dispute is this:

original: ci 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyud la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya bas rnam grangs shig yin nam 'on te de dang tha dad pa zhig yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyud la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya bas rnam grangs shig yin nam 'on te de dang tha dad pa zhig yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Is the so-called foundation consciousness a synonym for the stream of entry consciousness, or is it something different from that?

original: de la @306a * //
analyzed: de la @306a * //
translated: In this regard,

original: re zhig rnam grangs dang po'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: re zhig rnam grangs dang po'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: first, with respect to the first alternative,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bstan pas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bstan pas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gang du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: the BhagavƒÅn taught the foundation consciousness in the S≈´tra on the Ten Grounds, saying, ‚ÄúHere, the foundation consciousness is called the storehouse consciousness.üîΩ‚Äù

original: 'dir ni 'dri ba'i lan 'chad par 'gyur ba dang sbyar na 'dri ba 'di theg pa chen po pa mi mkhas pa zhig yin par mngon te /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'dri ba'i lan 'chad par 'gyur ba dang sbyar na 'dri ba 'di theg pa chen po pa mi mkhas pa zhig yin par mngon te /
translated: Here, if the answer is connected with what will be explained, it is clear that the questioner is an unwise follower of the MahƒÅyƒÅna,

original: 'di ltar dris pa'i don theg pa chen por gtogs pa'i mdo brjod pas gtan la dbab pa mdzad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dris pa'i don theg pa chen por gtogs pa'i mdo brjod pas gtan la dbab pa mdzad do //
translated: because the meaning of the question is settled by citing a s≈´tra included in the MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: 'on te sde pa zhig 'drin 'on kyang nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'on te sde pa zhig 'drin 'on kyang nyes pa med de /
translated: Or if the questioner is a sectarian, still there is no fault.

original: 'di ltar de ltar tshad mas theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyi gsung yin par khas len du bcug pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ltar tshad mas theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyi gsung yin par khas len du bcug pas so //
translated: Thus, by having the opponent accept that the Mahayana is the word of the Buddha through valid knowledge, he has been led to accept the existence of the foundation consciousness.

original: yang na slob dpon nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo la bltas nas /
analyzed: yang na slob dpon nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo la bltas nas /
translated: Or, the master himself, having considered future generations,

original: bdag nyid kyis dris nas lan gdab pa byas pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis dris nas lan gdab pa byas pa yin no //
translated: has asked the question and given the answer.

original: thog ma med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: As for the phrase ‚Äúbeginningless,‚Äù etc.,

original: 'dir yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs 'di bris na shes bya'i gnas zhes bya ba'i sgra chos kun gyi gnas yin pa nyid du ston pa mdzad de /
analyzed: 'dir yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs 'di bris na shes bya'i gnas zhes bya ba'i sgra chos kun gyi gnas yin pa nyid du ston pa mdzad de /
translated: here, if the term ‚Äúfoundation consciousness‚Äù is written, the term ‚Äúbasis of all objects of knowledge‚Äù indicates that it is the basis of all phenomena.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dris na /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dris na /
translated: If the foundation consciousness is asked about,

original: de yang dri ba byas pa yin no snyam du dgongs pas so //
analyzed: de yang dri ba byas pa yin no snyam du dgongs pas so //
translated: it is also asked about.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni skabs su ma bab pa ma yin gyi skabs su bab pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni skabs su ma bab pa ma yin gyi skabs su bab pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is not an inappropriate context, but an appropriate one.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i lan gdab par mdzad pa yin na yang ci ltar sngar shes bya'i gnas bstan nas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang shes bya'i gnas kyi ngo bo nyid dpyad pas kun gzhi
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i lan gdab par mdzad pa yin na yang ci ltar sngar shes bya'i gnas bstan nas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang shes bya'i gnas kyi ngo bo nyid dpyad pas kun gzhi
translated: In one sense, it is a response to the foundation consciousness, but just as the existence of the foundation consciousness was taught after the existence of the object of knowledge was taught, here also the nature of the object of knowledge is analyzed and the foundation consciousness is refuted.

original: rnam par shes pa'i sgra dpyod par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i sgra dpyod par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: In one way, it is a reply to the consciousness of the store-consciousness. But just as the consciousness of the store-consciousness was taught after the teaching of the stations of consciousness, in the same way, here also, the word consciousness is analyzed by the analysis of the nature of the stations of consciousness.

original: rnam grangs kyi skabs su don gyi skabs la ci 'bab ces brjod par yang mi nus te /
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi skabs su don gyi skabs la ci 'bab ces brjod par yang mi nus te /
translated: It cannot be said that the meaning of the word is applied to the meaning in the case of the synonyms,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid bstan pa 'di ltar ma yin pa ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid bstan pa 'di ltar ma yin pa ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not like the teaching of the own-characteristic, as will be explained later.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi zhes bya ba ni glo bur du byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi zhes bya ba ni glo bur du byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since beginningless time means that it is not adventitious.

original: dbyings zhes bya ba ni rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbyings zhes bya ba ni rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word dhƒÅtu means cause.

original: chos rnams kun gyi 'dri ba'i gnas //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos rnams kun gyi 'dri ba'i gnas //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
translated: The station of all dharmas.

original: 'di la re zhig las dge ba dang mi dge ba ni gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la re zhig las dge ba dang mi dge ba ni gnas ma yin no //
translated: First, neither a virtuous nor nonvirtuous action is a basis.üîΩIf they were a basis, they would be the ripened effect.

original: de dag gnas shig yin na rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i yin par 'gyur grang na rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu lhan cig pa'am /
analyzed: de dag gnas shig yin na rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i yin par 'gyur grang na rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu lhan cig pa'am /
translated: But there is no simultaneous or immediate ripened effect.

original: de ma thag pa ni med pas gang gi tshe 'bras bu de byung ba na las de 'das so //
analyzed: de ma thag pa ni med pas gang gi tshe 'bras bu de byung ba na las de 'das so //
translated: When that effect occurs, the action has already ceased.

original: 'das pa yang gnas ma yin te byed pa zhig pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: 'das pa yang gnas ma yin te byed pa zhig pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: Nor is the past a basis, because it is like a sky flower, since it has already been performed.

original: @306b skal ba mnyam pa dang srog gi dbang po dag kyang gnas nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: @306b skal ba mnyam pa dang srog gi dbang po dag kyang gnas nyid ma yin te /
translated: Nor are the homogeneous cause and the life faculty a basis,

original: rdzas su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not substantially exist.

original: gal te de thams cad yin pa zhig tu gyur na yang tshad yod pa zhig gi gnas yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de thams cad yin pa zhig tu gyur na yang tshad yod pa zhig gi gnas yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were all, they would be a basis of limited quantity.

original: bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bo tsam gyis kun gyi gnas so zhes brtags par yang mi nus te /
analyzed: bgegs mi byed pa'i ngo bo tsam gyis kun gyi gnas so zhes brtags par yang mi nus te /
translated: It is also not possible to impute that they are a basis by the mere nature of not obstructing.

original: 'di ltar gnas med pa yang gnas nyid du thal par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas med pa yang gnas nyid du thal par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would follow that a nonbasis would be a basis.

original: de bzhin du rang gi sde pas kun brtags pa gzhan yang gnas yin pa nyid dgag pa dang / shugs kyis chos kun gyi gnas ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi sde pas kun brtags pa gzhan yang gnas yin pa nyid dgag pa dang / shugs kyis chos kun gyi gnas ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the other imagined entities of our own group are also negated as being the basis, and by implication all entities are the basis of the store consciousness.

original: kun gzhi gang gi gnas yin pa'i kun de brtags pa'i phyir //
analyzed: kun gzhi gang gi gnas yin pa'i kun de brtags pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the store is imagined as the basis of that,

original: de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // mya ngan 'das pa'ang thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // mya ngan 'das pa'ang thob par 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: because of its existence, all beings and even the attainment of nirvana are possible.

original: 'gro kun zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: 'gro kun zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas nyid yin pas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúall beings‚Äù indicates that it is the basis of the defilement aspect of existence.

original: mya ngan 'das pa'ang thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /üîΩthos pa dang bsams pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rnam par byang ba'i gnas nyid yin par ston to //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa'ang thob par 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni / thos pa dang bsams pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rnam par byang ba'i gnas nyid yin par ston to //
translated: ‚ÄúEven the attainment of nirvana‚ÄùüîΩindicates that it is the basis of the purification aspect of existence.

original: rgyu med par smra ba dgag pa'i phyir thog ma med pa'i dus zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rgyu med par smra ba dgag pa'i phyir thog ma med pa'i dus zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to refute the doctrine of causeless origination, the root text states that the store consciousness has existed since beginningless time.

original: smra ba gang dag kha cig mi mthun pa'i rgyu gtso bo la sogs pa rtag pa nyid kyis thog ma med pa'i dus par rtog pa yod pa de dag yongs su spang ba'i phyir 'dra ba'i gnas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: smra ba gang dag kha cig mi mthun pa'i rgyu gtso bo la sogs pa rtag pa nyid kyis thog ma med pa'i dus par rtog pa yod pa de dag yongs su spang ba'i phyir 'dra ba'i gnas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Some philosophers imagine that the cause of the world is eternal, such as Primordial Essence, etc. In order to completely reject this, he says: ‚Äúthe state of similarity.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu dag dang 'dra na gnas yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: 'bras bu dag dang 'dra na gnas yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is: if the effect is similar, it is the state.

original: ji ltar 'bras bu skye ba dang 'brel pa de kho na bzhin du rgyu gang zhig skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa de ni 'bras bu dang 'dra bar dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu skye ba dang 'brel pa de kho na bzhin du rgyu gang zhig skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa de ni 'bras bu dang 'dra bar dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Just as the effect is related to production, so the cause that possesses production and destruction is considered to be similar to the effect.

original: de bzhin du smra ba gang kha cig rgyu rtag pa las kyang 'bras bu skye la /
analyzed: de bzhin du smra ba gang kha cig rgyu rtag pa las kyang 'bras bu skye la /
translated: In the same way, some philosophers imagine that the effect arises from a permanent cause,

original: rgyu ni byed pa dang ldan pa nyid du rtogs par byed pa yod de /
analyzed: rgyu ni byed pa dang ldan pa nyid du rtogs par byed pa yod de /
translated: and that the cause is endowed with activity.

original: dper na bye brag pa dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bye brag pa dag lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the Vai≈õe·π£ikas.

original: de dgag pa'i phyir de yod pas na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dgag pa'i phyir de yod pas na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to refute this, he says: ‚Äúbecause it exists.‚Äù

original: byed pa med pa kho nar yod pa tsam gyis rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byed pa med pa kho nar yod pa tsam gyis rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the statement is that it is a cause by its mere existence, without any activity.
