original: 'dir yang de kho na yod pas zhes bya ba dang de yod pa kho nas shes /üîΩgnyi gar nges par gzung bar bya rig pas bya ste /üîΩgang dag rgyu rtag pa yin la bdag la sogs pa'i rdzas dang gzhan gtso bo las 'bras bu 'byung bar rtog par byed pa de dag ni nges par bzung ba dang bos bsal to //
analyzed: 'dir yang de kho na yod pas zhes bya ba dang de yod pa kho nas shes / gnyi gar nges par gzung bar bya rig pas bya ste / gang dag rgyu rtag pa yin la bdag la sogs pa'i rdzas dang gzhan gtso bo las 'bras bu 'byung bar rtog par byed pa de dag ni nges par bzung ba dang bos bsal to //
translated: Here, the phrase ‚Äúby its mere existence‚Äù and the phrase ‚Äúby its existence alone‚Äù are both used to indicate that the cause is not a cause by virtue of any activity.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúby its mere existence‚Äù is used to exclude the notion that the cause is a cause by virtue of some other factor, such as a self or a primary principle.

original: gang dag yod pa tsam dang byed pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis rgyu'i dngos por rtog par byed pa de dag ni nges par gzung ba gnyis pas so //üîΩyang @307a * //
analyzed: gang dag yod pa tsam dang byed pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis rgyu'i dngos por rtog par byed pa de dag ni nges par gzung ba gnyis pas so // yang @307a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúby its existence alone‚Äù is used to exclude the notion that the cause is a cause by virtue of some other factor, such as activity.

original: dpyad par bya ste 'dir gang gi tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas nyid kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes par tha snyad gdags te /
analyzed: dpyad par bya ste 'dir gang gi tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas nyid kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes par tha snyad gdags te /
translated: Now, we must continue our analysis. Here, the alaya-vijnana is designated by the state of affliction.

original: ji skad du kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad sbyor ba zhes 'chad par 'gyur pa lta bu zhig yin na ni phyogs de la ni thog ma med pa'i dus kyi dbyings zhes bya ba kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas nyid kyis dbyings yin par dgongs te
analyzed: ji skad du kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad sbyor ba zhes 'chad par 'gyur pa lta bu zhig yin na ni phyogs de la ni thog ma med pa'i dus kyi dbyings zhes bya ba kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas nyid kyis dbyings yin par dgongs te
translated: If it is the case that all afflicted phenomena are the ‚Äúentanglements‚Äù as will be explained, then in that case, the ‚Äúelement of beginningless time‚Äù is considered to be the element because it is the very basis of affliction.

original: / de'i tshe ni rgyu'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir de yod pas na 'gro kun dang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / de'i tshe ni rgyu'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir de yod pas na 'gro kun dang zhes bya'o //
translated: At that time, it is the causal condition, and therefore it is said, ‚ÄúBecause it exists, all beings.‚Äù

original: rnam par byang ba la ltos na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba la ltos na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon te /
translated: In relation to purification, it is the seed of affliction.

original: bdag po'i rkyen yin te mi mthun pa'i phyogs med par gnyen po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen yin te mi mthun pa'i phyogs med par gnyen po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the dominant condition, because without an opposing factor, there is no antidote.

original: de bas na bdag po'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'ang thob par 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na bdag po'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'ang thob par 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúNirvana is attained because it is the dominant condition.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon la yang ltos rnam par byang ba rang bzhin gyi rigs la yang ltos nas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes par tha snyad gdags te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon la yang ltos rnam par byang ba rang bzhin gyi rigs la yang ltos nas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes par tha snyad gdags te /
translated: When it is designated as the ƒÅlaya consciousness in dependence on the seeds of affliction and in dependence on the naturally existing lineage of purification,

original: dpal phreng seng ge'i nga ro'i mdo las /
analyzed: dpal phreng seng ge'i nga ro'i mdo las /
translated: the Lion‚Äôs Roar of Queen ≈örƒ´mƒÅlƒÅ S≈´tra says,üîΩ‚ÄúIn dependence on the seeds of purification, all sentient beings possess the essence of the tathƒÅgata.‚Äù

original: rnam par byang ba'i sa bon la ltos nas sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can no zhes 'byung ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo las /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i sa bon la ltos nas sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can no zhes 'byung ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo las /
translated: And the MahƒÅparinirvƒÅ·πáa S≈´tra says,üîΩ‚ÄúThe enjoyment body is subsumed by the foundation consciousness and the active consciousnesses.‚Äù

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dag gis longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bsdus so zhes gang 'byung ba lta bu zhig yin na ni de'i phyir 'di lta bu yin te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dag gis longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bsdus so zhes gang 'byung ba lta bu zhig yin na ni de'i phyir 'di lta bu yin te /
translated: If that were so, then it would be like this:

original: thog ma med pa dus kyi dbyings //
analyzed: thog ma med pa dus kyi dbyings //
translated: The realm without beginning or end

original: zhes bya ba gnyi ga'i sa bon la ltos te tha snyad gdags so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gnyi ga'i sa bon la ltos te tha snyad gdags so //
translated: is designated in dependence on the seeds of both.

original: de'i tshe yang bde 'gror 'gyur pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon rgyu'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir dang / thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa rnam par byang ba'i sa bon 'phel zhing kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon yang bsal par byas nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang bde 'gror 'gyur pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon rgyu'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir dang / thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa rnam par byang ba'i sa bon 'phel zhing kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon yang bsal par byas nas /
translated: and the seed of purification is the dominant condition, because the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation, such as those derived from hearing, increase and the seeds of the afflictions are removed.

original: skad cig ma bcu gnyis 'dus pas nye bar gzung ba'i bdag gi ngo bo mngon par grub pa'i sgo nas rnam par byang ba'i sa bon bdag po'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skad cig ma bcu gnyis 'dus pas nye bar gzung ba'i bdag gi ngo bo mngon par grub pa'i sgo nas rnam par byang ba'i sa bon bdag po'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The seed of purification is the dominant condition, because the self that is the object of the twelve moments is established as the nature of the self.üîΩSince that exists, all beings

original: de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // zhes bya ba gsungs la kun nas nyon mongs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi ngo bos bdag po'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par byang ba'i sa bon rgyu'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // zhes bya ba gsungs la kun nas nyon mongs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi ngo bos bdag po'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par byang ba'i sa bon rgyu'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir /
translated: are said to exist. The seed of the afflictions is the dominant condition, because it is the nature of the opposing factor to purification. The seed of purification is the causal condition.

original: mya ngan 'das pa'ang thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa'ang thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, nirvana is also attained.

original: @307b yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon rgyu'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par byang ba'i sa bon yang rnam par byang ba'i rgyu'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du sbyar ba nyid du /üîΩde yod pas na 'gro kun dang // mya ngan 'das pa'ang 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: @307b yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon rgyu'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par byang ba'i sa bon yang rnam par byang ba'i rgyu'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du sbyar ba nyid du / de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // mya ngan 'das pa'ang 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: Or else, the seed of the defilement class is the causal condition, and the seed of the purification class is the causal condition of purification.üîΩBecause of its existence, all beings

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: and even nirvana is attained.

original: rnam pa gcig tu rgyu rtag pa dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu rgyu rtag pa dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: In one sense, in order to refute a permanent cause,

original: thog ma med pa'i dus zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúbeginningless time.‚Äù

original: dus zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Time is characterized by birth and destruction.

original: gang la de rgyun chags par 'jug pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: gang la de rgyun chags par 'jug pa'i sgo nas /
translated: That which has a continuum of thatüîΩis beginningless time.

original: thog ma med pa yod pa de ni thog ma med pa'i dus kyi dbyings /
analyzed: thog ma med pa yod pa de ni thog ma med pa'i dus kyi dbyings /
translated: The realm of that is the beginningless realm.

original: gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i gtso bo la sogs pa ni de ltar bu ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i gtso bo la sogs pa ni de ltar bu ma yin no //
translated: The primal nature imagined by others is not like that.

original: kha cig ni sngon byas pa'i rgyur smra ba khas len la rang gi sde pa nyid dag la yang kha cig rgyu ni snga la 'bras bu ni 'phyi bar rtog par byed de /
analyzed: kha cig ni sngon byas pa'i rgyur smra ba khas len la rang gi sde pa nyid dag la yang kha cig rgyu ni snga la 'bras bu ni 'phyi bar rtog par byed de /
translated: Some accept the theory of the cause of what was done in the past, but some of our own schools imagine that the cause is prior and the effect is subsequent.

original: 'di gnyi ga'ang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag snga phyi yod pa nyid du mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga'ang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag snga phyi yod pa nyid du mngon par zhen to //
translated: Both of these cling to the prior existence of cause and effect.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i lta ba ngan pa de dag bsal pa'i phyir /üîΩchos rnams kun gyi 'dra ba'i gnas //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i lta ba ngan pa de dag bsal pa'i phyir / chos rnams kun gyi 'dra ba'i gnas //
translated: In order to eliminate these bad views of past and future,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: the root text says, ‚ÄúThe state of similarity of all things.‚Äù

original: dus mnyam pa'i gnas ni 'dra ba'i gnas te /
analyzed: dus mnyam pa'i gnas ni 'dra ba'i gnas te /
translated: The state of simultaneity is the state of similarity.

original: 'bras bu dang dus mnyam du rgyu yod pa zhes bya ba'i don yin na /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang dus mnyam du rgyu yod pa zhes bya ba'i don yin na /
translated: The meaning is that the cause exists simultaneously with the effect.

original: de la yang nges par mi zin te /
analyzed: de la yang nges par mi zin te /
translated: But that is not ascertained,

original: la las rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dus tha dad par yang khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la las rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dus tha dad par yang khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because some accept the relation of cause and effect as being different in time.

original: chad par smra ba gang dag kha cig 'di skad du /
analyzed: chad par smra ba gang dag kha cig 'di skad du /
translated: Some nihilists say,

original: 'di nyid du bdag 'di chad par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba yod pas de dgag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di nyid du bdag 'di chad par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba yod pas de dgag pa'i phyir //
translated: Since some say, This self will be annihilated right here, he says this to refute that.

original: de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Since it exists, all beings

original: de yod pas 'gro ba thams cad du 'pho bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yod pas 'gro ba thams cad du 'pho bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since it exists, all beings transmigrate.

original: rtag par smra ba gang dag kha cig 'khor ba'i btson ra ba'i bdag ni rtag pa nyid du rtog par byed pa yod pas de dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag par smra ba gang dag kha cig 'khor ba'i btson ra ba'i bdag ni rtag pa nyid du rtog par byed pa yod pas de dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Some eternalists imagine that the self is permanent in the prison of cyclic existence. Since they exist, he says this to refute them.

original: mya ngan 'das pa'ang thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa'ang thob par 'gyur // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Nirvana is also attained.

original: yang na shes bya'i gnas dpyad pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i sgra dpyod par mdzad pa yin zhes bshad pa shes bya'i gnas de ni rang gi ngo bos shes bya'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum gyi gnas yin la /
analyzed: yang na shes bya'i gnas dpyad pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i sgra dpyod par mdzad pa yin zhes bshad pa shes bya'i gnas de ni rang gi ngo bos shes bya'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum gyi gnas yin la /
translated: Or, since the basis of cognition is analyzed, the term foundation consciousness is analyzed. The basis of cognition is the basis of the three aspects of the characteristics of the object of cognition by nature.

original: de yang tshigs su bcad pas ston to //
analyzed: de yang tshigs su bcad pas ston to //
translated: That is taught in a verse.

original: thog ma med pa dus kyi dbyings //
analyzed: thog ma med pa dus kyi dbyings //
translated: The basic element is beginningless.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: This is its nature.

original: chos rnams kun gyi 'dra ba'i gnas //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos rnams kun gyi 'dra ba'i gnas // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The abode of the sameness of all things.

original: gzhan gyi dbang sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyi gnas @308a * //üîΩyin pa'o // de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad kyi gnas @308a * // yin pa'o // de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: This is the dependent nature, which is the abode of all minds and mental factors.üîΩSince it exists, all beingsüîΩThis is the imagined nature, which is the imagined nature of all afflicted phenomena.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kun brtags pa nyid do zhes 'chad par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kun brtags pa nyid do zhes 'chad par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: It will be explained that

original: mya ngan 'das pa'ang thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i rten nyid de /
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa'ang thob par 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i rten nyid de /
translated: Nirvana is also attained.üîΩThis is the perfected nature, which is the perfected nature of purified phenomena.

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos yongs su grub pa nyid do zhes 'chad par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos yongs su grub pa nyid do zhes 'chad par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: It will be explained that

original: chos kun sa bon thams cad pa //
analyzed: chos kun sa bon thams cad pa //
translated: All phenomena are seeds.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa las grags pa kun gzhi la kun du dga' ba zhes bya ba 'di nyid sbyar bar bya ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa las grags pa kun gzhi la kun du dga' ba zhes bya ba 'di nyid sbyar bar bya ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Since the term ‚Äústorehouse‚Äù is well known in the ≈õrƒÅvaka vehicle, should it not be applied to the storehouse consciousness?

original: 'di las rnam par shes pa smos pa mi 'byung ba sngar ni rnam par shes pa dris te /
analyzed: 'di las rnam par shes pa smos pa mi 'byung ba sngar ni rnam par shes pa dris te /
translated: But the term consciousness does not occur in the latter passage.

original: de lta bas na gang las rnam par shes pa smos pa 'byung ba de nyid nye bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang las rnam par shes pa smos pa 'byung ba de nyid nye bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the passage in which the term consciousness does occur is to be applied to the present context.

original: de ltar na 'o na dge 'dun phal chen sde las grags pa srid pa'i yan lag gi rnam par shes pa nye bar sbyar bar bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na dge 'dun phal chen sde las grags pa srid pa'i yan lag gi rnam par shes pa nye bar sbyar bar bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the consciousness of the members of existence, which is renowned in the MahƒÅsƒÅ·πÉghika school, should not be applied to the present context.

original: de las kyang kun gzhi smos pa mi 'byung la sngar ni kun gzhi dris te /
analyzed: de las kyang kun gzhi smos pa mi 'byung la sngar ni kun gzhi dris te /
translated: But the term store consciousness does not occur in that passage, and the store consciousness was mentioned earlier.

original: de lta bas na gang las gnyi ga 'byung ba de kho na theg pa chen po'i thun mongs ma yin par bshad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang las gnyi ga 'byung ba de kho na theg pa chen po'i thun mongs ma yin par bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the passage in which both terms occur is to be applied to the present context, and that passage is not common to the MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: chos kun zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: chos kun zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi'o //
translated: The term all things refers to all the defilements.

original: grangs can gyis brtags pa gtso bo la sogs pa yang de lta bu yin pas de rnam par bcad pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: grangs can gyis brtags pa gtso bo la sogs pa yang de lta bu yin pas de rnam par bcad pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Since the primal substance, etc., imagined by the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas is also like that, the term consciousness is stated in order to exclude that.

original: 'di de dag gi gnas su 'gyur ba ni rten dang brten pa nyid kyi gnas su 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: 'di de dag gi gnas su 'gyur ba ni rten dang brten pa nyid kyi gnas su 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Are these the bases of these? Are they the bases in the sense of being the foundation and that which is founded?

original: sa bon thams cad pa'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sa bon thams cad pa'i zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The verse says, ‚Äúall seeds. ‚Äù

original: rgyu nyid kyis gnas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu nyid kyis gnas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are the bases in the sense of being the cause.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa yin na 'di'i dmigs pa ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa yin na 'di'i dmigs pa ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: If they are consciousnesses, what are their objects?

original: sa bon dang migs la  sogs pa dang yul gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon dang migs la  sogs pa dang yul gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The objects are seeds, the seen part, etc., and the objects such as form.

original: sa bon de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sa bon de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: These seeds are of two kinds:

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bsten pa'i sa bon yongs su smin pa dang yongs su ma smin pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bsten pa'i sa bon yongs su smin pa dang yongs su ma smin pa'o //
translated: the maturation of wholesome, unwholesome, and neutral seeds, and the nonmaturation of these seeds.

original: sa bon rnam pa de dag gnyi ga yang khams gsum na 'di'i dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: sa bon rnam pa de dag gnyi ga yang khams gsum na 'di'i dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Both of these kinds of seeds are the objects of this consciousness in the three realms.

original: mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa ni 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams kho na'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa ni 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams kho na'o //
translated: The eyes, etc., and form, etc., are only in the desire realm and the form realm.

original: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba yang mig la sogs pa gang dag yin zhe na mig la sogs pa'i sa bon yongs su ma smin pa 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas pa gang gi tshe yongs su smin par gyur pa de'i tshe mig la sogs paüîΩzhes @308b bya'o ;
analyzed: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba yang mig la sogs pa gang dag yin zhe na mig la sogs pa'i sa bon yongs su ma smin pa 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas pa gang gi tshe yongs su smin par gyur pa de'i tshe mig la sogs pa zhes @308b bya'o ;
translated: When they ripen, they are called eyes, etc.

original: ; yang ji ltar yongs su smin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ; yang ji ltar yongs su smin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do they ripen?

original: mig la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur pa'i las srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags dang / mig mig ces bya ba nas lus lus zhes bya ba'i bar gyi mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags la yang brten nas gang gi tshe gzugs can gyi khams su sngon bo la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi bdag po'i rkyen gyi dngos por yongs su gyur
analyzed: mig la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur pa'i las srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags dang / mig mig ces bya ba nas lus lus zhes bya ba'i bar gyi mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags la yang brten nas gang gi tshe gzugs can gyi khams su sngon bo la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi bdag po'i rkyen gyi dngos por yongs su gyur
translated: When the latent potentialities of the members of cyclic existence, the karma that produces the eyes, etc., and the latent potentialities of verbal expressions, such as eye, eye, etc., up to body, body, etc., become the dominant conditions for the consciousnesses of the form realm, such as blue, etc.,

original: pa de'i tshe yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa de'i tshe yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: then they are said to ripen.

original: yang de ltar sa bon yongs su smin pa rnams mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la khyad par ci zhig byad ce na /
analyzed: yang de ltar sa bon yongs su smin pa rnams mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la khyad par ci zhig byad ce na /
translated: Also, what is the difference between the fully ripened seeds and the eye consciousnesses, etc.?

original: re zhig dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sa bon las mig gi rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i ngo bor skye ba la mig yongs su smin pa sgra la sogs pa'i yul la
analyzed: re zhig dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sa bon las mig gi rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i ngo bor skye ba la mig yongs su smin pa sgra la sogs pa'i yul la
translated: First, the eye fully ripens the eye consciousness, etc., from virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral seeds, and causes them to arise as virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral entities.

original: ldog pas rang gi yul la 'jug pa'i khyad par byed do //
analyzed: ldog pas rang gi yul la 'jug pa'i khyad par byed do //
translated: It causes them to engage their own objects by turning them toward their objects, such as form, etc.

original: yang mthong bar 'gyur pa'i srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags mig gis sa bon la ci zhig byed na yongs su smin par byed ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang mthong bar 'gyur pa'i srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags mig gis sa bon la ci zhig byed na yongs su smin par byed ces bya zhe na /
translated: Also, what does the eye do to the latent seeds of the links of existence that will be seen, that it is said to fully ripen them?

original: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro'i ngo bor byed pa la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro'i ngo bor byed pa la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It causes them to be the entities of happy or bad rebirths.

original: mig mig ces mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi mthun las ni ci nas kyang mig mig ces tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur na de ltar mig gis sa bon yongs su 'gyur ro //üîΩmig gi rnam par shes pa ni ;
analyzed: mig mig ces mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi mthun las ni ci nas kyang mig mig ces tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur na de ltar mig gis sa bon yongs su 'gyur ro // mig gi rnam par shes pa ni ;
translated: The eye is the result of the maturation of the latent impressions of the verbal expression ‚Äúeye‚Äù in such a way that it becomes the cause for the conventional expression ‚Äúeye‚Äù in some other person.üîΩThe eye consciousness is the result of the maturation of the latent impressions of the verbal expression ‚Äúeye consciousness‚Äù in such a way that it becomes the cause for the conventional expression ‚Äúeye consciousness‚Äù in some other person.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi khyad par de dang / gzugs gzugs zhes mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi khyad par de las ji lta ji ltar 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa dang /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi khyad par de dang / gzugs gzugs zhes mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi khyad par de las ji lta ji ltar 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa dang /
translated: The eye consciousness arises from the specific latent impressions of the verbal expression ‚Äúeye consciousness‚Äù and from the specific latent impressions of the verbal expression ‚Äúform‚Äù in such a way that it becomes the cause for the adherence to the apprehension of the eye consciousness and for the adherence to the apprehended object.

original: gzung ba mngon par zhen pa'i rgyur 'gyur pa de lta de ltar yongs su 'gyur bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzung ba mngon par zhen pa'i rgyur 'gyur pa de lta de ltar yongs su 'gyur bar 'gyur te /
translated: It arises in such a way that it becomes the cause for the adherence to the apprehension of the eye consciousness and for the adherence to the apprehended object in some other person.

original: de bzhin du rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la yang bsam pa 'di bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la yang bsam pa 'di bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the ear consciousness and so on.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa mig la sogs pa yin no zhes bshad pa ci rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa kho na dmigs sam zhe na /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa mig la sogs pa yin no zhes bshad pa ci rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa kho na dmigs sam zhe na /
translated: Is it only that which is included in one‚Äôs own mental continuum?

original: smras pa ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa dag la yang dmigs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa dag la yang dmigs te /
translated: It also has as its objective supports those included in the mental continuum of another.

original: de skad du sems can du snang ba ni dbang po lngar rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud dag la yang yin pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de skad du sems can du snang ba ni dbang po lngar rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud dag la yang yin pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus it is said, ‚ÄúThe appearance of sentient beings is in the five sense faculties of oneself and others.‚Äù

original: yang ji ltar mig la sogs pa dmigs par 'gyur zhe na /üîΩkun gzhi rnam par shes pa de ni rang gi mig la sogs pa dang 'brel pa dang / gzhan @309a * //
analyzed: yang ji ltar mig la sogs pa dmigs par 'gyur zhe na / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de ni rang gi mig la sogs pa dang 'brel pa dang / gzhan @309a * //
translated: How is it that the eye, etc., are its objective supports?

original: dang 'brel par 'gyur pa'i las kyis gang gis na 'khrul pa can gyi rang gi rgyud la ni sems can gyi rnam par rig pa gzhan gyi rgyud la ni sems can gzhan du rnam par rig pa'i rgyud 'gyur ba de lta bur so sor snang ba'i khyad parüîΩchan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang 'brel par 'gyur pa'i las kyis gang gis na 'khrul pa can gyi rang gi rgyud la ni sems can gyi rnam par rig pa gzhan gyi rgyud la ni sems can gzhan du rnam par rig pa'i rgyud 'gyur ba de lta bur so sor snang ba'i khyad parüîΩchan du 'gyur ro //
translated: The store consciousness is related to one‚Äôs own eye, etc., and to those of another through the power of karma, because of which there is a difference in the appearance of the transformation of the continuum of consciousness, i.e., the appearance of sentient beings in one‚Äôs own deluded mental continuum and the appearance of other sentient beings in the mental continuum of another.üîΩThis is the difference in the appearance of the transformation of the continuum of consciousness.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs nyid 'ba' zhig dmigs par byas pa ma yin nas zhe na /
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs nyid 'ba' zhig dmigs par byas pa ma yin nas zhe na /
translated: But it is not that only color and shape are observed.

original: de ni ma yin te de dag la dmigs kyang de dag dang tha mi dad par grags pa la sogs pa yang dmigs par byas so zhes tha snyad gdags so //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te de dag la dmigs kyang de dag dang tha mi dad par grags pa la sogs pa yang dmigs par byas so zhes tha snyad gdags so //
translated: That is not so, for even though they are observed, it is conventionally said that they are observed as not different from the aggregates of feeling and so on.

original: 'o na gal te gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i mig la sogs pa yang dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'o na gal te gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i mig la sogs pa yang dmigs pa yin la /
translated: If the eyes and so on belonging to the mindstreams of others are observed,

original: de dag kyang nus pas rab tu bya ba yin na go //
analyzed: de dag kyang nus pas rab tu bya ba yin na go //
translated: and if they are objects of activity of the eye consciousness,

original: ci'i phyir rang gi rgyud las gzhan gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rang gi rgyud las gzhan gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: why does eye consciousness and so on not arise in the mindstreams of others?

original: dmigs par byas pa mig la sogs pa'i nus pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs par byas pa mig la sogs pa'i nus pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the eye and so on that are observed have the potential to generate eye consciousness and so on.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: dper na yid kyi rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi mig la sogs par skye la /
analyzed: dper na yid kyi rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi mig la sogs par skye la /
translated: for example, mental consciousness arises in the eyes and so on of others.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin pa dang yang dper na rang gi rgyud la yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa mig la sogs pa'i nus par snang ba'i dmigs pa la de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rig pa la sogs
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin pa dang yang dper na rang gi rgyud la yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa mig la sogs pa'i nus par snang ba'i dmigs pa la de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rig pa la sogs
translated: And it is not the cause of eye consciousness, etc. For example, in one‚Äôs own continuum, the objective support of the appearance of the potential of the eye, etc., of the store consciousness is observed by the awareness that is associated with it, etc.

original: pa dmigs pa mtshungs pa nyid kyis dmigs la /
analyzed: pa dmigs pa mtshungs pa nyid kyis dmigs la /
translated: , because of the similarity of the objective support.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yang ma yin pa ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yang ma yin pa ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And it is not the cause of eye consciousness, etc. This is similar to that.

original: nus pa'i rten nyid kyang gzhan du yin la dmigs pa'i dngos po yang gzhan du yin te /
analyzed: nus pa'i rten nyid kyang gzhan du yin la dmigs pa'i dngos po yang gzhan du yin te /
translated: The basis of the potential is different, and the objective entity is different.

original: rten nyid kyis ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rten nyid kyis ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: By being the basis, it is the cause of eye consciousness, etc.

original: 'o na gal te rnam par shes pa yin na 'di la sems las 'byung ba dag kyang yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rnam par shes pa yin na 'di la sems las 'byung ba dag kyang yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is consciousness, then mental factors would also exist in this.

original: de ltar yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yin te /
translated: That is so.

original: reg pa la sogs pa lnga kun du 'gro ba yod do //
analyzed: reg pa la sogs pa lnga kun du 'gro ba yod do //
translated: The five omnipresent mental factors, such as contact, exist.

original: ci'i phyir reg pa la sogs pa kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir reg pa la sogs pa kho na yin zhe na /
translated: Why are contact, etc. alone universal mental activities?

original: thams cad du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are found in all minds.

original: kha cig ni reg pa ma 'ongs pa kho na dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams phan tshun 'brel pa'i phyir pa sems thams cad la byung bas kun du 'gro ba nyid yin par khas len to //
analyzed: kha cig ni reg pa ma 'ongs pa kho na dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams phan tshun 'brel pa'i phyir pa sems thams cad la byung bas kun du 'gro ba nyid yin par khas len to //
translated: Some believe that future contact is a universal mental activity because it is the mutual relationship of the sense faculty, object, and consciousness.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not reasonable,

original: ma 'ongs pa la skyes bu'i byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta bas na reg pa ni yul gyi khyad par phan pa dang gnod pa dang / gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid kho na la reg pa dbang po 'gyur ba @309b byed pas 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la skyes bu'i byed pa med pa'i phyir ro // de lta bas na reg pa ni yul gyi khyad par phan pa dang gnod pa dang / gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid kho na la reg pa dbang po 'gyur ba @309b byed pas 'byung ba yin la /
translated: because there is no human activity in the future.üîΩThus, contact is the sense faculty that is modified by the special object that is characterized as beneficial, harmful, or neither of those two.

original: de yang phan pa dang gnod pa dang / bar mar gnas pa'i yul rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig la nges par 'byung ba'i phyir kun du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang phan pa dang gnod pa dang / bar mar gnas pa'i yul rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig la nges par 'byung ba'i phyir kun du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: It is a universal mental activity because it definitely occurs in relation to any of the objects that are beneficial, harmful, or remain neutral.

original: tshor ba yang bye brag tu smra ba kha cig sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad la 'byung ba yul nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid yongs su gcod pa yin la /
analyzed: tshor ba yang bye brag tu smra ba kha cig sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad la 'byung ba yul nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid yongs su gcod pa yin la /
translated: Some VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say: Feeling has the characteristic of experiencing the object element that is, the object field of all minds and mental factors.

original: rang rig pa khas mi len pa'i phyir rang nyams su myong ba yongs su bor nas phan pa dang / gnod pa dang gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i yul yongs su gzung ba'i rnam pa can gyi reg pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du rnam par rjes su byed pa myong ba'i mtshan nyid yin par brjod de /
analyzed: rang rig pa khas mi len pa'i phyir rang nyams su myong ba yongs su bor nas phan pa dang / gnod pa dang gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i yul yongs su gzung ba'i rnam pa can gyi reg pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du rnam par rjes su byed pa myong ba'i mtshan nyid yin par brjod de /
translated: Since they do not accept autocognition, they discard the experience of the object field and say that feeling has the characteristic of experiencing the object field in the manner of a reflection of contact that grasps the object field that is beneficial, harmful, or neutral.

original: de'i phyir reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yin no zhe'o //
translated: Therefore feeling is conditioned by contact.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: tshor ba reg pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyis de la dmigs par thal par 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba reg pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyis de la dmigs par thal par 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
translated: It would follow that feeling would focus on contact because feeling would be concomitant with contact.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni phan tshun mi dmigs te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni phan tshun mi dmigs te /
translated: Minds and mental factors do not focus on each other.

original: dmigs pa nyid nyams par thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid nyams par thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the object itself would be lost.

original: de lta bas na tshor ba ni reg pas yongs su bcas pa'i yul gyi khyad par phan pa dang gnod pa dang / gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid kho na rang gir byed pa nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na tshor ba ni reg pas yongs su bcas pa'i yul gyi khyad par phan pa dang gnod pa dang / gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid kho na rang gir byed pa nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, feeling is the experience of the specific object that is defined by contact, which is characterized by benefit, harm, or neither.

original: reg pa'i rkyen can zhes kyang bya la /
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen can zhes kyang bya la /
translated: It is also called the condition of contact.

original: de yang rang gir byed pa med na mi 'byung ba yin pas thams cad du 'gro ba nyid do //
analyzed: de yang rang gir byed pa med na mi 'byung ba yin pas thams cad du 'gro ba nyid do //
translated: Moreover, since it does not occur without the experience of the object, it is omnipresent.

original: 'du shes ni gzhan sel par sgrub par byed pa mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa las byung ba /
analyzed: 'du shes ni gzhan sel par sgrub par byed pa mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa las byung ba /
translated: Discrimination is the determination of the exclusion of other, which arises from the maturation of the latent impressions of verbalization.

original: rang gi yul la yul gzhan sel bar byed cing 'jug pa'o zhes bya bar thams cad kyis shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi yul la yul gzhan sel bar byed cing 'jug pa'o zhes bya bar thams cad kyis shes pa nyid do //
translated: It is understood by all to be the engagement in the exclusion of other objects with regard to one‚Äôs own object.

original: yul gzhan sel pa yang dmigs par bya ba'i yul thams cad la yod pas kun du 'gro ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: yul gzhan sel pa yang dmigs par bya ba'i yul thams cad la yod pas kun du 'gro ba nyid yin no //
translated: Since the exclusion of other objects exists in all objects that are perceived, it is omnipresent.

original: yid la byed pa yang bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar na chos thams cad bzhi tshan du nges pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa yul gzhan dang phral nas yul gzhan la gtod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang rang gi yul la 'jug pa tsam zhig byedüîΩpar zad do //
analyzed: yid la byed pa yang bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar na chos thams cad bzhi tshan du nges pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa yul gzhan dang phral nas yul gzhan la gtod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang rang gi yul la 'jug pa tsam zhig byed par zad do //
translated: And attention is the same way, because according to the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas, all dharmas are definitely classified into four groups. Therefore, consciousness is not detached from one object and directed to another object. Rather, it is simply engaged with its own object.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyi ltar na yang /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyi ltar na yang /
translated: According to the YogƒÅcƒÅras,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i sa bon las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa la bdag po'i rkyen nyid kyis gzung bar snang ba la gtod pa yin te /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i sa bon las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa la bdag po'i rkyen nyid kyis gzung bar snang ba la gtod pa yin te /
translated: consciousness arises from the seeds of the grasped and grasper, and it is directed to the appearance of the grasped by the dominant condition.

original: don 'dis na sems kyis 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don 'dis na sems kyis 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is what is meant by the engagement of mind.

original: don 'di yang thams cad du 'byung bas @310a * //
analyzed: don 'di yang thams cad du 'byung bas @310a * //
translated: Since this meaning occurs in all cases,

original: thams cad du 'gro ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba nyid yin no //
translated: it is omnipresent.

original: sems pa yang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i rnam par mngon par 'du byed cing 'byung ba yin pas thams cad du 'gro ba nyid las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: sems pa yang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i rnam par mngon par 'du byed cing 'byung ba yin pas thams cad du 'gro ba nyid las mi 'da'o //
translated: And since volition is the formation that occurs in virtue of virtue, nonvirtue, or the opposite of both, it does not transcend being omnipresent.

original: lung yang yod de gsum 'dus pa gang yin pa de ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: lung yang yod de gsum 'dus pa gang yin pa de ni reg pa'o //
translated: There is also a scriptural source: ‚ÄúWhatever is the union of the three is contact.

original: reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa ni tshor ba dang sems dang 'du shes yin pas dbang po tha mi dad pa yin la /
analyzed: reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa ni tshor ba dang sems dang 'du shes yin pas dbang po tha mi dad pa yin la /
translated: Feeling, thought, and conception arise simultaneously with contact, and therefore they are not separate faculties.

original: de las byung ba yid la byed pa yang nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de las byung ba yid la byed pa yang nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Attention also occurs in dependence on them.‚Äù

original: yang bye brag tu smra bas 'dun pa la sogs pa kun du 'gro ba gzhan sngar bshad pa gang yin pa de dag ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: yang bye brag tu smra bas 'dun pa la sogs pa kun du 'gro ba gzhan sngar bshad pa gang yin pa de dag ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhe na /
translated: Again, the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas ask, ‚ÄúWhy don‚Äôt you accept the other omnipresent factors such as aspiration that were explained earlier?‚Äù

original: yul nges pa nyid kyis kun du 'gro ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul nges pa nyid kyis kun du 'gro ba nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They reply, ‚ÄúBecause they are not omnipresent since they are determined by their objects.

original: de dag gi ltar na 'dun pa ni byed 'dod pa nyid de yul la gtod pa yin na de yang yid la byed pa las mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin pas de lta bu yin par mi bzung ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na 'dun pa ni byed 'dod pa nyid de yul la gtod pa yin na de yang yid la byed pa las mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin pas de lta bu yin par mi bzung ngo //
translated: According to them, aspiration is the desire to act, which is the directing of the mind to an object. But that is not different from attention in its characteristics, so it should not be held to be such.

original: de lta bas na bsams pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa ni 'dun pa yin na /
analyzed: de lta bas na bsams pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa ni 'dun pa yin na /
translated: Therefore, aspiration is the desire for a considered object.

original: de yang mi 'dod pa dang bar mar gnas pa'i dmigs pa dag la mi 'byung bas kun du 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang mi 'dod pa dang bar mar gnas pa'i dmigs pa dag la mi 'byung bas kun du 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: It does not occur in relation to objects that are undesirable or neutral, so it is not universal.

original: mos pa ni lhag par mos pa ste /
analyzed: mos pa ni lhag par mos pa ste /
translated: Interest is a form of resolve.

original: nges pa zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde yang bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar na the tshom yod pa'i gnas skabs ni theg tshom dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems la yang 'byung ste /
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ba'i don to // de yang bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar na the tshom yod pa'i gnas skabs ni theg tshom dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems la yang 'byung ste /
translated: It is a form of conviction.

original: yul gzhan las ldog pa'i rnam pa can yin par yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan las ldog pa'i rnam pa can yin par yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: According to the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas, it occurs in relation to a mind that is accompanied by doubt, because it is held to be a form of attention that turns away from other objects.

original: de ni mtshan nyid de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni mtshan nyid de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: But it is not a mental factor with that characteristic.

original: 'du shes kyi byed pa kho nas grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi byed pa kho nas grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is known to be a form of attention alone.

original: de lta bas na mos pa na mos pa ni the tshom log pa nges pa'i dngos po la de kho na bzhin du nges par 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na mos pa na mos pa ni the tshom log pa nges pa'i dngos po la de kho na bzhin du nges par 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, interest is a form of resolve that is a form of attention that is a form of conviction that holds an object in just that way when doubt has been eliminated.

original: de bas na kun du 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na kun du 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not universal.

original: ting nge 'dzin yang kha cig ni rtse gcig pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid skad cig ma gcig gnas pa yin par sems so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yang kha cig ni rtse gcig pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid skad cig ma gcig gnas pa yin par sems so //
translated: Some think that concentration is the characteristic of one-pointedness of mind, which is the abiding in a single moment.

original: de ni de lta yin par ma bzung ste /
analyzed: de ni de lta yin par ma bzung ste /
translated: But that is not accepted,

original: sems la rang gis skad cig ma gcig gnas pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems la rang gis skad cig ma gcig gnas pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind abides in a single moment by itself.

original: gzhan dag ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams yul so so la gyes pa yongs su spong bas yul gcig la sdud cing 'jog pa ni ting nge 'dzin yin par sems so //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams yul so so la gyes pa yongs su spong bas yul gcig la sdud cing 'jog pa ni ting nge 'dzin yin par sems so //
translated: Others think that concentration is the settling of the mind by withdrawing it from the dispersion of the mind and mental factors to individual objects and concentrating them on a single object.

original: de yang de ltar yin par mi gzung ste /
analyzed: de yang de ltar yin par mi gzung ste /
translated: But that is not accepted,

original: 'du shes kho nas grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du shes kho nas grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is well known to be discernment.

original: de lta bas na ting nge 'dzin ni brtag par bya ba'i yul kho na skad cig ma gcig dang / gnyis dang gsum la sogs pa'i rgyun 'jug pa nyid kyis sems rtse gcig @310b pa nyid kyi rgyu yin par khas blangs la /
analyzed: de lta bas na ting nge 'dzin ni brtag par bya ba'i yul kho na skad cig ma gcig dang / gnyis dang gsum la sogs pa'i rgyun 'jug pa nyid kyis sems rtse gcig @310b pa nyid kyi rgyu yin par khas blangs la /
translated: Therefore, concentration is the cause of one-pointedness of mind, because it is the cause of the mind abiding for one moment, two moments, three moments, and so on, in a single object that is to be examined.

original: de yang brtag par bya ba ma yin pa'i yul la rgyun dang bral ba'i gnas skabs na mi 'byung bas kun du 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang brtag par bya ba ma yin pa'i yul la rgyun dang bral ba'i gnas skabs na mi 'byung bas kun du 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is not universal, since it does not occur when the object is not being examined, or when the mind is distracted.

original: ngan pa ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar na sems kyi mngon par brjod pa nyid de /
analyzed: ngan pa ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar na sems kyi mngon par brjod pa nyid de /
translated: Bad is verbal expression of the mind, according to the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas.

original: de yang yul gsal bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: de yang yul gsal bar byed pa'am /
translated: It is the cause of the clarity of the object, or

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa gcig yin grang na /
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa gcig yin grang na /
translated: the cause of the retention of the sign.

original: gnyi ga ltar na yang shes rab dang 'du shes dag gi don grags pa'i phyir de ni yang dag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar na yang shes rab dang 'du shes dag gi don grags pa'i phyir de ni yang dag pa ma yin no //
translated: But in both cases, it is not real, since it is well known that praj√±ƒÅ and sa·πÉj√±ƒÅ are different.

original: de bas na dran pa ni yul 'dris pa la de'i rjes su 'gro ba'i sems kyi mngon par brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: de bas na dran pa ni yul 'dris pa la de'i rjes su 'gro ba'i sems kyi mngon par brjod pa yin la /
translated: Thus memory is the verbal expression of the mind that follows the object that has been experienced.

original: de yang ma 'dris pa la med pas kun du 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang ma 'dris pa la med pas kun du 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: And since it does not exist in regard to what has not been experienced, it is not universal.

original: de ltar na yang dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag tu mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag tu mi 'gyur te /
translated: But in that case, memory would not be the factor of enlightenment called recollection of what has been experienced,

original: mthong ba'i lam la de bzhin nyid sngon nyams sum myong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la de bzhin nyid sngon nyams sum myong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because suchness has not been experienced on the path of insight.

original: de ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de ni nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault,

original: skad cig ma dang po la dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma dang po la dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because in the first moment, the factor of enlightenment that is right mindfulness does not exist.

original: gnyis la sogs pa la ni yod do //
analyzed: gnyis la sogs pa la ni yod do //
translated: It exists in the second moment and so on.

original: de'i tshe ni de bzhin nyid sngar nyams su myong ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni de bzhin nyid sngar nyams su myong ba nyid do //
translated: At that time, suchness is experienced as it was previously.

original: mthong ba'i lam la byang chub kyi yan lag bdun zhes bshad pa ni rgyun las dgongs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la byang chub kyi yan lag bdun zhes bshad pa ni rgyun las dgongs pa yin gyi /
translated: The explanation that the seven factors of enlightenment exist on the path of seeing is from the perspective of a continuum,

original: skad cig ma ni ma yin pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: skad cig ma ni ma yin pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: but not from the perspective of a moment. Therefore there is no contradiction.

original: yang na sbyor ba'i dus na de bzhin nyid spyi'i rnam pa nyams su myong bas skad cig ma dang po la yang dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: yang na sbyor ba'i dus na de bzhin nyid spyi'i rnam pa nyams su myong bas skad cig ma dang po la yang dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag mi 'gal lo //
translated: Or, since suchness is experienced in a general way at the time of preparation, it is not contradictory that the factor of enlightenment that is right mindfulness exists in the first moment.

original: shes rab kyang bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar na chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyang bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar na chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yin no //
translated: Also, wisdom is the discernment of phenomena, according to the Vaibhasikas.

original: rab tu 'byed pa yang gal te yul yongs su gcod pa tsam zhig yin na de ni sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad la mtshungs so //
analyzed: rab tu 'byed pa yang gal te yul yongs su gcod pa tsam zhig yin na de ni sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad la mtshungs so //
translated: If discernment is merely the determination of an object, then it is the same for all minds and mental factors.

original: de lta bas ni shes rab ni nye bar brtag par bya ba kho na la rigs pa dang rigs pa ma yin pa dang gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas ni shes rab ni nye bar brtag par bya ba kho na la rigs pa dang rigs pa ma yin pa dang gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, discernment is the discrimination of what is reasonable and unreasonable and the opposite of both in regard to what is to be examined.

original: de bas na shes rab ni kun du 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na shes rab ni kun du 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, discernment is not universal.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs nye bar gnas pa las byung ba rnams la shes rab mi srid de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs nye bar gnas pa las byung ba rnams la shes rab mi srid de /
translated: Therefore, discernment is not possible in the cognitions of eye, etc., which arise from the presence of objects,

original: de dag yongs su rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag yongs su rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not capable of comprehending.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'phangs pa rnams ni yod do //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'phangs pa rnams ni yod do //
translated: It is possible in those that are projected by the immediately preceding mind cognition.

original: kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa de dag kyang rnam par shes pa gsal ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mi gsal ba dang lhan cig mtshungs par mi ldan no //üîΩ'phen par byed @311a * //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa de dag kyang rnam par shes pa gsal ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mi gsal ba dang lhan cig mtshungs par mi ldan no // 'phen par byed @311a * //
translated: The foundation consciousness is not clear, and it is not concomitant with them.

original: pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa can dang dad pa la sogs dge ba rnams kyang mi srid do //
analyzed: pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa can dang dad pa la sogs dge ba rnams kyang mi srid do //
translated: Since the projecting karma and its maturation are unobscured and indeterminate, it is impossible for it to be concomitant with afflicted states such as attachment or virtuous states such as faith.

original: gnyid la sogs pa ma nges pa gzhan bzhi po gang dag yin pa de dag yang mtshungs par mi ldan te /
analyzed: gnyid la sogs pa ma nges pa gzhan bzhi po gang dag yin pa de dag yang mtshungs par mi ldan te /
translated: The other four indeterminate states are not concomitant with the foundation consciousness.

original: re zhig gnyid na nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni gti mug gi khyad par 'ga' kho na la gdags te /
analyzed: re zhig gnyid na nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni gti mug gi khyad par 'ga' kho na la gdags te /
translated: Sleep is imputed to be a particular type of delusion that is the nature of a branch of affliction.

original: mi gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis sems mngon par sdud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis sems mngon par sdud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the nature of mental unclarity that causes the mind to withdraw.

original: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i gnas skabs kyi gang yin pa de yang shes rab kyi rdzas ma nges pa gnyi ga'i gnas skabs su 'byung ba la gdags te /
analyzed: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i gnas skabs kyi gang yin pa de yang shes rab kyi rdzas ma nges pa gnyi ga'i gnas skabs su 'byung ba la gdags te /
translated: It is designated as the substance of wisdom that occurs in both states of virtue and neutral states.üîΩ

original: ma nges pa nyid kyi phyir dang gsal ba nyid du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid kyi phyir dang gsal ba nyid du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The substance of wisdom is designated as occurring in both states, the state of virtue and the state of indeterminate, because it is indeterminate and because it occurs as clarity.

original: 'gyod pa yang rtog pa'i rnam par yid la gcags pa 'dren pa'i phyir shes rab kho na la gdags so //
analyzed: 'gyod pa yang rtog pa'i rnam par yid la gcags pa 'dren pa'i phyir shes rab kho na la gdags so //
translated: Regret is also designated as wisdom alone, because it is a mental factor that draws one into the mode of thinking.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag kyang rtog pa'i rnam par zhugs pa yin pas de dag kyang shes rab kho na la gdags so //üîΩshes rab kyang ma rig pa dag ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag kyang rtog pa'i rnam par zhugs pa yin pas de dag kyang shes rab kho na la gdags so // shes rab kyang ma rig pa dag ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Since both investigation and analysis also occur in the mode of thinking, they are also designated as wisdom alone.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir dang kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir dang kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Wisdom is not associated with the storehouse consciousness, because it is not an afflicted state and it is not omnipresent.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag sems pa la gdags pa de dag kyang thams cad lam yin gyi /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag sems pa la gdags pa de dag kyang thams cad lam yin gyi /
translated: Investigation and analysis are not designated as intention, because they are not omnipresent.

original: tshol zhing so sor rtog pa'i rnam pa can la yin na sems pa de lta bu ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshol zhing so sor rtog pa'i rnam pa can la yin na sems pa de lta bu ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: If it has the aspect of seeking and examining, then such intention is not concomitant with the storehouse consciousness,

original: mi gsal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gsal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not unclear.

original: spros pa btang la de dkyus ma kho na brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: spros pa btang la de dkyus ma kho na brjod par bya ste /
translated: Abandoning elaboration, I will simply explain the meaning.

original: yang na chos rnams kyi kun gzhi ni zhes bya ba 'di la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang na chos rnams kyi kun gzhi ni zhes bya ba 'di la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Or, in the phrase ‚Äúthe storehouse of all phenomena,‚Äù the storehouse consciousness is twofold:

original: 'bras bu'i gnas skabs rnam par smin pa gang yin pa dang / rgyu'i gnas skabs rnam par smin pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gnas skabs rnam par smin pa gang yin pa dang / rgyu'i gnas skabs rnam par smin pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: the result state, which is the matured effect, and the cause state, which is the maturing cause.

original: rnam par smin pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /üîΩchos rnams kun gyi kun gzhi ni //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i dbang du mdzad nas / chos rnams kun gyi kun gzhi ni //
translated: From the perspective of the matured effect,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe storehouse of all phenomena.‚Äù

original: rnam par ma smin pa'i dbang mdzad nas /
analyzed: rnam par ma smin pa'i dbang mdzad nas /
translated: From the perspective of the nonmatured cause,

original: sa kho na kun ba'i zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: sa kho na kun ba'i zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe storehouse of the earth alone.‚Äù

original: gnyi ga'i dbang du mdzad nas /üîΩde bas kun gzhi rnam shes te //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i dbang du mdzad nas / de bas kun gzhi rnam shes te //
translated: From the perspective of both,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúTherefore, the storehouse consciousness.‚Äù

original: de la dmigs par gyur ba mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni de'i so sor snang ba'i ngo bo yin pa nyid kyis kun gzhi @311b rnam par shes pa de rten nyid kyis kun gzhi yin no //
analyzed: de la dmigs par gyur ba mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni de'i so sor snang ba'i ngo bo yin pa nyid kyis kun gzhi @311b rnam par shes pa de rten nyid kyis kun gzhi yin no //
translated: Those that are its objects, such as the eye, etc., and such things as form, etc., are its individual appearances, and the store consciousness is the storehouse because it is their support.

original: rang dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa dang / rnam par shes pa bdun gyi tshogs rnams kyi ni de la rag las te /
analyzed: rang dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa dang / rnam par shes pa bdun gyi tshogs rnams kyi ni de la rag las te /
translated: The store consciousness is the storehouse of the seven collections of consciousnesses, such as feeling, etc., that are associated with it,

original: skye ba nyid kyi phyir kun gzhi yin no //
analyzed: skye ba nyid kyi phyir kun gzhi yin no //
translated: because they are born from it.

original: skye ba can kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad 'bras bu'i dngos por der sbyor ba'am zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skye ba can kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad 'bras bu'i dngos por der sbyor ba'am zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All dharmas that are born from it are bound to it as a result,

original: phal che ba'i phyir de skad brjod de /
analyzed: phal che ba'i phyir de skad brjod de /
translated: This is said because the majority of sentient beings are defiled.

original: sems can gyi khams ni phal cher kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ni phal cher kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The realm of sentient beings is for the most part defiled.

original: kha cig kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba ni mi slob pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa la gnas pa la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: kha cig kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba ni mi slob pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa la gnas pa la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: Some say: Those who are not afflicted are those who are not learners, those abiding on the eighth level and so on of bodhisattvas.

original: de dag gi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gyur pa de rnam par byang ba'i chos kyi rten du mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gyur pa de rnam par byang ba'i chos kyi rten du mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that their transformation of foundation consciousness is not the basis of purified phenomena.

original: gang yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs na rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs dang yang dag par bsgrubs pa de yang rnam par byang ba'i chos kyi rgyu nyid yin yang kun gzhi nyid du ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: gang yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs na rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs dang yang dag par bsgrubs pa de yang rnam par byang ba'i chos kyi rgyu nyid yin yang kun gzhi nyid du ni mi 'dod de /
translated: Also, the naturally existing lineage and the established lineage in the context of affliction are causes of purified phenomena, but they are not asserted to be foundation consciousness.

original: gnas skabs de na gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir dang rdzas su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs de na gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir dang rdzas su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not primary in that context and because they do not substantially exist.

original: gang gi phyir kun gzhi zhes bya ba'i tha snyad bye brag med pa'i rgyu'i dngos po tsam la btags par snang ba de'i tshe ni yongs su gyur pa la yang bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kun gzhi zhes bya ba'i tha snyad bye brag med pa'i rgyu'i dngos po tsam la btags par snang ba de'i tshe ni yongs su gyur pa la yang bya ba nyid de /
translated: When the term foundation consciousness is imputed to the mere causal entity without specific distinction, then it also applies to the transformed state.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo las ji skad du /
translated: As the MahƒÅparinirvƒÅ·πáa S≈´tra says,

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dag gis longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bsdus so zhes byung ba lta bu'o //üîΩ'dir yang gal te gzhan dag der sbyor ro zhe'am /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dag gis longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bsdus so zhes byung ba lta bu'o // 'dir yang gal te gzhan dag der sbyor ro zhe'am /
translated: The enjoyment body is included in the foundation consciousness and the active forms of consciousness.üîΩHere, if others are connected to it,

original: de gzhan du sbyor ro zhes byas kyang rung /
analyzed: de gzhan du sbyor ro zhes byas kyang rung /
translated: or if it is connected to others,

original: gnyi ga ltar na yang kun gzhi ni rgyu'i ngo bo kho na yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar na yang kun gzhi ni rgyu'i ngo bo kho na yin te /
translated: in both cases the foundation consciousness is only a causal entity.

original: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan nges pa'i tshig gis byas pa tha snyad par zad do //
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan nges pa'i tshig gis byas pa tha snyad par zad do //
translated: The reason for the use of the term is merely a conventional designation.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par nges pa dag dang / lhan cig phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yin pa ni rkyen rnam par dpyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par nges pa dag dang / lhan cig phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yin pa ni rkyen rnam par dpyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The determination of the active forms of consciousness and their mutual causal relationship will be analyzed in the section on conditions.

original: sems can rnams la de'i bdag nyid du sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni gnas pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la de'i bdag nyid du sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni gnas pa ste /
translated: It is the support of sentient beings because it connects them to their essential nature.

original: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan rnam par shes pa'i ngo bor gnas so //
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan rnam par shes pa'i ngo bor gnas so //
translated: The reason for the use of the term is that it is the support of the essential nature of consciousness.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: bdag nyid du zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdag nyid du zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says: as the self.

original: bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the self.

original: de ni sems can rnams kyi bdag nyid yin te /üîΩbdag nyid shin tu dul ba yis //
analyzed: de ni sems can rnams kyi bdag nyid yin te / bdag nyid shin tu dul ba yis //
translated: It is the self of sentient beings,

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la ni bdag ces nye @312a * //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro // gzhan 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la ni bdag ces nye @312a * //
translated: because it is said: ‚ÄúThrough the complete self-control of the self.üîΩ‚Äù

original: bar mi 'dogs te /
analyzed: bar mi 'dogs te /
translated: The other consciousnesses that engage objects are not designated as the self,üîΩbecause they are not the self,

original: skabs skabs su rgyun 'chad pas bdag dang chos mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skabs skabs su rgyun 'chad pas bdag dang chos mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not continuous, and because they are not homogeneous with the self.

original: rnam par gcig tu na sems can rnams de'i bdag nyid du sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par gcig tu na sems can rnams de'i bdag nyid du sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In another way, it is the self of sentient beings because they are connected to it.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta bas dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta bas dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The afflicted mind is the object of the view of the transitory collection.

original: rnam pa gang du zhe na /üîΩbdag nyid du ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gang du zhe na / bdag nyid du ste /
translated: In what aspect?üîΩAs the self.

original: bdag gi rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gi rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means in the aspect of the self.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i khongs su ma gtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba rnam pa nyi shus bdag tu dmigs pa
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i khongs su ma gtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba rnam pa nyi shus bdag tu dmigs pa
translated: Also, the other engaging consciousnesses are not included in the five appropriated aggregates. Therefore the afflicted view of the self that is concomitant with mental consciousness focuses on the self in twenty aspects.

original: ma yin nam /
analyzed: ma yin nam /
translated: Also, other engaging consciousnesses are not included in the five appropriated aggregates, so why is the afflicted view of the self associated with mental consciousness not focused on the self through the twenty aspects?

original: de dag kyang kun gzhi yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang kun gzhi yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are the foundation consciousness,

original: phal cher dmigs pa la kun gzhir dgongs pa yin na yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni phal cher dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phal cher dmigs pa la kun gzhir dgongs pa yin na yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni phal cher dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: then if the intention is that the foundation consciousness is the object of the majority of afflicted states, the afflicted view of the self associated with mental consciousness is not the object of the majority of afflicted states,

original: dus dpag tu yod pa zhig tu kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: dus dpag tu yod pa zhig tu kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it occurs for a limited time.

original: / yang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la ji ltar dmigs she na /
analyzed: / yang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la ji ltar dmigs she na /
translated: How does the afflicted view of the self focus on foundation consciousness?

original: de'i dbang gis bdag gi rnam par skye ba'i sgo nas yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis bdag gi rnam par skye ba'i sgo nas yin gyi /
translated: It does so by way of generating the aspect of self through the power of that foundation consciousness.

original: rang gi ngo bo 'jog pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo 'jog pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by way of positing their own nature.

original: yang 'dir gang dag 'di skad du mig la sogs pa ni kun gzhi'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: yang 'dir gang dag 'di skad du mig la sogs pa ni kun gzhi'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, in this regard, some say: The eye, etc. are not of the nature of the store-consciousness,

original: dbang po yin pa'i phyir yid kyi dbang po bzhin no zhes zer ba de ni kun gzhi'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa yid kyi dbang po dang de'i ngo bo nyid yin na srog gi dbang pos ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po yin pa'i phyir yid kyi dbang po bzhin no zhes zer ba de ni kun gzhi'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa yid kyi dbang po dang de'i ngo bo nyid yin na srog gi dbang pos ma nges pa yin no //
translated: because they are sense-faculties, like the sense-faculty of thought. But this is not the nature of the store-consciousness, and if it were, it would be uncertain because of the sense-faculty of life.

original: mig la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: It cannot be said that the eye, etc. are not of the nature of consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa grags pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir yid kyi dbang po bzhin no zhes kyang brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa grags pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir yid kyi dbang po bzhin no zhes kyang brjod par mi nus so //
translated: because they are the support of the well-known consciousness, like the sense-faculty of thought.

original: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las zhes bya ba la dgongs pa ni ldem por dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las zhes bya ba la dgongs pa ni ldem por dgongs pa'o //
translated: In the Sandhinirmocana Sutra, etc. means: the intention is the indirect intention.

original: de la nyan thos rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas bstan pa gang yin pa de ni de las gzugs la sogs pa brtags pa yin par ldem por dgongs pa ma bkrol lo //
analyzed: de la nyan thos rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas bstan pa gang yin pa de ni de las gzugs la sogs pa brtags pa yin par ldem por dgongs pa ma bkrol lo //
translated: The teaching given in the Sravakabhumi for the sake of the Sravakas is not an explanation of the underlying intent of the investigation of form, etc.

original: gang yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa brgyad bstan pa de yang /üîΩ'di ni kun brtags pa dgag pa lhur mdzad pa yin no zhes bya bar ldem por dgongs pa ma bkrol lo //
analyzed: gang yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa brgyad bstan pa de yang / 'di ni kun brtags pa dgag pa lhur mdzad pa yin no zhes bya bar ldem por dgongs pa ma bkrol lo //
translated: The teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom is not an explanation of the underlying intent of the teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di las ni ldem por dgongs pa bkrol bas na dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa zhes bya'o //üîΩde la zag pa ni rnam @312b par smin pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di las ni ldem por dgongs pa bkrol bas na dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa zhes bya'o // de la zag pa ni rnam @312b par smin pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom is not an explanation of the underlying intent of the teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom is not an explanation of the underlying intent of the teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'jig rten gyi mkhas pa rnams kyis gting dpag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //üîΩphra ba ni sa bon gyi gnas skabs gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mkhas pa rnams kyis gting dpag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro // phra ba ni sa bon gyi gnas skabs gang yin pa ste /
translated: The teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom is not an explanation of the underlying intent of the teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom is not an explanation of the underlying intent of the teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom is not an explanation of the underlying intent of the teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom is not an explanation of the underlying intent of the teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom is not an explanation of the underlying intent of the teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom is not an explanation of the underlying intent of the teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom is not an explanation of the underlying intent of the teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom is not an explanation of the underlying intent of the teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom is not an explanation of the underlying intent of the teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom is not an explanation of the underlying intent of the teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom is not an explanation of the underlying intent of the teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom.
