original: rdzas su med pas de nyid dang gzhan nyid dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyis brtags par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas su med pas de nyid dang gzhan nyid dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyis brtags par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching of the eight aspects of the perfection of wisdom is not an explanation

original: rnam pa gcig tu na thos pa las byung ba dang bsams pa las byung ba dang / skyes nas thob pa'i shes pa dag gis mngon sum du ma byas pa'i phyir zab pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na thos pa las byung ba dang bsams pa las byung ba dang / skyes nas thob pa'i shes pa dag gis mngon sum du ma byas pa'i phyir zab pa'o //
translated: In one sense, it is profound because it is not directly perceived by the knowledge that arises from hearing and reflection, or by the knowledge obtained from birth.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsgoms pa las byung ba'i mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir phra ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsgoms pa las byung ba'i mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir phra ba'o //
translated: In another sense, it is subtle because it is not directly perceived by the mundane knowledge that arises from meditation.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi shes pas yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir zab pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi shes pas yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir zab pa'o //
translated: In one sense, it is profound because it is not fully understood by the knowledge of all the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and ordinary beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa'i shes pas shes par dka' ba'i phyir phra ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa'i shes pas shes par dka' ba'i phyir phra ba'o //
translated: In another sense, it is subtle because it is difficult to know with the knowledge of the bodhisattvas who practice with devoted interest.

original: sa bon thams cad ces bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: sa bon thams cad ces bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: By the phrase ‚Äúall seeds,‚Äù

original: grangs can gyi smra ba sel te /
analyzed: grangs can gyi smra ba sel te /
translated: the theory of the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas is refuted.

original: sa bon rnams dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pa'i tshul gyis sa bon bzung ba byas pa rnam par shes pa de sa bon gyi dngos por 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sa bon rnams dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pa'i tshul gyis sa bon bzung ba byas pa rnam par shes pa de sa bon gyi dngos por 'gyur gyi /
translated: The consciousness that has taken up the seeds by the method of arising and ceasing together with the seeds becomes the thing that is the seed.

original: gtso bo bzhin du gzhan la mi ltos par sa bon yongs su 'dzin par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gtso bo bzhin du gzhan la mi ltos par sa bon yongs su 'dzin par ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not like the principal, which is not dependent on anything else and retains the seed.

original: rlung gi rgyun shugs drag po chu'i rlabs 'byung ba dang mthun pa ni chu bo'o //
analyzed: rlung gi rgyun shugs drag po chu'i rlabs 'byung ba dang mthun pa ni chu bo'o //
translated: A river is a stream of water that is suitable for the arising of waves.

original: de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa skad cig ma brgyud pa breng chags pa'i rgyun yang rim dang rig car dag tu 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa bdun gyi rlabs 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i phyir chu bo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa skad cig ma brgyud pa breng chags pa'i rgyun yang rim dang rig car dag tu 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa bdun gyi rlabs 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i phyir chu bo'o //
translated: In the same way, the foundation consciousness is a stream of a series of moments, and it is a river because it is suitable for the arising of the waves of the seven consciousnesses, which operate in sequence and simultaneously.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na rang gi sde pa kha cig rgyu dang 'bras bu dag de nyid dang gzhan nyid du sems pa de'i gnyen por chu bo bzhin du zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na rang gi sde pa kha cig rgyu dang 'bras bu dag de nyid dang gzhan nyid du sems pa de'i gnyen por chu bo bzhin du zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: In another way, it is called a river as an antidote to the idea of some Buddhist schools that causes and results are the same or different.

original: ji ltar klung gi chu bo las de nyid dang gzhan du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa rlabs 'byung ba de bzhin du kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyun gyi rgyun las kyang de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa sems dang
analyzed: ji ltar klung gi chu bo las de nyid dang gzhan du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa rlabs 'byung ba de bzhin du kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyun gyi rgyun las kyang de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa sems dang
translated: Just as waves arise from the water of a river, which cannot be said to be either the same as or different from them, in the same way, mental processes and mental episodes arise from the stream of the fundamental consciousness, which cannot be said to be either the same as or different from them.

original: sems las byung ba'i rlabs rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i rlabs rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: Mental processes and mental episodes are like waves.

original: 'di ltar rgyu las 'bras bu gzhan nyid du ni brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu las 'bras bu gzhan nyid du ni brjod par mi nus te /
translated: The effect cannot be said to be different from the cause,

original: thams cad las thams cad 'byung bar thal par 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
analyzed: thams cad las thams cad 'byung bar thal par 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
translated: because it would absurdly follow that anything could arise from anything.

original: gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor can they be said to be non-different,

original: grangs can gyi smra bar thal par 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
analyzed: grangs can gyi smra bar thal par 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
translated: because it would absurdly follow that the SƒÅ·πÉkhya theory would be correct.

original: byis pa rnams la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byis pa rnams la zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are taught to the immature.

original: byis pa ni 'dir nyan thos kyi rigs can gang dag de'i dus kyi @313a * //
analyzed: byis pa ni 'dir nyan thos kyi rigs can gang dag de'i dus kyi @313a * //
translated: Here, the immature are those who belong to the ≈õrƒÅvaka lineage.

original: skal pa med pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ldem por dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa bstan pa'i don la log par brtags pas ma thob par yongs su nyams pa'i sgo nas rang gi 'bras bu las yong su nyams par 'gyur pa de dag yin no //
analyzed: skal pa med pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ldem por dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa bstan pa'i don la log par brtags pas ma thob par yongs su nyams pa'i sgo nas rang gi 'bras bu las yong su nyams par 'gyur pa de dag yin no //
translated: They are those who have no good fortune, who have fallen away from their result due to complete degeneration, due to wrongly conceptualizing the meaning of the teaching of the definitive sutra that reveals the interpretable meaning of foundation consciousness.

original: dbang po gzugs can thams cad nye bar len par byed pa de nyid ces bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can thams cad nye bar len par byed pa de nyid ces bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: All physical faculties are appropriated.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel pa'i 'og rol gyi dbang po gzugs can tshe ji srid pa gang dag yin pa de dag nye bar len pa ston te /
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel pa'i 'og rol gyi dbang po gzugs can tshe ji srid pa gang dag yin pa de dag nye bar len pa ston te /
translated: This shows that the physical faculties that last for the duration of life, after the linking consciousness has been projected, are appropriated.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel pa'i skad cig ma nye bar len pa ni mjug thogs kyi tshig gis ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel pa'i skad cig ma nye bar len pa ni mjug thogs kyi tshig gis ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The moment of the projected linking consciousness is shown by the word ‚Äúappropriated‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúappropriated at the end.‚Äù

original: dbang po gzugs can thams cad ni 'dir rten du gyur pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag dang / de dag dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa yul gzugs la sogs pa dang bcas pa la dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can thams cad ni 'dir rten du gyur pa'i 'byung ba chen po dag dang / de dag dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa yul gzugs la sogs pa dang bcas pa la dgongs pa yin no //
translated: All the material faculties are the great elements that serve as their support, and they are not different from those elements, along with their objects such as form.

original: lus thams cad nye bar len pa'i gnas su gyur pa nyid ces bya ba 'dis ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel pa'i skad cig ma ma lus skye ba ril dang 'brel pa mig la sogs pas bsdus pas bon gyi sgo nas dang / lus kyi dbang po rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas nye bar len pa ston to //
analyzed: lus thams cad nye bar len pa'i gnas su gyur pa nyid ces bya ba 'dis ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel pa'i skad cig ma ma lus skye ba ril dang 'brel pa mig la sogs pas bsdus pas bon gyi sgo nas dang / lus kyi dbang po rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas nye bar len pa ston to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe basis for the appropriation of the entire body‚Äù indicates that the eye and the other faculties are related to the entire body, which is the collection of all the moments of the series that begins with the linking of consciousness at rebirth.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúas long as they exist‚Äù indicates the duration of the appropriation.

original: 'di ltar tshe ji srid par rjes su 'jug pa'i bar du des dbang po gzugs can dag ces bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig dang po'i nye bar len pa'i don rnam par 'grel te /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshe ji srid par rjes su 'jug pa'i bar du des dbang po gzugs can dag ces bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig dang po'i nye bar len pa'i don rnam par 'grel te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe material faculties‚Äù indicates the appropriation in terms of the seeds, and the body faculty indicates the appropriation in terms of its essential nature.

original: 'jig pa'i gags su bdag gir byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i gags su bdag gir byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúas long as they exist‚Äù indicates the duration of the appropriation.

original: yang ji ltar mig la sogs pa bdag gir byas she na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar mig la sogs pa bdag gir byas she na /
translated: Moreover, how is it that the eye, etc. are appropriated?

original: phan pa dang gnod pa dag gis bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rten nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan pa dang gnod pa dag gis bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rten nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they appear as the very basis of pleasure, pain, etc. through benefit and injury.

original: bdag gir ma byas par snang ba gang yin pa de ni ma zhin pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag gir ma byas par snang ba gang yin pa de ni ma zhin pa yin te /
translated: That which appears as not appropriated is not appropriated.

original: dper na snod kyi 'jig rten dang ; shi ba'i ro la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na snod kyi 'jig rten dang ; shi ba'i ro la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the inanimate world, a corpse, etc.

original: dper na rmi lam na yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig las tha dad pa ma yin yang lus bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rten du snang ba gang yin pa de ni zin pa'o zhes 'khrul pa'i rgyur grags la /
analyzed: dper na rmi lam na yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig las tha dad pa ma yin yang lus bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rten du snang ba gang yin pa de ni zin pa'o zhes 'khrul pa'i rgyur grags la /
translated: For example, in a dream, although there is no difference in the mental consciousness, that which appears as the basis of the pleasure, pain, etc. of the body is known as appropriated.

original: khang bzangs la sogs par snang ba gang yin pa de ni ma zin pa'o zhes grags pa ltar 'di la yang tshul ni de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: khang bzangs la sogs par snang ba gang yin pa de ni ma zin pa'o zhes grags pa ltar 'di la yang tshul ni de dang 'dra'o //
translated: That which appears as a palace, etc. is known as non-appropriated. The method here is like that.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel pa na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel pa na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Also, when linking at death, etc.

original: tshig gnyis pa'i nye bar len pa'i don rnam par 'grel te /
analyzed: tshig gnyis pa'i nye bar len pa'i don rnam par 'grel te /
translated: The meaning of the two phrases is explained.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel pa skye ba ril dang 'brel pa'i lus kyi sa bon du gtogs pa ste mngon par bsgrubs pa'i @313b sgo nas lus bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel pa skye ba ril dang 'brel pa'i lus kyi sa bon du gtogs pa ste mngon par bsgrubs pa'i @313b sgo nas lus bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the appropriator is the seed of the body that connects with the next life, which is related to the entire body that is born, and it is the appropriator of the body in the sense that it establishes it.

original: yang ci'i phyir bye brag tu nye bar len pa gnyis ston ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir bye brag tu nye bar len pa gnyis ston ce na /
translated: Why are two types of appropriators taught?

original: rtsod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of dispute.

original: rang gi sde pa rnams kyi ltar na /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa rnams kyi ltar na /
translated: According to our schools,

original: chang dang mtshams sbyor 'dod chags bral //
analyzed: chang dang mtshams sbyor 'dod chags bral //
translated: it is said that conception, desire, freedom from attachment,üîΩdegeneration, death, birth,

original: nyams dang 'chi 'pho skye ba dang // yid kyi rnam shes kho nar 'dod //
analyzed: nyams dang 'chi 'pho skye ba dang // yid kyi rnam shes kho nar 'dod //
translated: and mind alone are appropriators.

original: ces 'byung bas nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i 'og rol tu ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam pa shes pa kho na nye bar len pa po yin par grags la /
analyzed: ces 'byung bas nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i 'og rol tu ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam pa shes pa kho na nye bar len pa po yin par grags la /
translated: Therefore it is well known that after conception, the appropriator is the consciousness of the eye and so on.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel pa na ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa po yin par grags so //
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel pa na ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa nye bar len pa po yin par grags so //
translated: But when conception is appropriated, it is well known that the appropriator is mental consciousness.

original: de gnyi ga yang ji ltar mi srid pa de bzhin du skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spyod pa nas ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang ji ltar mi srid pa de bzhin du skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spyod pa nas ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: We will show later on how both of these are impossible.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de'i gnyen por bye brag tu nye bar len pa gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de'i gnyen por bye brag tu nye bar len pa gnyis bstan to //
translated: Thus, in order to remedy these two, the two kinds of appropriation are taught.

original: de la dbang po gzugs can thams cad nye bar len par byed pa nyid ni 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams dag tu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dbang po gzugs can thams cad nye bar len par byed pa nyid ni 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams dag tu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The appropriation of all material organs is to be known as being in the desire realm and the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i sems can rnams la yang dbang po gzugs can ni srid na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i sems can rnams la yang dbang po gzugs can ni srid na /
translated: Even though the material organs of the formless realm beings are possible,

original: ci'i phyir 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams dag tu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams dag tu zhes bya ste /
translated: why is it said to be in the desire realm and the form realm?

original: 'di ltar gzugs med pa'i sems can rnams kyi gzhal med khang dag dang / bcom ldan 'das la yang chos mnyan pa dang lta ba dang / rim gro bya ba'i phyir 'ong bar mdo gzhan dag las byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs med pa'i sems can rnams kyi gzhal med khang dag dang / bcom ldan 'das la yang chos mnyan pa dang lta ba dang / rim gro bya ba'i phyir 'ong bar mdo gzhan dag las byung ngo zhe na /
translated: In other sutras, it is said that the palaces of the formless realm beings and the Blessed One come to the desire realm and the form realm in order to listen to the Dharma, to see, and to pay respect.

original: las las skyes pa'i dbang po gzugs can nye bar len par byed pa nyid las bsams te smras pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: las las skyes pa'i dbang po gzugs can nye bar len par byed pa nyid las bsams te smras pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: The fault does not apply, because the statement is made with reference to the appropriation of the material faculties that arise from action.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi mig la sogs pa ni ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi mig la sogs pa ni ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa yin no //
translated: The divine eye and ear of the realm of form are born from concentration.

original: 'on te de lta na go gzugs can gyi khams na yang lha'i mig dang rna ba yang ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i phyir ma zin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te de lta na go gzugs can gyi khams na yang lha'i mig dang rna ba yang ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i phyir ma zin par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if that is so, then the divine eye and ear of the realm of form would not be appropriated, because they are born from concentration.

original: de ltar na 'o na ni //
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na ni //
translated: If that is so,

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i dbang po gzugs can las bsams te smras pas nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i dbang po gzugs can las bsams te smras pas nyes pa med de /
translated: then the fault does not apply, because the statement is made with reference to the material faculties of the realms of desire and form.

original: de na ni dbang po gzugs can yod pa nyid du rang gi sde pa rnams la grags so //
analyzed: de na ni dbang po gzugs can yod pa nyid du rang gi sde pa rnams la grags so //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas of the Western Regions say that the material faculties exist in the realm of form.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel pa na lus thams cad nye bar len pa'i gnas su gyur pa nyid ni khams gsum char na yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel pa na lus thams cad nye bar len pa'i gnas su gyur pa nyid ni khams gsum char na yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The body is the basis of appropriation for the entire realm of existence, and it should be understood that this is so for all three realms.

original: rang gi sde pa ni khams gsum char na yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho nas nyid mtshams sbyor ro zhes bya bar log par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sde pa ni khams gsum char na yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho nas nyid mtshams sbyor ro zhes bya bar log par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas of the Western Land say that the mental consciousness alone links at death and birth in all three realms.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i rnam grangs brjod pa rdzogs so /üîΩ// / thun mong gi dbang du mdzad @314a * //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i rnam grangs brjod pa rdzogs so / // / thun mong gi dbang du mdzad @314a * //
translated: The uncommon enumeration is complete.

original: nas ; de ni sems zhes kyang bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: nas ; de ni sems zhes kyang bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The common enumeration is stated in the line, ‚ÄúIt is also called mind.‚Äù

original: de la khyad par ni 'di yod de theg pa chen po las ni re 'ga' ni rnam par shes pa brgyad ni tshogs sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyor la /
analyzed: de la khyad par ni 'di yod de theg pa chen po las ni re 'ga' ni rnam par shes pa brgyad ni tshogs sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyor la /
translated: There is this difference. In the MahƒÅyƒÅna, sometimes the eight consciousnesses are called mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: res 'ga' ni sems zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gtsor kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kho na la /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni sems zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gtsor kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kho na la /
translated: Sometimes the term mind refers to the foundation consciousness alone.

original: yid ces bya ba'i sgra ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam par shes pa drug la'o //
analyzed: yid ces bya ba'i sgra ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam par shes pa drug la'o //
translated: The term thought refers to the afflicted mind, and the term consciousness refers to the six consciousnesses.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa las ni sgra 'di gsum char yang gtsor rnam par shes pa drug kho na la sbyor ro zhes brjod cing 'di rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig dbye ba yang 'di skad du brjod de /üîΩsogs pas na sems so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa las ni sgra 'di gsum char yang gtsor rnam par shes pa drug kho na la sbyor ro zhes brjod cing 'di rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig dbye ba yang 'di skad du brjod de / sogs pas na sems so //
translated: The etymologies and classifications of these terms are explained as follows.

original: rtogs pas ni yid do //
analyzed: rtogs pas ni yid do //
translated: The prefix ‚Äúmanas‚Äù means mind.üîΩThe prefix ‚Äúmati‚Äù means thought.

original: rnam par shes pas na rnam pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pas na rnam pa shes pa'o //
translated: The prefix ‚Äúvij√±ƒÅna‚Äù means consciousness.

original: yang na dus kyi bye brag yin te ma 'ongs pa ni sems so //
analyzed: yang na dus kyi bye brag yin te ma 'ongs pa ni sems so //
translated: Alternatively, they are distinguished by time: future is mind,

original: 'das pa ni yid do //
analyzed: 'das pa ni yid do //
translated: past is thought,

original: da ltar byung ba ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: and present is consciousness.

original: yang na byed pa'i byed brag yin te /
analyzed: yang na byed pa'i byed brag yin te /
translated: Alternatively, they are distinguished by function.

original: ring du 'gro ba ni sems so //
analyzed: ring du 'gro ba ni sems so //
translated: Mind is that which goes far,

original: sngon du 'gro ba ni yid de chos thams cad ni yid sngon du 'gro ba can no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon du 'gro ba ni yid de chos thams cad ni yid sngon du 'gro ba can no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: thought is that which precedes, because it is said, ‚ÄúAll phenomena are preceded by thought.‚Äù

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i byed pa'i bye brag gis rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i byed pa'i bye brag gis rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Consciousness is distinguished by the function of linking.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúConditioned by formations, there is consciousness.‚Äù

original: yang na bstan pa'i bye brag yin te /
analyzed: yang na bstan pa'i bye brag yin te /
translated: Or else, they are different in name because they are taught in different contexts.

original: khams bstan par ni sems te /
analyzed: khams bstan par ni sems te /
translated: In the teaching of the elements, it is mind,

original: sems kyi khams bdun zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi khams bdun zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it says, ‚ÄúThe seven elements of consciousness.‚ÄùüîΩIn the teaching of the sense bases, it is the mental faculty,

original: skye mched bstan par ni yid de yid kyi skye mched ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched bstan par ni yid de yid kyi skye mched ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it says, ‚ÄúThe sense base of the mental faculty.‚Äù

original: phung po bstan par ni rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: phung po bstan par ni rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: In the teaching of the aggregates, it is consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang na ldan pa ma yin pa'i ming gi bye brag yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro // yang na ldan pa ma yin pa'i ming gi bye brag yin no //
translated: because it says, ‚ÄúThe aggregate of consciousness.‚ÄùüîΩOr else, they are different in name because they are not associated.

original: yang na sgra tsam zhig tha dad par zad do zhes zer te /
analyzed: yang na sgra tsam zhig tha dad par zad do zhes zer te /
translated: Or else, they are different only in name.

original: de thams cad ni rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de thams cad ni rung ba ma yin no //
translated: All of these explanations are incorrect.

original: de la re zhig sogs pas na sems so zhes smras pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: de la re zhig sogs pas na sems so zhes smras pa gang yin pa /
translated: First, it is said that mind is so called because it accumulates.

original: gal te rang gi nus pa stsogs pa yin na ni sems las byung ba rnams dang gzugs la yang thal par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rang gi nus pa stsogs pa yin na ni sems las byung ba rnams dang gzugs la yang thal par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it accumulates its own potential, it follows that mental factors and form also accumulate.

original: 'on te 'bras bu stsogs pas so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu stsogs pas so zhe na /
translated: But if it accumulates results,

original: las kho na yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: las kho na yin par 'gyur te /
translated: it is just action.

original: las kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med par mi sogs so zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //üîΩde bzhin du gal te rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de nyid rtogs pa yin no zhes bya na ni sgra tsam zhig tha dad par 'gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi rgyu mtshan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: las kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med par mi sogs so zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro // de bzhin du gal te rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de nyid rtogs pa yin no zhes bya na ni sgra tsam zhig tha dad par 'gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi rgyu mtshan ni ma yin no //
translated: and action is not possible without the consciousness of the ground of all.üîΩIf the consciousness itself is the perception, then the two are merely different names and there is no difference in their meaning.

original: 'on te gzhan zhig la @314b bya'o zhen de yang ma bshad do //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan zhig la @314b bya'o zhen de yang ma bshad do //
translated: If you say that perception is something other than consciousness, that is not explained.

original: rnam par shes pas na rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni khas len pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pas na rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni khas len pa nyid do //
translated: The consciousness is called consciousness because it is conscious.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gre skyes kyi mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gre skyes kyi mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said in the S≈´tra on the Wise and Foolish:üîΩ‚ÄúIn the same way, the future mind is the mind.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa ni sems so zhes bya ba ji ltar na sems zhes bya /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa ni sems so zhes bya ba ji ltar na sems zhes bya /
translated: How is it the mind?

original: gal te sems las byung ba'i tshigs bsags nas da ltar gyi dus su 'ong bas so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sems las byung ba'i tshigs bsags nas da ltar gyi dus su 'ong bas so zhe na /
translated: If you say it is because it will come to the present time as a collection of mental factors,

original: de ni rnar mi 'ong ste ma 'ongs pa med pa'i phyir dang byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnar mi 'ong ste ma 'ongs pa med pa'i phyir dang byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not reasonable because the future does not exist and it has no activity.

original: de bzhin du 'das pa yang ji ltar yid yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'das pa yang ji ltar yid yin /
translated: Likewise, how can the past be the mind?

original: gal te mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos pos 'bras bu 'byin ba dang 'dzin par nus pa'i phyir yin la de yang yang dag pa nyid kho nar khas len na khyim bya shi ba yang skad 'byin par 'gyur bas de ni rnar mi 'ong ste
analyzed: gal te mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos pos 'bras bu 'byin ba dang 'dzin par nus pa'i phyir yin la de yang yang dag pa nyid kho nar khas len na khyim bya shi ba yang skad 'byin par 'gyur bas de ni rnar mi 'ong ste
translated: If you claim that the past is the mind because it is able to produce and grasp an effect by means of the state of being the equivalent immediately preceding condition, then even a dead crow would caw, but that is not heard.

original: / rnam par shes pa ni da ltar byung ba yin par khas len pa nyid do //
analyzed: / rnam par shes pa ni da ltar byung ba yin par khas len pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore consciousness is accepted as present.

original: de bzhin du byed pa'i bye brag la yang thag ring po 'dzin pa'i phyir sems yin na sems las byung ba dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du byed pa'i bye brag la yang thag ring po 'dzin pa'i phyir sems yin na sems las byung ba dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, if the mind is that which apprehends distant objects, then mental factors would also be the mind, since they are also distinguished by their function.

original: yid sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba 'di la yang gnas skabs gang na las byed pa de'i sngon rol na dngos su yid ma yin te 'das pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba 'di la yang gnas skabs gang na las byed pa de'i sngon rol na dngos su yid ma yin te 'das pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, in the statement the mind precedes, the mind is not actually the mind prior to the state in which it performs its function, because the past does not exist.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba yang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas mi srid kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pas ni srid do zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba yang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas mi srid kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pas ni srid do zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is also impossible for the consciousness that links rebirth to occur in the form of the evolving consciousnesses, but it is possible for it to occur in the form of the store consciousness.

original: de bzhin du sems kyi khams bdun zhes bya ba yang sems kyi sgra snga ma bzhin du brtag mi bzod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems kyi khams bdun zhes bya ba yang sems kyi sgra snga ma bzhin du brtag mi bzod do //
translated: In the same way, the expression ‚Äúthe seven consciousness constituents‚Äù is untenable, since the word ‚Äúconsciousness‚Äù in the first case cannot be understood as referring to the store consciousness.

original: skye mched bstan par yang yid kyi sgra skye mched du mi srid pa'i phyir dang 'das pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched bstan par yang yid kyi sgra skye mched du mi srid pa'i phyir dang 'das pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the presentation of the sense bases, the word ‚Äúmind‚Äù cannot refer to a sense base, and the past is not a sense base.

original: de bzhin du phung po bstan par rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'byung bar brjod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du phung po bstan par rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'byung bar brjod de /
translated: In the same way, the word ‚Äúconsciousness‚Äù occurs in the presentation of the aggregates.

original: phung po la sogs pa ni gang zag gdags pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa ni gang zag gdags pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: The aggregates, etc., are the causes for the designation of a person.

original: gdags pa'i rgyur yang da ltar gyi rnam par shes pa rung ngo zhes 'don to //
analyzed: gdags pa'i rgyur yang da ltar gyi rnam par shes pa rung ngo zhes 'don to //
translated: The present consciousness is suitable as the cause for the designation.

original: de yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: This is also untenable.

original: 'das pa la sogs pas tha dad pa la rnam par shes pa'i phung por 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pas tha dad pa la rnam par shes pa'i phung por 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the aggregates of consciousness are distinguished by the past, etc.

original: gdul ba 'ga' zhig la rnam grangs 'ga' zhig gis yid ches par bya ba'i phyir dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bskyed pa'i phyir ming gi sgra tsam zhig tha dad par khas len pa nyid yin na rnam grangs tha dad pa de nyid rgyu mtshan gang gis yin pa ni ma sgras pas de yang rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gdul ba 'ga' zhig la rnam grangs 'ga' zhig gis yid ches par bya ba'i phyir dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bskyed pa'i phyir ming gi sgra tsam zhig tha dad par khas len pa nyid yin na rnam grangs tha dad pa de nyid rgyu mtshan gang gis yin pa ni ma sgras pas de yang rung ba ma yin no //
translated: For the sake of convincing some disciples by some means and for the sake of generating the analytical knowledges, they accept that the mere sound of the name is different, but they do not accept that the reason for those different enumerations is different.

original: de lta bas na theg pa chen po pa rnams kyi ci lta ba de ltar na bzang ste /üîΩgang gi tshe rnam par shes pa @315a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na theg pa chen po pa rnams kyi ci lta ba de ltar na bzang ste / gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa @315a * //
translated: Therefore, it is good if the MahƒÅyƒÅna is just as it is.

original: brgyad car gyi tshogs la bya ba de'i tshe ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni sogs pas na sems so //
analyzed: brgyad car gyi tshogs la bya ba de'i tshe ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni sogs pas na sems so //
translated: When the collection of the eight consciousnesses is the object, then the ƒÅlaya consciousness is the mind because it is the collection.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni don sems pas na sems so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni don sems pas na sems so //
translated: The afflicted mind is the mind because it thinks about objects.

original: rnam par shes pa drug gi tshogs ni sna tshogs la dmigs pa'i phyir sems so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug gi tshogs ni sna tshogs la dmigs pa'i phyir sems so //
translated: The collection of the six consciousnesses is the mind because it focuses on various objects.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad car yang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i don tam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad car yang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i don tam /
translated: The meaning of equivalent immediately antecedent condition is the same for all eight consciousnesses.

original: rtogs pa'i don gyis gdags pa'i sgo nas yid yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i don gyis gdags pa'i sgo nas yid yin no //
translated: All eight collections of consciousness are mind in the sense of being the immediately preceding condition or in the sense of being the support of realization.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad car yang yul so sor rnam par rig pa'i don gyis rnam par shes pa yin no //üîΩgang gi tshe gtsor bya ba de'i tshe ni sna tshogs pa'i phyir dang don sems pa'i phyir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa kho na sems yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad car yang yul so sor rnam par rig pa'i don gyis rnam par shes pa yin no // gang gi tshe gtsor bya ba de'i tshe ni sna tshogs pa'i phyir dang don sems pa'i phyir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa kho na sems yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: All eight collections of consciousness are consciousness in the sense of being the awareness of individual objects.

original: rgyu gsum mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu gsum mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When mind is primary, then the consciousness that is the foundation of all events is mind, because it is diverse and it thinks of objects, but the others are not, because the three reasons are impossible.

original: dus rtag tu gsal ba'i rnam par rlom pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kho na yid yin gyi gsal ba'i phyir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: dus rtag tu gsal ba'i rnam par rlom pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kho na yid yin gyi gsal ba'i phyir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Afflicted mind alone is mind, because it is always clear and it is conceited. The consciousness that is the foundation of all events is not, because it is unclear.

original: rgyun 'chad pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa gzhan dag kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyun 'chad pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa gzhan dag kyang ma yin no //
translated: The other forms of consciousness are not, because they are interrupted.

original: sna tshogs gsal ba'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa kho na rnam par shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sna tshogs gsal ba'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa kho na rnam par shes pa yin gyi /
translated: Because it has the aspect of the manifestation of the manifold, it is only the active consciousness that is consciousness.

original: mi gsal ba'i phyir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yang ma yin la sna tshogs can ma yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i phyir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yang ma yin la sna tshogs can ma yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the store-consciousness, because that is not manifest. It is not the defiled mind, because that is not manifold.

original: de la gtsor sems la brten na sems zhes kyang bya ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de la gtsor sems la brten na sems zhes kyang bya ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In this regard, it is called mind because it is the principal one among the mental factors.üîΩIn order to show the difference, it is called thought because it is the principal one among the various thoughts.

original: khyad par nyid du na yang khungs bcom ldan 'das kyis sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: khyad par nyid du na yang khungs bcom ldan 'das kyis sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to show the difference, it is called consciousness because it is the principal one among the various consciousnesses.

original: de la gtsor ni sems kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa kho na yin par ston par 'gyur ro //üîΩyid ni khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la gtsor ni sems kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa kho na yin par ston par 'gyur ro // yid ni khyad par du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, mind is the store-consciousness itself, because it is the principal one.

original: de la yid ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de la yid ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to show the difference, thought is said to be of two kinds.üîΩIn order to show the difference, consciousness is said to be of six kinds.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen byed pas gnas su gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zhar la spyir yid kun rdzob pa de ston par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen byed pas gnas su gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zhar la spyir yid kun rdzob pa de ston par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is the basis that acts as the immediately preceding condition‚Äù is a digression that generally indicates the conventional mental consciousness.

original: 'dir yang drug po kho na las 'das ma thag pa gang yin pa de gzung gi phan tshun dag tu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang drug po kho na las 'das ma thag pa gang yin pa de gzung gi phan tshun dag tu ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, the immediately preceding condition is only one of the six consciousnesses, not one of the other two.

original: lhan cig kyang 'byung ba'i phyir //üîΩdngos bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lhan cig kyang 'byung ba'i phyir // dngos bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they arise simultaneously.

original: gnyis pa nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gnyis pa nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ces bya ba smos so //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe second is the afflicted mind.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa bzhi po zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la bdag nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //üîΩbdag nyid du gzung ba @315b gang yin pa des khengs par 'gyur pa'i phyir nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bzhi po zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la bdag nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o // bdag nyid du gzung ba @315b gang yin pa des khengs par 'gyur pa'i phyir nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe four afflictions‚Äù refers to the afflicted view of a real self, because this consciousness grasps the storehouse consciousness as a self.üîΩIt is the pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù because one becomes inflated due to grasping a self.

original: gang gis khengs par 'gyur ba de la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir bdag la chags pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis khengs par 'gyur ba de la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir bdag la chags pa'o //
translated: It is attachment to a self, because one clings to that which is inflated.

original: de dag thams cad kyang ma rig pa las 'gyur bas ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang ma rig pa las 'gyur bas ma rig pa'o //
translated: All of these are due to ignorance, therefore, it is ignorance.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas so zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa drug car gyi yang zag pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi gnas yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas so zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa drug car gyi yang zag pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi gnas yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This is the basis of the afflicted mind consciousness. This means that it is the basis of the afflicted nature of the six consciousnesses.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bzhin no //
translated: The term afflicted is a synonym for contaminated, like the affliction of birth.

original: de ltar ma yin na ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i skye ba ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i skye ba ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa yin par 'gyur /
translated: If it were not so, how could the birth of the unobscured-non-defined be afflicted?

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la ltos na ni 'chad par 'gyur ba skyed pa'i rkyen nyid kyang yod de /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la ltos na ni 'chad par 'gyur ba skyed pa'i rkyen nyid kyang yod de /
translated: In relation to mental consciousness, it is the condition that generates the explained consciousnesses.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas nyid dang por bstan to //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas nyid dang por bstan to //
translated: It is the basis of affliction because it is the immediately preceding condition and it is not shared.

original: yang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ji ltar na zag pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ji ltar na zag pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: Also, how is the afflicted mind the cause of being accompanied by defilements?

original: de la re zhig gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa drug gi tshogs nyon mongs pa can yin pa de'i tshe ni rang dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i zag pa dag kho na dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir de dag zag pa dang bcas pa nyid du grub na
analyzed: de la re zhig gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa drug gi tshogs nyon mongs pa can yin pa de'i tshe ni rang dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i zag pa dag kho na dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir de dag zag pa dang bcas pa nyid du grub na
translated: If the group of six consciousnesses is afflicted, then it is established that they are accompanied by defilements because they occur simultaneously with the defilements that are concomitant with them.

original: / gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa de'i tshe go ji ltar yin /
analyzed: / gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa de'i tshe go ji ltar yin /
translated: But how is it when they are not afflicted?

original: zag pa'i sa bon dang 'brel pa'i gnas las skye ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod par yang mi nus te lam gyi bden pa la yang thal par 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
analyzed: zag pa'i sa bon dang 'brel pa'i gnas las skye ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod par yang mi nus te lam gyi bden pa la yang thal par 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
translated: It cannot be said that they are accompanied by defilements because they arise from the state that is related to the seeds of defilements, because it would follow that the truth of the path would also be accompanied by defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid khas len na ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i zag pa dag kho na dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid khas len na ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i zag pa dag kho na dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa nyid yin no //
translated: If you accept that there is an afflicted mind, then it is accompanied by defilements because it occurs simultaneously with the defilements that are concomitant with it.

original: de lta na 'o na ni 'gog pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas skabs na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa zag pa dang bcas pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni 'gog pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas skabs na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa zag pa dang bcas pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then at the time of entering meditative attainment in the state of the path of no learning or the supramundane path of meditation, the contaminated foundation consciousness would not exist.üîΩ

original: de ni de'i tshe nyon mongs pa rnams dang lhan cig mi 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: de ni de'i tshe nyon mongs pa rnams dang lhan cig mi 'jug go zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then at the time of entering meditative attainment in the path of cessation and the supramundane path, the afflicted mind would not be associated with the contaminated foundation consciousness.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so, because

original: de ni zag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni zag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa nyid yin no //
translated: it is contaminated since it is the cause of contamination.

original: de la nyon mongs pa bzhi dang sngar bstan pa'i kun du 'gro ba lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir 'di'i sems las byung ba ni dgu kho na yin nom //üîΩyul so sor nges pa rnams kyi nang @316a * //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa bzhi dang sngar bstan pa'i kun du 'gro ba lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir 'di'i sems las byung ba ni dgu kho na yin nom // yul so sor nges pa rnams kyi nang @316a * //
translated: Since it is concomitant with the four afflictions and the five omnipresent mental factors taught previously, there are only nine mental factors in this mind.

original: nas re zhig 'dun pa ni mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nas re zhig 'dun pa ni mi 'byung ngo //
translated: From among the mental factors that are specific to objects, aspiration does not occur.

original: de ni rnam pa gsum ste don du gnyer ba'i 'dun pa dang / 'phrad pa'i 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum ste don du gnyer ba'i 'dun pa dang / 'phrad pa'i 'dun pa'o //
translated: Aspiration has three types: aspiration for a goal, aspiration for contact, and aspiration for a specific object.

original: re zhig don du gnyer ba'i 'dun pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig don du gnyer ba'i 'dun pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Aspiration for a goal does not occur at that time.

original: yid kyi yul ni nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi yul ni nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of mind is near.

original: ma bral bar rnam par snang ba'i phyir 'phrad pa'i 'dun pa yang ma yin te 'phrad pa'i 'dun ba ni dngos po thag ring ba'i yul can yin pas so //
analyzed: ma bral bar rnam par snang ba'i phyir 'phrad pa'i 'dun pa yang ma yin te 'phrad pa'i 'dun ba ni dngos po thag ring ba'i yul can yin pas so //
translated: It is not a desire for contact, because it is clearly manifest without contact, and the desire for contact has a distant object.

original: mi 'bral ba'i 'dun pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi 'bral ba'i 'dun pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not a desire for non-separation,

original: de ni bral gyis dogs pas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir la nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la ni de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bral gyis dogs pas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir la nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la ni de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is distinguished by the fear of separation, and because that does not exist in the afflicted mind.

original: mos pa yang mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: mos pa yang mi 'byung ste /
translated: There is no resolve,

original: nges pa'i bdag nyid kyi mos pa ni the tshom rnam par chad pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir dang yul nyams su myong ba can yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: nges pa'i bdag nyid kyi mos pa ni the tshom rnam par chad pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir dang yul nyams su myong ba can yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: because resolve is of the nature of certainty, preceded by the elimination of doubt, and it has an experienced object.

original: yid ni ngo bo gcig pa nyid du 'jug pa'i phyir the tshom yang mi srid la da ltar byung ba'i yul can yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: yid ni ngo bo gcig pa nyid du 'jug pa'i phyir the tshom yang mi srid la da ltar byung ba'i yul can yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Doubt is also impossible, because mind engages in a single nature, and because it has a present object.

original: dran pa yang yul nyams su myong ba can yin pa'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: dran pa yang yul nyams su myong ba can yin pa'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: There is no memory, because it has an experienced object.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni skad cig re re la sngon med pa'i rdzas la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni skad cig re re la sngon med pa'i rdzas la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The afflicted mind is not concentration because it focuses on a substance that did not exist previously in each moment.

original: ting nge 'dzin yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yang ma yin no //
translated: It is also not meditative concentration.

original: ci'i phyir te 'di ltar brtag par bya ba'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig pa nyid do zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir te 'di ltar brtag par bya ba'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig pa nyid do zhes bshad pa /
translated: Why? Because it is said that meditative concentration is the one-pointedness of mind on an object of investigation.

original: 'di la yang brtag par bya ba'i dngos po yang yod la rtse gcig pa nyid kyang yod de kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la yang brtag par bya ba'i dngos po yang yod la rtse gcig pa nyid kyang yod de kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: In this case, there is an object of investigation and there is one-pointedness because it focuses on the store consciousness.

original: de ni ma yin te gang la rnam par g-yeng ba yod pa las sems kyis sems mnyam par 'jog pa de la ting nge 'dzin yod na /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te gang la rnam par g-yeng ba yod pa las sems kyis sems mnyam par 'jog pa de la ting nge 'dzin yod na /
translated: That is not so, because if meditative concentration exists in the mind that is concentrated on a mind that has distraction,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni de lta bur mnyam par 'jog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni de lta bur mnyam par 'jog pa ma yin te /
translated: the afflicted mind is not concentrated in that way,

original: 'khor ba ji srid par ngo bo gcig pa nyid du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba ji srid par ngo bo gcig pa nyid du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it operates with the same nature for as long as cyclic existence continues.

original: yang na dmigs pa'i skad cig ma snga ma nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de nyid la yang dang yang du 'byung ba ni ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin na nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na dmigs pa'i skad cig ma snga ma nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de nyid la yang dang yang du 'byung ba ni ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin na nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: Or, if it is the repeated occurrence of the experience of the prior moment of the object, then it is concomitant with concentration. But afflicted mind is not like that.

original: skad cig re re zhing sngon med pa'i rdzas la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig re re zhing sngon med pa'i rdzas la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it focuses on a substance that did not exist previously in each moment.

original: yang na dbang po gzugs can gyi rnam par shes pa rnam ma gtogs pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab gang yang rung ba de thams cad ni mngon par rtogs pa'i rtog pa yin na /
analyzed: yang na dbang po gzugs can gyi rnam par shes pa rnam ma gtogs pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab gang yang rung ba de thams cad ni mngon par rtogs pa'i rtog pa yin na /
translated: Or, if it is any wisdom concomitant with a mind not in equipoise, except for the consciousnesses of physical sense faculties, then it is the conception of realization.

original: de yang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la yod de /
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la yod de /
translated: And that exists in afflicted mind.

original: bdag tu lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir @316b ro ;
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir @316b ro ;
translated: Because it is concomitant with the view of self.

original: ; mngon par rtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: ; mngon par rtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The mind that is conceptual due to the conception of realization

original: ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan par rung ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan par rung ste /
translated: It is compatible with concentration,

original: de'i byed pa snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i byed pa snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because its activity is clear.üîΩIt must be accepted that it is also compatible with wisdom,

original: shes rab kyang khas blangs dgos pa nyid de bdag tu lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyang khas blangs dgos pa nyid de bdag tu lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu po'i nang nas de las gzhan pa'i lta ba rnams dang ni mtshungs par mi ldan te /

analyzed: shes rab gzhan dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir ro // rnam grangs kyis mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin te /

original: de las rnam par brtags pa nyid kyi lta ba gsum po gang dag yin pa de dag ni mtshungs par mi ldan te yid ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las rnam par brtags pa nyid kyi lta ba gsum po gang dag yin pa de dag ni mtshungs par mi ldan te yid ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not compatible with the other views that are among the ten root afflictions,üîΩbecause it is not compatible with other wisdoms.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba mthar 'dzin pa dang yang mtshungs par mi ldan te /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba mthar 'dzin pa dang yang mtshungs par mi ldan te /
translated: It is not compatible with the other views that are among the ten root afflictions,

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not compatible with other wisdoms.üîΩIt is not compatible with the other views that are among the ten root afflictions,üîΩbecause it is not compatible with other wisdoms.üîΩIt is not compatible with the other views that are

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni ngo bo gcig pa yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid du bzung nas rtag pa nyid du 'dzin par nus pa ma yin no //üîΩbdag tu lta ba rnam pa gnyis las kyang bdag gi'i rnam pa can de mi srid de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni ngo bo gcig pa yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid du bzung nas rtag pa nyid du 'dzin par nus pa ma yin no // bdag tu lta ba rnam pa gnyis las kyang bdag gi'i rnam pa can de mi srid de /
translated: The afflicted mind is not capable of grasping itself as permanent, because it is of the same nature.

original: bdag tu lta ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, it is impossible that it has the aspect of mine, because it is preceded by the view of self.

original: zhe sdang ni mi dga' ba'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: zhe sdang ni mi dga' ba'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Aversion has the aspect of dislike,

original: yid ni dga' ba'i rnam pa can du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid ni dga' ba'i rnam pa can du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the mind engages its object with the aspect of delight.

original: dga' ba'i rnam pa can nyid yin yang sems pa'i tshor ba can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dga' ba'i rnam pa can nyid yin yang sems pa'i tshor ba can ni ma yin te /
translated: Even though it has the aspect of delight, it is not associated with the feeling of pleasure,

original: gang du skyes pa de'i'o gzhan zhes 'byung ba'i phyir reg pa la sogs pa ji ltar skabs su bab pa dag kho na bsgres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du skyes pa de'i'o gzhan zhes 'byung ba'i phyir reg pa la sogs pa ji ltar skabs su bab pa dag kho na bsgres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that it is the feeling of whatever is born there, and because contact, etc., are only as they occur.

original: 'on te tshor ba gzhan yang yod na ni khyad par du byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te tshor ba gzhan yang yod na ni khyad par du byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if there were another feeling, it would be specified.

original: mi rung ba'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: mi rung ba'i yang phyir te /
translated: Also, because it is not tenable.

original: yid bde ba dang mi ldan te kun brtags pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid bde ba dang mi ldan te kun brtags pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not associated with mental pleasure, because it arises by the power of imagination.

original: yid ni mngon par rtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yod kyang gti mug pa'i rnam pa can gyis yongs su rtog pa ni med do //
analyzed: yid ni mngon par rtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yod kyang gti mug pa'i rnam pa can gyis yongs su rtog pa ni med do //
translated: The mental faculty is associated with the imagination of the conceptualization of clear realization, but not with the imagination of the conceptualization of delusion.

original: bde ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not associated with pleasure,

original: rtag tu yod pa'i nyes par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa'i nyes par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the error of its being permanent would then follow.

original: 'o na btang snyoms pa yin na ji ltar dga' ba'i rnam pa can yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na btang snyoms pa yin na ji ltar dga' ba'i rnam pa can yin zhe na /
translated: If it is equanimity, how can it be associated with the aspect of joy?

original: bdag la chags pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la chags pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is associated with attachment to self.

original: the tshom yang dngos po gnyis su byed pa'i yul can nyid kyis shes rab kho na la btags pa yin na /
analyzed: the tshom yang dngos po gnyis su byed pa'i yul can nyid kyis shes rab kho na la btags pa yin na /
translated: Doubt is also designated as wisdom, because it has an object that is divided into two parts.

original: de dang yang mi ldan te /üîΩyid ni rigs @317a * //
analyzed: de dang yang mi ldan te / yid ni rigs @317a * //
translated: It is not associated with that,

original: gcig pa'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pa'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mental faculty has the aspect of a single type.

original: rigs gcig pa'i rnam pa can nyid kyis re zhig ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan par mi rung na /
analyzed: rigs gcig pa'i rnam pa can nyid kyis re zhig ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan par mi rung na /
translated: Since it is the aspect of a single type, it is not suitable to be associated with ignorance.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa phan tshun du go ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa phan tshun du go ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How can attachment and so on be mutually concomitant?

original: 'dir sde pa'i gsungs rab kyi lugs lta bur dgongs pa ni ma yin gyi 'dir ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la yang 'dod chags la sogs pa mi 'gal ba rnams phan tshun mtshungs par ldan par zhal gyis ba zhes so //
analyzed: 'dir sde pa'i gsungs rab kyi lugs lta bur dgongs pa ni ma yin gyi 'dir ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la yang 'dod chags la sogs pa mi 'gal ba rnams phan tshun mtshungs par ldan par zhal gyis ba zhes so //
translated: Here, the intention is not that they are concomitant like the system of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas. Here, it is asserted that attachment and so on are mutually concomitant in the six active consciousnesses.

original: rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa 'di dag ni ma rig pa med par nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa 'di dag ni ma rig pa med par nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: These root afflictions are not concomitant with other afflictions in the absence of ignorance,

original: ma rig pa yang rtsa pa'i nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa ma yin pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa yang rtsa pa'i nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa ma yin pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: because ignorance is a root affliction, like the other root afflictions.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams las kyang khro ba dang rnam par 'tshe ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / phrag dog dang / 'tshig pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni mi dga' ba'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir dang / kha phyir bltas pa'i phyir mtshungs par mi ldan no //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams las kyang khro ba dang rnam par 'tshe ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / phrag dog dang / 'tshig pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni mi dga' ba'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir dang / kha phyir bltas pa'i phyir mtshungs par mi ldan no //
translated: The secondary passions are also not associated with anger, enmity, dissimulation, jealousy, and violence, because they function as the basis of displeasure and because they are directed outward.

original: rgyags pa dang sgyu dang g-yo dang 'chab pa dang ser sna dag ni /
analyzed: rgyags pa dang sgyu dang g-yo dang 'chab pa dang ser sna dag ni /
translated: Arrogance, deceit, dissimulation, concealment, and avarice

original: 'dod chags dang gti mug gi char gtogs pa nyid yin yang kha phyir bltas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang gti mug gi char gtogs pa nyid yin yang kha phyir bltas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are not associated with anger, etc., because they are included in attachment and delusion and because they are directed outward.

original: ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa dag ni gcig tu mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa dag ni gcig tu mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Shamelessness and lack of conscience are not associated with anger, etc., because they are unwholesome only.

original: shes bzhin ma yin pa ni kha phyir bltas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bzhin ma yin pa ni kha phyir bltas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Lack of conscience is not associated with anger, etc., because it is directed outward.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba ni ngar 'dzin cing nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba yin pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba ni ngar 'dzin cing nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba yin pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Carelessness is associated with anger, etc., because it is the distraction of the bad habit of the pride of self-satisfaction and self-reference.

original: bag med pa ni 'dod chags dang gti mug gi char gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag med pa ni 'dod chags dang gti mug gi char gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because heedlessness is a part of attachment and delusion.

original: rgod pa ni 'dod chags kyi char gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgod pa ni 'dod chags kyi char gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because excitement is a part of attachment.

original: ma dad pa dang le lo dang rmugs pa rnams gti mug gi char gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma dad pa dang le lo dang rmugs pa rnams gti mug gi char gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because lack of faith, laziness, and lethargy are parts of delusion.

original: yang na mtshungs par mi ldan pa nyid de 'dod chags la sogs pa ni sngar gsal ba'i rnam par zhugs pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na mtshungs par mi ldan pa nyid de 'dod chags la sogs pa ni sngar gsal ba'i rnam par zhugs pa yin la /
translated: Or else, they are not associated with the store consciousness, because attachment, etc., are already present in a manifest form.

original: de'i rjes la shas kyis bri bar zhugs pa na nye pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams zhes gdags na //
analyzed: de'i rjes la shas kyis bri bar zhugs pa na nye pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams zhes gdags na //
translated: When they are present in a subtle form after that, they are designated as secondary passions.

original: yid la ni de lta bu mi srid de /
analyzed: yid la ni de lta bu mi srid de /
translated: But this is impossible for the manas,

original: ngo bo gcig pa nyid du zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo gcig pa nyid du zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is present in a single nature.

original: brjed ngas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: brjed ngas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not forgetfulness,

original: 'dres pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dres pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has as its object a confused entity.

original: gnyid kyang ma yin te gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dang 'gal ba'i @317b phyir ro ;
analyzed: gnyid kyang ma yin te gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dang 'gal ba'i @317b phyir ro ;
translated: It is not sleep, because it is opposed to the realms of form and the formless.

original: ;'gyod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ;'gyod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not regret,üîΩbecause it is not associated with memory.

original: mi dga' ba'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dga' ba'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the aspect of non-delight.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag kyang ma yin te tshol ba dang / so sor rtog pa'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag kyang ma yin te tshol ba dang / so sor rtog pa'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not discursive thought and indecision, because they have the aspect of seeking and discerning.

original: yid 'di ni lung sil bu'i mdo las de ni nyon mongs pa rnams las nges par grol par ma gyur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid 'di ni lung sil bu'i mdo las de ni nyon mongs pa rnams las nges par grol par ma gyur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This mind is not definitely liberated from the defilements, nor will it be liberated from them, as is stated in the sutra of miscellaneous discourses.üîΩIt is also established in the sutra of the definitive explanation of the intention.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa'i mdo las kyang grub po //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa la sogs pa'i mdo las kyang grub po //
translated: It is also established by reasoning.

original: rigs pas kyang bsgrub par mi rig pa ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rigs pas kyang bsgrub par mi rig pa ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The statement, ‚Äúit is not known to be unmixed‚Äù and so on.

original: ma 'dres pa ni ma rig pa rang dbang can yin gyi /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa ni ma rig pa rang dbang can yin gyi /
translated: Unmixed means that ignorance is independent.

original: rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par mi ldan pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par mi ldan pas ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that it is not concomitant with other root afflictions,

original: khro ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang der thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
analyzed: khro ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang der thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
translated: because it would follow that it would be concomitant with anger and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par mi ldan pas der thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par mi ldan pas der thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not concomitant with any root or secondary mental afflictions, so it is not tenable that it is concomitant with them.

original: de med par thal ba nyid du 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de med par thal ba nyid du 'gyur bas so //
translated: It would follow that it does not exist.

original: de lta bas na rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs las yang rdzas gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir rang dbang can ni ma 'dres pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs las yang rdzas gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir rang dbang can ni ma 'dres pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is unmixed because it is not a substance that is concomitant with the root mental afflictions or that is a collection of mental factors other than that.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i don gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i don gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not unmixed in the sense of being unique,

original: rnam par shes pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pas /
translated: because it is concomitant with other forms of consciousness.

original: der thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
analyzed: der thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
translated: It would follow that it is mixed with them.

original: 'di ni sde pa dag gi ltar na rnam pa gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sde pa dag gi ltar na rnam pa gcig kho na ste /
translated: According to the schools of tenets, it is only one type,

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa bden pa mthong ba'i gags byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa bden pa mthong ba'i gags byed pa yin te /
translated: because it is a hindrance to seeing the truths that is concomitant with the active forms of consciousness.

original: de ni mthong bas spang par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩtheg pa chen po'i ltar na ni rnam pa gnyis te dus nges par kun du 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni mthong bas spang par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro // theg pa chen po'i ltar na ni rnam pa gnyis te dus nges par kun du 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: because it is to be abandoned by the path of vision.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni gcig go //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni gcig go //
translated: According to the Mahayana, there are two kinds of manas: one is associated with the evolving consciousnesses, because it arises at a fixed time;üîΩthe other is associated with the store consciousness, because it arises at all times.

original: gnyis pa ni dus thams cad du kun du 'byung ba'i phyir 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sgrub pas rab tu grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dus thams cad du kun du 'byung ba'i phyir 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sgrub pas rab tu grub pa yin no //
translated: This is established by the previously mentioned proof.

original: de ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la ma yin te /
translated: This manas is not associated with the evolving consciousnesses,

original: de rnams ni rgyun 'chad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnams ni rgyun 'chad pa'i phyir /
translated: because these are interrupted.

original: yang khyad par du dpyad par bya ste re zhig rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga la ni ma yin te //
analyzed: yang khyad par du dpyad par bya ste re zhig rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga la ni ma yin te //
translated: We must further analyze this manas. It is not associated with the five consciousnesses, visual, etc.,

original: gang na mi mthun pa yod pa de na gnyen po yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang na mi mthun pa yod pa de na gnyen po yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when there is a conflict, there is an antidote.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la yang gnyen po med pa'i phyir de med par thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la yang gnyen po med pa'i phyir de med par thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But since there is no antidote to the defiled manas, it would follow that it is not nonexistent.

original: @318a * // de ni ma yin te 'di ni sgrub pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'di ni ma bslabs pa sde pa dag gis khas blangs pa sun 'byin pa yin no //
analyzed: @318a * // de ni ma yin te 'di ni sgrub pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'di ni ma bslabs pa sde pa dag gis khas blangs pa sun 'byin pa yin no //
translated: That is not so, for this is not a proof, but rather a refutation of the assertion of the untrained factions.

original: gal te pha rol po rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga la yang ma 'dres pa yod do zhes smra bar byed na /
analyzed: gal te pha rol po rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga la yang ma 'dres pa yod do zhes smra bar byed na /
translated: If the opponent says that the fivefold collection of consciousnesses also has no admixture,

original: de la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la brjod par bya ste /
translated: then this should be said to him:

original: rnam par shes pa gang la mthong ba'i lam yod pa de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod par khyod kyis khas blangs na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga la ni lam med de de kha phyir bltas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang la mthong ba'i lam yod pa de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod par khyod kyis khas blangs na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga la ni lam med de de kha phyir bltas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: You accept that whatever path of seeing exists in a consciousness, its counteragent exists there, but the fivefold collection of consciousnesses has no path, because it is extroverted.

original: yang na gang la zhes bya ba ni yul dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na gang la zhes bya ba ni yul dang sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, ‚Äúwhatever‚Äù is connected to the object.

original: yul bden pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid gang la gnyen po yod pa de kho na la de'i dmigs pa nyid du de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mthong bas spang bar bya ba yod na /
analyzed: yul bden pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid gang la gnyen po yod pa de kho na la de'i dmigs pa nyid du de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mthong bas spang bar bya ba yod na /
translated: If the object, the nature of the four noble truths, has a counteragent, then its counteragent exists there, and its counteragent is the object of seeing that which is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni ma yin te kha phyir bltas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni ma yin te kha phyir bltas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The five collections of consciousness are not, because they are directed outward.

original: rang gi lta bas kyang tshig 'di la 'di ltar drang ste /
analyzed: rang gi lta bas kyang tshig 'di la 'di ltar drang ste /
translated: The author himself explains the meaning of this passage as follows:

original: gang la zhes bya ba 'di ni yul du gyur pa de gzhan nyid dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba 'di ni yul du gyur pa de gzhan nyid dang sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn regard to what‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúother.‚Äù

original: de la yang bstan pa'i phyir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la de dang 'brel par ston to //
analyzed: de la yang bstan pa'i phyir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la de dang 'brel par ston to //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚Äúit is connected with the store consciousness.‚Äù

original: de nyid la nyon mongs pa can gyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa yang yod de /
analyzed: de nyid la nyon mongs pa can gyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa yang yod de /
translated: Moreover, there is ignorance associated with the afflicted consciousness in that store consciousness,

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la bdag med par mthong pa'i gags su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la bdag med par mthong pa'i gags su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the obstruction to the insight into no-self in the store consciousness.

original: gnas skabs dang yang sbyar te /
analyzed: gnas skabs dang yang sbyar te /
translated: The author also connects this with the stage of development:

original: gnas skabs gang na mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma dang po yod pa'i gnas skabs de na srang mda'i mthon dman bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs chos kyi mchog rnams dang lhan cig 'gag pa yin na 'di thams cad ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga la
analyzed: gnas skabs gang na mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma dang po yod pa'i gnas skabs de na srang mda'i mthon dman bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs chos kyi mchog rnams dang lhan cig 'gag pa yin na 'di thams cad ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga la
