translated: When the first moment of the path of seeing exists, then the supreme mundane state, which is incompatible with it, ceases simultaneously with it, like the arms of a balance rising and falling.

original: mi srid de /
analyzed: mi srid de /
translated: This is not possible in the five collections of consciousness,

original: gcig tu mnyam par ma bzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu mnyam par ma bzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not equipoise.

original: dus thams cad du kun du 'byung ba de nyid kyi rnam par shes pa la yang rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dus thams cad du kun du 'byung ba de nyid kyi rnam par shes pa la yang rung ba ma yin te /
translated: It is also not possible in the consciousness that always occurs,üîΩbecause two independent phenomena cannot exist in one consciousness.

original: gcig la chos gnyis rang dbang can mi srid pa'i phyir re zhig 'dod chags la sogs pa sems las byung ba rang dbang can la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig la chos gnyis rang dbang can mi srid pa'i phyir re zhig 'dod chags la sogs pa sems las byung ba rang dbang can la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible in independent mental factors such as attachment.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa la yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not possible in nonafflicted states,

original: de dang 'gal ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i phyir na /
translated: because they are incompatible with it.

original: che chung gi rim pas sbyor pa'i lam bsgom pa nyams par 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: che chung gi rim pas sbyor pa'i lam bsgom pa nyams par 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro //
translated: And because the stages of small, medium, and great would be lost in the cultivation of the path of preparation.

original: des na shugs kyis gang la dus thams cad du kun du 'byung ba de yod par 'gyur ba rnam par shes pa gzhan bdun pa khas blang dgos te /
analyzed: des na shugs kyis gang la dus thams cad du kun du 'byung ba de yod par 'gyur ba rnam par shes pa gzhan bdun pa khas blang dgos te /
translated: Therefore, it is necessary to accept that the other seven consciousnesses exist, since they are always and everywhere associated with ignorance.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yin no //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yin no //
translated: This is the afflicted mind.

original: de la ni ma rig pa dang rang dbang can yod de de'i stobs kyis de dang @318b mtshungs par ldan pa 'dod chags la sogs pa drangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni ma rig pa dang rang dbang can yod de de'i stobs kyis de dang @318b mtshungs par ldan pa 'dod chags la sogs pa drangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In it, ignorance and independence exist, because it attracts attachment and so on that is associated with it through the power of ignorance.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la ni /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la ni /
translated: As for the active forms of consciousness,

original: sngar kun du rmongs pa la de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i phyir sngar spyad pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa ldan na res 'ga' rang dbang can ma yin par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar kun du rmongs pa la de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i phyir sngar spyad pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa ldan na res 'ga' rang dbang can ma yin par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: attachment and so on are sometimes not independent, because other afflictions arise from prior confusion, and because prior action is primary.

original: lnga po dag dang 'dra ba med pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni ri zhig bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i rten ni mig la sogs pa lhan cig skye ba yin no //
analyzed: lnga po dag dang 'dra ba med pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni ri zhig bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i rten ni mig la sogs pa lhan cig skye ba yin no //
translated: According to the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas, the support of the five collections of consciousness is the eye, etc., which are coexistent.

original: dmigs pa ni gzugs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni gzugs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The object is form, etc.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rten ni yid 'das pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rten ni yid 'das pa kho na yin no //
translated: The equivalent immediately preceding is only the past mind.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten ni yid 'das pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten ni yid 'das pa kho na yin no //
translated: The support of mental consciousness is only the past mind.

original: dmigs pa ni dus gsum dang dus kyis ma bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni dus gsum dang dus kyis ma bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The object is the three times and what is not subsumed in the three times.

original: gnas brtan pa rnams kyi ltar na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i thams cad bye brag tu smra bas bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gnas brtan pa rnams kyi ltar na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i thams cad bye brag tu smra bas bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: According to the Sthaviras, all of the five collections of consciousness are as explained by the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig skye ba'i rten ni snying gi phyogs kyi bu ga gcig dang gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi nas bu ga dgu'i bar yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig skye ba'i rten ni snying gi phyogs kyi bu ga gcig dang gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi nas bu ga dgu'i bar yin no //
translated: The support that is coexistent with mental consciousness is one, two, three, or four holes in the heart, up to nine holes.

original: dmigs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The object is as above.

original: dge 'dun phal chen sde rnams kyi ltar na yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i rten ni tshul de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun phal chen sde rnams kyi ltar na yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i rten ni tshul de dang 'dra'o //
translated: According to the MahƒÅsƒÅ·πÉghika, the support of the five collections of consciousness is the same as above.

original: lhan cig skye ba'i rten gzhan ni rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig skye ba'i rten gzhan ni rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: The support of the other consciousnesses is the fundamental consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig skye ba'i rten ni de kho na yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig skye ba'i rten ni de kho na yin no //
translated: The support of the mental consciousness is just that.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent is as above.

original: sa ston sde rnams kyi ltar na rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i sgra btang ste 'khor ba ji srid pa'i phung po zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sa ston sde rnams kyi ltar na rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i sgra btang ste 'khor ba ji srid pa'i phung po zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: According to the Mahƒ´≈õƒÅsaka, the term fundamental consciousness is abandoned and the term the aggregates that last as long as sa·πÉsƒÅra is substituted.

original: gzhan thams cad ni de kho na dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhan thams cad ni de kho na dang 'dra'o //
translated: All the rest is the same as above.

original: mdo sde pa rnams kyi ltar na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga la dbang po dang don dag ni snga la /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams kyi ltar na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga la dbang po dang don dag ni snga la /
translated: According to the SautrƒÅntika, the sense faculties and objects precede the five collections of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ni 'phyi ste mi gsal bas de dag ga dbang gis skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni 'phyi ste mi gsal bas de dag ga dbang gis skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Consciousness is later, because it is unclear, and because it arises by the power of those two.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent is as was said previously.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten ni yid 'das ma thag pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten ni yid 'das ma thag pa kho na yin no //
translated: The support of the mental consciousness is the immediately past mind alone.

original: 'di ni gsal ba'i phyir skye ba yul gyis byas pa'i nges pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'di ni gsal ba'i phyir skye ba yul gyis byas pa'i nges pa ni med do //
translated: Since this is clear, there is no restriction that its arising is due to the object.

original: dmigs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //üîΩrnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug car gyi yang rgyu'i rkyen ni dbang po gzugs can la @319a * //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni snga ma bzhin no // rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug car gyi yang rgyu'i rkyen ni dbang po gzugs can la @319a * //
translated: The object of observation is as was said previously.

original: yod pa dang / sems la yod pa'i sa bon yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang / sems la yod pa'i sa bon yin no //
translated: The causal condition of the six collections of consciousness is the seeds that exist in the physical sense faculties and in the mind.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the dominant condition,

original: bye brag tu smra ba'i srog gi dbang po la sogs pa lta bur de 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba'i srog gi dbang po la sogs pa lta bur de 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not act in accordance with the changes of those.

original: 'dir ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i rten dang dmigs pa dag ni bye brag tu smra ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i rten dang dmigs pa dag ni bye brag tu smra ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: Here the support and object of the five collections of consciousness are similar to those of the Vaibhasikas.

original: sa bon gyi rten gyi dngos po ni lhan cig skye ba yin no //
analyzed: sa bon gyi rten gyi dngos po ni lhan cig skye ba yin no //
translated: The support of the seed is the simultaneous cause.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yang dmigs pa ni de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yang dmigs pa ni de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The object-field of mental consciousness is the same.

original: yid 'das ma thag pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yid 'das ma thag pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The immediately preceding mind is as above.

original: bdag po'i rkyen lhan cig skye ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yin no //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen lhan cig skye ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yin no //
translated: The simultaneous dominant condition is the afflicted view of self.

original: de la 'dir bye brag tu smra ba rnams la brjod par bya ste /üîΩ'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid du mtshungs pa las ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa drug pa'i rten 'das ma thag pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de la 'dir bye brag tu smra ba rnams la brjod par bya ste / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid du mtshungs pa las ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa drug pa'i rten 'das ma thag pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: Here, we must question the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas.

original: rten lhan cig skye ba ni ma yin /
analyzed: rten lhan cig skye ba ni ma yin /
translated: Why is the immediately preceding condition of the six consciousnesses the immediately preceding mind and not a simultaneous support?

original: rnam par shes pa drug pa ni rten 'das pa can kho na ma yin te 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pas gnod do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug pa ni rten 'das pa can kho na ma yin te 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pas gnod do //
translated: The six consciousnesses are not supported only on a past support, because they are engaged consciousnesses, like the eye consciousness, etc. This is a logical refutation.

original: dge 'dun phal chen sde rnams dang sa ston sde rnams kyi ltar na rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa dang 'khor ba ji srid pa'i phung po zhes bya ba rnam par shes pa drug char gyi tha mi dang pa'i rgyu yin pa de dag la yang brjod par
analyzed: dge 'dun phal chen sde rnams dang sa ston sde rnams kyi ltar na rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa dang 'khor ba ji srid pa'i phung po zhes bya ba rnam par shes pa drug char gyi tha mi dang pa'i rgyu yin pa de dag la yang brjod par
translated: According to the MahƒÅsƒÅ·πÉghika and the Mahƒ´≈õƒÅsaka schools, the root consciousness and the so-called aggregates that exist as long as cyclic existence exists are the cause of the six collections of consciousness.

original: bya ste / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni rten thun mong can kho na ma yin te /
analyzed: bya ste / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni rten thun mong can kho na ma yin te /
translated: Mental consciousness is not a shared support,

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir de dag bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir de dag bzhin no //
translated: because it is an active consciousness, like those.

original: gang dag gi snying gi phyogs thun mong ma yin par rtog pa de dag gi ltar na yang sems las byung ba'i tshor ba nyid nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dag gi snying gi phyogs thun mong ma yin par rtog pa de dag gi ltar na yang sems las byung ba'i tshor ba nyid nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: According to those who assert that the heart is the uncommon support of the mental faculty, feeling that is a mental factor would be impaired,

original: rdul phra rab bsags pa la brten pa'i phyir thams cad lus kyi kho na yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab bsags pa la brten pa'i phyir thams cad lus kyi kho na yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would be supported on a collection of subtle particles and all would be the body.

original: rjes su dpag pas kyang 'gal te 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten ni gzugs can ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas kyang 'gal te 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten ni gzugs can ma yin te /
translated: It is also contradictory to inference, because the basis of mental consciousness in the desire realm and the form realm is not form,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'i khams na spyod pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'i khams na spyod pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is mental consciousness, like the mental consciousness that occurs in the formless realm.

original: mdo sde pa la yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mdo sde pa la yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: It should be said to the Sautrantikas:

original: lhan cig ces bya ba'i sgra de ma thag brjod par byed pa la brten nas /
analyzed: lhan cig ces bya ba'i sgra de ma thag brjod par byed pa la brten nas /
translated: The word ‚Äútogether‚Äù is seen to express immediately antecedent condition,

original: lhan cig ces bya ba'i sgra de ma thag pa la yang mthong ste /
analyzed: lhan cig ces bya ba'i sgra de ma thag pa la yang mthong ste /
translated: and it is also seen to express simultaneous condition.

original: dper na byams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na byams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in the phrase ‚Äúloving kindness, etc.‚Äù

original: de la yang @319b dmigs kyis bsal ba ni bya dgongs so //
analyzed: de la yang @319b dmigs kyis bsal ba ni bya dgongs so //
translated: In that case, the word ‚Äútogether‚Äù is an exception.

original: ci'i phyir rten lhan cig sgye ba kho na ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rten lhan cig sgye ba kho na ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the basis not only simultaneous?

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa las ldang ba'i tshe mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen lhan cig skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa las ldang ba'i tshe mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen lhan cig skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the immediately preceding condition that arises from the meditative attainment of cessation, etc., is not simultaneous.

original: rang gi gzhung lugs kyis kyang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi gzhung lugs kyis kyang brjod par bya ste /
translated: We also must state our own system.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni skye ba'i rten rang gi ming gis nye bar mtshon pa'i skye mchod thun mong ma yin pa can yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni skye ba'i rten rang gi ming gis nye bar mtshon pa'i skye mchod thun mong ma yin pa can yin te /
translated: The mental consciousness has as its special support the sense base that is indicated by its own name.

original: rgol ba la rab tu grags pa'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgol ba la rab tu grags pa'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: This is because it is a consciousness that is included in the class of engaged consciousnesses that are well known to the disputants, just as is the case with eye consciousness.

original: de la skye ba'i rten ces bya ba'i sgra ni /
analyzed: de la skye ba'i rten ces bya ba'i sgra ni /
translated: The term support of birth

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rten rnam par gcad pa'i phyir te /üîΩde ni drug car la yang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rten rnam par gcad pa'i phyir te / de ni drug car la yang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is used to rule out a support that is afflicted.

original: mdo sde pa la dpe grub par bya ba'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: mdo sde pa la dpe grub par bya ba'i yang phyir te /
translated: This is because that is not a special support for the mental consciousness, since it is not a special support for any of the six consciousnesses.üîΩThe Sautrantikas must establish this example,

original: lhan cig skye ba'i rten smos na ni /
analyzed: lhan cig skye ba'i rten smos na ni /
translated: because if the simultaneous support is mentioned,

original: der snang ba nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der snang ba nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the mental consciousness would be the support of eye consciousness and so on.

original: thun mong ma yin pa smos pa ni /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa smos pa ni /
translated: The term special is mentionedüîΩbecause the mental faculty is the support of the mental consciousness.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rten rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir dang / rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnam par dpyad pa'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rten rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir dang / rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnam par dpyad pa'i yang phyir te /
translated: because the basis of the similar and immediately antecedent condition is investigated, and because the fundamental consciousness, etc., are investigated.

original: de ni de dag gis sa bon gyi khyad par med par yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug car gyi yang thun mong gi rten nyid du brtags so //
analyzed: de ni de dag gis sa bon gyi khyad par med par yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug car gyi yang thun mong gi rten nyid du brtags so //
translated: That is imagined to be the common basis of all six groups of consciousness, even without a special seed.

original: rang gi ming gis nye bar mtshon par zhes smos pa ni gnas brtan pas rab tu brtags pa snying gi phyogs rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ming gis nye bar mtshon par zhes smos pa ni gnas brtan pas rab tu brtags pa snying gi phyogs rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúindicated by its own name‚Äù is mentioned because the Sthavira investigated the location of the heart.

original: de ni ming gis nye bar mtshon pa med de /
analyzed: de ni ming gis nye bar mtshon pa med de /
translated: That is not indicated by its own name.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la yid ces bya ba'i sgrar brjod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la yid ces bya ba'i sgrar brjod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the word ‚Äúmind‚Äù is not used to refer to the mental consciousness.

original: 'on te de nyid yid yin no zhes zer na skye mched ces smos pas de rnam par dpyad do //
analyzed: 'on te de nyid yid yin no zhes zer na skye mched ces smos pas de rnam par dpyad do //
translated: But if you say that it is the mind itself, that is investigated by the word ‚Äúsense-field.‚Äù

original: de nyid skye mched yin no zhes brjod par yang mi nus te /
analyzed: de nyid skye mched yin no zhes brjod par yang mi nus te /
translated: It cannot be said that it is the sense-field itself.

original: dge slong yid ni mang gi skye mched de gzugs can ma yin pa bstan du med pa /
analyzed: dge slong yid ni mang gi skye mched de gzugs can ma yin pa bstan du med pa /
translated: The monk's mind is a sense base that is not physical, not visible.

original: thogs pa med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lung gis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lung gis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement in the sutra, ‚ÄúMonks, the mind is the sixth base, it is not physical, it is not visible, it is not obstructive,‚Äù and so on, contradicts your position.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khong su gtogs pa zhes brjod nas /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khong su gtogs pa zhes brjod nas /
translated: Having said that it is included in the consciousnesses of the six sense bases,

original: yang rnam par shes pa zhes brjod pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po yin par bstan pas ldan pa ma yin pa rnam par dpyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang rnam par shes pa zhes brjod pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po yin par bstan pas ldan pa ma yin pa rnam par dpyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it then says that consciousness is the aggregate of consciousness, and this is to analyze the nonassociated formative forces.

original: phyir rgol ba la grags pa dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas ma nges pa yang ma yin te /üîΩgtan tshigs rgol ba la @320a * //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba la grags pa dmyal ba'i srung ma la sogs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas ma nges pa yang ma yin te / gtan tshigs rgol ba la @320a * //
translated: It is not the case that the opponent‚Äôs position is not established by the mental consciousness of the hell guardians and so on,

original: grags pa nyid kyis khyad par du byas pa'i phyir de dang 'dra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: grags pa nyid kyis khyad par du byas pa'i phyir de dang 'dra ba ma yin no //
translated: because the reason is distinguished by being renowned to the opponent.

original: lhan cig skye ba'i rten nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi ngo bo nyid la sogs pa mtha' yas pa bsgrub par bya ba dang 'gal ba'i chos 'grub pa dang 'gal ba khams gzhan na gnas pa'i sems can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang sems can
analyzed: lhan cig skye ba'i rten nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi ngo bo nyid la sogs pa mtha' yas pa bsgrub par bya ba dang 'gal ba'i chos 'grub pa dang 'gal ba khams gzhan na gnas pa'i sems can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang sems can
translated: and it is not established as a property that is contradictory to the establishment of the infinite things that are the basis of coemergence, such as the nature of the afflicted mind, and so on, because it is not ascertained by the mental consciousness of sentient beings who abide in other realms and by those sentient beings who are included in the third group.

original: gyi tshogs gsum pas bsdus pa rnams kyis kyang ma nges pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde ni khams gzhan du gtogs pas khyad par du byas pas 'grub pa yang ma yin te /üîΩsems can gyi tshogs gsum pas bsdus pa dag kho nas ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gyi tshogs gsum pas bsdus pa rnams kyis kyang ma nges pa'i phyir ro // de ni khams gzhan du gtogs pas khyad par du byas pas 'grub pa yang ma yin te / sems can gyi tshogs gsum pas bsdus pa dag kho nas ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not established as a property that is contradictory to the establishment of the infinite things that are the basis of coemergence, such as the nature of the afflicted mind, and so on, because it is not ascertained by the mental consciousness of sentient beings who abide in other realms and by those sentient beings who are included in the third group.üîΩIt is not established as a property that is contradictory to the establishment of the infinite things that are the basis of coemergence, such as the nature of the afflicted mind, and so on, because it is not ascertained by the mental consciousness of sentient beings who abide in other realms and by those sentient beings who are included in the third group.üîΩIt is not established as a property that is contradictory to the establishment of the infinite things that are the basis of coemergence, such as the nature of the afflicted mind, and so on, because it is not ascertained by the mental consciousness of sentient beings who abide in other realms and by those sentient beings who are included in the third group.üîΩIt is not established as a property that is contradictory to the establishment of the infinite things that are the basis of coemergence, such as the nature of the afflicted mind, and so on, because it is not ascertained by the mental consciousness of sentient beings who abide in other realms and by those sentient beings who are included in the third group.üîΩIt is not established as a property that is contradictory to the establishment of the infinite things that are the basis of coemergence, such as the nature of the afflicted mind, and so on, because it is not ascertained by the mental consciousness of sentient beings who abide in other realms and by those sentient beings who are included in the third group.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'das pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i phyogs su byas pa'i phyir 'gal ba rang la rten ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'das pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i phyogs su byas pa'i phyir 'gal ba rang la rten ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not established as a property that is contradictory to the establishment of the infinite things that are the basis of coemergence, such as the nature of the afflicted mind, and so on, because it is not ascertained by the mental consciousness of sentient beings who abide in other realms and by those sentient beings who are included in the third group.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa nyid khyad par du byed na ni /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa nyid khyad par du byed na ni /
translated: It is not established as a property that is contradictory to the establishment of

original: chos thams cad la reg pa'i phyir sgrub pa sgrub pa'i nyes pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: chos thams cad la reg pa'i phyir sgrub pa sgrub pa'i nyes pa dang ldan no //
translated: It is a fault of the treatise to touch on all phenomena.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa slob pa'i gnas skabs kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pas ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa slob pa'i gnas skabs kyi yid kyi rnam par shes pas ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it indeterminate because of the mental consciousness in the state of training that is a supramundane meditative absorption,

original: de'i tshe yang yid gyur pa gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang yid gyur pa gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even at that time the mind is transformed and remains.

original: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las ni /
translated: The Samdhinirmocana S≈´tra says:

original: res 'ga' ni gcig dang ste gang gi tshe yid dang zhes 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni gcig dang ste gang gi tshe yid dang zhes 'byung ba'o //
translated: Sometimes it is one, when it is said mind.

original: res 'ga' ni gnyis dang ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni gnyis dang ste /
translated: Sometimes it is two,

original: yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: when it is said mind and mental consciousness.

original: gal te yang de'i tshe gyur pa yang yid ma yin pa zhig tu gyur na ni 'di yang yid ma yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te yang de'i tshe gyur pa yang yid ma yin pa zhig tu gyur na ni 'di yang yid ma yin par 'gyur la /
translated: If at that time the transformed mind were not mind, then this would not be mind.

original: 'di skad du res 'ga' ni gcig dang ste gang gi tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang zhes kyang bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad du res 'ga' ni gcig dang ste gang gi tshe yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang zhes kyang bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would have to be explained sometimes it is one, when it is said mental consciousness.

original: gzhan yang brgya la ba la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs yul la rag las te skye ba rnams de mi nye ba'i phyir rgyun 'chang ngo zhes bya ba ni rigs na /
analyzed: gzhan yang brgya la ba la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs yul la rag las te skye ba rnams de mi nye ba'i phyir rgyun 'chang ngo zhes bya ba ni rigs na /
translated: Moreover, it is reasonable to say that the group of consciousnesses that engages objects such as form is interrupted because its objects are not present.

original: yid 'khor ba ji srid par rigs gcig pa dang dmigs pa nye ba kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las 'byung ba go ji ltar rgyun 'chang /
analyzed: yid 'khor ba ji srid par rigs gcig pa dang dmigs pa nye ba kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las 'byung ba go ji ltar rgyun 'chang /
translated: But how can the mental consciousness, which is of the same type and is proximate to the foundation consciousness for as long as cyclic existence continues, be interrupted?

original: yid de yang kha cig na re gnas skabs de na zag pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: yid de yang kha cig na re gnas skabs de na zag pa med pa yin te /
translated: Some say: At that time, the mental consciousness is uncontaminated.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa de ni 'phags pa'i lam la snyoms par 'jug pas rgyun kun du mi 'byung bas sa bon gyi gnas skabs par 'jog go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa de ni 'phags pa'i lam la snyoms par 'jug pas rgyun kun du mi 'byung bas sa bon gyi gnas skabs par 'jog go zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, that which is afflicted is posited as the state of seeds because it does not occur in the continuum when one enters the ƒÅrya path.

original: zag pa med pa ni thog ma med pa'i rang gi rigs las @320b bdag med pa mngon sum du byas pa'i 'phags pa'i lam bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni thog ma med pa'i rang gi rigs las @320b bdag med pa mngon sum du byas pa'i 'phags pa'i lam bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang 'byung ngo //
translated: The uncontaminated mental consciousness arises from the foundation consciousness, just as the ƒÅrya path arises from the beginningless lineage of its own type.

original: yang zag pa med pa las langs pa la zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems pa mngon du gyur ba'i tshe nyon mongs pa can khyad par med pa gang yin pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang zag pa med pa las langs pa la zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems pa mngon du gyur ba'i tshe nyon mongs pa can khyad par med pa gang yin pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, when the uncontaminated mind arises from the contaminated mind, the afflicted mind arises without distinction.

original: 'on te slob pa'i gnas skabs na sa bon bcom pa'i phyir nam yang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid med na ni zag pa med pa kho na 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'on te slob pa'i gnas skabs na sa bon bcom pa'i phyir nam yang nyon mongs pa can gyi yid med na ni zag pa med pa kho na 'byung ste /
translated: But if the afflicted mind never exists in the state of a learner because its seed is destroyed, then only the uncontaminated mind arises.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dgra bcom pa ni bya ba thams cad la spyod pa rab tu zhi ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dgra bcom pa ni bya ba thams cad la spyod pa rab tu zhi ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: For this reason, it is said that arhats are completely pacified in all activities.

original: kha cig na re zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Some say: It is contaminated.

original: 'di ltar nus pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar nus pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir po zhes zer ro //
translated: Because it possesses two powers.

original: cig car bdag med pa gnyi ga mthong ba'i gags su gyur pa'i ma rig pa gang yin pa de la brten nas thag pa'i srid kyi dbyibs la rtog pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi sprul du rab tu rtogs pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa can gyi yid
analyzed: cig car bdag med pa gnyi ga mthong ba'i gags su gyur pa'i ma rig pa gang yin pa de la brten nas thag pa'i srid kyi dbyibs la rtog pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi sprul du rab tu rtogs pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa can gyi yid
translated: The ignorance that is the obstruction to simultaneously seeing both forms of selflessness is the basis for the conception of a person, just as the conception of a snake is based on the shape of a rope.

original: dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i lta ba cig car chos dang gang zag tu rab tu rtog par byed par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i lta ba cig car chos dang gang zag tu rab tu rtog par byed par 'byung ngo //
translated: The afflicted mind that is concomitant with the view simultaneously conceives the person and phenomena.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam skyes na ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam skyes na ni /
translated: When the supramundane path arises,

original: 'phags pa nyan thos gang zag la bdag med pa mthong ba'i phyir gang zag tu sgro 'dogs pa med par yid de chos rnams la mi gsal ba dang sgro 'dogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gti mug dang lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos gang zag la bdag med pa mthong ba'i phyir gang zag tu sgro 'dogs pa med par yid de chos rnams la mi gsal ba dang sgro 'dogs pa'i ngo bo nyid gti mug dang lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan par 'byung ngo //
translated: the mind of an ƒÅrya ≈õrƒÅvaka who has seen the selflessness of the person is free of the superimposition of a person. It arises as ignorance and view that are concomitant with the lack of clarity and superimposition of the nature of phenomena.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa de yang nyan thos kyi 'bras bu la gags mi byed pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa de yang nyan thos kyi 'bras bu la gags mi byed pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, that non-afflicted view of the self does not obstruct the result of sravakas, it is the cause of the result of the desire realm and it causes the attainment of nirvana.

original: don dam pa ma yin pa'i phyir dge ba ni ma yin no /
analyzed: don dam pa ma yin pa'i phyir dge ba ni ma yin no /
translated: And that non-defiled form is not virtuous because it is not ultimate.

original: gzhan yang las las skyes pa yin yang spyod lam pa dang sprul pa pa nyid du mi rung ba nyid kyis ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan yang las las skyes pa yin yang spyod lam pa dang sprul pa pa nyid du mi rung ba nyid kyis ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa las skyes pa nyid du bshad do //
translated: Also, although it arises from karma, it is explained to be form arisen from karmic maturation because it is not form arisen from the actual basis, it is not form arisen from enhancement, it is not form arisen from meditation, it is not form arisen from the elements, it is not form arisen from the ripening cause and it is not form arisen from the dominant condition.

original: zag pa rnams dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pas rang gi sa bon yongs su rgyas pa'i sgo nas 'byung ba'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa rnams dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pas rang gi sa bon yongs su rgyas pa'i sgo nas 'byung ba'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: It is contaminated because it arises and ceases simultaneously with contaminants and it increases its own seed.

original: chos nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa la chags pa dang nga rgyal dag dang yang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: chos nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa la chags pa dang nga rgyal dag dang yang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: It is concomitant with attachment and pride that are not afflicted.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa nyan thos kha cig la nyon mongs pa las byung ba ltar bu'i spyod pa snang ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa nyan thos kha cig la nyon mongs pa las byung ba ltar bu'i spyod pa snang ste /
translated: For this reason, the conduct of some ƒÅryas ≈õrƒÅvakas appears to arise from the afflictions.

original: de ni bag chags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bag chags zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called a residual impression.

original: @321a * // 'on te gal te byang chub sems dpa' byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'am nges pa'i rigs can zhig yin par gyur na ni /
analyzed: @321a * // 'on te gal te byang chub sems dpa' byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'am nges pa'i rigs can zhig yin par gyur na ni /
translated: If a bodhisattva or one of fixed lineage were to dedicate the merit to enlightenment,

original: gnas skabs de na bdag med pa gnyis mngon sum pa'i zag pa med pa kho na 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gnas skabs de na bdag med pa gnyis mngon sum pa'i zag pa med pa kho na 'byung ngo //
translated: then at that time, only the uncontaminated state that directly realizes the two types of selflessness would arise.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rten zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rten zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term coemergent refers to

original: bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs ltar na lhan cig ces bya ba'i sgra cig car yin par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs ltar na lhan cig ces bya ba'i sgra cig car yin par bshad par bya'o //
translated: the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika position, where the term coemergent should be explained as simultaneous.

original: mdo sde pa'i phyogs ltar na ni //
analyzed: mdo sde pa'i phyogs ltar na ni //
translated: According to the SautrƒÅntika position,

original: de ma thag pa yin te byams pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de ma thag pa yin te byams pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: it refers to immediately antecedent, like the phrase ‚Äúaccompanied by love.

original: ji ltar cig car ram de ma thag tu yang rung mig la sogs pa'i skye ba'i rten lhan cig skye ba thun mong ma yin pa ltar ;
analyzed: ji ltar cig car ram de ma thag tu yang rung mig la sogs pa'i skye ba'i rten lhan cig skye ba thun mong ma yin pa ltar ;
translated: Just as the eye, etc. have a simultaneous, uncommon support for their arising,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya'i tha tshig go //
translated: so too is it for the mental consciousness.üîΩThis is the refutation.

original: nges pa'i tshig med pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni sun 'byin pa yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig med pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni sun 'byin pa yin no //
translated: The fault of the absence of an etymological definition also arises.

original: gzhan gyis nges pa'i tshig yang dag pa nyid du khas blangs pa gang yin pa de ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la mi rung gi nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la ni rung ste de ni gong du bstan zin to //üîΩ'du shes med pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis nges pa'i tshig yang dag pa nyid du khas blangs pa gang yin pa de ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la mi rung gi nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la ni rung ste de ni gong du bstan zin to // 'du shes med pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Whatever is accepted as the correct etymological definition by others is not suitable for the active consciousnesses, but it is suitable for the afflicted mind, and that has already been explained above.üîΩThe two meditative attainments

original: 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag go //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag go //
translated: The two meditative attainments are called the meditative attainment of cessation and the meditative attainment of nonperception.

original: kha cig ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i khyad par gyi rang gi ngo bo sems dang sems las byung ba mi skye ba tsam kho na yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i khyad par gyi rang gi ngo bo sems dang sems las byung ba mi skye ba tsam kho na yin par 'dod do //
translated: Some believe that the specific essential nature of analytical cessation is the mere non-arising of mind and the mental factors.

original: kha cig ni sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Some believe that it is not associated with mind.

original: kha cig ni rten gyi sems dang sems las byung ba dang 'gog pa'i gnas skabs dang / 'gag pa na sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pas drangs pa'i bag chags te /
analyzed: kha cig ni rten gyi sems dang sems las byung ba dang 'gog pa'i gnas skabs dang / 'gag pa na sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pas drangs pa'i bag chags te /
translated: Some believe that it is a latent impression which is drawn forth by the engagement of mind and the mental factors in the state of cessation and in the cessation of the mind and the mental factors that are the basis.

original: langs pa yang de dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: langs pa yang de dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because one who has arisen is also endowed with it,

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it is said that he is endowed with the eight deliverances.

original: de la 'du byed kyi phung po'i zhes smos pa'i phyir dang / ldan pa ma yin pa rnams kyang bsal pa'i phyir yongs su rtog pa dang po dang gnyis pa spangs so //
analyzed: de la 'du byed kyi phung po'i zhes smos pa'i phyir dang / ldan pa ma yin pa rnams kyang bsal pa'i phyir yongs su rtog pa dang po dang gnyis pa spangs so //
translated: The first and second assumptions are rejected because of the expression: 'in the aggregate of formative factors' and because the non-associated formative forces are excluded.

original: rtog pa gzhan gnyis las kyang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sbyor ba la sogs pa'i khyad par yod kyang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni ngar 'dzin pa'i nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang /üîΩbdag la chags pa kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ma zhi ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa gzhan gnyis las kyang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa sbyor ba la sogs pa'i khyad par yod kyang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni ngar 'dzin pa'i nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / bdag la chags pa kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ma zhi ba nyid yin no //
translated: Also, the meditative attainment of nondiscernment is superior to the meditative attainment of cessation in terms of preparation and so on, but the meditative attainment of nondiscernment is not peaceful because the pride thinking I and attachment to I occur.

original: de gnyis @321b 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa'i rgyud kyi khyad par gzhan yang 'dod de /
analyzed: de gnyis @321b 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa'i rgyud kyi khyad par gzhan yang 'dod de /
translated: Also, there is another difference between the meditative attainment of nondiscernment and the meditative attainment of cessation, which is that the former is in the mindstreams of ordinary beings and the latter is in the mindstreams of ƒÅryas.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis g-yang sa bzhin du yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis g-yang sa bzhin du yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meditative attainment of nondiscernment is not peaceful because ƒÅryas completely abandon it like a precipice.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa gnyi ga la sems dang sems las byung ba nye bar zhi ba khyad par med pa'i phyir ji ltar 'dir 'gyur /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa gnyi ga la sems dang sems las byung ba nye bar zhi ba khyad par med pa'i phyir ji ltar 'dir 'gyur /
translated: But how is that so, since both meditative attainments are similar in that they pacify the mind and mental factors?

original: de lta bas na nyon mongs pa can gyi yid khas blang dgos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na nyon mongs pa can gyi yid khas blang dgos te /
translated: Therefore the afflicted mind must be accepted.

original: de 'gags pa'i phyir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhi ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: de 'gags pa'i phyir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhi ba nyid yin la /
translated: Because it stops that, the meditative attainment of cessation is peace.

original: de ma 'gags pa'i phyir 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug par ngar 'dzin pa dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / bdag la chags pa kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ma zhi ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ma 'gags pa'i phyir 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug par ngar 'dzin pa dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / bdag la chags pa kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ma zhi ba nyid yin no //
translated: Because it does not stop that, the meditative attainment of nonperception is not peace, because the pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù and attachment to ‚ÄúI‚Äù occur.

original: de lta ma yin na 'di gnyis la 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa'i rgyud kyis byas pa'i khyad par yod par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩ'du shes med pa par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te nyon mongs pa can gyi yid med na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'di gnyis la 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa'i rgyud kyis byas pa'i khyad par yod par mi 'gyur ro // 'du shes med pa par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te nyon mongs pa can gyi yid med na /
translated: If that were not so, there would be no difference between these two in terms of whether or not they are the mental continuums of ƒÅryas.üîΩIf the afflicted mind does not exist, why do ƒÅryas reject the state of nondiscernment,

original: ci'i phyir 'phags pa rnams 'du shes med pa pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa mi khom par skye ba'i gnas nyid kyis spong bar mdzad /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'phags pa rnams 'du shes med pa pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa mi khom par skye ba'i gnas nyid kyis spong bar mdzad /
translated: because it is an afflicted state that is not a proper place for rebirth?

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa nye bar zhi ba tsam ni mi khom pa'i gnas ma yin te 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa nye bar zhi ba tsam ni mi khom pa'i gnas ma yin te 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin no //
translated: The mere pacification of the active consciousnesses is not an unfavorable state, like the attainment of cessation.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yod na ni ngar 'dzin pa la sogs pa kun du 'byung bas phyin ci log gis yun ring mo zhig tu gnas dgos pas mi khom pa'i gnas nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yod na ni ngar 'dzin pa la sogs pa kun du 'byung bas phyin ci log gis yun ring mo zhig tu gnas dgos pas mi khom pa'i gnas nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the afflicted mind exists, then the occurrence of the conceit ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù etc., would be a long-lasting error, and so it would be an unfavorable state.

original: dus thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nga sbyin pa sbyin no //
analyzed: dus thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nga sbyin pa sbyin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAt all times‚Äù and so on means that the afflicted mind is well known to occur at the time when a virtuous mind, etc., is manifest, such as when one thinks ‚ÄúI give a gift,‚Äù

original: nga srog chags gsod do //üîΩnga ri mo 'dri'o zhes ngar 'dzin pa dge ba la sogs pa'i sems mngon du gyur pa'i dus na kun du 'byung bar grags so //
analyzed: nga srog chags gsod do //üîΩnga ri mo 'dri'o zhes ngar 'dzin pa dge ba la sogs pa'i sems mngon du gyur pa'i dus na kun du 'byung bar grags so //
translated: ‚ÄúI kill a living being,‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúI draw a picture.‚Äù

original: ngar 'dzin pa kun du 'byung ba dang / skad cig ma tha dad pa las dus tha dad pa nyid cha phra ba'i phyir 'khrul pas dge ba la sogs pa'i sems dang dus mnyam pa nyid du yongs su bzung bar zad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa kun du 'byung ba dang / skad cig ma tha dad pa las dus tha dad pa nyid cha phra ba'i phyir 'khrul pas dge ba la sogs pa'i sems dang dus mnyam pa nyid du yongs su bzung bar zad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But doesn‚Äôt the self-habit occur in every moment, and isn‚Äôt it mistaken to hold that it occurs simultaneously with virtuous minds, etc., because of the subtlety of its occurrence at different times from the different moments?

original: ma yin te ngar 'dzin pa ni gdon mi za bar dus thams cad du kun du 'byung ngo zhes bya bar khas blang dgos so //
analyzed: ma yin te ngar 'dzin pa ni gdon mi za bar dus thams cad du kun du 'byung ngo zhes bya bar khas blang dgos so //
translated: No, for it must be admitted that the self-habit occurs at all times.

original: de lta ma yin na ji ltar dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag zag pa dang bcas pa nyid yin /üîΩre zhig rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i zag pa la dmigs pa nyid kyis ni ma yin te /üîΩde'i gnas skabs na de dag 'das pa nyid @322a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ji ltar dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag zag pa dang bcas pa nyid yin / re zhig rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i zag pa la dmigs pa nyid kyis ni ma yin te / de'i gnas skabs na de dag 'das pa nyid @322a * //
translated: Otherwise, how could virtuous and neutral minds be contaminated?üîΩThey are not contaminated by the contamination that exists in one‚Äôs continuum at that time,

original: dang ; ma 'ongs pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang ; ma 'ongs pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time it is past or future and does not exist.

original: med pa ni zag pa rnams rgyas par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa ni zag pa rnams rgyas par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And what does not exist cannot increase the contamination.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i zag pa la dmigs pa nyid kyis kyang ma yin te phyi'i dmigs pa btsal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i zag pa la dmigs pa nyid kyis kyang ma yin te phyi'i dmigs pa btsal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it because it has as its object the contaminants that exist in the mental continuum of another, because it seeks external objects.

original: bdag po tsam gyis yin na ni zag pa med pa la thal bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: bdag po tsam gyis yin na ni zag pa med pa la thal bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: If it were because of being the mere dominant condition, then the consequence would be that the uncontaminated would be contaminated.

original: ; yang na zag pa med pa la mi dmigs pa'i phyir rtag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ; yang na zag pa med pa la mi dmigs pa'i phyir rtag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, because it does not have as its object the uncontaminated, it would always be contaminated.

original: de dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis yin na ni nye bar btags pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis yin na ni nye bar btags pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were because of being of the same type, then the error would be that it would be a mere designation.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon dang 'brel pa nyid kyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon dang 'brel pa nyid kyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it because of being related to the seed of that which is contaminated,

original: lam gyi bden pa la yang thal ba'i nyes par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa la yang thal ba'i nyes par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the consequence would be that the truth of the path would be contaminated.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yod na ni zag pa dang bcas pa lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'grub bo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yod na ni zag pa dang bcas pa lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'grub bo //
translated: But if there is a defiled mind, then because it arises simultaneously with that which is contaminated, it is established as being contaminated.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs ltar na ngar 'dzin pa bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir de ji ltar mi dge ba'i sems la kun du 'byung /
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs ltar na ngar 'dzin pa bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir de ji ltar mi dge ba'i sems la kun du 'byung /
translated: If it is like the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika position, then since the view of the transitory collection is an obscured neutral state, how could it occur in nonvirtuous minds?

original: mdo sde pa'i phyogs dang rang gi phyogs ltar na ngar 'dzin pa dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lhan cig skye ba dag bsgribs pa kho na la kun du 'byung ba'i phyir de dag ji ltar mi dge ba'i sems la kun du 'byung ba ma yin nam zhe
analyzed: mdo sde pa'i phyogs dang rang gi phyogs ltar na ngar 'dzin pa dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lhan cig skye ba dag bsgribs pa kho na la kun du 'byung ba'i phyir de dag ji ltar mi dge ba'i sems la kun du 'byung ba ma yin nam zhe
translated: If it is like the SautrƒÅntika position and our own position, then since the innate view of the transitory collection and the innate pride thinking I occur only in obscured minds, how could they occur in nonvirtuous minds?

original: na / de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: na / de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: mi dge ba ni 'dir dge ba'i mi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni 'dir dge ba'i mi mthun pa yin no //
translated: because nonvirtue is the opposite of virtue.

original: bsgribs pa yang yin te rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa can yin par dgongs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgribs pa yang yin te rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa can yin par dgongs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that obscured minds are considered to have undesirable karmic maturation.

original: bye brag tu smra ba'i lta bur ngar 'dzin pa dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal du grags pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi phyogs ltar na kun brtags pa kho na la yin te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba'i lta bur ngar 'dzin pa dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal du grags pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi phyogs ltar na kun brtags pa kho na la yin te /
translated: The view of the Vaibhasikas is that the so-called pride of grasping an i and thinking i is only imagination from their own perspective.

original: mi dge ba'i sems kho na la 'byung bas mi dge ba'i sems zhes smos so //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems kho na la 'byung bas mi dge ba'i sems zhes smos so //
translated: Since it occurs only in nonvirtuous minds, it is called a nonvirtuous mind.

original: lhan cig 'byung bar kun du 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ngar 'dzin pa dang / mtshungs par ldan par kun du 'byung ba la zhes bya ba 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin na nyes pa 'di dag du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung bar kun du 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ngar 'dzin pa dang / mtshungs par ldan par kun du 'byung ba la zhes bya ba 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin na nyes pa 'di dag du mi 'gyur te /
translated: The error of the Vaibhasikas is that if it is said that the view of the self is both concomitant and coemergent, then the error of the view of the self occurring in all minds would arise.

original: dus thams cad du ngar 'dzin pa kun du 'byung ba med pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad du ngar 'dzin pa kun du 'byung ba med pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The error of the view of the self occurring in all minds is the error that the view of the self occurs at all times.

original: gzhan dag ni mtshungs par ldan par kun du mi 'byung ba la zhes bya bar 'dod de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni mtshungs par ldan par kun du mi 'byung ba la zhes bya bar 'dod de /
translated: Others assert that the view of the self does not occur as a concomitant.

original: tshig de gnyis ni don rnam pa drug car gyi mjug sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig de gnyis ni don rnam pa drug car gyi mjug sdud pa yin no //
translated: These two phrases summarize the six topics.

original: nyon mongs pa can @322b gyi yid yod na ni ngar 'dzin pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dang lhan cig kun du 'byung bar 'gyur gyi de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can @322b gyi yid yod na ni ngar 'dzin pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dang lhan cig kun du 'byung bar 'gyur gyi de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If there were an afflicted mind, it would occur simultaneously with the six consciousnesses that engage the apprehension of an ‚ÄúI,‚Äù etc., but it would not be associated with them.

original: lhan cig 'byung bar kun du 'byung ba zhes bshad na mtshungs par ldan par yang 'gyur bas mtshungs par ldan par kun du mi 'byung ba la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung bar kun du 'byung ba zhes bshad na mtshungs par ldan par yang 'gyur bas mtshungs par ldan par kun du mi 'byung ba la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since it is explained that it occurs simultaneously, it would also be associated, so he says, ‚ÄúIt does not occur as an association.‚Äù

original: kun du 'byung ba ni skad cig ma tha dad par yang yin pas lhan cig 'byung bar kun du 'byung ba zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: kun du 'byung ba ni skad cig ma tha dad par yang yin pas lhan cig 'byung bar kun du 'byung ba zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since occurrence is also a different moment, he says, ‚ÄúIt occurs simultaneously.‚Äù

analyzed: nyon mongs can gyi yid med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis bshad pa'i don nyid sdud pa yin no //
