analyzed: theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyi gsung yin pa nyid du gong du rab tu bsgrubs pa'i phyir sil bu'i mdo'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Why did he not cite the verse from the Anavatapta-suÃÑtra,üîΩ‚ÄúArisen together, they cease together,

original: lhan cig tu ni skye zhing 'gag / ces bya ba la sogs pa ci'i phyir nye bar ma bkod ce na /
analyzed: lhan cig tu ni skye zhing 'gag / ces bya ba la sogs pa ci'i phyir nye bar ma bkod ce na /
translated: ‚Äù in order to prove that the Mahayana is the word of the Buddha?

original: 'di las ma rig pa dngos su ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las ma rig pa dngos su ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ignorance is not explicitly mentioned in that suÃÑtra.

original: de la yang dag pa nyid don yin te /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa nyid don yin te /
translated: The meaning of reality is

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: the nature of the four noble truths.

original: de la dmigs par byed pa nyid du sems 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs par byed pa nyid du sems 'jug pa'o //
translated: The mind is engaged in observing that.

original: bgegs su rtag gyur pa ni ji srid zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems kun du 'byung ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bgegs su rtag gyur pa ni ji srid zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems kun du 'byung ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The obstacle is always present as long as the contaminated mind continues to function.

original: de ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams dang mdo sde pa rnams kyi ltar na res 'ga' mngon du mi 'gyur yang thob pa dang sa bon gyi sgo nas yang dag par mthong ba'i bgegs su gyur pas dus thams cad du kun du 'byung ba yin no @323aüîΩ* // zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams dang mdo sde pa rnams kyi ltar na res 'ga' mngon du mi 'gyur yang thob pa dang sa bon gyi sgo nas yang dag par mthong ba'i bgegs su gyur pas dus thams cad du kun du 'byung ba yin no @323a * // zhes bya ste /
translated: According to the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas and SautrƒÅntikas, even though it is not sometimes manifest, it is always present because it is an obstruction to the path of seeing from the perspective of obtainment and seeds.

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum du gyur pa bzhin du bgegs su gyur pa de'i tshe dus thams cad du 'byung ba yin par khas blang bar bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum du gyur pa bzhin du bgegs su gyur pa de'i tshe dus thams cad du 'byung ba yin par khas blang bar bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Objection: It should be accepted that it is present at all times, just as it is an obstruction when it is manifest.

original: thob pa ni re zhig de gsal ba'i phyir dang snga ma dang phyi mar yang khyad par med pa'i phyir bgegs su gyur pa ma yin par yang rigs na /
analyzed: thob pa ni re zhig de gsal ba'i phyir dang snga ma dang phyi mar yang khyad par med pa'i phyir bgegs su gyur pa ma yin par yang rigs na /
translated: Objection: It is reasonable that obtainment is not an obstruction because it is the clarity of that and there is no difference between earlier and later.

original: sa bon go ji ltar de 'di ltar de ma nyams pa ni yang dag par mthong ba'i bgegs su gyur pa yin la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig la nyams pa ni de'i bgegs su gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sa bon go ji ltar de 'di ltar de ma nyams pa ni yang dag par mthong ba'i bgegs su gyur pa yin la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig la nyams pa ni de'i bgegs su gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: The seed of that is not damaged, because it is an obstruction to seeing reality. But when it is damaged in the moment of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, it is not an obstruction to that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir slob pa la sa bon nyams pa yod pa'i phyir sprin dang bcas pa'i nyin mo gzugs mthong ba bzhin du chos mthong ba yin la mi slob pa'i ni spangs pa'i phyir sprin med pa'i nyin mo gzugs mthong ba bzhin du chos mthong ba yin
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slob pa la sa bon nyams pa yod pa'i phyir sprin dang bcas pa'i nyin mo gzugs mthong ba bzhin du chos mthong ba yin la mi slob pa'i ni spangs pa'i phyir sprin med pa'i nyin mo gzugs mthong ba bzhin du chos mthong ba yin
translated: Therefore, because the seed is damaged in the learner, Dharma is seen like seeing form on a cloudy day. But for the nonlearner, Dharma is seen like seeing form on a cloudless day, because it is abandoned.

original: no // yang na mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i mi shes pa nyid nyon mongs pa can gyi gnas skabs dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang lung du ma bstan pa'i gnas skabs na mngon du gyur pa dang / sa bon gyi sgo nas yang dag par mthong ba'i gags su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: no // yang na mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i mi shes pa nyid nyon mongs pa can gyi gnas skabs dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang lung du ma bstan pa'i gnas skabs na mngon du gyur pa dang / sa bon gyi sgo nas yang dag par mthong ba'i gags su gyur pa yin no //
translated: Or, ignorance to be abandoned by the path of seeing is a state of affliction and is manifest in the state of contaminated virtue and neutral states. It is an obstruction to seeing reality in terms of the seed.

original: de 'gags na ni mun pa 'gags na snang ba 'byung ba bzhin du yang dag par mthong ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de 'gags na ni mun pa 'gags na snang ba 'byung ba bzhin du yang dag par mthong ba 'byung ste /
translated: When that is stopped, then seeing is stopped, just as when darkness is stopped, light appears.

original: de'i phyir ma rig pa'i khyad par gzhan brtag par mi bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pa'i khyad par gzhan brtag par mi bya'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, another kind of ignorance should not be imagined.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te gang zhig mi gsal pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi sgrib pa'i bdag nyid yin pa de ni yang dag pa mthong ba'i gags su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te gang zhig mi gsal pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi sgrib pa'i bdag nyid yin pa de ni yang dag pa mthong ba'i gags su gyur pa yin no //
translated: That is not reasonable, because that which has the nature of obscurity, which is the nature of obstruction, is the obstruction to seeing reality.

original: mun pa mngon du gyur pa ni sgrib pa'i bdag nyid yin gyi sa bon gyi gnas skabs ni ma yin te phyi'i mun pa dang chos mthun pas so //
analyzed: mun pa mngon du gyur pa ni sgrib pa'i bdag nyid yin gyi sa bon gyi gnas skabs ni ma yin te phyi'i mun pa dang chos mthun pas so //
translated: Darkness that is manifest is the nature of obstruction, but it is not in the state of a seed, because it is similar to external darkness.

original: phyi'i mun pa'i sa bon ni mthong ba'i bgegs byed par grags pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi'i mun pa'i sa bon ni mthong ba'i bgegs byed par grags pa yin no //
translated: The seed of external darkness is known to obstruct seeing.

original: sa bon ni ma nyams pa dang nyams pa rang gi 'bras bu skye ba dang mi skye ba la bya ba byed kyi /
analyzed: sa bon ni ma nyams pa dang nyams pa rang gi 'bras bu skye ba dang mi skye ba la bya ba byed kyi /
translated: A seed, whether damaged or undamaged, functions to produce or not produce its own result.

original: rigs gzhan gyi bgegs byed pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs gzhan gyi bgegs byed pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not function to obstruct the production of a different type of result.

original: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ma bsags pa nyid dang / bsags pa nyid kyis yongs su ma rgyas pa'i phyir dang / yongs su smin pa'i phyir sprin dang bcas pa dang / sprin med pa'i nyin mo gzugs mthong ba bzhin du slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lta ba dag gis chos mthong ba yin gyi sa bon bgegs su gyur @323b pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ma bsags pa nyid dang / bsags pa nyid kyis yongs su ma rgyas pa'i phyir dang / yongs su smin pa'i phyir sprin dang bcas pa dang / sprin med pa'i nyin mo gzugs mthong ba bzhin du slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lta ba dag gis chos mthong ba yin gyi sa bon bgegs su gyur @323b pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: Because the homogeneous cause is not accumulated or is accumulated, but not fully developed or is fully developed, like seeing form on a cloudy day or a cloudless day, respectively, one sees phenomena with the view of a learner or nonlearner, but not because the seed is an obstruction.

original: 'o na ni mi dge ba'i sa bon yongs su ma rgyas pa dang yongs su rgyas pa de nyid las yang dag pa ma mthong ba dang mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni mi dge ba'i sa bon yongs su ma rgyas pa dang yongs su rgyas pa de nyid las yang dag pa ma mthong ba dang mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then one would not see reality due to the nondevelopment of the seed of nonvirtue or due to its development.

original: de ni ma yin te mi shes pa kun du 'byung ba'i gnas skabs pa kho na mthong ba'i bgegs byed pa yin no zhes de ni bshad zhin to //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te mi shes pa kun du 'byung ba'i gnas skabs pa kho na mthong ba'i bgegs byed pa yin no zhes de ni bshad zhin to //
translated: That is not so, because the state of the arising of ignorance alone obstructs seeing.

original: bgegs byed pa med na ni /
analyzed: bgegs byed pa med na ni /
translated: If there is no obstruction,

original: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems pa chung ngus kyang yang dag par mthong ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems pa chung ngus kyang yang dag par mthong ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: because even a small wholesome volition that is contaminated can see reality, and thus can exhaust the defilements.

original: de ltar bas na rtag tu kun du 'byung ba'i mi shes pas khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bas na rtag tu kun du 'byung ba'i mi shes pas khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be accepted that the ignorance that is always operative is the ignorance of the non-apprehension of the self.

original: de yang rnam par shes pa gzhan med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa gzhan med pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not the case that there is no other consciousness,

original: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i gnas skabs na de mi srid par thal par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i gnas skabs na de mi srid par thal par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be impossible in the states of wholesome and neutral minds.

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni grub pa yin no //üîΩnyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyon mongs pa can nyid kyi yang dag pa mthong ba la sgrib pa'i phyir bsgribs pa ste ;
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni grub pa yin no // nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyon mongs pa can nyid kyi yang dag pa mthong ba la sgrib pa'i phyir bsgribs pa ste ;
translated: Therefore, the existence of the afflicted mind is established.üîΩIt is obscured because it is afflicted, etc. It is obscured because it obscures the seeing of reality due to its being afflicted.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bzhin du dus thams cad du ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bzhin du dus thams cad du ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is associated with all the afflicted mental states because it is associated with all the afflicted mental states, like the afflicted view of the self, etc., and because it is associated with all the afflicted mental states, like the afflicted view of the body, etc., and because it is associated with all the afflicted mental states, like the afflicted view of the body, etc., and because it is associated with all the afflicted mental states, like the afflicted view of the body, etc., and because it is associated with all the afflicted mental states, like the afflicted view of the body, etc., and because it is associated with all the afflicted mental states, like the afflicted view of the body, etc., and because it is associated with all the afflicted mental states, like the afflicted view of the body, etc., and because it is associated with all the afflicted mental states, like the afflicted view of the body, etc., and because it is associated with all the afflicted mental states, like the afflicted view of the body, etc., and because it is associated with all the afflicted mental states, like the afflicted view of the body, etc., and because it is associated with all the afflicted mental states, like the afflicted view of the body, etc., and because it is associated with all the afflicted mental states, like the afflicted view of the body, etc., and because it is associated with all the afflicted mental states, like the afflicted view of the body, etc., and because it is associated with all the afflicted mental states, like the afflicted view of the body, etc., and because it is associated with all the afflicted mental states, like the afflicted view of the body, etc., and because it is associated with all the afflicted mental states, like the afflicted view of the body, etc., and because it is associated with all the afflicted mental states, like the afflicted view of the body, etc., and because it

original: dus thams cad du ldan pa nyid ni kha nang du bltas pa nyid kyis phra ba'i phyir mi 'gal pas so //
analyzed: dus thams cad du ldan pa nyid ni kha nang du bltas pa nyid kyis phra ba'i phyir mi 'gal pas so //
translated: It is not contradictory that it is always associated with the mind, because it is subtle, since it is directed internally.

original: dge ba dang mi 'gal pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi 'gal pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
translated: It is neutral, because it is not associated with virtue or evil.

original: dper na gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa zhi gnas dang mthun pa lung du ma bstan pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa zhi gnas dang mthun pa lung du ma bstan pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, it is like the neutral afflicted view that is compatible with serenity in the form and formless realms.

original: zhar la 'ongs par rdzogs so /
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs par rdzogs so /
translated: The digression is complete.

original: // / dkyus ma nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas sems kyi lus gsum pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: // / dkyus ma nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas sems kyi lus gsum pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: From the perspective of the main point, the root text states, ‚ÄúThe third is the body of mind.‚Äù

original: bstan pa'i sgo nas gsum pa nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang bshad pa'i sgo nas yin no //
analyzed: bstan pa'i sgo nas gsum pa nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang bshad pa'i sgo nas yin no //
translated: It is not the third from the perspective of being taught, but rather from the perspective of being explained.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúexcept for the foundation consciousness‚Äù

original: 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan thun mong ma yin pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan thun mong ma yin pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: is stated from the perspective of the uncommon characteristics of the cause of engagement.

original: sems zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa'i don rjod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sems zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa'i don rjod par byed pa yin te /
translated: The term ‚Äúmind‚Äù is a synonym for consciousness.

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because the words mind, thought, and consciousness are synonyms.

original: dper na bsgrubs pa'i yid ces bya ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na bsgrubs pa'i yid ces bya ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, it is like the word ‚Äúthought‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúthought that is cultivated.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs de nyid kyi phyir yid kyang don gzhan rjod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de nyid kyi phyir yid kyang don gzhan rjod par byed pa yin te /
translated: For that very reason, thought is also a term for something else,

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //üîΩkun gzhi'i rnam @324a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba bzhin no // kun gzhi'i rnam @324a * //
translated: like the word ‚Äúconsciousness.‚Äù

original: shes pa grub pa de cir dgos she na /
analyzed: shes pa grub pa de cir dgos she na /
translated: What is the purpose of establishing the storehouse consciousness?

original: de'i phyir sa bon thams cad pa de las yid dang rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa bon thams cad pa de las yid dang rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that mind and consciousness arise from that which contains all the seeds.üîΩNow, in order to demonstrate the uncommon reason, it is said:

original: da ni chos kyi bag chags kyi sa bon bsags pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyu mtshan thun mong ma yin pa de ston to //
analyzed: da ni chos kyi bag chags kyi sa bon bsags pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyu mtshan thun mong ma yin pa de ston to //
translated: ‚Äúfrom the accumulation of the seeds of the impregnations of the propensities of all the dharmas.

original: sna tshogs nyid dang sems pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir nye bar ma bkod de /
analyzed: sna tshogs nyid dang sems pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir nye bar ma bkod de /
translated: ‚Äù The variety and the intention are not mentioned because they are not uncommon.

original: gang tshe sems zhes bya ba'i sgra sems dang sems las byung ba dang sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa la sbyor ba de'i tshe ni rgyu mtshan thun mong la brten to //
analyzed: gang tshe sems zhes bya ba'i sgra sems dang sems las byung ba dang sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa la sbyor ba de'i tshe ni rgyu mtshan thun mong la brten to //
translated: When the term ‚Äúmind‚Äù is applied to the mind, mental factors, and the dissociated forces, then the reason is based on a common characteristic.

original: yang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i thun mong ma yin pa'i rnam grangs ston pa yin no //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i thun mong ma yin pa'i rnam grangs ston pa yin no //
translated: Why is it called the Great Vehicle?

original: shes bya phra mo bsdu ba'i phyir //
analyzed: shes bya phra mo bsdu ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to include subtle objects of knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba ni shes bya ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shes bya ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of objects of knowledge:

original: phra mo dang rags pa'o //
analyzed: phra mo dang rags pa'o //
translated: subtle and gross.

original: phra mo ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas chos la bdag med pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas shes par dka' ba nyid kyis kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o //üîΩrags pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas gang zag la bdag med pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phra mo ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas chos la bdag med pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas shes par dka' ba nyid kyis kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o //üîΩrags pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas gang zag la bdag med pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The subtle is the store consciousness, because it is difficult to know by means of its own characteristics, that is, by means of the selflessness of dharmas, and because it is subtle by means of its general characteristics.üîΩThe gross is the other six consciousnesses, because they are easy to know by means of their own characteristics, that is, by means of the selflessness of persons, and because they are gross by means of their general characteristics.

original: de la nyan thos rnams ni spyi'i mtshan nyid dang rang gi mtshan nyid rags pa thos pa dang bsams pa dag gis goms par byas nas go rims bzhin du 'phags pa'i lam dang de'i rjes la thob pa'i shes pas mngon sum du bya bar nus te /
analyzed: de la nyan thos rnams ni spyi'i mtshan nyid dang rang gi mtshan nyid rags pa thos pa dang bsams pa dag gis goms par byas nas go rims bzhin du 'phags pa'i lam dang de'i rjes la thob pa'i shes pas mngon sum du bya bar nus te /
translated: The Listeners, having cultivated the general and specific characteristics of the gross, by means of hearing and reflection, are able to realize them in order by means of the Noble Path and the knowledge subsequent to it.

original: de'i phyir de rnams la de kho na bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams la de kho na bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the Reality is taught to them.

original: de'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes pa ni zhar yin pa'i phyir la mya ngan las 'das pa ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa ni zhar yin pa'i phyir la mya ngan las 'das pa ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because knowledge is secondary and Nirvana is primary.

original: de nyid shes bya thams cad shes pa la rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya bas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid shes bya thams cad shes pa la rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya bas ston te /
translated: It is not the case that all objects of knowledge are known by the knowledge of that.

original: de bas na de dag ni blo mi gsal ba'i phyir shes bya thams can shes pas rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhugs ba ma yin gyi rags pa kho na shes par nus pa de tsam gyis de dag gi rnam par grol ba 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de dag ni blo mi gsal ba'i phyir shes bya thams can shes pas rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhugs ba ma yin gyi rags pa kho na shes par nus pa de tsam gyis de dag gi rnam par grol ba 'grub pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because their intellect is not clear, they do not enter into the knowledge of all objects of knowledge in order to realize them. They are able to know only the gross, and that is enough for them to achieve liberation.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don de nyid ston to //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni med na med pa yin pa'i phyir la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩnus pa yang yod la don du yang gnyer ba'i phyir shes bya thams cad shes pa la gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don de nyid ston to // byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni med na med pa yin pa'i phyir la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro // nus pa yang yod la don du yang gnyer ba'i phyir shes bya thams cad shes pa la gtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the passage beginning with ‚Äúfor that reason‚Äù teaches just that meaning.

original: de'i phyir 'phags @324b pa'i lam gyis spyi'i mtshan nyid rags pa dang phra mo dang / de'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyis rang gi mtshan nyid rags pa dang phra mo mngon sum du byas nas dgos pa'i gtso bo ma thob par 'khor ba nyid na yongs su rgyu'o //üîΩde bas na de'i phyir de dag la de bstan te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags @324b pa'i lam gyis spyi'i mtshan nyid rags pa dang phra mo dang / de'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyis rang gi mtshan nyid rags pa dang phra mo mngon sum du byas nas dgos pa'i gtso bo ma thob par 'khor ba nyid na yongs su rgyu'o //üîΩde bas na de'i phyir de dag la de bstan te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: 'di ltar gang kho na thos pa dang bsams pa dag gis yul du byas pa de kho na phyis mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang kho na thos pa dang bsams pa dag gis yul du byas pa de kho na phyis mngon sum du byed do //
translated: In this way, one makes an object of that very thing which one has heard and reflected upon, and later one realizes it by direct intuition.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With reference to the vehicle of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, he says:

original: yang zhes bya ba la sgos pa smos te /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba la sgos pa smos te /
translated: again,

original: thams cad yod par smra ba rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba rnams kyi yin no //
translated: this refers to the SarvƒÅstivƒÅdins.

original: kun gzhi la kun du dga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig bzhi ni rnam grangs tsam du zad de /üîΩdbang po rtul po rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ram /üîΩgdul ba 'ga' zhig rnam grangs 'ga' zhig gis don grags pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: kun gzhi la kun du dga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig bzhi ni rnam grangs tsam du zad de / dbang po rtul po rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ram / gdul ba 'ga' zhig rnam grangs 'ga' zhig gis don grags pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ram /
translated: The four terms beginning with ‚Äòdelight in the store-consciousness‚Äô are merely synonyms.üîΩThis is because it is for the sake of those of dull faculties that it is taught;üîΩor it is for the sake of those who are to be trained, so that they may understand the meaning through some other synonym;

original: gdul ba rnams la so so yang dag par rig pa'i sa bon bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul ba rnams la so so yang dag par rig pa'i sa bon bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or it is for the sake of those who are to be trained, so that the seed of the analytical knowledges may be planted in them.

original: yang na kun gzhi la kun du dga' ba zhes bya ba ni bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na kun gzhi la kun du dga' ba zhes bya ba ni bstan pa yin no //
translated: Alternatively, the term ‚Äòdelight in the store-consciousness‚Äô is the teaching;

original: lhag ma ni dus kyi khyad par gyis de'i bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni dus kyi khyad par gyis de'i bshad pa yin no //
translated: the rest is the explanation of that, according to the difference in time.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i yul gyi khyad par gyis go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i yul gyi khyad par gyis go rims bzhin no //
translated: The three phrases are in the order of past, present, and future objects.

original: yang na 'dod pa dang gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i bye brag gis tshig gsum go rims bzhin du de'i bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa dang gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i bye brag gis tshig gsum go rims bzhin du de'i bshad pa yin no //
translated: Or else, the three phrases are in the order of the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm.

original: yang nang na song gi 'gro ba dang lha ma yin gyi 'gro ba dang / lha'i 'gro ba las brtsams nas tshig gsum go rims bzhin du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: yang nang na song gi 'gro ba dang lha ma yin gyi 'gro ba dang / lha'i 'gro ba las brtsams nas tshig gsum go rims bzhin du bshad pa yin no //
translated: Or else, the three phrases are in the order of the realm of ghosts, the realm of demigods, and the realm of gods.

original: go rims bzhin du 'phen par byed pa dang rdzogs par byed pa /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du 'phen par byed pa dang rdzogs par byed pa /
translated: The three phrases are in the order of projecting and completing.

original: yi dags dang lha'i 'gro bas bsdus pa dag gis mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir lha ma yin gyi 'gro ba gzhan du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: yi dags dang lha'i 'gro bas bsdus pa dag gis mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir lha ma yin gyi 'gro ba gzhan du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The realm of demigods is established as separate from the realms of ghosts and gods because it is established by both the projecting and completing karma of the desire realm.

original: yang na mngal nas skye ba dang sgo nga las skye ba dang drod gsher las skye ba dang / rdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas kyi dbang du mdzad nas tshig bzhi go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na mngal nas skye ba dang sgo nga las skye ba dang drod gsher las skye ba dang / rdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas kyi dbang du mdzad nas tshig bzhi go rims bzhin no //
translated: Or else, the four phrases are in the order of the four birth processes: womb birth, egg birth, birth from heat and moisture, and spontaneous birth.

original: yang na 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs kyi sred pa dang / gzugs med pa'i sred pa dang / 'jigs pa'i sred pa las brtsams nas so //
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs kyi sred pa dang / gzugs med pa'i sred pa dang / 'jigs pa'i sred pa las brtsams nas so //
translated: or else, beginning with craving for the realm of desire, craving for the realm of form, craving for the formless realm, and craving for fear;

original: yang na phyin ci log bzhi las brtsams nas so //
analyzed: yang na phyin ci log bzhi las brtsams nas so //
translated: or else, beginning with the four errors.

original: nyan 'dod la zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig bzhi ni /
analyzed: nyan 'dod la zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig bzhi ni /
translated: The four phrases beginning with ‚Äúdesire to hear‚Äù refer to

original: skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / thos pa dang / bsams @325a * //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / thos pa dang / bsams @325a * //
translated: the wisdom that arises from reliance on holy persons, from listening,

original: ba dang ; bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi dbang du mdzad nas go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: ba dang ; bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi dbang du mdzad nas go rims bzhin no //
translated: from reflection, and from meditative development.

original: de la skyes bu dam pa la brten pa ni gsum gyi sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: de la skyes bu dam pa la brten pa ni gsum gyi sbyor ba yin no //
translated: In this regard, reliance on holy persons is the application of the three.

original: yang na thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: yang na thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi khyad par yin no //
translated: Or else, it is the wisdom that arises from listening.

original: yang na bsnyen bkur byed pa'i gnas skabs na skyes nas thob pa'i shes rab yin no //
analyzed: yang na bsnyen bkur byed pa'i gnas skabs na skyes nas thob pa'i shes rab yin no //
translated: Or else, it is the wisdom obtained at birth in the situation of service.

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos zhes bya ba la chos ni bden pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos zhes bya ba la chos ni bden pa mthong ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe Dharma that accords with the Dharma‚Äù means: the Dharma is the vision of the truth.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i chos ni de'i sbyor ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i chos ni de'i sbyor ba'i lam mo //
translated: The Dharma that is in conformity with that is the path of preparation.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na chos ni mi slob pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na chos ni mi slob pa'i lam mo //
translated: Or else, the Dharma is the path of no-more-learning,

original: rjes su mthun pa'i chos ni slob pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i chos ni slob pa'i lam mo //
translated: and the Dharma that is in conformity with that is the path of learning.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na chos ni don dam pa mya ngan la 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na chos ni don dam pa mya ngan la 'das pa'o //
translated: Or else, the Dharma is the ultimate truth, i.e., nirvana,

original: rjes su mthun pa'i chos ni zag pa med pa'i lam thams cad do //üîΩlung rnams las zhes mang po'i tshig smos pa ni //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i chos ni zag pa med pa'i lam thams cad do // lung rnams las zhes mang po'i tshig smos pa ni //
translated: and the Dharma that is in conformity with that is the entire pure path.üîΩThe plural particle in the expression ‚Äúin the scriptures‚Äù indicates

original: lung mang po las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung mang po las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: that the scriptures contain many such statements.

original: rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa gzhan bstan pa zhig yin no zhes bya ba de ltar rtogs so //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa gzhan bstan pa zhig yin no zhes bya ba de ltar rtogs so //
translated: The expression ‚Äúthe root consciousness‚Äù refers to the store consciousness.

original: de ni kun du rtog pa tsam du zad de yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gzhan nyid mi rung ba'i phyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni kun du rtog pa tsam du zad de yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gzhan nyid mi rung ba'i phyi mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gzhan bzhin no //
translated: This is mere speculation, because it is not possible for the stream of the mental consciousness to be different from the stream of the store consciousness, just as the visual consciousness is not different from the stream of the store consciousness.

original: rtsa ba la brten pa'i shing ljon pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtsa ba la brten pa'i shing ljon pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is like a tree that is rooted in the ground.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rtsa bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rtsa bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the root of the other consciousnesses.

original: 'khor ba ji srid pa'i zhes bya ba ni ji srid 'tsho'i bar du 'jug ste dper na srog lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba ji srid pa'i zhes bya ba ni ji srid 'tsho'i bar du 'jug ste dper na srog lta bu'o //
translated: It continues as long as samsara does means that it continues as long as life does, like the life faculty.

original: la la ni skad cig tsam ste dper na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: la la ni skad cig tsam ste dper na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: Some continue for only an instant, like the consciousnesses of the sense faculties.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du 'jug go //
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du 'jug go //
translated: The foundation consciousness continues until nirvana.

original: la lar res 'ga' zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i khams dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas skabs na go rims bzhin du gzugs dang sems dag gi rgyud 'chad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la lar res 'ga' zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i khams dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas skabs na go rims bzhin du gzugs dang sems dag gi rgyud 'chad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Some are sometimes interrupted means that in the formless realm and in the state of composure without conception, the continuum of form and mind is interrupted, respectively, as is seen.

original: 'di la de dag ni ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi khyad par zhig 'khor ba ji srid pa yin pa nyid du rtogs te /
analyzed: 'di la de dag ni ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyi khyad par zhig 'khor ba ji srid pa yin pa nyid du rtogs te /
translated: In this regard, they imagine that some special nonconcurrent formation continues as long as samsara does.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa rnams bsal ba'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa rnams bsal ba'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is illogical, because nonconcurrent formations are excluded from this category.

original: gang shes bya'i gnas zhes bya ba ngo bo nyid bstan pa dang / len pa'i rnam pa shes pa la sogs pa zhar la theg pa chen po'i thun mong @325b ma yin pa'i rnam grangs brjod pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa dang thun mong gi tshig gsum dang /

The statement ‚ÄúThe consciousness that appropriates the aspects of form and so on‚Äù teaches the synonyms of the ƒÅlaya consciousness that are not shared with the MahƒÅyƒÅna. analyzed: de ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ste zhes bya ba thun mong ma yin par bshad par bya ba'i rnam grangs bstan pas ni de mjug sdud pa yin no //

original: dang 'khor ba ji srid pa'i phung po nyid ces bya ba la dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gong ma rnams bsdu ba'i don to //üîΩyang na sde ba gzhan dag 'don pa bsdu ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dang 'khor ba ji srid pa'i phung po nyid ces bya ba la dang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gong ma rnams bsdu ba'i don to //üîΩyang na sde ba gzhan dag 'don pa bsdu ba'i phyir te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is the basis of all conditioned phenomena‚Äù teaches the synonyms of the ƒÅlaya consciousness that are shared with the Hƒ´nayƒÅna.üîΩThe statement ‚ÄúIt is the basis

original: dper na mang pos bkur ba'i sde rnams mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug bstan nas rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa ston pa lta bu dang / gnas brtan pa rnams de kho na bzhin du bstan nas /
analyzed: dper na mang pos bkur ba'i sde rnams mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug bstan nas rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa ston pa lta bu dang / gnas brtan pa rnams de kho na bzhin du bstan nas /
translated: For example, the Sa·πÉmitƒ´yas teach the six consciousnesses such as eye consciousness and then teach the consciousness that is the result of karmic maturation.

original: srid pa'i yan lag gi rnam par shes pa ston pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag gi rnam par shes pa ston pa lta bu ste /
translated: The Sthaviras teach the six consciousnesses in the same way and then teach the consciousness that is a link of existence.

original: de dag kyang rnam par shes pa drug las rigs gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yin no //üîΩlam po che btang ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni dper na rgyal po chen po'i gshegs shul long ba rnams kyis mi mthong zhing mi ngan pas bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa skal ba med pa
analyzed: de dag kyang rnam par shes pa drug las rigs gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yin no // lam po che btang ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni dper na rgyal po chen po'i gshegs shul long ba rnams kyis mi mthong zhing mi ngan pas bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa skal ba med pa
translated: Since these are different types of consciousness from the six consciousnesses, they are the foundation consciousness.üîΩThe path is only abandoned means that, for example, the blind do not see the path of a great king and it is not to be traversed by evil people.

original: rnams kyi yul ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: rnams kyi yul ma yin pa'am /
translated: In the same way, the foundation consciousness is not the domain of those who lack good fortune.

original: dper na 'khor los sgyur pa'i rgyal po chen po gshegs pa shul gser gyi bye mas g-yogs pa de dbang thang med pa rnams la mi snang ba ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na 'khor los sgyur pa'i rgyal po chen po gshegs pa shul gser gyi bye mas g-yogs pa de dbang thang med pa rnams la mi snang ba ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, it is like the great universal monarch's path being covered with golden sand, which is not seen by those who are not entitled to it. This is also like that.

original: brtsad pa'i dbang du mdzad nas 'dir tshig 'bru tha dad do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: brtsad pa'i dbang du mdzad nas 'dir tshig 'bru tha dad do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In response to the dispute, it is said here that the words are different.

original: sngar bshad pa rnam pa drug gi ni ming khyad par yod pa nyid 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes ston par byed de tshig 'bru ni ming gi rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa rnam pa drug gi ni ming khyad par yod pa nyid 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes ston par byed de tshig 'bru ni ming gi rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is shown that the six previously explained [types of non-arising] only have the difference of name, because the words are the basis of the name.

original: yid dang rnam pa shes pa gnyis don tha dad par dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de dag gi gzhung lugs nyid kyi 'das pa ni yid de rgyur gyur pa yi pa la da ltar byung ba ni rnam par shes pa ste 'bras bur gyur pa
analyzed: yid dang rnam pa shes pa gnyis don tha dad par dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de dag gi gzhung lugs nyid kyi 'das pa ni yid de rgyur gyur pa yi pa la da ltar byung ba ni rnam par shes pa ste 'bras bur gyur pa
translated: Because the mind and consciousness are observed as different objects. The past is the mind, which is the cause, and the present is the consciousness, which is the result.

original: yin no // de ltar bas na sems zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam par shes pa las don gzhan rjod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: yin no // de ltar bas na sems zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam par shes pa las don gzhan rjod par byed pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the term ‚Äúmind‚Äù expresses a meaning that is different from consciousness,

original: tshig de dag gi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir yid ces bya ba'i sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig de dag gi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir yid ces bya ba'i sgra bzhin no //
translated: just like the term ‚Äúthought‚Äù because they are synonyms.

original: ma 'ongs pa sems yin par rnam par gzhag pa yang mi nus te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa sems yin par rnam par gzhag pa yang mi nus te /
translated: Also, it is not possible to posit future states as mind,

original: nges pa'i tshig mi srid pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang na don tha dad par dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sngar bsgrubs pa'i tshad ma'i lugs @326a * //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig mi srid pa'i phyir ro // yang na don tha dad par dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sngar bsgrubs pa'i tshad ma'i lugs @326a * //
translated: because it is impossible for them to have a verbal definition.üîΩOr, because a different meaning is observed,

original: kyis de skad du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: kyis de skad du brjod pa yin no //
translated: this is stated according to the system of the previously established valid knowledge.

original: yang kha cig ni zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dbyig bshes so //
analyzed: yang kha cig ni zhes bya ba ni btsun pa dbyig bshes so //
translated: Some say: The venerable Vasumitra.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag ces bya ba ni /
translated: The five appropriating aggregates

original: de'i lta ba la grags pa kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la ma gtogs pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i lta ba la grags pa kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la ma gtogs pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: are those that are not included in the foundation consciousness that is renowned in his view.

original: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni sngar btsun pa mi'u thung ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni sngar btsun pa mi'u thung ste /
translated: Others say: The venerable VƒÅtsƒ´putra.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: Possessed of attachment means associated with attachment.

original: yang na 'dod chags dang dus mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dod chags dang dus mnyam pa ste /
translated: Or, it is simultaneous with attachment.

original: phyogs 'di la na 'dod chags la dmigs par byed pa yang bsdu'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'di la na 'dod chags la dmigs par byed pa yang bsdu'o //
translated: In this interpretation, that which takes attachment as its object is also included.

original: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs te /
translated: Others means Bhadanta Gho·π£aka.

original: don de dag gsum char yang 'dod chags kyi rang gir byed pa'i phyir kun gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don de dag gsum char yang 'dod chags kyi rang gir byed pa'i phyir kun gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: All three of these meanings are called the storehouse consciousness because they are the appropriator of attachment.

original: lung dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lung dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Scripture means the scriptures.

original: de las rnam par phye ste bsten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las rnam par phye ste bsten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is explained and relied upon in those scriptures.

original: rtogs pas zhes bya ba ni spyi'i mtshan nyid rags pa rtogs pa'i phyir dang / de'i rjes la thob pa'i shes pas rang gi mtshan nyid gzugs la sogs pa rags pa kho na rtogs kyi phra mo ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: rtogs pas zhes bya ba ni spyi'i mtshan nyid rags pa rtogs pa'i phyir dang / de'i rjes la thob pa'i shes pas rang gi mtshan nyid gzugs la sogs pa rags pa kho na rtogs kyi phra mo ni ma yin pas so //
translated: Realization means that the storehouse consciousness is the appropriator of attachment because it is the basis of the realization of the gross, which is the general characteristic, and because the knowledge that is obtained subsequently realizes only the gross, form, etc., which are the specific characteristics, and not the subtle.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa rnam par gzhag pa ni shes bya rags pa'i dbang du mdzad pa yin pas de dag gi yongs su rtog pa de yang shes bya rags pa la zhugs pa rnams la rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa rnam par gzhag pa ni shes bya rags pa'i dbang du mdzad pa yin pas de dag gi yongs su rtog pa de yang shes bya rags pa la zhugs pa rnams la rung ba nyid do //
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvaka vehicle is presented from the perspective of gross objects of knowledge, so their imagination is suitable for those engaged in gross objects of knowledge.

original: chos bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is a good doctrine‚Äù

original: nying mtshams sbyor bar byed pa sems can thams cad la khyab par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor bar byed pa sems can thams cad la khyab par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is because it pervades all sentient beings who link to it.

original: de yang gzhan gyi lta ba la mi srid pa dang / rang gi lta ba la srid pas sgrub par mdzad de /
analyzed: de yang gzhan gyi lta ba la mi srid pa dang / rang gi lta ba la srid pas sgrub par mdzad de /
translated: Since it is impossible in the views of others and possible in our own views, it is established.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi lta ba la mi srid par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi lta ba la mi srid par ston pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is like this‚Äù and so on teaches that it is impossible in the views of others.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar na 'phen par byed pa dang rdzogs par byed pa'i las mi dge ba kho na dmyal ba rnams su lus 'grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar na 'phen par byed pa dang rdzogs par byed pa'i las mi dge ba kho na dmyal ba rnams su lus 'grub pa'i phyir //
translated: According to the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas, since nonvirtuous projecting and completing karma establish bodies in the hells,

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba sim pa dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa med de //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba sim pa dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa med de //
translated: There is no neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant ripening sensation.

original: mnar med pa la gtogs pa tsha ba dang grang ba dag na ni rlung bsil ba dang dro ba'i reg pas rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i bde pa yod do //
analyzed: mnar med pa la gtogs pa tsha ba dang grang ba dag na ni rlung bsil ba dang dro ba'i reg pas rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i bde pa yod do //
translated: In the cold hells, there is the pleasure of the concordant cause of the sensation of the agreeable, warm wind.

original: yi dags dang dud 'gro dag na ni /üîΩmi dge ba kho nas 'phangs mod kyi res 'ga' zhig la lar rdzogs par byed pa dge ba yin pas rnam par smin pa las skyes @326b pa bde ba dang bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: yi dags dang dud 'gro dag na ni / mi dge ba kho nas 'phangs mod kyi res 'ga' zhig la lar rdzogs par byed pa dge ba yin pas rnam par smin pa las skyes @326b pa bde ba dang bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: In the animal realm and the ghost realm,

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa yod do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa yod do //
translated: there is the pleasure of the concordant cause of the agreeable, and also the pleasure of ripening and the neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant sensation, because the animals and ghosts sometimes complete the wholesome action that projects the realm of animals and ghosts and sometimes complete the wholesome action that projects the realm of gods.üîΩIn the hells, the animals and ghosts, there is no pleasure of the concordant cause of the agreeable, because the action that projects the hells, etc., is only unwholesome.

original: de lta bas na mnar med pa ni shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i ngan 'gro yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mnar med pa ni shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i ngan 'gro yin no //
translated: Thus the Avici hell is the worst of the unfortunate planes of existence.

original: mdo sde ba gzhan rnams kyi ltar na /
analyzed: mdo sde ba gzhan rnams kyi ltar na /
translated: According to other masters,

original: mnar med pa ma gtogs pa dmyal ba dag na yang rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i bde ba med de /
analyzed: mnar med pa ma gtogs pa dmyal ba dag na yang rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'i bde ba med de /
translated: there is no pleasure of the concordant cause in the unfortunate planes of existence, with the exception of the Avici hell.

original: rlung gi reg pas ni sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba tsam 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: rlung gi reg pas ni sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba tsam 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: The touch of the wind merely alleviates the suffering.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa ni yod mod kyi /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa ni yod mod kyi /
translated: There is neither pleasure nor suffering,

original: mi dga' ba'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir de ni 'dod chags dang mthun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dga' ba'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir de ni 'dod chags dang mthun pa ma yin no //
translated: but it is not conducive to passion because it has the aspect of displeasure.

original: yi dgas dang dud 'gro kha cig na yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: yi dgas dang dud 'gro kha cig na yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same is true for some hungry ghosts and animals.

original: de lta bas na gnyi ga la grags pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po de dag la 'dod chags kyi sbyor ba med de /
analyzed: de lta bas na gnyi ga la grags pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po de dag la 'dod chags kyi sbyor ba med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no attachment to those appropriated aggregates that are renowned to both parties,

original: de dag dang 'bral bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dang 'bral bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one desires to be separated from them.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni mdo sde pa kha cig ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar la mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa srid pa'i phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal yod la /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni mdo sde pa kha cig ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar la mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa srid pa'i phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal yod la /
translated: Some Sautrantikas say that there is pleasure and suffering up to the fourth absorption because eye consciousness and so on are possible there.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar la yid kyi rnam par shes pa srid pa'i phyir yid bde ba yod par 'dod do //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar la yid kyi rnam par shes pa srid pa'i phyir yid bde ba yod par 'dod do //
translated: Because mental consciousness exists up to the peak of cyclic existence, they assert that mental satisfaction exists.

original: de dag gi lta ba de ni mthar gyis snyoms par 'jug pa bstan pa'i mdo la sogs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir gong ma la med de zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde dang ldan ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gi lta ba de ni mthar gyis snyoms par 'jug pa bstan pa'i mdo la sogs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir gong ma la med de zhes bya ba'o // de dang ldan ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Their view is that it does not exist above the third absorption because it contradicts the S≈´tra on the Demonstration of Equipoise Through Meditative Attainment and so on.

original: bsam gtan bzhi ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Possessing that is possessing the fourth absorption and so on.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya ba la 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya ba la 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The view of the transitory collection is twofold:

original: kun brtags pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'o //üîΩkun brtags pa gang yin pa de ni slob pa rnams kyi ni spongs pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: kun brtags pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'o // kun brtags pa gang yin pa de ni slob pa rnams kyi ni spongs pa'i phyir la /
translated: the imputed and the innate.

original: sbyor ba'i lam la gnas pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyi ni kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir mi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam la gnas pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyi ni kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir mi mthun pa yin no //
translated: The imputed is abandoned by learners and the innate is not active in ordinary beings who abide on the path of preparation.

original: lhan cig skyes pa ni gnyi ga la kun du 'byung mod kyi bdag med pa la mos pa'i phyir de la chags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa ni gnyi ga la kun du 'byung mod kyi bdag med pa la mos pa'i phyir de la chags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The innate is present in both, but there is no attachment to it because of the conviction in selflessness.

original: rang gi lta ba la sred pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: rang gi lta ba la sred pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to craving one‚Äôs own view,

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚Äúthe consciousness of the ground of all,‚Äù and so on.

original: nang gi zhes bya ba ni nang du'o //
analyzed: nang gi zhes bya ba ni nang du'o //
translated: ‚Äú Internally‚Äù means within.

original: rnam par gzhig par 'dod par ni nam yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni btang snyoms kyi tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pas mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar sdug bsngal gyi @327a * //
analyzed: rnam par gzhig par 'dod par ni nam yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni btang snyoms kyi tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pas mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar sdug bsngal gyi @327a * //
translated: ‚Äú One never wishes to destroy it‚Äù because it is associated with the feeling of indifference, and so there is no conflict.

original: phung po 'di dag rnam grangs med par med kyang ci ma rung snyam du sems kyi /
analyzed: phung po 'di dag rnam grangs med par med kyang ci ma rung snyam du sems kyi /
translated: In this way, one thinks, ‚ÄúHow wonderful it would be if this mass of suffering were nonexistent,‚Äù

original: bdag nyid med kyang ci ma rung snyam du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid med kyang ci ma rung snyam du ni ma yin te /
translated: but one does not think, ‚ÄúHow wonderful it would be if I were nonexistent.‚Äù

original: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po med pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'dod chags kyang 'di la sbyor bas so //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po med pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'dod chags kyang 'di la sbyor bas so //
translated: because there is no antidote to the view of self, and because attachment associated with afflicted mind is also applied to this.

original: yang ji ltar mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu bde ba yang ma yin na sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba yang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu bde ba yang ma yin na sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba yang yin zhe na /
translated: How can the result of nonvirtuous action be a feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'dir bde ba'i lta ba lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir bde ba'i lta ba lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, it is not like the view of pleasure.

original: 'dir ni bde ba dang yid bde ba ni dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir ni bde ba dang yid bde ba ni dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin la /
translated: Here, pleasure and mental pleasure arise from the maturation of virtuous action.

original: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba ni mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba ni mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin no //
translated: Pain and mental pain arise from the maturation of nonvirtuous action.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa ni /
translated: A feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain

original: gnyi ga'i rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yin no //
translated: arises from the maturation of both.

original: mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa las skyes pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa las skyes pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which arises from the maturation of nonvirtuous action

original: mi dge ba'i rnam pa can nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rnam pa can nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not of the nature of nonvirtue,

original: mi gsal bas de la nyon mongs pa can gyi yid sbyor ba srid do //
analyzed: mi gsal bas de la nyon mongs pa can gyi yid sbyor ba srid do //
translated: because it is unclear, it is possible for the afflicted mind to be associated with it.

original: rnam grangs bstan pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rnam grangs bstan pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the synonyms is complete.

original: // / da ni mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i skabs la bab po //
analyzed: // / da ni mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i skabs la bab po //
translated: Now, the occasion of the establishment of the characteristics is at hand.

original: 'dir yang dngos po bdun nye bar bkod de /
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos po bdun nye bar bkod de /
translated: Here, seven topics are presented:

original: mtshan nyid dang / bag chags dang / de'i de nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang / phan tshun du rkyen nyid dang / sna tshogs dang sna tshogs ma yin pa nyid dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rkyen rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang / bag chags dang / de'i de nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang / phan tshun du rkyen nyid dang / sna tshogs dang sna tshogs ma yin pa nyid dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rkyen rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: the characteristics, the habitual tendencies, their sameness and difference, their mutual conditionality, their variety and non-variety, dependent origination, and the establishment of conditions.

original: 'di thams cad ni mtshan nyid kyi zhar la yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni mtshan nyid kyi zhar la yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Since all of this is ancillary to the characteristics, it is established as characteristics.

original: dngos po dang po'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: dngos po dang po'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the first topic,

original: de nas 'di'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nas 'di'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúNow, how is its characteristic established?‚Äù

original: mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba ni rgyas par ni rnam par gtan la dbab ba bsdu ba las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba ni rgyas par ni rnam par gtan la dbab ba bsdu ba las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: In brief, the extensive explanation of the characteristics of the dependent nature is as found in the Compendium of Ascertainments.

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni kha cig na re gang la rgyu sa bon yongs su ma smin pa dang / sa bon yongs su smin pa yod pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sa bon yin te /
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni kha cig na re gang la rgyu sa bon yongs su ma smin pa dang / sa bon yongs su smin pa yod pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sa bon yin te /
translated: Some say: The seed of dependent origination is the dependent nature that has an unripened seed cause and a ripened seed cause.

original: gzhan gyi dbang de ni 'bras bu yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang de ni 'bras bu yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: That dependent nature is the result.

original: de skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir de ni rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir de ni rung ba ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct because it is said that the seed is the sign of origination.

original: ma smin pa ni skye ba'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no //
analyzed: ma smin pa ni skye ba'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no //
translated: An unripened seed is not the sign of origination.

original: kha cig na re gzhan gyi dbang @327b rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni 'bras bu la ltos na sa bon te rgyu yin la /
analyzed: kha cig na re gzhan gyi dbang @327b rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni 'bras bu la ltos na sa bon te rgyu yin la /
translated: Some say: The seed of dependent origination is the dependent nature that is the cause in dependence on the result.

original: de nyid sgo bar byed pa'i chos la ltos na ni 'bras bu yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de nyid sgo bar byed pa'i chos la ltos na ni 'bras bu yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: That is the result in dependence on the phenomena that activate it.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not a correct reason,

original: de skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid de zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / bag chags la brten nas 'byung ba zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid de zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / bag chags la brten nas 'byung ba zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it says, ‚ÄúThe cause of its arising is just that,‚Äù and because it says, ‚ÄúIt arises in dependence on propensities.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na yongs su smin pa dang yongs su ma smin pa dbye ba ma byas par sa bon gyi cha dang rnam par smin pa'i cha bsdus nas rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na yongs su smin pa dang yongs su ma smin pa dbye ba ma byas par sa bon gyi cha dang rnam par smin pa'i cha bsdus nas rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, without distinguishing between the matured and the immature, the seed aspect and the fruitional aspect are combined and called the individual nature.

original: rnam smin sa bon thams cad pa //
analyzed: rnam smin sa bon thams cad pa //
translated: It is called the ‚Äúseed of all fruitions.‚Äù

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / 'og nas mdor bsdu na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / 'og nas mdor bsdu na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And later it says, ‚ÄúIn brief, the consciousness called ‚Äòstore‚Äô . . . .‚Äù

original: de nyid de la kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: de nyid de la kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: That very consciousness is taught to be the individual nature of the store consciousness, etc.

original: bag chags la brten nas zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'byung ba zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ste /
analyzed: bag chags la brten nas zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'byung ba zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ste /
translated: In dependence on propensities means that the word ‚Äúarises‚Äù is supplied from the previous sentence.

original: 'dis ni rnam par smin pa'i cha rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam par smin pa'i cha rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bshad do //
translated: This explains the dependent origination of the aspect of karmic ripening.

original: de skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The characteristic of the cause of its arising is

original: de nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de rnams skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de rnams skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin pa'o //
translated: the characteristic of the cause of the arising of those dharmas that are completely afflicted.

original: yang ji ltar rgyu mtshan nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar rgyu mtshan nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how is it the characteristic of the cause?

original: sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan pas zhes bya ba smos so ;
analyzed: sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan pas zhes bya ba smos so ;
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause it possesses the holding of seeds.‚Äù

original: /'di ni gtso bo la sogs pa rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: /'di ni gtso bo la sogs pa rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because of the analysis of the primary cause, etc.

original: 'di ltar sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan pa ni skye ba dang ldan pa rnams dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pa dag gis bag chags yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan pa ni skye ba dang ldan pa rnams dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pa dag gis bag chags yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Thus, because it possesses the holding of seeds, it is the holding of the latent impressions of those that possess arising, through the arising and ceasing together.

original: 'dis ni sa bon gyi cha bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sa bon gyi cha bstan to //
translated: This teaches the aspect of the seed.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs ba thams cad kyi bag chags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs ba thams cad kyi bag chags ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the latent impression of all afflictions.

original: mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags dang / srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i bag chags so //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags dang / srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i bag chags so //
translated: The habitual propensities of verbalization, the habitual propensities of the members of existence, and the habitual propensities of the view of the real body.

original: mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags ni rgyu'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags ni rgyu'i rkyen yin te /
translated: The habitual propensities of verbalization are the causal condition,

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the cause for the establishment of the essence of the consciousness of the store-consciousness.

original: srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags ni bdag po'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags ni bdag po'i rkyen yin te /
translated: The habitual propensities of the members of existence are the dominant condition,

original: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gror 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gror 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the cause for good and bad destinies.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i bag chags kyang bdag po'i rkyen yin te /üîΩbdag dang gzhan du 'byed @328a * //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i bag chags kyang bdag po'i rkyen yin te / bdag dang gzhan du 'byed @328a * //
translated: The habitual propensities of the view of the real body are also the dominant condition,

original: pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the cause for the discrimination of self and other.

original: de lta ma yin na sems can thams cad gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sems can thams cad gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, all sentient beings would be one.

original: sa bon gyi cha de nyid rnam par phye nas /
analyzed: sa bon gyi cha de nyid rnam par phye nas /
translated: Having distinguished that part which is the seed,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de dag nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyu'i mtshan nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de dag nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyu'i mtshan nyid du bstan to //
translated: The characteristic of cause is indicated by the words ‚Äúof those very dharmas that are afflicted‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam par smin pa'i cha yang gang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'bras bu nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i cha yang gang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'bras bu nyid du bstan to //
translated: The aspect of maturation is indicated by the words ‚Äúthe so-called ƒÅlaya consciousness‚Äù and so on, which show it to be a result.

original: bag chags kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: bag chags kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the latent impressions,

original: bag chags zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bag chags zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the root text states, ‚ÄúWhat is a latent impression?‚Äù and so on.

original: chos mthun pa gang gis na bag chags zhes bya /
analyzed: chos mthun pa gang gis na bag chags zhes bya /
translated: What is the similarity of dharmas that is called a latent impression?

original: bag chags de ni ci yin zhes dri bag nyis kyi don yin no //
analyzed: bag chags de ni ci yin zhes dri bag nyis kyi don yin no //
translated: What is the nature of a latent impression?

original: bsgo bar bya ba kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de sgo bar byed pa'i chos rnams dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag par gyur nas sgo bar byed pa'i chos de rnams kyis ma 'ongs pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa ni bag chags te /
analyzed: bsgo bar bya ba kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de sgo bar byed pa'i chos rnams dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag par gyur nas sgo bar byed pa'i chos de rnams kyis ma 'ongs pa skye ba'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa ni bag chags te /
translated: The ƒÅlaya consciousness, which is to be imprinted, arises and ceases together with the dharmas that imprint it. The dharmas that imprint it become the cause for the arising of future latent impressions.

original: dper na 'jig rten na til rnams me tog dang phrad nas lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pa la brten nas de dang 'dra ba'i dri 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ba lta bu 'am /
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten na til rnams me tog dang phrad nas lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pa la brten nas de dang 'dra ba'i dri 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ba lta bu 'am /
translated: For example, in the world, when sesame seeds come into contact with flowers, the cause for the arising of a similar scent is the arising and ceasing of the sesame seeds together with the flowers.

original: dper na bstan bcos la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa mang du thos pas yongs su bsdus pa dran pa dang shes rab la sogs pa dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag par 'gyur ba'i sems de dag dang 'dra ba skye ba'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ba bag chags yin pa
analyzed: dper na bstan bcos la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa mang du thos pas yongs su bsdus pa dran pa dang shes rab la sogs pa dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag par 'gyur ba'i sems de dag dang 'dra ba skye ba'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ba bag chags yin pa
translated: For example, in the treatise, the mind that arises and ceases together with the factors associated with the side of affliction such as attachment and the factors associated with the side of purification such as mindfulness and wisdom that are included in listening to much Dharma is the cause for the arising of similar minds.

original: lta bu'o // 'dir yang skad cig ma'i bye brag la bsgo bar bya ba dang sgo bar byed pa nyid dgag pa chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyun gyi tshul du kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nyid rnam par gzhag la /
analyzed: lta bu'o // 'dir yang skad cig ma'i bye brag la bsgo bar bya ba dang sgo bar byed pa nyid dgag pa chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyun gyi tshul du kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nyid rnam par gzhag la /
translated: Here, the foundation consciousness is posited as the cause for the arising of similar minds because the act of being the object of the command and the act of being the commander are negated in terms of the specific moments.

original: rang gi tshogs dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems la pha rol bag chags khas len du bcug la /
analyzed: rang gi tshogs dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems la pha rol bag chags khas len du bcug la /
translated: The mind associated with its own collection is made to accept the latent impressions of the other.

original: lhan cig 'byung zhing 'gags na zhes brjod do //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung zhing 'gags na zhes brjod do //
translated: When they arise and cease together,

original: de 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: the reason for their arising is called a latent impression.

original: dri ba gnyis pa'i lan yin no //
analyzed: dri ba gnyis pa'i lan yin no //
translated: This is the answer to the second question.

original: sgo bar byed pa'i mthun pa nyid kyis bag chags zhes bya bas shugs kyi sa ni dri ba dang po'i lan yang yin no //
analyzed: sgo bar byed pa'i mthun pa nyid kyis bag chags zhes bya bas shugs kyi sa ni dri ba dang po'i lan yang yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúlatent impression‚Äù itself, as a synonym for ‚Äúthat which causes the door to open,‚Äù also implies the answer to the first question.

original: 'di la rnam par rtog pa gsum ste /üîΩkha cig na re bag chags ni sgo bar byed pa la ni mi ltos par chos nyid @328b kyi gnas la 'dod chags la sogs pa la lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pas ni yongs su gso ba 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi skye ba ni ma yin no
analyzed: 'di la rnam par rtog pa gsum ste / kha cig na re bag chags ni sgo bar byed pa la ni mi ltos par chos nyid @328b kyi gnas la 'dod chags la sogs pa la lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pas ni yongs su gso ba 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi skye ba ni ma yin no
translated: There are three theories about this.

original: zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: Latent impressions are not dependent on that which causes the door to open. They are asserted to be the natural state of things. Arisen and ceased desire and so on are merely nourished, but they are not born.

original: de ni de ltar yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar yin te /
translated: This is so.

original: 'di ltar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid ni rang bzhin gyi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid ni rang bzhin gyi rigs te /
translated: Thus, the cause of the arising of the ƒÅlaya consciousness and the ƒÅrya path is the naturally existing lineage.

original: rgyu'i rkyen nyid du bag chags yin par khas len na /
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen nyid du bag chags yin par khas len na /
translated: If you accept that the imprints are the causal condition,

original: de dag ni lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pas rang gi bag chags skyed bar mi srid de /
analyzed: de dag ni lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pas rang gi bag chags skyed bar mi srid de /
translated: then it is impossible for them to generate their own imprints because they arise and cease simultaneously.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gnyis phrad pa med pa'i phyir dang 'phags pa'i lam yang 'dris pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gnyis phrad pa med pa'i phyir dang 'phags pa'i lam yang 'dris pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the ƒÅlaya consciousnesses do not meet each other and because the ƒÅrya path is not familiar with the ƒÅlaya consciousness.

original: yongs su gso bar byed pan mi 'dra bar yang 'gyur bas de ni mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: yongs su gso bar byed pan mi 'dra bar yang 'gyur bas de ni mi 'gal lo //
translated: But it is not contradictory for them to be the cause of the arising of other imprints because they are different from those that are being nurtured.

original: gzhan dag ni til la sogs pa la bag chags sgo bar byed pa la ltos pas mthong nas sgo bar byed pas sngon med pa skye ba dang / sgo bar byed pas sngon bskyed pa yongs su gso bar yang 'dod de nang gi skye mched la dmigs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de'i khongs su gtogs pa kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la yang dmigs par 'dra bas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa bskyed
analyzed: gzhan dag ni til la sogs pa la bag chags sgo bar byed pa la ltos pas mthong nas sgo bar byed pas sngon med pa skye ba dang / sgo bar byed pas sngon bskyed pa yongs su gso bar yang 'dod de nang gi skye mched la dmigs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de'i khongs su gtogs pa kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la yang dmigs par 'dra bas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa bskyed
translated: Others assert that since imprints are established in sesame seeds and so on in dependence on being established, they are generated anew by seeing and established and that previously generated seeds are sustained by being established.

original: par bya ba la bag chags rgyu'i rkyen du gyur pa skyed par yang sems so //
analyzed: par bya ba la bag chags rgyu'i rkyen du gyur pa skyed par yang sems so //
translated: Since the mental consciousness that focuses on internal bases is similar in focusing on the foundation consciousness that is included in it, it is also considered to be the cause of generating the foundation consciousness.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi rigs kyang zag pa med pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi rigs kyang zag pa med pa'i lam gyi bdag nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: The potential of the ƒÅrya path is not the nature of the uncontaminated path.

original: 'on kyang rgyud gang la nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon srab pa'i phyir spang du rung ba de ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyud gang la nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon srab pa'i phyir spang du rung ba de ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yin la /
translated: However, the potential of a bodhisattva is a mindstream in which the seeds of afflictive obscurations and the seeds of the obscurations to omniscience are weak and can be eliminated.

original: gang la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i sa bon yod pa de nyid nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs yin /
analyzed: gang la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i sa bon yod pa de nyid nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs yin /
translated: Those who possess the seeds of the afflictive obstructions are of the sravaka or pratyekabuddha lineage.
