original: gang la gnyi ga'i sa bon che ba'i phyir spang du mi rung ba yod pa de ni rigs med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la gnyi ga'i sa bon che ba'i phyir spang du mi rung ba yod pa de ni rigs med pa yin no //
translated: Those who possess the seeds of both are not suitable to abandon either and are of no lineage.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi skad cig ma dang po la ni rgyu'i rkyen med do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi skad cig ma dang po la ni rgyu'i rkyen med do //
translated: The first moment of the arya path has no causal condition.

original: rkyen gzhi zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srid par gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rkyen gzhi zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srid par gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The basis of the condition is said to be the dharmadhatu because it is stated as it exists.

original: gzhan dag na re bag chags ni chos nyid kyis gnas pa yongs su gso bar bya ba dang / sngon med pa bskyed par bya ba yang yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bag chags ni chos nyid kyis gnas pa yongs su gso bar bya ba dang / sngon med pa bskyed par bya ba yang yin te /
translated: Others say that imprints are both the natural state of phenomena that is to be sustained and that which is to be generated that was not previously existent.

original: bskyed pa'i bag chags du ma ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu nyid kyi chos nyid bag chags kyi bdag po'i rkyen yin la /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i bag chags du ma ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu nyid kyi chos nyid bag chags kyi bdag po'i rkyen yin la /
translated: Many generated imprints are the dominant condition of the imprint that is the natural state of phenomena, which is the coemergent cause.

original: chos nyid kyi bag chags gang yin pa dang / sngon med pa bskyed pa @329a * //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi bag chags gang yin pa dang / sngon med pa bskyed pa @329a * //
translated: The imprint that is the natural state of phenomena and that which is generated that was not previously existent are the objective condition of the first moment of the arya path.

original: pa'i bag chags du ma yang bye brag tu smra ba brtags pa skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu bzhin du skad cig ma gcig pa'i 'bras bu skye ba'i yang rgyu'i rkyen nyid du sems so //
analyzed: pa'i bag chags du ma yang bye brag tu smra ba brtags pa skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu bzhin du skad cig ma gcig pa'i 'bras bu skye ba'i yang rgyu'i rkyen nyid du sems so //
translated: and the many latent impressions of the various actions are the causal condition for the arising of the result that is simultaneous with them, like the specific investigation of the cause of the same fortune.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa dang po la gleng bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa dang po la gleng bar bya ste /
translated: Here, the first conception should be discussed.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni yongs su gso ba tsam du nye bar gnas pa'i phyir rgyu'i rkyen du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni yongs su gso ba tsam du nye bar gnas pa'i phyir rgyu'i rkyen du mi 'grub ste /
translated: Attachment and so on are not established as causal conditions because they merely exist as the complete nourishment of the seeds.

original: dper na 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba 'di la 'du byed rnam par shes pa'i sa bon yongs su gso bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir bdag po'i rkyen nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba 'di la 'du byed rnam par shes pa'i sa bon yongs su gso bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir bdag po'i rkyen nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in this statement ‚Äúconsciousness is conditioned by formations,‚Äù formations are the dominant condition because they nourish the seed of consciousness.

original: 'o na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gnyis pa la gang gi rkyen zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gnyis pa la gang gi rkyen zhes bya zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then in the second dependent origination, what is the condition for ignorance?

original: bdag po'i rkyen to zhes 'byung ba'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen to zhes 'byung ba'i yang phyir te /
translated: It is the dominant condition, because it is stated that way.

original: des na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ji lta ba de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyang rgyu'i rkyen yin no zhes bya ba 'di 'gal lo //üîΩde ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ji lta ba de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyang rgyu'i rkyen yin no zhes bya ba 'di 'gal lo // de ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, it is contradictory to say that afflicted phenomena are causal conditions in the same way that the foundation consciousness is.

original: rigs mthun pa'i sa bon yongs su gsos pas rgyu'i rkyen nyid yin te /
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i sa bon yongs su gsos pas rgyu'i rkyen nyid yin te /
translated: That is not so, because the causal condition is the seed of a homogeneous continuum that is activated.

original: dper na bye brag tu smra ba'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu rdzas gzhan nyid skal ba mnyam pa'i phyir rdzas gzhan gyi yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bye brag tu smra ba'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu rdzas gzhan nyid skal ba mnyam pa'i phyir rdzas gzhan gyi yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that the homogeneous cause is a substantial entity that is different from the homogeneous result, but it is not a substantial entity that is different from the homogeneous cause.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni mi 'dra ba'i bag chags yongs su gsos pa'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni mi 'dra ba'i bag chags yongs su gsos pa'i phyir yin no //
translated: The dominant condition is the activation of the latent impressions of dissimilar states.

original: 'on te til la sogs pa la de lta bu ma mthong ba'i phyir ji ltar chos nyid kyi gnas pa'i bag chags su 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te til la sogs pa la de lta bu ma mthong ba'i phyir ji ltar chos nyid kyi gnas pa'i bag chags su 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But since this is not seen in sesame seeds and so on, how can it be a latent impression that abides by the power of phenomena?

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: sgog skya'i rngo la sogs pa la me tog dang phrad kyang de'i dri mi 'dzin pa snang ba'i phyir til la sogs pa la chos nyid kho nas dri 'dzin pa'i nus pa yod do zhes bya bar shes so ;
analyzed: sgog skya'i rngo la sogs pa la me tog dang phrad kyang de'i dri mi 'dzin pa snang ba'i phyir til la sogs pa la chos nyid kho nas dri 'dzin pa'i nus pa yod do zhes bya bar shes so ;
translated: Because it is seen that garlic and so on do not smell even when they come into contact with flowers, it is understood that sesame seeds and so on have the capacity to smell by their intrinsic reality alone.

original: ; gzhan yang sems dang sems las byung ba las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir til la sogs pa ni med pa kho na'i /
analyzed: ; gzhan yang sems dang sems las byung ba las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir til la sogs pa ni med pa kho na'i /
translated: Moreover, because there are no things that are not mind and mental factors, sesame seeds and so on do not exist at all.

original: 'jig rten gyi grags par bag chags kyi rten nyid du grags pas bag chags 'byung ba la sogs pa'i dpe tsam du byas pa 'ba' zhig tu zad na na ji ltar de dang 'dra bar thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi grags par bag chags kyi rten nyid du grags pas bag chags 'byung ba la sogs pa'i dpe tsam du byas pa 'ba' zhig tu zad na na ji ltar de dang 'dra bar thal bar 'gyur /
translated: If they are merely used as examples of the arising of latent propensities because they are renowned as the basis of latent propensities in the world, then how could they be similar to the self?

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa la yang kha cig gleng ba /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa la yang kha cig gleng ba /
translated: In response to the second conception, some say:

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gzhan dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir de skye ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi bag chags su mi 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gzhan dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir de skye ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi bag chags su mi 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: The storehouse consciousness does not arise and cease simultaneously with another storehouse consciousness, and therefore the other consciousnesses do not plant seeds in it.

original: @329b dmigs pa 'dra ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas bag chags bskyed do zhes bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: @329b dmigs pa 'dra ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas bag chags bskyed do zhes bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But hasn‚Äôt it been explained that the mental consciousness that has a similar object plants seeds?

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not reasonable.

original: dmigs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of objects:

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid rdzas dang / gzugs kyi bdag nyid rdzas su med pa'o //üîΩde la sems dang sems las byung ba la dmigs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa des ni /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid rdzas dang / gzugs kyi bdag nyid rdzas su med pa'o // de la sems dang sems las byung ba la dmigs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa des ni /
translated: those that are substantial, having the nature of mind and mental activities, and those that are insubstantial, having the nature of form.

original: de dag kho na bskyed par bya ba'i phyir bag chags skyed la /
analyzed: de dag kho na bskyed par bya ba'i phyir bag chags skyed la /
translated: The mental consciousness that has as its object mind and mental activities plants seeds in the storehouse consciousness in order to generate those.

original: gzugs la dmigs pa gang yin pa des kyang de kho na bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la dmigs pa gang yin pa des kyang de kho na bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mental consciousness that has form as its object plants seeds in the storehouse consciousness in order to generate that.

original: sems tsam nyid kyi lugs kyis ni gnyi ga ltar yang dmigs pa dang rnam pa ma grub pa'i phyir ji ltar na dmigs pa'i sgo nas 'dra bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sems tsam nyid kyi lugs kyis ni gnyi ga ltar yang dmigs pa dang rnam pa ma grub pa'i phyir ji ltar na dmigs pa'i sgo nas 'dra bar 'gyur /
translated: In the CittamƒÅtra system, both are not established as objects or aspects. So how could they be similar in terms of their objects?

original: 'on te mngon sum du dmigs pa dang brgyud pa'i sgo nas gzhan du rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum du dmigs pa dang brgyud pa'i sgo nas gzhan du rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Or, there are two types of objects: direct objects and indirect objects.

original: de la mngon sum gyi dmigs pa ni gzung ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mngon sum gyi dmigs pa ni gzung ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The direct object is the aspect of the object that is apprehended.

original: brgyud pa'i dmigs pa ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: brgyud pa'i dmigs pa ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The indirect object is the foundation consciousness.

original: de'i dbang gis gzung ba'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis gzung ba'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the appearance of the aspect of the object is due to the power of that.

original: de bas na brgyud pa'i dmigs pa'i sgo nas rdzas su yod pa la dmigs pa ni ji ltar na dmigs pa'i sgo nas mi 'dra snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de bas na brgyud pa'i dmigs pa'i sgo nas rdzas su yod pa la dmigs pa ni ji ltar na dmigs pa'i sgo nas mi 'dra snyam du sems na /
translated: Therefore, if you think, ‚ÄúHow could the object that is substantially existent in terms of the indirect object be different in terms of the direct object?‚Äù

original: rtog pa 'di la yang gzhan gyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i dbang gis kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su 'dzin par skyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa 'di la yang gzhan gyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i dbang gis kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su 'dzin par skyed pa'i phyir /
translated: In this conception, the mental consciousness is also generated to apprehend the object and its aspect due to the power of the mind and mental factors.

original: des bskyed pa'i bag chags gzhan gyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen du 'gyur bas sems can thams cad rgyud gcig pa nyid du thal par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des bskyed pa'i bag chags gzhan gyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen du 'gyur bas sems can thams cad rgyud gcig pa nyid du thal par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the habitual tendencies produced by that would be the causal condition of other minds and mental factors, it would follow that all sentient beings would have a single continuum.

original: rgyud de dmigs pa nyid yin na yang dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang rnam pa mi 'dra ba de'i so na 'dug go //
analyzed: rgyud de dmigs pa nyid yin na yang dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang rnam pa mi 'dra ba de'i so na 'dug go //
translated: And if that continuum were the objective support, the difference between objective supports and aspects would remain, because the objective support and the aspect are not fully established.

original: gang yang rang bzhin gyi rigs nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa srab pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang rang bzhin gyi rigs nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa srab pa yin no //
translated: And it is also not tenable that the naturally existing gene is the causal condition of the path of the noble ones, because the naturally existing gene is weak in terms of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience.

original: 'phags pa'i lam la rgyu'i rkyen med do zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam la rgyu'i rkyen med do zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not reasonable to say that the path of the noble ones has no causal condition,

original: rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs ni skye mched drug gi khyad par ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / sde ba thams cad las kyang sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad rkyen bzhis skye bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rigs ni skye mched drug gi khyad par ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / sde ba thams cad las kyang sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad rkyen bzhis skye bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that the naturally existing gene is a special case of the six sense spheres, and because all schools agree that all minds and mental factors arise from four conditions.

original: rnam par gtan @330a * //
analyzed: rnam par gtan @330a * //
translated: The Compendium of Ascertainments says:

original: la dbab pa bsdu ba las 'byung ba ni sgrib pa'i sa bon srab pa nyid kyi chos nyid kyi sa bon zag pa med pa yod pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa yongs su brtag par nus so //
analyzed: la dbab pa bsdu ba las 'byung ba ni sgrib pa'i sa bon srab pa nyid kyi chos nyid kyi sa bon zag pa med pa yod pa nyid du bstan pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa yongs su brtag par nus so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe seeds of the obscurations are the seeds of the dharmadhƒÅtu, which is the nature of the subtle existence of the seeds of the uncontaminated.‚Äù

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid kyi le'u yi ge dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid kyi le'u yi ge dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: The chapter on sameness and difference is from the perspective of the seeds.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyi sa bon de dag ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyi sa bon de dag ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The seeds of the afflicted phenomena and the all-base consciousness are the same and different.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi sa bon dag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi sa bon dag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The seeds of the afflicted phenomena are the seeds of the phenomena that are associated with the contaminants.

original: zag pa med pa'i sa bon dag kyang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sa bon dag kyang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Don‚Äôt the seeds of the uncontaminated also exist?

original: 'di la rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa smra ba rnams na re /
analyzed: 'di la rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa smra ba rnams na re /
translated: In this regard, the proponents of the second conception say:

original: so so'i skye bo'i rgyud kyi chos kyi sa bon dag gi dbang du mdzad nas bshad pa yin na /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i rgyud kyi chos kyi sa bon dag gi dbang du mdzad nas bshad pa yin na /
translated: This explanation is from the perspective of the seeds of the phenomena in the continuum of an ordinary being.

original: de dag la ni zag pa med pa'i sa bon yang med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de dag la ni zag pa med pa'i sa bon yang med do zhes zer ro //
translated: They do not have the seeds of the uncontaminated.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not correct,

original: rnam par rtog pa de spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is in order to abandon that conception.

original: de lta bas na so so'i skye bo'i rgyud la sa bon gang dag dag sde pa dag las grags pa de dag gi dbang du mdzad nas bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na so so'i skye bo'i rgyud la sa bon gang dag dag sde pa dag las grags pa de dag gi dbang du mdzad nas bshad pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the seeds that are in the continuum of an ordinary being are explained from the perspective of those that are known in the treatises of the sects.

original: sde pa dag las ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon grags so //
analyzed: sde pa dag las ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon grags so //
translated: The seeds of the contaminated are known in the treatises of the sects.

original: yang na zag pa med pa'i sa bon 'chad par 'gyur ba kun gzhi ma yin pa zhig bya ba las kun gzhi'i rnam par shes par bsdus pa gang yin pa de'i dbang du mdzad pa de bshad pa yin pas nyes pa med do //üîΩso so'i tha dad dam zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa las rdzas su gzhan pa nyid du gnas pa zhig gam /
analyzed: yang na zag pa med pa'i sa bon 'chad par 'gyur ba kun gzhi ma yin pa zhig bya ba las kun gzhi'i rnam par shes par bsdus pa gang yin pa de'i dbang du mdzad pa de bshad pa yin pas nyes pa med do // so so'i tha dad dam zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa las rdzas su gzhan pa nyid du gnas pa zhig gam /
translated: Or, the seeds of the uncontaminated are included in the foundation consciousness, which is not the foundation consciousness that is explained as the cause of the contaminated. Therefore, there is no fault.üîΩAre they different?

original: gal te de ltar gzhan nyid gcig yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te de ltar gzhan nyid gcig yin na ni /
translated: If they are different,

original: gzugs ni bsal ba'i phyir sa bon de dag sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs ni bsal ba'i phyir sa bon de dag sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the seeds are the nature of mind and mental factors.

original: des ma rten gcig la yang sems can gyi rgyud mang po zhig tu thal bar 'gyur ro //üîΩji ltar skad cig ma gcig la sems dang sems las byung ba mang po zhig 'byung la /
analyzed: des ma rten gcig la yang sems can gyi rgyud mang po zhig tu thal bar 'gyur ro // ji ltar skad cig ma gcig la sems dang sems las byung ba mang po zhig 'byung la /
translated: If that is so, then it follows that in one body there would be many mind-streams.üîΩJust as many minds and mental factors arise in one moment,

original: rgyud du ma nyid kyang ma yin pa lta bu ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyud du ma nyid kyang ma yin pa lta bu ma yin zhe na /
translated: and yet there is not a multiplicity of mind-streams.

original: 'di la ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'di la ni nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault here.

original: sems las byung ba rnams la rag las te 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams la rag las te 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they arise in dependence on mental factors.

original: 'o na ji ltar skad cig ma gcig la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa bdun 'byung la /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar skad cig ma gcig la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa bdun 'byung la /
translated: Well then, how is it that in one moment seven consciousnesses arise,

original: rgyud du ma nyid kyang ma yin pa lta bu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyud du ma nyid kyang ma yin pa lta bu yin no zhe na /
translated: and yet there is not a multiplicity of mind-streams?

original: 'di la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'di la nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault here.

original: de dag ni kun gzhi rnam par shes @330b pa gcig la rag las te 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni kun gzhi rnam par shes @330b pa gcig la rag las te 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they arise in dependence on one foundation consciousness.

original: sa bon rnams ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid gcig yin na /
analyzed: sa bon rnams ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid gcig yin na /
translated: If the seeds are of the same nature as mind and mental factors,

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa las rang dbang du gnas pa'i phyir rgyud du mar thal pa so na 'dug go //
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa las rang dbang du gnas pa'i phyir rgyud du mar thal pa so na 'dug go //
translated: then the consequence is that there are many mind-streams, because the seeds exist independently of the store consciousness.

original: 'on te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las sa bon rnams tha mi dad pa zhig du gyur na ni /
analyzed: 'on te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las sa bon rnams tha mi dad pa zhig du gyur na ni /
translated: But if the seeds are not different from the store consciousness,

original: de ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: then, because the store consciousness is unobscured and undefined,

original: sa bon rnams kyang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pas ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i chos 'byung ba kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sa bon rnams kyang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pas ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i chos 'byung ba kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: the seeds would be unobscured and undefined. Only unobscured and undefined dharmas would occur,

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos 'byung bar ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos 'byung bar ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: and it would be impossible for good and bad dharmas to occur from unobscured and undefined seeds.

original: de ltar phyogs gnyi ga la yang nyes pa gnyis snang bas /
analyzed: de ltar phyogs gnyi ga la yang nyes pa gnyis snang bas /
translated: Thus, both positions have the fault of being untenable.

original: de la gnas pa de dag dang rdzas su tha dad pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la gnas pa de dag dang rdzas su tha dad pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, the seeds are neither the same as nor different from the actual mind.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa rnams yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa rnams yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are not described as being the same as or different from the foundation consciousness.

original: de lta bur grags pa gzhan yang chud zad lta yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bur grags pa gzhan yang chud zad lta yod dam zhe na /
translated: Are there any other such examples that are well known?

original: smras pa yod de dper na bye brag tu smra ba'i da ltar gyi rdzas la 'bras bu 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: smras pa yod de dper na bye brag tu smra ba'i da ltar gyi rdzas la 'bras bu 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid lta bu'o //
translated: Yes, for example, the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika assertion that the present substance has the characteristic of holding its effect.

original: de ni rdzas las gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rdzas las gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not different from substance because

original: rdzas byed pas stong pa'i phyir da ltar ma yin par thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
analyzed: rdzas byed pas stong pa'i phyir da ltar ma yin par thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
translated: it would follow, absurdly, that the present would not be substance since it would be empty of the function of substance.

original: gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not nondifferent because

original: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid las tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus na yang byed pa yod pas da ltar nyid du thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
analyzed: rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid las tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'das pa'i dus na yang byed pa yod pas da ltar nyid du thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
translated: it would follow, absurdly, that the present would be the past since it would not be different from the defining characteristic of substance.

original: yang dper na mdo sde pa'i gzugs med pa'i khams su 'phags pa zag pa med pa'i sems mngon du gyur na /
analyzed: yang dper na mdo sde pa'i gzugs med pa'i khams su 'phags pa zag pa med pa'i sems mngon du gyur na /
translated: Again, for example, the SautrƒÅntika assertion that when the ƒÅrya‚Äôs uncontaminated mind manifests in the formless realm,

original: sems de las kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon rnams de nyid du brjod par bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sems de las kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon rnams de nyid du brjod par bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And the seeds of affliction cannot be said to be in that mind itself,

original: de dang 'dra bar zag pa med pa nyid du thal par 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar zag pa med pa nyid du thal par 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be free of contaminants just like that.

original: gzhan nyid du yang brjod par bya ba ma yin te //
analyzed: gzhan nyid du yang brjod par bya ba ma yin te //
translated: Nor can they be said to be different from it,

original: snga ma bzhin du rgyud du mar thal bar 'gyur du 'ong ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rgyud du mar thal bar 'gyur du 'ong ba lta bu yin no //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that there would be many mind streams just as before.

original: de bzhin du grub pa'i mtha' gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du grub pa'i mtha' gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to other tenet systems.

original: mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbut‚Äù and so on

original: don de nyid kyi mjug sdud cing sa bon gyi rang bzhin ngo bo ston to //
analyzed: don de nyid kyi mjug sdud cing sa bon gyi rang bzhin ngo bo ston to //
translated: concludes that point and indicates the nature of the seeds.

original: 'byung ba'i mthu yi khyad par can //üîΩzhes bya ba 'dis ni mthu'i khyad par yin pa'i @331a * //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i mthu yi khyad par can // zhes bya ba 'dis ni mthu'i khyad par yin pa'i @331a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe special power of arising‚Äù

original: phyir ; kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyir ; kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: indicates that the seeds are not of the nature of the foundation consciousness because they are a special power.

original: de bzhin du 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the same way‚ÄùüîΩindicates that the seeds are not of the nature of the foundation consciousness because they are a special power.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it other than the consciousness of the store-consciousness,

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa kho na rgyur byas nas ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa kho na rgyur byas nas ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: for it is only the consciousness of the store-consciousness that is the cause.

original: / sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: / sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: The expression ‚Äúcontaining all the seeds‚Äù shows that

original: de lta bu'i sa bon gyi sa bon thams cad ba zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sa bon gyi sa bon thams cad ba zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: it is the seed of such a seed, and that it contains all the seeds.

original: phan tshun rkyen gyi le'u'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: phan tshun rkyen gyi le'u'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With reference to the chapter on the conditionality of mutual dependence,

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúthe consciousness of the store-consciousness, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang kun rtas nyon mongs pa zhes smos pa ni snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang kun rtas nyon mongs pa zhes smos pa ni snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: Here, too, the expression ‚Äúthe store-consciousness is afflicted‚Äù should be explained as before.

original: mdo sde pa yang 'di la de bzhin du rgol zhing rtog ste /
analyzed: mdo sde pa yang 'di la de bzhin du rgol zhing rtog ste /
translated: The Sautrantikas also argue and speculate in this way.

original: de'i ltar na rkyen skad cig ma tha dad par rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: de'i ltar na rkyen skad cig ma tha dad par rnam par 'jog go //
translated: Thus, they posit the conditions as being different moments.

original: de gal te dus mi mnyam pa dag kho na rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin no zhes sgrub kyang rung /
analyzed: de gal te dus mi mnyam pa dag kho na rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin no zhes sgrub kyang rung /
translated: If they establish that cause and effect are only at different times,

original: 'on te dus mnyam pa dag 'gog kyang rung ste /
analyzed: 'on te dus mnyam pa dag 'gog kyang rung ste /
translated: But if you refute them as simultaneous,

original: gnyi ga ltar na yang ma nges pa nyid du rab du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar na yang ma nges pa nyid du rab du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: then in both cases, the refutation is inconclusive.üîΩThe example of the flame and the torch

original: me lce dang tshig pa dang mdung khyim dag bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: me lce dang tshig pa dang mdung khyim dag bshad par bya'o //
translated: is to be explained in the same way.

original: de la re zhig tshig pa snga la me lce 'phyi ba ni ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar tshig pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig tshig pa snga la me lce 'phyi ba ni ma yin te / 'di ltar tshig pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: First, the torch is not prior to the flame,üîΩbecause the torch

original: bud shing mes byas pa'i 'gyur ba yin no //üîΩde lta bas na me lce med par sngar tshig pa med do //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir me lce 'phyi ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bud shing mes byas pa'i 'gyur ba yin no // de lta bas na me lce med par sngar tshig pa med do // de nyid kyi phyir me lce 'phyi ba yang ma yin no //
translated: is a transformation of the fuel caused by the flame.üîΩTherefore, the torch is not prior to the flame.üîΩFor the same reason, the flame is not prior to the torch.

original: de bzhin du me lce snga la tshig pa 'phyi ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du me lce snga la tshig pa 'phyi ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And the torch is not prior to the flame,

original: 'bar ba bzhin du bud shing 'gyur ba med par thal par 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
analyzed: 'bar ba bzhin du bud shing 'gyur ba med par thal par 'gyur du 'ong bas so //
translated: because the fuel would be transformed without the flame.

original: ji ltar na bud shing ma tshig pa kho nar me lce'i rten du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar na bud shing ma tshig pa kho nar me lce'i rten du 'gyur te /
translated: How could the fuel be the basis of the flame if it were not burning?

original: de lta bas na tshig pa dang me lce dag ni dus mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na tshig pa dang me lce dag ni dus mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the torch and the flame are simultaneous.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: The consciousness of the store-consciousness is twofold:

original: sa bon gyi char bsdus pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i char bsdus pa dang rnam pa gnyis zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sa bon gyi char bsdus pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i char bsdus pa dang rnam pa gnyis zhes bshad do //
translated: it is included in the seed-aspect and it is included in the maturation-aspect.

original: sa bon yang rnam par rtog pa gsum pa ltar na snying dang skyed pa dang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: sa bon yang rnam par rtog pa gsum pa ltar na snying dang skyed pa dang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The seed is twofold, like the third concept, the heart and the womb.üîΩIn this regard, the first example is for the sake of establishing the following:

original: de la skad cig ma gang kho na las sa bon snying las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba skad cig ma de kho na la kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la sa bon gsar skyed de /
analyzed: de la skad cig ma gang kho na las sa bon snying las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba skad cig ma de kho na la kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la sa bon gsar skyed de /
translated: In the very moment when the consciousness that has entered the heart arises from the seed, the seed is newly generated in the store-consciousness.

original: gsar dang rnying nyid dbye ba ma byas par spyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon yin la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa @331b yang sa bon gyi rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di dag rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir dpe dang po'o //
analyzed: gsar dang rnying nyid dbye ba ma byas par spyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon yin la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa @331b yang sa bon gyi rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di dag rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir dpe dang po'o //
translated: The seed of the actual consciousness is not distinguished as new or old, but in general it is the seed of the actual consciousness. And the actual consciousness is the cause of the seed.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bo ltar na sa bon gang kho na las 'byung ba de nyid yongs su gso lo zhes bya ba'i don 'dir rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir dngos kho nar dpe dang po'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bo ltar na sa bon gang kho na las 'byung ba de nyid yongs su gso lo zhes bya ba'i don 'dir rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir dngos kho nar dpe dang po'o //
translated: In the first case, the first example is given in order to establish the meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThat very seed which produces the consciousness is that which nourishes it.‚Äù

original: rnam par smin par bsdus pa gang yin pa de ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yin la /
analyzed: rnam par smin par bsdus pa gang yin pa de ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i yin la /
translated: That which is included in the fruitions is the consciousness that is the foundation consciousness.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa yang rnam par smin pa bsdus pa'i bdag po'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa yang rnam par smin pa bsdus pa'i bdag po'i rkyen yin te /
translated: And the consciousness that is the foundation consciousness is the dominant condition for the consciousnesses that are its fruitions.

original: phan tshun rag las te 'byung ba'i phyir bye brag tu smra ba'i tshe la sogs pa phan tshun lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di rab tu 'grub par bya ba'i phyir mdung khyim gyi dpe'o //
analyzed: phan tshun rag las te 'byung ba'i phyir bye brag tu smra ba'i tshe la sogs pa phan tshun lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di rab tu 'grub par bya ba'i phyir mdung khyim gyi dpe'o //
translated: The second example of a spear and a bundle of reeds is given in order to establish the meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThey arise in mutual dependence,‚Äù like the life faculty and so on of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas.

original: ji ltar mdung khyim phan tshun bsten pas mi 'gyel pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar mdung khyim phan tshun bsten pas mi 'gyel pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a bundle of reeds does not fall because it is mutually dependent,

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dag phan tshun gyi dbang gis mi 'jig go //
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dag phan tshun gyi dbang gis mi 'jig go //
translated: so too the foundation consciousness and the active forms of consciousness do not disintegrate because of their mutual dependence.

original: 'di yang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa la nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kun du 'chad pa'i phyogs la ni /
analyzed: 'di yang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa la nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kun du 'chad pa'i phyogs la ni /
translated: Also, in the case of the position that the afflicted mind is interrupted in the meditative attainment of cessation, etc.,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: it should be explained as ‚Äúin the state of having contaminants.‚Äù

original: gzhan du gyur pa'i phyogs la ni spyir zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa'i phyogs la ni spyir zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: In the case of the position of transformation, it should be explained as ‚Äúin general.‚Äù

original: de ltar rgyu'i rkyen du rnam par gzhag ste zhes bya ba'i gzhung gang yin pa de na sa bon gyi cha dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dbang du mdzad pa yin no zhes drang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu'i rkyen du rnam par gzhag ste zhes bya ba'i gzhung gang yin pa de na sa bon gyi cha dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dbang du mdzad pa yin no zhes drang bar bya ste /
translated: The passage ‚ÄúThus it is posited as the causal condition‚Äù should be interpreted as referring to the seed part and the consciousness that engages objects.

original: rnam par smin pa'i cha gang yin pa de ni sa bon gyi cha'i rten tsam gyis bdag po'i rkyen yin la sa bon gang yin pa de ni sa bon gyi cha mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rgyu'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i cha gang yin pa de ni sa bon gyi cha'i rten tsam gyis bdag po'i rkyen yin la sa bon gang yin pa de ni sa bon gyi cha mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rgyu'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The part that is karmic maturation is the dominant condition of the seed part alone, and the seed is the causal condition because it is the cause that establishes the seed part.

original: sa bon rnam pa gsum zhes bshad pa de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i bag chags kyi sa bon gang yin pa de ni dus mnyam pa dang dus mi mnyam pa'i bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: sa bon rnam pa gsum zhes bshad pa de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i bag chags kyi sa bon gang yin pa de ni dus mnyam pa dang dus mi mnyam pa'i bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The three seeds that were explained are as follows: The seed of the latent afflictions of the view of the self is the dominant condition of the same time period and of different time periods.

original: srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags kyi sa bon gang yin pa de ni dus mi mnyam pa kho na'i bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags kyi sa bon gang yin pa de ni dus mi mnyam pa kho na'i bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The seed of the latent afflictions of the branches of existence is the dominant condition of different time periods alone.

original: spros pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon rgyu'i rkyen ces bya ba bshad pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: spros pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon rgyu'i rkyen ces bya ba bshad pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The seed of the latent afflictions of proliferation is the causal condition.

original: kha cig na re dus mnyam pa nyid du gcig gi rgyu nyid du gcig gi rgyu nyid du gcig 'gyur zhes 'byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: kha cig na re dus mnyam pa nyid du gcig gi rgyu nyid du gcig gi rgyu nyid du gcig 'gyur zhes 'byung ba'i phyir //
translated: Some say: It is a condition of the same time period because it is said, ‚ÄúOne thing becomes the cause of another thing.‚Äù

original: dus mnyam pa kho na'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: dus mnyam pa kho na'i rkyen yin te /
translated: It is a condition of the same time period alone.

original: 'bras bu da ltar 'byung ba yin na /
analyzed: 'bras bu da ltar 'byung ba yin na /
translated: If the effect occurs in the present,

original: 'das pa ni med pas nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du rgyu nyid @332a * //
analyzed: 'das pa ni med pas nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du rgyu nyid @332a * //
translated: the past does not exist, and it is like a sky flower.

original: du mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / rgyu da ltar byung ba yin na 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni med pas 'bras bu nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: du mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / rgyu da ltar byung ba yin na 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni med pas 'bras bu nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: because it is untenable that a future entity is a cause, and because it is untenable that an effect is a cause, since if the cause is present, that which is to arise does not exist.

original: gzhan dag na re rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las /
translated: Others say: The Compendium of Ascertainment mentions:

original: dus mi mnyam pa kho na'i rkyen du 'byung bas rgyu'i rkyen ni srid pa'i yan lag gi sa bon bzhin du dus mi mnyam pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: dus mi mnyam pa kho na'i rkyen du 'byung bas rgyu'i rkyen ni srid pa'i yan lag gi sa bon bzhin du dus mi mnyam pa kho na yin no //
translated: The causal condition is only a different time because it arises as a condition of a different time, like the seed of a branch of existence.

original: dus mnyam du gcig gi rgyu nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni 'di ltar drang ste /
analyzed: dus mnyam du gcig gi rgyu nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni 'di ltar drang ste /
translated: That which is said, ‚ÄúThey would be simultaneous causes,‚Äù is interpreted as follows:

original: rgyu sa bon ni da ltar byung ba yin la /üîΩ'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni ma 'ongs pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: rgyu sa bon ni da ltar byung ba yin la / 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni ma 'ongs pa yin mod kyi /
translated: The seed that is the cause is present.üîΩThe effect that is to arise is future.

original: 'on kyang rgyud ltar byung ba gang yin pa de nyid 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyud ltar byung ba gang yin pa de nyid 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: However, that which arises in the continuum is the future effect.

original: de bzhin du 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa skyes pa ni sa bon ma 'ongs pa 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa skyes pa ni sa bon ma 'ongs pa 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: So too, the present consciousness that is the result of the seed is the cause of the future seed that is the result.

original: rgyu da ltar byung ba gang yin pa de nyid 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa yin pas dus mnyam pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rgyu da ltar byung ba gang yin pa de nyid 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa yin pas dus mnyam pa nyid yin te /
translated: Since the present cause is the future result, they are simultaneous.

original: rim pa 'dis na sa bon ni rgyun 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: rim pa 'dis na sa bon ni rgyun 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: In this way, the seed is the cause of the consciousness that is the continuum of the seed.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa yang rgyun 'jug pas sa bon gyi yin pas gcig gi rgyu nyid du gcig 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa yang rgyun 'jug pas sa bon gyi yin pas gcig gi rgyu nyid du gcig 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
translated: Since the present consciousness that is the result of the seed is the cause of the future seed, it is the cause of the seed.

original: dpe gnyis la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dpe gnyis la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The two examples should be applied in this way.

original: kha cig na re dus mnyam du gcig gi rgyu nyid du gcig 'gyur zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las dus mi mnyam pa'i rgyu'i rkyen nyid du 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kha cig na re dus mnyam du gcig gi rgyu nyid du gcig 'gyur zhes 'byung ba'i phyir dang / rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las dus mi mnyam pa'i rgyu'i rkyen nyid du 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Some say: Since it says, ‚ÄúThey become the cause of each other as they are simultaneous,‚Äù and since it is said in the Compendium of Ascertainments that they are the condition by the action of the cause, they are not simultaneous.

original: rgyu'i rkyen ni dus mnyam pa dang dus mi mnyam pa gang yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen ni dus mnyam pa dang dus mi mnyam pa gang yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The causal condition is either simultaneous or not simultaneous.

original: yang re zhig rnam par rtog pa dang po la gleng par bya ste /
analyzed: yang re zhig rnam par rtog pa dang po la gleng par bya ste /
translated: Let us first examine the first hypothesis.

original: sa bon dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dag ni dus mnyam du rgyu'i rkyen nyid du rung ngo //
analyzed: sa bon dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dag ni dus mnyam du rgyu'i rkyen nyid du rung ngo //
translated: The seed and the actual consciousness are simultaneous and are a causal condition.

original: sa bon snga ma ni rgyun 'jug pas sa bon phyi ma'i dus tha dad pa kho na'i rgyu'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: sa bon snga ma ni rgyun 'jug pas sa bon phyi ma'i dus tha dad pa kho na'i rgyu'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The prior seed is the cause of the subsequent seed, since the stream is continuous.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni ma yin te /
translated: The seed is not the dominant condition of the actual consciousness,

original: skal pa mnyam pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the cause of the production of the homogeneous continuum.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yang ma yin te /
translated: The seed is not the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent of the actual consciousness,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not of the nature of mind or mental factors.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen yang ma yin te /
translated: The seed is not the object condition of the actual consciousness,

original: sa bon la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the seed is not the object of the actual consciousness.

original: sa bon rgyun 'jug pas mi 'byung ngo zhes brjod par yang mi nus te /
analyzed: sa bon rgyun 'jug pas mi 'byung ngo zhes brjod par yang mi nus te /
translated: It cannot be said that the actual consciousness does not arise from the seed because the stream is continuous.

original: byas pa chud za bar thal par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa chud za bar thal par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that what is done would perish.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis @332b pa yang gzhung yi ge dang mi mthun par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis @332b pa yang gzhung yi ge dang mi mthun par bshad pa yin te /
translated: The two alternatives are explained in a way that does not accord with the text.

original: gzhung ni sa bon dang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams da ltar byung ba'i dus kho nar dus mnyam pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gzhung ni sa bon dang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams da ltar byung ba'i dus kho nar dus mnyam pa nyid yin la /
translated: The text says that the seed and the dharmas that are defiled are simultaneous only in the present moment.

original: de nyid la gcig gi rgyu nyid du gcig 'gyur bar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid la gcig gi rgyu nyid du gcig 'gyur bar bshad pa yin no //
translated: It says that in that very moment, one becomes the cause of the other.

original: de lta bas na rnam par rtog pa gsum pa kho na bzang ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par rtog pa gsum pa kho na bzang ste /
translated: Therefore, the third alternative is the best.

original: de la rgyu'i rkyen nyid dus mnyam pa ni sa bon dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dag go //
analyzed: de la rgyu'i rkyen nyid dus mnyam pa ni sa bon dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dag go //
translated: In that case, the causal condition is simultaneous, such as the seed and the actual consciousness.

original: dus mi mnyam pa ni sa bon rgyun 'jug pas sa bon gyi'o //
analyzed: dus mi mnyam pa ni sa bon rgyun 'jug pas sa bon gyi'o //
translated: It is not simultaneous, such as the seed and the continuum of the seed.

original: dus mnyam du gcig gi rgyu nyid du gcig 'gyur zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni sa bon dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa phan tshun gyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dus mnyam du gcig gi rgyu nyid du gcig 'gyur zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni sa bon dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa phan tshun gyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: As for the statement that ‚Äúone becomes the cause of the other at the same time,‚Äù this is stated with reference to the seed and the actual consciousness being mutually dependent.

original: gang yang rgyu da ltar byung ba'i yin na 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni med pas 'bras bu nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: gang yang rgyu da ltar byung ba'i yin na 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni med pas 'bras bu nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa ni /
translated: And if it is the effect of a cause that has already arisen, it is not tenable that it is an effect, because that which is to arise does not exist.

original: don dam pa bsam pa la ni de de ltar yang yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa bsam pa la ni de de ltar yang yin no //
translated: In the case of the ultimate, which is the object of thought, this is so.

original: kun rdzob tu ni rgyu rkyen du rnam par gzhag pa dus mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni rgyu rkyen du rnam par gzhag pa dus mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But in the case of the conventional, the arrangement of cause and effect is not in terms of simultaneity or non-simultaneity,

original: sa bon dang myu gu lta bu dang / mar me dang 'od lta bu'o //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu lta bu dang / mar me dang 'od lta bu'o //
translated: like a seed and a sprout, or like a lamp and its light.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / de la rag las pas te 'jug pa'i phyir de lta bur grags so //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / de la rag las pas te 'jug pa'i phyir de lta bur grags so //
translated: And because things and non-things are endowed with that, and because they are dependent on that, they are renowned in that way.

original: don 'di nyid mjug bsdu bar ji ltar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: don 'di nyid mjug bsdu bar ji ltar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: This very point is summarized in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúJust as the consciousness called foundation consciousness‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: 'di la kha cig na re kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i reg pa la sogs pa yang gzung ste /
analyzed: 'di la kha cig na re kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i reg pa la sogs pa yang gzung ste /
translated: Some say: The phenomena of affliction are also the contact, etc. associated with the foundation consciousness, because

original: 'di ltar de dag ni rang gi bag chags 'jog pa na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin la kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yang de dag gi bskyed pa'i sa bon yongs su smin pa'i sgo nas de dag bskyed par bya ba de dag gi yangüîΩrgyu yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni rang gi bag chags 'jog pa na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin la kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yang de dag gi bskyed pa'i sa bon yongs su smin pa'i sgo nas de dag bskyed par bya ba de dag gi yang rgyu yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: when they deposit their own latent ten dencies, they are the cause of the foundation consciousness, and the foundation consciousness is their cause through the maturation of the seeds that generate them.

original: gzhan dag na re de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams ni gzung ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams ni gzung ste /
translated: Others say: The phenomena of affliction are the contact, etc. associated with the foundation consciousness,

original: 'di ltar rnam par smin pa nyid kyis lung du ma bstan pas mi gsal pa'i phyir bag chags skyed mi nus kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par smin pa nyid kyis lung du ma bstan pas mi gsal pa'i phyir bag chags skyed mi nus kyi /
translated: because they are not able to generate latent tendencies because they are not clear, being neutral by way of their maturation alone.

original: las kyi 'phen pa'i dbang kho nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: las kyi 'phen pa'i dbang kho nas 'byung ngo //
translated: They arise only through the power of the impetus of karma.

original: byung ba rnams kyang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu bskyed pa'i phyir bag chags mi 'jog ste /
analyzed: byung ba rnams kyang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu bskyed pa'i phyir bag chags mi 'jog ste /
translated: Also, they do not deposit latent tendencies because they generate the result of natural outflow.

original: 'di ltar las kyi 'phen pa kho nas ma shi'i bar du 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar las kyi 'phen pa kho nas ma shi'i bar du 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, it is said that they occur until death, due to the projection of karma alone.

original: rgyu'i rkyen gzhan @333a * //
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen gzhan @333a * //
translated: The causal condition is not perceived

original: mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba la ma gtogs pa gzugs can dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba la ma gtogs pa gzugs can dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: apart from the mind and mental factors, because form and the non-associated formative forces do not exist as substances.

original: 'di ltar gnyi ga yang rdzas nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba'i gnas skabs dag la gdags so //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyi ga yang rdzas nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba'i gnas skabs dag la gdags so //
translated: Thus, they are imputed in the states of the mind and mental factors, because both are unsuitable as substances.

original: de'i phyir gtsor ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kho na phan tshun rgyu'i rkyen yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtsor ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kho na phan tshun rgyu'i rkyen yin la /
translated: Therefore, primarily the mind and mental factors are the causal condition of each other.

original: de'i sgo nas ni kha cig gzugs can rnams kyang sa bon skyed pa'i rim gyis rgyu'i rkyen nyid du khas len to //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas ni kha cig gzugs can rnams kyang sa bon skyed pa'i rim gyis rgyu'i rkyen nyid du khas len to //
translated: Through that, some accept that even the form realm is the causal condition in the order of producing the seed.

original: gzhan dag ni brtags pa ni med pa dang 'dra'o snyam du khas mi len to //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni brtags pa ni med pa dang 'dra'o snyam du khas mi len to //
translated: Others do not accept that, thinking that imputation is like a non-existent.

original: yang na rgyu'i rkyen gzhan mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sde pa gzhan dag gis kun brtags pa rgyu zhes bya ba rgyu lnga nyid ces bya ba 'di'o //
analyzed: yang na rgyu'i rkyen gzhan mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sde pa gzhan dag gis kun brtags pa rgyu zhes bya ba rgyu lnga nyid ces bya ba 'di'o //
translated: Or else, because another causal condition is not perceived. This is the opinion of other schools that the imagined cause is the five causes.

original: ji ltar mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi dmigs she na /
translated: How is it not perceived?

original: re zhig lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ni phan tshun rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te dus tha mi dad pa nyid la rigs mi mthun pa rnams med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu'i rkyen nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: re zhig lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ni phan tshun rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir ro // gal te dus tha mi dad pa nyid la rigs mi mthun pa rnams med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu'i rkyen nyid yin na ni /
translated: First, co-existent and associated causes are not reciprocal causes, because they are not of the same kind.

original: bdag po'i rkyen tha dad pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen tha dad pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: If something is a causal condition because it is not without a cause when there is a difference in time, then the dominant condition would not be different,üîΩbecause it is not without a cause when there is a difference in time.

original: des na mig la sogs pa yang de dag gi rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na mig la sogs pa yang de dag gi rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the eye, etc., would be causal conditions for the consciousnesses of form, etc.

original: de lta bas na rgyu'i rkyen ni rigs mthun pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyu'i rkyen ni rigs mthun pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa la ltos pa yin no //
translated: Thus, a causal condition is in relation to the production of an effect that is of the same kind.

original: de yang sa bon dang rdzas kyi sgo nas rnam pa gnyis la re zhig sa bon gyi sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang sa bon dang rdzas kyi sgo nas rnam pa gnyis la re zhig sa bon gyi sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the two are not simultaneous in terms of seed and substance.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams pa rang skye bar bya ba'i phyir phan tshun sa bon 'jog pa ni med de /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams pa rang skye bar bya ba'i phyir phan tshun sa bon 'jog pa ni med de /
translated: They are not simultaneous in terms of seed, because coemergent and concomitant states do not mutually establish seeds in order to generate each other.

original: gzugs can rnams dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams gsal ba'i phyir dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la sa bon 'jog pa 'gog pa'i phyir dang / gzhan yang khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs can rnams dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams gsal ba'i phyir dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la sa bon 'jog pa 'gog pa'i phyir dang / gzhan yang khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are not form, they are not concomitant states, they are not established as seeds in the active consciousnesses and they are not accepted by other schools.

original: gzhan ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams rang gi sa bon las 'byung zhing rang gi sa bon 'jog pas lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu zhes so zhes khang mi len to //
analyzed: gzhan ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams rang gi sa bon las 'byung zhing rang gi sa bon 'jog pas lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu zhes so zhes khang mi len to //
translated: Other schools assert that coemergent and concomitant states arise from their own seeds and establish their own seeds, and therefore they are coemergent and concomitant causes.

original: rdzas kyi sgo nas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzas kyi sgo nas kyang ma yin te /
translated: They are not simultaneous in terms of substance, because

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams ni phan tshun rigs tha dad pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams ni phan tshun rigs tha dad pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Coemergent and concomitant causes are not reciprocal causes, because they are of different types.

original: skal pa mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag rgyu'i rkyen nyid @333b du 'gyur na /
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag rgyu'i rkyen nyid @333b du 'gyur na /
translated: If homogeneous and omnipresent causes are the causal condition,

original: rdzas 'dra ba dang sa bon 'dra ba'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis shig tu gyur grang na /
analyzed: rdzas 'dra ba dang sa bon 'dra ba'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis shig tu gyur grang na /
translated: then there are two types of causes: those that are similar in substance and those that are similar as seeds.

original: re zhig rdzas 'dra ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig rdzas 'dra ba ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not similar in substance,üîΩbecause the activity of a person does not exist for those that have long since passed.

original: 'das nas ring zhig lon pa rnams la skyes bu'i byed pa med pa'i phyir dang / skal pa mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba 'gags ma thag pa yang rgyu'i rkyen du rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das nas ring zhig lon pa rnams la skyes bu'i byed pa med pa'i phyir dang / skal pa mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba 'gags ma thag pa yang rgyu'i rkyen du rung ba ma yin te /
translated: Also, the homogeneous and omnipresent causes that have just ceased do not function as the causal condition,

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis 'phangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis 'phangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are projected by the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent.

original: sa bon med par ni dngos po rnams kyi rang gi mngon par 'grub par yang rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sa bon med par ni dngos po rnams kyi rang gi mngon par 'grub par yang rung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible for things to be established from seeds that do not exist.

original: 'gags ma thag pa'i skad cig ma nyid sa bon gyi rten kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gags ma thag pa'i skad cig ma nyid sa bon gyi rten kyang ma yin te /
translated: The moment that has just ceased does not function as the basis of the seed,üîΩbecause the seed is not different from the sprout.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dag la sa bon 'jog pa 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dag la sa bon 'jog pa 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would stop the seeds being placed in the actual consciousnesses.

original: sa bon ni 'bras bu mngon par 'grub par bya ba la nye ba yin na /
analyzed: sa bon ni 'bras bu mngon par 'grub par bya ba la nye ba yin na /
translated: The seed is near to the production of the fruit.

original: de yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa kho na la srid pas de kho na rgyu'i rkyen nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa kho na la srid pas de kho na rgyu'i rkyen nyid yin no //
translated: And that is possible only in the store consciousness, so that alone is the causal condition.

original: de ltar na gzhan gyi lta ba la skal pa mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag sa bon gyi sgo nas kyang rkyen nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan gyi lta ba la skal pa mnyam pa dang kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag sa bon gyi sgo nas kyang rkyen nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, in the other systems, the homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause are not tenable as conditions even from the point of view of seeds.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yang rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas ni /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu yang rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas ni /
translated: The causal condition is not tenable as the maturation cause, even from the point of view of its own nature,

original: 'das nas ring zhig lon pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das nas ring zhig lon pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is long past and gone.

original: sa bon gyi sgo nas kyang rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyis bdag po'i rkyen gyis 'phangs pa'i phyir rgyu'i rkyen nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sa bon gyi sgo nas kyang rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyis bdag po'i rkyen gyis 'phangs pa'i phyir rgyu'i rkyen nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: And it is not tenable as the causal condition even from the point of view of seeds, because it is projected by the dominant condition, and because it is not of the same species.

original: yang na rgyu'i rkyen gzhan zhes bya ba ni dus tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: yang na rgyu'i rkyen gzhan zhes bya ba ni dus tha dad pa ste /
translated: Or else, another causal condition is a different time.

original: re zhig sems dang sems las byung ba 'gags ma thag pa dag ni rgyu'i rkyen ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig sems dang sems las byung ba 'gags ma thag pa dag ni rgyu'i rkyen ma yin te /
translated: First, minds and mental factors that have just ceased are not the causal condition of those minds and mental factors because they are past.üîΩ

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis 'phangs pa'i phyir dang / sa bon gyi rten ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang gi tshe kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de'i tshe yang skad cig ma snga mas bsdus pa'i sa bon ni rnam par shes pa phyi ma'i rkyen ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis 'phangs pa'i phyir dang / sa bon gyi rten ma yin pa'i phyir ro // gang gi tshe kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de'i tshe yang skad cig ma snga mas bsdus pa'i sa bon ni rnam par shes pa phyi ma'i rkyen ma yin te /
translated: First, the mind and mental factors that have just ceased are not the causal condition of the present mind and mental factors because they are projected by the immediately preceding condition and because they are not the support of seeds.

original: nas kyi sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nas kyi sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Even when the foundation consciousness exists, the seeds included in the prior moment are not a condition of the subsequent consciousness because they are not its support, like barley seeds and a sprout.

original: 'di ltar gang na rgyu zhig nas 'bras bu yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang na rgyu zhig nas 'bras bu yin pa de ni /
translated: Thus, when a cause ceases and an effect arises,

original: rgyu gang dang 'bras bu dag snga phyi nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: rgyu gang dang 'bras bu dag snga phyi nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: the cause and effect are sequential.

original: gang la rgyu'i byed rgyu ma zhig par 'bras bu yin pa de ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus tha mi dad pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gang la rgyu'i byed rgyu ma zhig par 'bras bu yin pa de ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus tha mi dad pa kho na ste /
translated: When a cause does not cease and an effect arises, the cause and effect are not sequential.

original: dper na autpala'i rtsa ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na autpala'i rtsa ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the root of an utpala flower and so on.

original: sa bon kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ma 'gags par yang 'bras bu rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sa bon kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ma 'gags par yang 'bras bu rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The seed consciousness is the causal condition of the resultant consciousness, which is called consciousness.

original: de lta bas na sa bon kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni 'bras bu dang dus @334a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na sa bon kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni 'bras bu dang dus @334a * //
translated: Thus the seed consciousness is the causal condition of the result consciousness, which is simultaneous with it.

original: mnyam pa kho nar rgyu'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: mnyam pa kho nar rgyu'i rkyen yin te /
translated: It is not a condition as cause of the evolving consciousnesses, because it is not their homogeneous cause.

original: 'bras bu dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir autpala'i rtsa ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir autpala'i rtsa ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is not a contradictory condition of the result consciousness, because it is not incompatible with the result, like the root of an utpala flower, etc.

original: ji ltar mi 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'gal zhe na /
translated: How is it not incompatible?

original: de'i gags byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gags byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not obstruct the result.

original: kun gzhi'i sa bon gyi rgyu nyid ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i sa bon gyi rgyu nyid ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
translated: The evolving consciousnesses are not the causal condition of the seed consciousness,

original: de'i rgyun yin pa'i phyir skad cig snga mas bsdus pa'i sa bon ni sa bon phyi ma'i rgyu'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //üîΩ'o na de ltar na rgyu'i rkyen gzhan mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rgyun yin pa'i phyir skad cig snga mas bsdus pa'i sa bon ni sa bon phyi ma'i rgyu'i rkyen du 'gyur ro //üîΩ'o na de ltar na rgyu'i rkyen gzhan mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: because the former is included in the prior moment and the latter is included in the subsequent moment.üîΩIf the seed consciousness is the causal condition of the evolving consciousnesses, then the former is not the latter, because the latter is not perceived as something other than the former.

original: 'di ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin pas mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin pas mi 'gal lo //
translated: This is stated from the perspective of the active consciousnesses, so there is no contradiction.

original: sna tshogs dang sna tshogs ma yin pa'i le'u'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: sna tshogs dang sna tshogs ma yin pa'i le'u'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With respect to the chapter on the various and non-various,

original: bag chags tha dad pa ma yin zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bag chags tha dad pa ma yin zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: it says, ‚ÄúThe various latent propensities are not different.‚Äù

original: ji ltar na bag chags ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa rgyur byas na 'jug pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar na bag chags ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa rgyur byas na 'jug pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin zhing /
translated: How is it that the latent propensities are not different because they are the cause of the consciousness of the ground of all?

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid du mi dmigs pa'i phyir sna tshogs ma yin la /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid du mi dmigs pa'i phyir sna tshogs ma yin la /
translated: They are not various because they are not observed to be virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: de las byung ba'i chos rnams phan tshun rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa ngo bor mngon pa'i phyir tha dad pa dang / sna tshogs pa yin /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i chos rnams phan tshun rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa ngo bor mngon pa'i phyir tha dad pa dang / sna tshogs pa yin /
translated: The phenomena that arise from it are different and various because their individual natures are different from each other and because they are manifest as entities such as virtuous and nonvirtuous.

original: 'di skad du nas kyi sa bon sna tshogs ma yin pa las s'a lu dang nas dang gro la sogs pa tha dad cing sna tshogs pa dag skye ba ni ma mthong ngo zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'di skad du nas kyi sa bon sna tshogs ma yin pa las s'a lu dang nas dang gro la sogs pa tha dad cing sna tshogs pa dag skye ba ni ma mthong ngo zhes ston to //
translated: This is taught by the words: ‚ÄúBut it is not seen that different kinds of rice, barley, wheat, etc. are produced from different kinds of seeds, such as rice seeds, etc.‚Äù

original: dper na tshi gu rtsi sna tshogs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dper na tshi gu rtsi sna tshogs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: For example, a cloth, etc.

original: tshi gu rtsi ni tshon gyi khyad par bye brag mi mngon pa zhig go //
analyzed: tshi gu rtsi ni tshon gyi khyad par bye brag mi mngon pa zhig go //
translated: A cloth is a particular kind of dye that is not apparent.

original: yang na ti gu rtsi ni tha gus bcing pa'i khyad par bye brag mi mngon pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na ti gu rtsi ni tha gus bcing pa'i khyad par bye brag mi mngon pa yin no //
translated: Or, a cloth is a particular kind of binding with a rope that is not apparent.

original: de bzhin du sgo bar byed pa na tshogs kyis bskyed pa'i bag chags sna tshogs kyang bag chags kyi dus na sna tshogs su mi mngon no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgo bar byed pa na tshogs kyis bskyed pa'i bag chags sna tshogs kyang bag chags kyi dus na sna tshogs su mi mngon no //
translated: In the same way, when it is being woven, the various latent impressions produced by the collection are not apparent as various latent impressions.

original: 'bras bu 'grub pa nyid tshon gyi snod de der bcug pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'grub pa nyid tshon gyi snod de der bcug pa'o //
translated: When the result is being produced, it is like a dye vessel into which it is put.

original: rkyen nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir gos lta bu ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: rkyen nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir gos lta bu ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yin te /
translated: The cloth-like fundamental consciousness is established as a condition.

original: tshon lta bu'i chos sna tshogs ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshon lta bu'i chos sna tshogs ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it teaches the various dharmas like colors.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i le'u'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i le'u'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With reference to the chapter on Dependent Origination, he says:

original: 'di ni theg pa chen po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni theg pa chen po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This is the Great Vehicle, etc.

original: phra ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyis shes par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phra ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyis shes par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is subtle because it is difficult for ordinary people to understand.

original: mchog tu zab pa ni nyan thos dang @334b rang sangs rgyas kyis gteng dpogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog tu zab pa ni nyan thos dang @334b rang sangs rgyas kyis gteng dpogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is supremely profound because it is difficult for the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas to fathom.

original: yang na phra ba ni nyan thos la sogs pas shes par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na phra ba ni nyan thos la sogs pas shes par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, it is subtle because it is difficult for the Sravakas, etc. to understand.

original: mchog tu zab pa ni mos pas spyod pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpas gting dpogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog tu zab pa ni mos pas spyod pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpas gting dpogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is supremely profound because it is difficult for the Bodhisattvas who practice the practice of conviction to fathom.

original: yang na phra ba ni mnyam par ma bzhag pas shes par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na phra ba ni mnyam par ma bzhag pas shes par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, it is subtle because it is difficult for the non-concentrated mind to understand.

original: mchog tu zab pa'i mnyam par zhag pa'i shes pas kyang gting dpogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: mchog tu zab pa'i mnyam par zhag pa'i shes pas kyang gting dpogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro /
translated: It is supremely profound because it is difficult for the concentrated mind to fathom.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la brten nas chos sna tshogs 'byung ba shes par dka' zhing dpogs par dka' ba de'i phyir 'di ni theg pa chen po kho na las bstan to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la brten nas chos sna tshogs 'byung ba shes par dka' zhing dpogs par dka' ba de'i phyir 'di ni theg pa chen po kho na las bstan to //
translated: Because it is difficult to understand and difficult to fathom how various phenomena arise in dependence on the consciousness of the ground of all, therefore this is taught only in the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe dependent origination of those who enjoy objects is included in the dependent origination that discerns natures.

original: nye bar spyod pa can gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa can gyi nang du bsdus nas mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩde la ngo bo nyid rnams par 'byed par nus pa'ang der dgos pa ni /
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa can gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa can gyi nang du bsdus nas mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba smos so // de la ngo bo nyid rnams par 'byed par nus pa'ang der dgos pa ni /
translated: In brief, it is said.

original: ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa can no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa can no //
translated: Among them, the dependent origination that discerns natures is the power to discern natures.

original: de bzhin du sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'gro ba rnam par 'byed par nus pa'ang der dgos pa ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'gro ba rnam par 'byed pa can no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'gro ba rnam par 'byed par nus pa'ang der dgos pa ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'gro ba rnam par 'byed pa can no //
