translated: The dependent origination that discerns pleasant and unpleasant reincarnating beings is the power to discern pleasant and unpleasant reincarnating beings.

original: ngo bo nyid sna tshogs rnam par dbye ba'i phyir rkyen gyis dngos por gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di las 'byung bas na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid sna tshogs rnam par dbye ba'i phyir rkyen gyis dngos por gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di las 'byung bas na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the conditions are things that have arisen, since they are the differentiation of the various natures.

original: de yang spros pa'i cag chags kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de yang spros pa'i cag chags kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: And that is the nature of the proliferation of conceptual thought.

original: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dag tu zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dag tu zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the happy and unhappy destinies,

original: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro ni ming dang gzugs la sogs pa tshor ba la thug pa rnams dang skye ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro ni ming dang gzugs la sogs pa tshor ba la thug pa rnams dang skye ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: the happy and unhappy destinies are the members from name-and-form up to feeling, and birth, etc.

original: de la las dang nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi yan lag rnams rkyen du gyur pas na sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'gro ba rnam par 'byed pa can nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la las dang nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi yan lag rnams rkyen du gyur pas na sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'gro ba rnam par 'byed pa can nyid yin no //
translated: Among them, the members that are the nature of action and affliction are the conditions, since they differentiate the happy and unhappy destinies.

original: yang na bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro ni yan lag bcu gnyis nyid yin te /üîΩyan lag snga ma snga ma la brten nas /
analyzed: yang na bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro ni yan lag bcu gnyis nyid yin te / yan lag snga ma snga ma la brten nas /
translated: Or else, the happy and unhappy destinies are the twelve members themselves,

original: yan lag phyi ma phyi ma 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag phyi ma phyi ma 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the later members arise in dependence on the earlier members.

original: rim pa 'dis ni yan lag bcu gnyis po nyid bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dag tu rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim pa 'dis ni yan lag bcu gnyis po nyid bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dag tu rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the twelve members are causes of good and bad destinies.

original: de la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang po ni phra ba'i phyir dang zab pa'i phyir theg pa chen po kho na las bstan te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de las bstan pa'i @335a * //
analyzed: de la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang po ni phra ba'i phyir dang zab pa'i phyir theg pa chen po kho na las bstan te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de las bstan pa'i @335a * //
translated: The first dependent origination is taught in the Great Vehicle alone because it is subtle and profound, and because it is taught in the foundation consciousness.

original: phyir ro // gnyis pa ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa rnam par ma phye ba'i phyir de ltar zab pa ma yin pas nyan thos kyi theg pa las kyang bstan to //
analyzed: phyir ro // gnyis pa ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa rnam par ma phye ba'i phyir de ltar zab pa ma yin pas nyan thos kyi theg pa las kyang bstan to //
translated: The second is not that profound because it does not distinguish the foundation consciousness, and so it is taught in the Sravakayana.

original: de dag la la la zhig gis glang po che zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ji ltar sngon sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag la la la zhig gis glang po che zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ji ltar sngon sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa de bzhin du /
translated: Some say that the elephant is the foundation consciousness, and just as it was taught by the Buddha in the past,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mu stegs can dag la bstan pa na'o /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mu stegs can dag la bstan pa na'o /
translated: so it is taught by the Tathagatas to the tirthikas.

original: kha cig gis ni glang po che'i sna la zhes bya ba ni dper na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de nyid la mu stegs can de nyid kyi sa bon thams cad pa la sogs pa'i dngos por thos pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni glang po che'i sna la zhes bya ba ni dper na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa de nyid la mu stegs can de nyid kyi sa bon thams cad pa la sogs pa'i dngos por thos pa lta bu'o //
translated: Some say that it is like the seed of all entities, meaning that it is like the seed of all the entities of the tƒ´rthikas‚Äô doctrine of primal substance and so on.

original: kha cig na re zhes bya ba ni dper na mu stegs can de dag nyid kyis nus pa bsags pa tsam du dmigs nas log par rang bzhin la sogs pa rgyu nyid du rtog par byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re zhes bya ba ni dper na mu stegs can de dag nyid kyis nus pa bsags pa tsam du dmigs nas log par rang bzhin la sogs pa rgyu nyid du rtog par byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: Some say that it is like the accumulation of the power of the tƒ´rthikas‚Äô meditation, meaning that, having observed the mere accumulation of the power of meditation, the tƒ´rthikas imagine that it is the cause of the intrinsic natures and so on.

original: sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya ba 'dir sa bon zhes bya ba bshad pas de'i zhar la sa bon bye brag tu shes par bya ba'i phyir phyi dang nang dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya ba 'dir sa bon zhes bya ba bshad pas de'i zhar la sa bon bye brag tu shes par bya ba'i phyir phyi dang nang dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The term ‚Äúseed‚Äù is explained here in the expression ‚Äúthe seed of all entities.‚Äù In order to understand the distinction between seeds, the root text declares, ‚Äúexternal and internal.‚Äù

original: phyi'i sa bon s'a lu dang autpala'i rtsa ba la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: phyi'i sa bon s'a lu dang autpala'i rtsa ba la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: External seeds are those of rice, barley, and so on.

original: nang gi kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: Internal seeds are those that are included within the store consciousness.

original: mi gsal ba gnyis zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba gnyis sam kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba gnyis mi gsal zhing yongs su mi gsal ba ste /
analyzed: mi gsal ba gnyis zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba gnyis sam kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba gnyis mi gsal zhing yongs su mi gsal ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äútwo unclear‚Äù means that the two, virtue and nonvirtue, or the two, affliction and purification, are unclear and not fully clear.

original: lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩkha cig ni gnyis su zhes 'don te sa bon ni dge ba dang mi dge ba gnyis su spyad na'am /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // kha cig ni gnyis su zhes 'don te sa bon ni dge ba dang mi dge ba gnyis su spyad na'am /
translated: This is synonymous with ‚Äúindeterminate.‚Äù

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'am rnam par byang ba gnyis su dpyad na mi gsal te lung du ma bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'am rnam par byang ba gnyis su dpyad na mi gsal te lung du ma bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Some read ‚Äútwo‚Äù in place of ‚Äúunclear,‚Äù and the meaning is that if one practices the two, virtue and nonvirtue, or analyzes the two, affliction and purification, the seed is unclear and indeterminate.

original: de la phyi'i sa bon ni lung du bstan pa ste lung du ma bstan pa nyid kyis mi gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de la phyi'i sa bon ni lung du bstan pa ste lung du ma bstan pa nyid kyis mi gsal ba yin no //
translated: The external seed is clear, because it is determinate.

original: nang gi yang dge ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor mi dmigs pa'i phyir mi gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: nang gi yang dge ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor mi dmigs pa'i phyir mi gsal ba yin no //
translated: The internal is unclear, because it is not apprehended as having the nature of virtue and so on.

original: yang na phyi'i sa bon ni lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na phyi'i sa bon ni lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, the external seed is unclear, because it is indeterminate.

original: nang gi yang chung zad cig mi gsal te nang gi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos kyis skyed pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi yang chung zad cig mi gsal te nang gi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos kyis skyed pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The internal is not at all unclear, because it is the cause of the generation of internal virtuous and nonvirtuous phenomena.

original: gnyis dang kun rdzob ces bya ba ni phyi'i ste tha snyad pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir @335b yongs su ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis dang kun rdzob ces bya ba ni phyi'i ste tha snyad pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir @335b yongs su ma grub pa yin no //
translated: The external is both and conventional, because it is the object of conventional cognition.

original: dam pa'i don ni nang gi ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i don ni nang gi ste /
translated: The ultimate is internal,

original: brtag bzod pa gnyis kyis yongs su grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtag bzod pa gnyis kyis yongs su grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is fully established by both kinds of ability to bear analysis.

original: skad cig pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sa bon rnam pa drug ston to //
analyzed: skad cig pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sa bon rnam pa drug ston to //
translated: The six kinds of seeds are indicated by the words ‚Äúmomentary‚Äù and so on.

original: de la rtag pa las 'bras bu mi dmigs pa'i phyir phyi dang nang gi sa bon gnyi ga skad cig ma yin no //
analyzed: de la rtag pa las 'bras bu mi dmigs pa'i phyir phyi dang nang gi sa bon gnyi ga skad cig ma yin no //
translated: The external and internal seeds are momentary, because the effect is not observed to arise constantly.

original: nang gi 'bras bu dang lhan cig 'byung ngo zhes sngar bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: nang gi 'bras bu dang lhan cig 'byung ngo zhes sngar bsgrubs zin to //
translated: It has been established earlier that the internal effect arises simultaneously with it.

original: phyi'i yang chung zad cig lhan cig 'byung bar grags te dper na autpala'i rtsa ba dang chu shel dang sgron ma dang grib pa ma dang myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: phyi'i yang chung zad cig lhan cig 'byung bar grags te dper na autpala'i rtsa ba dang chu shel dang sgron ma dang grib pa ma dang myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is well known that external seeds arise together with their fruits, for example, the root of the lotus, water crystal, lamp, shadow, sprout, and so on.

original: yang na phyi'i sa bon thams cad kyang 'bras bu dang lhan cig 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na phyi'i sa bon thams cad kyang 'bras bu dang lhan cig 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Or, all external seeds arise together with their fruits.

original: sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa gang la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por dus mi mnyam pa'i ngo bor grags pa der yang myu gu'i gnas skabs na sa bon s'a lu'i 'bru'i rgyun 'jug pas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa gang la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por dus mi mnyam pa'i ngo bor grags pa der yang myu gu'i gnas skabs na sa bon s'a lu'i 'bru'i rgyun 'jug pas 'byung ngo //
translated: In the case of the seed and sprout, etc., which are known to be cause and effect and to have different times, the seed of the rice grain continues in the state of the sprout.

original: de ni de lta yin te 'di ltar myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun gyi mthar thug pa'i dus su yang 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pas so //
analyzed: de ni de lta yin te 'di ltar myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun gyi mthar thug pa'i dus su yang 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pas so //
translated: That is so, because even at the end of the continuum of the sprout, etc., the effect is established.

original: rgyun gyis 'jug pas 'byung ba de yang myu gu la sogs pa med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu bzhin du rgyu yang yin la /
analyzed: rgyun gyis 'jug pas 'byung ba de yang myu gu la sogs pa med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu bzhin du rgyu yang yin la /
translated: That arising by the continuation of the continuum is also a cause, like an associated cause, because the sprout, etc., do not occur without it.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba yang yin te mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba yang yin te mi 'gal lo //
translated: They are also co-existent, and there is no contradiction.

original: phyi'i sa bon ni 'gal ba'i rgyu dang ma phrad kyi bar du rjes su 'jug pa tsam gyis rgyun chags su 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: phyi'i sa bon ni 'gal ba'i rgyu dang ma phrad kyi bar du rjes su 'jug pa tsam gyis rgyun chags su 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The external seed is a continuum of mere continuation until it meets with a cause of destruction.

original: nang gi yang srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags kyi sa bon ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma byung gi bar du'o //
analyzed: nang gi yang srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags kyi sa bon ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma byung gi bar du'o //
translated: The internal seed of the latent impressions of the members of existence is until the result of ripening has occurred.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i sa bon dang nyon mongs pa can gyi spros pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon ni gnyen po ma byung gi bar du'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i sa bon dang nyon mongs pa can gyi spros pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon ni gnyen po ma byung gi bar du'o //
translated: The seed of the view of the transitory collection and the seed of the latent impressions of afflicted proliferation is until the antidote has occurred.

original: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i spros pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i spros pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das kyi bar du'o //
translated: The seed of the latent impressions of virtuous and neutral proliferation is until the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas have attained nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ni rdo rje lta bu'i bar du rgyun 'jug pa tsam gyis rgyun chags su 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ni rdo rje lta bu'i bar du rgyun 'jug pa tsam gyis rgyun chags su 'byung ngo //
translated: The seed of the tathƒÅgatas is a continuum of mere continuation until the vajra-like samƒÅdhi.

original: de lta bas na 'dis ni sa bon lhan cig 'byung ba yin yang glog bzhin du skad cig ma gcig gam gnyis sam gsum du gnas pa ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //üîΩgal te rgyun chags su 'byung na thams cad las thams cad ci ste mi 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dis ni sa bon lhan cig 'byung ba yin yang glog bzhin du skad cig ma gcig gam gnyis sam gsum du gnas pa ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed do // gal te rgyun chags su 'byung na thams cad las thams cad ci ste mi 'byung zhe na /
translated: Thus, this passage shows that even though the seed arises simultaneously with the sprout, it does not endure for one or two or three moments, like lightning.

original: nges @336a * //
analyzed: nges @336a * //
translated: If it arises in a continuous series, why doesn‚Äôt everything arise from everything?üîΩThe response is:

original: dang zhes bya bas lan 'debs te 'bras bu 'ga' kho na la rgyu la la nges so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang zhes bya bas lan 'debs te 'bras bu 'ga' kho na la rgyu la la nges so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because of the restriction of the result to a particular cause.

original: nges kyang ci'i phyir dus thams cad du 'bras bu mi 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: nges kyang ci'i phyir dus thams cad du 'bras bu mi 'byung zhe na /
translated: Even though there is restriction, why doesn‚Äôt the result arise at all times?üîΩThe response is:

original: rkyen la ltos pa dang zhes bya bas lan 'debs te /
analyzed: rkyen la ltos pa dang zhes bya bas lan 'debs te /
translated: because of dependence on conditions.

original: rkyen rtag tu nye ba ma yin pas nyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rkyen rtag tu nye ba ma yin pas nyes pa ma yin no //
translated: The fault is not that conditions are not always present.

original: 'o na sa bon de'i sa bon gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sa bon de'i sa bon gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the seed of that seed?

original: de'i phyir rang gi 'bras bus bsgrubs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi 'bras bus bsgrubs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is established by its own result.

original: sa bon dang sa bon can dag thog ma med pa'i phyir 'di'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de nyid sa bon no //
analyzed: sa bon dang sa bon can dag thog ma med pa'i phyir 'di'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de nyid sa bon no //
translated: Since the seed and the possessor of the seed are beginningless, that which is the result of this is the seed itself.

original: 'dis ni gtso bo la sogs pa sa bon nyid yin pa sel te /
analyzed: 'dis ni gtso bo la sogs pa sa bon nyid yin pa sel te /
translated: This refutes the seed being prakriti and so on,

original: ji skad bshad pa'i sa bon gyi chos dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i sa bon gyi chos dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not endowed with the qualities of a seed as explained.

original: sa bon dang sa bon can gyi dngos po ni 'dir bsgo bar bya ba dang sgo bar byed pa la ltos pa yin par bzhed pas brtan zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsgo bar bya ba dpyod par byed do //
analyzed: sa bon dang sa bon can gyi dngos po ni 'dir bsgo bar bya ba dang sgo bar byed pa la ltos pa yin par bzhed pas brtan zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsgo bar bya ba dpyod par byed do //
translated: Since the relationship of seed and possessor of the seed is asserted here to be based on the relationship of the object to be sown and the sower, the object to be sown is analyzed by the words ‚Äústable‚Äù and so on.

original: de la brtan pa ni mi 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de la brtan pa ni mi 'gyur pa ste /
translated: Among them, stable means unchanging.

original: ti la la sogs pa bzhin du rgyu rgyun chags su 'byung ba yin gyi rlung bzhin du g-yo ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ti la la sogs pa bzhin du rgyu rgyun chags su 'byung ba yin gyi rlung bzhin du g-yo ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is like til and so on, which are the cause of a continuous occurrence, but it is not like wind, which is moving.

original: rlung ni 'brel pas dri 'dzin pa kho nar zad kyi rang gi ngo bos dri 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir bag chags 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rlung ni 'brel pas dri 'dzin pa kho nar zad kyi rang gi ngo bos dri 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir bag chags 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Wind merely apprehends smell through connection, but it does not apprehend smell in order to produce smell through its own nature.

original: sgra bzhin du chad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra bzhin du chad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not like sound, which is discontinuous.

original: brtan pa yang gang zhig lung du ma bstan pa dri mnyam pa yin gyi sgog skya dang tsan dan la sogs pa lta bu dri mi zhim pa dang zhim pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brtan pa yang gang zhig lung du ma bstan pa dri mnyam pa yin gyi sgog skya dang tsan dan la sogs pa lta bu dri mi zhim pa dang zhim pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And what is stable is neutral, not foul smelling like garlic or fragrant like sandalwood.

original: sgo bya ba zhes bya ba ni yan lag mnyen pa'i phyir bsgo bar 'os pa'am bsgo bar nus pa gang yin pa de bsgo bar bya ba yin /
analyzed: sgo bya ba zhes bya ba ni yan lag mnyen pa'i phyir bsgo bar 'os pa'am bsgo bar nus pa gang yin pa de bsgo bar bya ba yin /
translated: What is to be ordered is that which is suitable to be ordered or capable of being ordered because its limbs are flexible.

original: yan lag sra ba'i phyir rdo la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yan lag sra ba'i phyir rdo la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But stone, etc., is not to be ordered because its limbs are hard.

original: bsgo bar bya ba yang sgo bar byed pa dang 'brel pa gang yin pa de la sgo bar byed kyi ma 'brel pa so so na gnas pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgo bar bya ba yang sgo bar byed pa dang 'brel pa gang yin pa de la sgo bar byed kyi ma 'brel pa so so na gnas pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: And what is to be ordered is that which is related to the one who gives the order, not that which is unrelated and remains separate.

original: de bzhin du kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa kho na brtan pa'i phyir bsgo bar bya ba yin gyi gzugs ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa kho na brtan pa'i phyir bsgo bar bya ba yin gyi gzugs ni ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, only the foundation consciousness is stable and thus to be ordered, not form,

original: gzugs med pa'i gnas skabs na 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i gnas skabs na 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because form is interrupted in the formless realm.

original: 'o na ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yang phung po med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par 'chad pa'i phyir bsgo bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩde ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yang phung po med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par 'chad pa'i phyir bsgo bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na / de ni ma yin te /
translated: But if that is so, then the foundation consciousness would not be something to be trained, because it is explained as nirvana that is not a non-existent aggregate.

original: 'di ni dus ji srid du sgo bar byed pa yod pa'i dus de srid du bsgo bar bya ba rgyun chags su 'byung ba'i @336b bstan pa la dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dus ji srid du sgo bar byed pa yod pa'i dus de srid du bsgo bar bya ba rgyun chags su 'byung ba'i @336b bstan pa la dgongs pa yin no //
translated: That is not so, because this passage intends to teach that as long as there is training, that which is to be trained exists continuously.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni sgo bar byed pa yod kyang bsgo bar bya ba gzugs med do //üîΩde bzhin du lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa kho na yin gyi 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni sgo bar byed pa yod kyang bsgo bar bya ba gzugs med do // de bzhin du lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa kho na yin gyi 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: In the formless realm, though there is training, there is no form that is to be trained.

original: de'i rgyun ni bar chad dang bcas pa dang bar chad med par dge ba dang mi dge ba kun du spyod pa nyid du shes che bas gcig tu ma bstan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyun ni bar chad dang bcas pa dang bar chad med par dge ba dang mi dge ba kun du spyod pa nyid du shes che bas gcig tu ma bstan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, the foundation consciousness alone is neutral, not the active consciousnesses, because their continuum is not taught to be neutral, since it is known to engage virtue and nonvirtue with and without interruption.

original: yang me long lta bu'i ye shes la sgo bar byed dam 'on te sgo bar mi byed /
analyzed: yang me long lta bu'i ye shes la sgo bar byed dam 'on te sgo bar mi byed /
translated: Moreover, does the mirror-like wisdom give rise to the other wisdoms or not?

original: gal te sgo bar byed na ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dus mi thung bar bag chags can dag pas da ltar gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bag chags nyung ba nyid kyis mthu dman par yang thal par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te sgo bar byed na ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dus mi thung bar bag chags can dag pas da ltar gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bag chags nyung ba nyid kyis mthu dman par yang thal par 'gyur la /
translated: If it does, then it follows that the present TathƒÅgatas, who have fewer habitual tendencies, would have less power than the TathƒÅgatas of the past, who had longer to accumulate habitual tendencies.

original: dge ba bsgo bar bya bar yang thal par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba bsgo bar bya bar yang thal par 'gyur te /
translated: And it would follow that virtue would be something that is given rise to.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni gcig tu dge ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni gcig tu dge ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the qualities of a buddha are entirely virtuous.

original: 'on te sgo bar mi byed na ni ji ltar skad cig ma'i rgyun gyi so sor rtog pa'i ye shes la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sgo bar mi byed na ni ji ltar skad cig ma'i rgyun gyi so sor rtog pa'i ye shes la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it does not give rise to them, how could the wisdom of individual knowledge and so on arise in a continuum of moments?

original: sgo bar mi byed do zhes bya ba 'di kho na bzang ngo //
analyzed: sgo bar mi byed do zhes bya ba 'di kho na bzang ngo //
translated: It is best to say that it does not give rise to them.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes la sogs pa 'byung ba ni sngon gyi sa bon gyi rgyun rdo rje lta bu'i dus nyid na cig car yongs su rgyas pa las yin gyi sngon med pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes la sogs pa 'byung ba ni sngon gyi sa bon gyi rgyun rdo rje lta bu'i dus nyid na cig car yongs su rgyas pa las yin gyi sngon med pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: The arising of the gnosis of individual investigation and so on is due to the complete expansion of the continuum of former seeds at the time of the vajra-like concentration, but not from what did not exist previously.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan pa rnams kyi ni bag chags med par nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i chos rnams khyad par can du 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas gdon mi za bar bsgo bar bya ba yin par khas blang dgos so
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan pa rnams kyi ni bag chags med par nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i chos rnams khyad par can du 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas gdon mi za bar bsgo bar bya ba yin par khas blang dgos so
translated: Since the special arising of afflicted and unafflicted phenomena without imprints in those other than a tathƒÅgata would be impossible, it must be accepted that they are definitely imprinted.

original: // de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i phyir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa kho na las bsgo bar 'os pa'am bsgo bar nus kyi /
analyzed: // de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i phyir kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa kho na las bsgo bar 'os pa'am bsgo bar nus kyi /
translated: Similarly, it is suitable to imprint or possible to imprint on the foundation consciousness alone because it is impermanent.

original: brtan pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dag la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brtan pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dag la ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not possible to imprint on space and analytical cessation because they are stable.

original: rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa sgo bar byed pa rnams dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'brel pa yin gyi 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / rgyud gzhan du gtogs pa yang ma yin pa 'di yang 'dir bsgo bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid du brjod par bya la /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa sgo bar byed pa rnams dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'brel pa yin gyi 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / rgyud gzhan du gtogs pa yang ma yin pa 'di yang 'dir bsgo bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid du brjod par bya la /
translated: The definition of what is to be ordered is that it is coemergent and related to the consciousnesses that are ordered in one‚Äôs own mental continuum, and it is not past or future or related to another mental continuum.

original: rten bsgo bar bya ba yin gyi brten pa reg pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rten bsgo bar bya ba yin gyi brten pa reg pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the basis that is ordered, not the contact, etc., that are based on it.

original: sde pa la ma grags pa'i phyir @337a * //
analyzed: sde pa la ma grags pa'i phyir @337a * //
translated: Because it is not accepted by other schools.

original: de skad du ma bstan te /
analyzed: de skad du ma bstan te /
translated: It is not taught in that way.

original: sde pa la ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i reg pa la sogs pa ma grags so //
analyzed: sde pa la ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i reg pa la sogs pa ma grags so //
translated: Because contact, etc., that are concomitant with the foundation consciousness are not accepted by other schools.

original: bsgo bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid 'di ni gzhan la grags pa'i bsgo bar bya ba dgag pas rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: bsgo bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid 'di ni gzhan la grags pa'i bsgo bar bya ba dgag pas rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: This definition of what is to be ordered is established by refuting what is to be ordered according to other schools.

original: dgag pa rgyas par ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgag pa rgyas par ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The extensive refutation will be explained later.

original: de ni bag chags kyi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni bag chags ni bsgo bar bya ba'i chos yin pas bsgo bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de yang bag chags kyi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bag chags kyi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni bag chags ni bsgo bar bya ba'i chos yin pas bsgo bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de yang bag chags kyi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the characteristic of instinct. Instinct is the object of the injunction, and whatever is the characteristic of the object of the injunction is also that of instinct.

original: mdo sde pa gang dag rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang dbang po rten dang bcas pa'i gzugs bsgo bar bya ba yin par sems dpa' de dag gi dgag pa 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdo sde pa gang dag rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang dbang po rten dang bcas pa'i gzugs bsgo bar bya ba yin par sems dpa' de dag gi dgag pa 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Sautrantikas, who believe that the five collections of consciousness and the form that is the basis of the sense faculties are the objects of the injunction, will be refuted later.

original: gang dag rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug kho na bsgo bar bya ba yin gyi gzugs ni ma yin no zhes bya bar sems pa de dag gi dgag pa ni lung du ma bstan pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar bshad zin mod kyi /
analyzed: gang dag rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug kho na bsgo bar bya ba yin gyi gzugs ni ma yin no zhes bya bar sems pa de dag gi dgag pa ni lung du ma bstan pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bar bshad zin mod kyi /
translated: Those who believe that only the six collections of consciousness are the objects of the injunction, not form, have already been refuted by the statement, ‚ÄúBecause they are not indeterminate.‚Äù

original: de'i zhar la drug po dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pas dgag pa gzhan brtsam mo //
analyzed: de'i zhar la drug po dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pas dgag pa gzhan brtsam mo //
translated: But in addition to that, another refutation is begun in the verse, ‚ÄúIf you say that the six are the objects of the injunction,‚Äù and so on.

original: de la kha cig na re 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po dag ni phan tshun bag chags 'jog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la kha cig na re 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po dag ni phan tshun bag chags 'jog pa ma yin te /
translated: Some say: The six active consciousnesses do not mutually plant imprints.üîΩ

original: gzhan khas len pa nyid kyis lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan khas len pa nyid kyis lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Some say: The six active consciousnesses do not mutually plant imprints because they are not related by the characteristic of arising and ceasing simultaneously, since they are not accepted as simultaneous.

original: yang gzhan gyi ji ltar de ltar khas blangs she na /
analyzed: yang gzhan gyi ji ltar de ltar khas blangs she na /
translated: How is it accepted that they are not simultaneous?

original: tha dad gsum dang 'gal pa'i phyir //
analyzed: tha dad gsum dang 'gal pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they are distinct and because they would contradict the three.

original: 'di ltar gsum po rten dang dmigs pa dang yid la byed pa dag ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug la so so tha dad par mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsum po rten dang dmigs pa dang yid la byed pa dag ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug la so so tha dad par mthong ste /
translated: Thus the three supports, focal objects and mental factors of the sixfold collection of consciousnesses are seen to be distinct.

original: gal te cig car skye bar gyur na de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gal te cig car skye bar gyur na de dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: If they were to arise simultaneously, they would contradict that.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: dbang po la sogs pa tha dad pa nyid ma yin yang cig car skye bar ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / gang dang zla ba la lta ba la sogs pa la srog chags rnams kyi dbang po la sogs pa tha dad kyang cig car skye ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa tha dad pa nyid ma yin yang cig car skye bar ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / gang dang zla ba la lta ba la sogs pa la srog chags rnams kyi dbang po la sogs pa tha dad kyang cig car skye ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The sense faculties, etc. are not different, but they are not seen to arise simultaneously, and the sense faculties, etc. of living beings are seen to arise simultaneously when they look at the moon, etc.

original: de lta bas na gzhan du rnam par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhan du rnam par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it should be analyzed further.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po dag ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir phan tshun bsgo bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po dag ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir phan tshun bsgo bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The six active consciousnesses are not mutually related because they are not related.

original: re zhig gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir phrad pa'i 'brel pa ni med do //
analyzed: re zhig gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir phrad pa'i 'brel pa ni med do //
translated: First, there is no relation of contact because they are not material.

original: dus mnyam du skye ba tsam gyis 'brel @337b pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dus mnyam du skye ba tsam gyis 'brel @337b pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not related merely by arising simultaneously,

original: rgyud gzhan la yang bag chags 'jog par thal par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan la yang bag chags 'jog par thal par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that they would deposit latent impressions in other continuums.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gcig gis byas pa'i 'brel pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gcig gis byas pa'i 'brel pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not related by being produced by a single equivalent immediately preceding condition,

original: de ni go 'byed pa tsam la nye bar sbyor gyi /
analyzed: de ni go 'byed pa tsam la nye bar sbyor gyi /
translated: because that is applied to mere opportunity.

original: 'bras bu rnams phan tshun sbyor ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnams phan tshun sbyor ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: But the result is not related to each other.

original: gang gi tshe 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug car gyi mjug thogs su 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug car cig car rim gyis skye ba de'i tshe mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen cig med pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug car gyi mjug thogs su 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug car cig car rim gyis skye ba de'i tshe mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen cig med pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: And when the six kinds of active consciousness arise simultaneously or in succession, immediately after any one of the six kinds of consciousness, then there is no reason for the condition of sameness of kind.

original: rten dang dmigs pa dang yid la byed pa gcig skye bas 'brel pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rten dang dmigs pa dang yid la byed pa gcig skye bas 'brel pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor are they related because they have the same support, object, and attention,

original: tha dad gsum 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tha dad gsum 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: because the three are incompatible with difference.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gi rten dang dmigs pa dang / yid la byed pa ni so sor tha dad par mthong ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug gi rten dang dmigs pa dang / yid la byed pa ni so sor tha dad par mthong ste /
translated: The support, object, and attention of the six kinds of active consciousness are seen to be different from each other.

original: de lta yin na 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, they would be incompatible.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po 'di ni rten la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir phan tshun 'brel pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po 'di ni rten la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir phan tshun 'brel pa med pa yin te /
translated: The six kinds of active consciousness are not related to each other because their supports, etc., are different,

original: rgyud gzhan bzhin no zhes gzhan la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan bzhin no zhes gzhan la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yin no //
translated: just like the consciousnesses of different continua.

original: sems can gcig gi rgyud du gtogs pa nyid kyis 'brel pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can gcig gi rgyud du gtogs pa nyid kyis 'brel pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there a relationship by way of belonging to the continuum of a single sentient being,

original: rten pa la sogs pa tha dad pa nyid kyis sems can gcig gi rgyud du gtogs pa nyid bsgrub par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten pa la sogs pa tha dad pa nyid kyis sems can gcig gi rgyud du gtogs pa nyid bsgrub par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is difficult to establish that they belong to the continuum of a single sentient being, since the basis and so on are different.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dag ni mdung khyim bzhin gcig la gcig rten pa'i phyir 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa dag ni mdung khyim bzhin gcig la gcig rten pa'i phyir 'brel pa yin no //
translated: The active consciousnesses and the consciousness that is the basis of all experience are related because they are mutually supportive, like the hub and spokes of a wheel.

original: gal te rten gcig pa nyid kyis 'brel pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa snga ma ni mig gi rnam par shes pa phyi ma'i sgo bar byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rten gcig pa nyid kyis 'brel pa'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa snga ma ni mig gi rnam par shes pa phyi ma'i sgo bar byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the previous moment of visual consciousness is the support of the subsequent moment of visual consciousness because they have the same support,

original: de'i phyir skad cig lhan cig med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig lhan cig med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: then we reply that this is not so, because they do not exist simultaneously.

original: 'di dag ni bsgo bar bya ba dang sgo bar byed pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni bsgo bar bya ba dang sgo bar byed pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: They are not the supported and the support,

original: dus tha dad pa'i phyir dus tha dad pa'i til dang me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: dus tha dad pa'i phyir dus tha dad pa'i til dang me tog bzhin no //
translated: because they exist at different times, like a sesame seed and a flower.

original: gal te yang snga ma dang phyi ma dag rgyun gcig pa nyid kyis rigs gcig pa'i phyir bsgo bar bya ba sgo bar byed pa yin no zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir / rigs la bya na gzhan du thal //
analyzed: gal te yang snga ma dang phyi ma dag rgyun gcig pa nyid kyis rigs gcig pa'i phyir bsgo bar bya ba sgo bar byed pa yin no zhe na / de'i phyir / rigs la bya na gzhan du thal //
translated: If you say that the former and latter are the same continuum and thus the same type, and so the one is the controller of the other,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then we reply, if you mean type, it follows they are different.

original: gzugs can gyi dbang po yang rigs gcig pa'i phyir gzugs can gyi dang po skad cig ma snga ma bsgo bar bya ba nyid du 'gyur ro //üîΩdes na sems kyi @338a * //
analyzed: gzugs can gyi dbang po yang rigs gcig pa'i phyir gzugs can gyi dang po skad cig ma snga ma bsgo bar bya ba nyid du 'gyur ro // des na sems kyi @338a * //
translated: If you mean that the former moment of form is the controller of the latter moment of form, because they are the same type,üîΩthen it follows that the mental continuum is not the controller of the mental continuum, because it is the same type.

original: rgyud kho na bsgo bar bya ba yin no zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud kho na bsgo bar bya ba yin no zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you cannot say that the mental continuum alone is the controller.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dpyad na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa ni bsgo bar bya bar rung ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar dpyad na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa ni bsgo bar bya bar rung ba ma yin pas /
translated: Since, when analyzed in this way, nothing other than the foundation consciousness is suitable to be the controlled,

original: de las gzhan pa la sgo bar mi byed pa'i phyir phyi dang nang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa la sgo bar mi byed pa'i phyir phyi dang nang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: it is not the controller of that which is other than it. Therefore he says, ‚Äúneither internal nor external,‚Äù and so on.

original: phyi dang nang gi sa bon de gnyi ga yang skyed par byed pa dang 'phen par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi sa bon de gnyi ga yang skyed par byed pa dang 'phen par byed pa yin te /
translated: Both the external and internal seeds are projectors and generators.

original: phyi'i sa bon ni myu gu'i mngon sum du skyed par byed pa yin no //üîΩsdong bu la sogs pa brgyud pa sbyang na 'dug pa'i bar gyi ni 'phen par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi'i sa bon ni myu gu'i mngon sum du skyed par byed pa yin no // sdong bu la sogs pa brgyud pa sbyang na 'dug pa'i bar gyi ni 'phen par byed pa yin no //
translated: The external seed is the generator of the sprout that is directly perceived.üîΩThe seed is the projector of the sprout that is not directly perceived, such as the sprout that exists in the future.

original: nang gi sa bon kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yang ming dang gzugs kyi ni mngon sum du skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nang gi sa bon kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yang ming dang gzugs kyi ni mngon sum du skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: The internal seed, the storehouse consciousness, is the generator of name-and-form that is directly perceived.

original: brgyud pa rga shi'i bar gyi ni 'phen par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: brgyud pa rga shi'i bar gyi ni 'phen par byed pa yin no //
translated: It is the projector of the series up to old age and death that is not directly perceived.

original: re zhig skyed par byed pa ni yin la reg na yang 'phen par byed pa kho ji ltar yin zhe na /üîΩma btab shi ba 'phen pa'i phyir //
analyzed: re zhig skyed par byed pa ni yin la reg na yang 'phen par byed pa kho ji ltar yin zhe na / ma btab shi ba 'phen pa'i phyir //
translated: How can it be a projector if it is only a generator?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it projects that which dies without having been sown.

original: gal te skyed par byed pa kho na yin gyi 'phen par byed pa ma yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te skyed par byed pa kho na yin gyi 'phen par byed pa ma yin par gyur na /
translated: If it were only a generator and not a projector,

original: nas la sogs pa'i sa bon sbyang la sogs pa na 'dug pa ma btab pa rnams kyi rgyun dus ring por 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nas la sogs pa'i sa bon sbyang la sogs pa na 'dug pa ma btab pa rnams kyi rgyun dus ring por 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The continuum of the seed of barley, etc. would not be connected for a long time if it were not planted.

original: ma btab pa zhes smos pa ni btab pa ni chu la sogs pas bsgyur pa'i phyir de 'phangs pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: ma btab pa zhes smos pa ni btab pa ni chu la sogs pas bsgyur pa'i phyir de 'phangs pa ma yin pas so //
translated: The word ‚Äúnot planted‚Äù means that the planted seed is not projected because it is changed by water, etc.

original: shi ba'i lus rnams kyi rgyun yang rjes su 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shi ba'i lus rnams kyi rgyun yang rjes su 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The continuum of the body of the dead person would not continue.

original: 'o na ci zhe na shi ma thag tu 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na shi ma thag tu 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: What then? It would be destroyed immediately upon death.

original: gal te yang sa bon ma btab pa dang shi ba'i ro rang gi rgyun kho nas 'jug gi 'phen par byed pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang sa bon ma btab pa dang shi ba'i ro rang gi rgyun kho nas 'jug gi 'phen par byed pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If the seed that is not planted and the body of the dead person continue by their own continuum alone and not by the power of projection,

original: rang gi ngang gis mthar 'jig bzhin //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis mthar 'jig bzhin //
translated: then they would be destroyed by their own nature.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says:

original: 'di ltar phyi'i rkyen la ltos par snying po dang snum zad pa'i mar me 'jig pa'i tshul du rang gi ngang gis mthar yongs su 'gyur bas 'jig pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi'i rkyen la ltos par snying po dang snum zad pa'i mar me 'jig pa'i tshul du rang gi ngang gis mthar yongs su 'gyur bas 'jig pa mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, like a lamp whose oil and wick are exhausted, they are seen to be destroyed by their own nature, depending on external conditions.

original: des na gdon mi za bar 'phen par byed pa zad de de'i phyir de 'du byed kyi rgyun gzhan rgyun chags par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: des na gdon mi za bar 'phen par byed pa zad de de'i phyir de 'du byed kyi rgyun gzhan rgyun chags par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rjes su dpag go //
translated: Therefore, it is inferred that the continuum of the causal process is interrupted because the projecting cause is necessarily exhausted.

original: de ltar phyi dang nang gi sa bon dag 'dra ba nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar phyi dang nang gi sa bon dag 'dra ba nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Having thus shown the similarity of external and internal seeds,

original: phyi rol sa bon ma bsgos pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi 'dra ba nyid brjod do //
analyzed: phyi rol sa bon ma bsgos pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi 'dra ba nyid brjod do //
translated: he states their dissimilarity with ‚ÄúExternal seeds are not moistened, etc.‚Äù

original: 'am zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bsgos pa yang yin @338b pas te /üîΩbsgos pa'i sa bon nyid ni ma tu lung ga'i sa bon rgya skyegs kyi khu bas bskus pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'am zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bsgos pa yang yin @338b pas te / bsgos pa'i sa bon nyid ni ma tu lung ga'i sa bon rgya skyegs kyi khu bas bskus pa rnams so //
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù indicates that they are moistened.üîΩMoistened seeds are barley seeds, etc., moistened by lac solution, etc.

original: ma bsgos pa'i sa bon nyid ni nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma bsgos pa'i sa bon nyid ni nas kyi sa bon la sogs pa'o //
translated: Unmoistened seeds are barley seeds, etc., that are not moistened.

original: nang ni 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nang ni 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: The internal is not like that.

original: gal te sngon med pa skyed pa ste /
analyzed: gal te sngon med pa skyed pa ste /
translated: If it is said that a seed produces what is not previously existent,

original: ji skad du rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa las brjod pa lta bu yang rung gal te chos nyid kyis gnas pa'i sa bon yongs su gsos pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: ji skad du rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa las brjod pa lta bu yang rung gal te chos nyid kyis gnas pa'i sa bon yongs su gsos pa yang rung ste /
translated: then, as stated in the second chapter, either the seed is moistened or the seed abides by its intrinsic nature and is activated.

original: rnam pa thams cad du bsgos pa sa bon nyid yin na phyi rol gyi ni de lta yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du bsgos pa sa bon nyid yin na phyi rol gyi ni de lta yang ma yin no //
translated: If the seed is the cause of the seed, it is not external.üîΩThe seed is the cause of the sprout, etc.üîΩThe seed is the cause of the seed, but not the external seed, because the seed is not the cause of the seed.üîΩThe external seed is not the cause of the seed, because the seed is not the cause of the seed.üîΩThe external seed is not the cause of the seed, because the seed is not the cause of the seed.

original: nang la sogs pa rang dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu bskyed pa'i phyir chu la sogs pas yongs su gsos shing nus pa bzhag pa yang sa bon gyi khyad par yongs su gsos pa zhes ni bya'o //
analyzed: nang la sogs pa rang dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu bskyed pa'i phyir chu la sogs pas yongs su gsos shing nus pa bzhag pa yang sa bon gyi khyad par yongs su gsos pa zhes ni bya'o //
translated: The external seed is not the cause of the seed, because the seed is not the cause of the seed.

original: gzhan dag ni phyi rol sa bon ma btab pa'am zhes bya bar 'don te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni phyi rol sa bon ma btab pa'am zhes bya bar 'don te /
translated: The external seed is not the cause of the seed, because the seed is not the cause of the seed.üîΩThe external seed is not the cause of the seed, because the seed is not the cause of the seed.üîΩThe external seed is not the cause of the seed, because the seed is not the cause of the seed.üîΩThe external seed is not the cause of the seed, because the seed is not the cause of the seed.üîΩThe external seed is not the cause of the seed, because the seed is not the cause of the seed.üîΩThe external seed is not the cause of the seed, because the seed is not the cause of the seed.

original: ma btab pa'i sa bon nyid ni dper na til dang autpala'i rtsa ba dang d'ur ba la sogs pa la go rims bzhin du sol ba dang / ba lang gi lci ba dang / lug bal la sogs pa'i lta bu ste /
analyzed: ma btab pa'i sa bon nyid ni dper na til dang autpala'i rtsa ba dang d'ur ba la sogs pa la go rims bzhin du sol ba dang / ba lang gi lci ba dang / lug bal la sogs pa'i lta bu ste /
translated: The external seed is not the cause of the seed, because the seed is not the cause of the seed.

original: sol ba la sogs pa la til la sogs pa'i sa bon btab pa ni ma yin no //üîΩbtab pa'i sa bon nyid ni nas la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: sol ba la sogs pa la til la sogs pa'i sa bon btab pa ni ma yin no // btab pa'i sa bon nyid ni nas la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: The external seed is not the cause of the seed, because the seed is not the cause of the seed.üîΩThe external seed is not the cause of the seed, because the seed is not the cause of the seed.üîΩThe external seed is not the cause of the seed, because the seed is not the cause of the seed.üîΩThe external seed is not the cause of the seed, because the seed is not the cause of the seed.üîΩThe external seed is not the cause of the seed, because the seed is not the cause of the seed.üîΩThe external seed is not the cause of the seed, because the seed is not the cause of the seed.üîΩThe external seed is not the cause of the seed, because the seed is not the cause of the seed.üîΩThe external seed is not the cause of the seed, because the seed is not the cause of the seed.üîΩThe external seed is not the cause of the seed, because the seed is not the cause of the seed.

original: phyi'i sa bon 'di ni rnam par btags pa'i yin te /
analyzed: phyi'i sa bon 'di ni rnam par btags pa'i yin te /
translated: The external seed is not the cause of the seed, because the seed is not the cause of the

original: nang gi chos nyid kyis gnas pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: nang gi chos nyid kyis gnas pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because the internal is established by the nature of reality.

original: ; sngon med pa bzhag pas sa bon btab pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: ; sngon med pa bzhag pas sa bon btab pa nyid yin na /
translated: If the seed is planted by the establishment of something that did not exist previously,

original: sol ba la sogs pa la ni de ltar btab pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sol ba la sogs pa la ni de ltar btab pa yang ma yin te /
translated: then seeds are not planted in charcoal, etc.,

original: grags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not renowned as seeds.

original: nang gi ni bsgos pa kho na'am btab pa kho na sa bon nyid yin zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: nang gi ni bsgos pa kho na'am btab pa kho na sa bon nyid yin zhe na bshad pa /
translated: If the internal is a seed by virtue of being perfumed or planted, then this is explained:

original: thos sogs bag chags med na ni /
analyzed: thos sogs bag chags med na ni /
translated: If there were no imprints of hearing, etc.,

original: de 'bras te /
analyzed: de 'bras te /
translated: then the result

original: 'bras bu mang du thos pa dang / mngon par shes pa la sogs pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang gal te ma bsgos par til dang autpala'i rtsa ba la sogs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: 'bras bu mang du thos pa dang / mngon par shes pa la sogs pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro // gzhan yang gal te ma bsgos par til dang autpala'i rtsa ba la sogs pa bzhin du /
translated: of hearing, such as higher perception, would not be seen.üîΩMoreover, if the result arose suddenly, like sesame and lotus roots,

original: glo bur du 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur na ni gtong ba can dbul por 'gyur la /
analyzed: glo bur du 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur na ni gtong ba can dbul por 'gyur la /
translated: then the generous would become poor,

original: ser sna can yang dbang phyug nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ser sna can yang dbang phyug nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: and the miser would become wealthy.

original: des na byas dang ma byas 'jig dang 'phrad //
analyzed: des na byas dang ma byas 'jig dang 'phrad //
translated: Therefore, the created and uncreated would meet with destruction,

original: nyes par 'gyur phyir grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes par 'gyur phyir grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and this would be a fault, because it would contradict the tenets of the treatise.

original: byas pa sbyin pa'i sa bon 'jig pa'i phyir dang / ma byas pa dbul po nyid dang phrad cing 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir @339a * //
analyzed: byas pa sbyin pa'i sa bon 'jig pa'i phyir dang / ma byas pa dbul po nyid dang phrad cing 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir @339a * //
translated: because the seed of giving what was done would be destroyed, and because the seed of receiving what was not done would arise.

original: ro ; ; gal te phyi'i sa bon kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: ro ; ; gal te phyi'i sa bon kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa yin na /
translated: If the external seeds are different from the consciousness that is the basis of all,

original: sngar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni sa bon thams cad pa nyid do zhes bshad pa la ji ltar gnod par mi 'gyur ba zhe na /üîΩnang ni phyi rol rkyen yin te //
analyzed: sngar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni sa bon thams cad pa nyid do zhes bshad pa la ji ltar gnod par mi 'gyur ba zhe na / nang ni phyi rol rkyen yin te //
translated: why is it not contradictory to say that the consciousness that is the basis of all is the seed of everything?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs te /
translated: The answer is that the external is a condition for the internal.

original: 'di ltar s'a lu la sogs pa'i sa bon de dag la nye bar spyod par byed pa'i srog chags rnams kyi las kyi bag chags kyi sa bon kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la yod pa dag gis de dag tu snang ba nyid du bsgrubs pa yin no
analyzed: 'di ltar s'a lu la sogs pa'i sa bon de dag la nye bar spyod par byed pa'i srog chags rnams kyi las kyi bag chags kyi sa bon kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la yod pa dag gis de dag tu snang ba nyid du bsgrubs pa yin no
translated: Thus, the seeds of rice, etc., are established as appearing as they do because of the seeds of the habitual tendencies of the karma of the living beings who use them, which exist in the consciousness that is the basis of all.

original: // de bas na de las tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: // de bas na de las tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not different from that.

original: thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i zhar la 'ongs pa sa bon rdzogs so /üîΩ// / thun mong ma yin pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i khongs su gtogs pa nye bar spyod pa can gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang yin pa de bstan par yang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i zhar la 'ongs pa sa bon rdzogs so / // / thun mong ma yin pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i khongs su gtogs pa nye bar spyod pa can gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang yin pa de bstan par yang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The section on the dependent origination that is included in the uncommon dependent origination is the dependent origination that is related to the enjoyment of the six sense objects.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po dag yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po dag yin te /
translated: The consciousnesses that engage are the six consciousnesses of engagement.

original: yang rnam par shes pa drug po dag ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang rnam par shes pa drug po dag ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it says, ‚Äúthe six consciousnesses of engagement,‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir drug po kho na yin zhe na 'di ltar lus dang 'gro ba thams cad du yul 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dang phrad na nye bar spyod pa gtso bar bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang btang snyoms gsal ba yin pas so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir drug po kho na yin zhe na 'di ltar lus dang 'gro ba thams cad du yul 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dang phrad na nye bar spyod pa gtso bar bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang btang snyoms gsal ba yin pas so //
translated: Why are there only six? Because when the body encounters desirable and undesirable objects in all migrations, the six consciousnesses of engagement are the primary factors that clarify the enjoyment of pleasure, pain, and equanimity.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la ni mi srid de mi gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la ni mi srid de mi gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not possible for the store consciousness, because it is not clear.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyang gsal ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyang gsal ba yin mod kyi /
translated: The afflicted mind is clear, but

original: de ni gtsor lta ba gtso bor gyur pa yin gyi tshor ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gtsor lta ba gtso bor gyur pa yin gyi tshor ba ni ma yin no //
translated: it is primarily the view that is the main factor, not feeling.

original: de lta bas na nye bar spyod pa ni gtsor tshor bas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug kho na nye bar spyod pa can yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na nye bar spyod pa ni gtsor tshor bas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug kho na nye bar spyod pa can yin no //
translated: Thus, since the experience is primarily distinguished by feeling, the six active forms of consciousness alone are said to be the ones that have experience.

original: ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said:

original: zhes bya ba ni nye bar spyod pa can nyid kyi khungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nye bar spyod pa can nyid kyi khungs so //
translated: This is the source for the statement that they have experience.

original: gcig ni rkyen gyi rnam par shes //
analyzed: gcig ni rkyen gyi rnam par shes //
translated: One is the consciousness that is a condition.

original: zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa 'bras bu nyid kyang yin mod kyi sa bon gyi rten nyid kyis ni chos rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rkyen gyis rab tu phye ba yin pa la rkyen gyi rnam par shes pa zhes
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa 'bras bu nyid kyang yin mod kyi sa bon gyi rten nyid kyis ni chos rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rkyen gyis rab tu phye ba yin pa la rkyen gyi rnam par shes pa zhes
translated: The store consciousness is indeed the result, but it is distinguished as a condition because it is the cause of the essential nature of all things by being the support for their seeds.

original: bya'o // 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni nye bar spyod pas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir nye bar spyod pa can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o // 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni nye bar spyod pas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir nye bar spyod pa can zhes bya'o //
translated: The active consciousness is called the active one because it is distinguished by activity.

original: nye bar spyod pa ni gtsor 'jug @339b pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa kho na'i tshor ba yin no //
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa ni gtsor 'jug @339b pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa kho na'i tshor ba yin no //
translated: Activity is the feeling that is associated with the active consciousness, which is the principal one.

original: de la mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni yongs gcod do //
analyzed: de la mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni yongs gcod do //
translated: The grasping of signs is the determination.

original: nye bar spyod pa de la 'jug par byed pa ni de dag las gzhan pa'i du byed rnams te gtsor 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa de la 'jug par byed pa ni de dag las gzhan pa'i du byed rnams te gtsor 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems las byung ba rnams yin no //
translated: The other mental factors that cause the activity of the active consciousness are the mental factors associated with the active consciousness, which is the principal one.

original: de lta bas na 'dis ni phyi'i dngos po med kyang srog chags rnams kyi nye bar spyod pa 'byung ba srid par ston to //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dis ni phyi'i dngos po med kyang srog chags rnams kyi nye bar spyod pa 'byung ba srid par ston to //
translated: Thus, this shows that activity is possible for living beings even in the absence of external things.

original: sngar gcig gi rkyen gcig yin par bshad pa de lung gis bstan par chos mngon pa'i mdo las tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sngar gcig gi rkyen gcig yin par bshad pa de lung gis bstan par chos mngon pa'i mdo las tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The verse cited from the Abhidharma S≈´tra shows that the one was previously explained as the condition of the one.

original: rkyen gyi rnam par shes pa zhes bshad pas gzhan rnams ni rkyen ma yin pa nyid du dogs pa de gsal ba'i phyir dang / zhar la 'og nas 'byung ba'i rkyen bstan pa'i phyir yang 'dir bkod do //
analyzed: rkyen gyi rnam par shes pa zhes bshad pas gzhan rnams ni rkyen ma yin pa nyid du dogs pa de gsal ba'i phyir dang / zhar la 'og nas 'byung ba'i rkyen bstan pa'i phyir yang 'dir bkod do //
translated: In order to clarify that, and in order to teach the conditions that will be mentioned below, they are listed here.

original: chos kun rnam par shes pa la sbyor zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kun rnam par shes pa la sbyor zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All phenomena are connected to consciousness.

original: rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las ji skad du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis kyi rkyen byed de /
analyzed: rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdu ba las ji skad du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis kyi rkyen byed de /
translated: As the Compendium of Ascertainments says, the all-base consciousness acts as the condition for the two kinds of active consciousnesses.

original: sa bon gyi ngo bo dang / rten sbyin pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: sa bon gyi ngo bo dang / rten sbyin pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: It does so by being their seed and by being their support.

original: de la sa bon gyi sgo nas ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa gang chung zad 'byung ba de thams cad ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon can yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sa bon gyi sgo nas ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa gang chung zad 'byung ba de thams cad ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon can yin pa'o //
translated: In this regard, in terms of being their seed, whatever active consciousnesses arise, whether virtuous, nonvirtuous, or neutral, they are all the seeds of the all-base consciousness.

original: de la rten sbyin pa'i sgo nas ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pas zin pa'i gzugs can gyi dbang po rnams la brten nas rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga 'byung bar 'gyur gyi ma zin pa dag la ma yin pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i rten bzhin du kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang /
analyzed: de la rten sbyin pa'i sgo nas ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pas zin pa'i gzugs can gyi dbang po rnams la brten nas rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga 'byung bar 'gyur gyi ma zin pa dag la ma yin pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i rten bzhin du kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yod na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang /
translated: In terms of the basis of giving, the five collections of consciousness arise in dependence on the physical sense faculties that are conjoined with the foundation consciousness, but not those that are not conjoined.

original: yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur gyi //
translated: And just as the eye and so on are the basis of the five collections of consciousness, if the foundation consciousness exists, the five collections of consciousness and mental consciousness arise.

original: med na ma yin pa'o //üîΩde la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la rnam pa gnyis kyis rkyen byed de mthong ba'i chos la sa bon yongs su gso ba dang tshe phyi ma la de mngon par grub par bya ba'i phyir sa bon yongs su 'dzin
analyzed: med na ma yin pa'o // de la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la rnam pa gnyis kyis rkyen byed de mthong ba'i chos la sa bon yongs su gso ba dang tshe phyi ma la de mngon par grub par bya ba'i phyir sa bon yongs su 'dzin
translated: But if it does not exist, they do not.

original: pa 'jog pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: pa 'jog pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: The engaging consciousness acts as a condition for the foundation consciousness in two ways: it preserves the seeds of the present life and it establishes the seeds for the next life by depositing them.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba'i chos la sa bon yongs su rgyas na ji lta ji ltar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mi @340a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba'i chos la sa bon yongs su rgyas na ji lta ji ltar kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dge ba dang mi @340a * //
translated: Therefore, if the seeds of the present life are fully developed, then the active consciousnesses supported on the foundation consciousness will be virtuous or nonvirtuous.üîΩ

original: dge ba lung ma bstan pa 'byung ba de lta de ltar rang gi rten la lhan cig 'byung ba dang 'gag pas sgo bar byed do //
analyzed: dge ba lung ma bstan pa 'byung ba de lta de ltar rang gi rten la lhan cig 'byung ba dang 'gag pas sgo bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, when the seeds are fully developed in this life, then the active consciousnesses that arise in dependence on the store consciousness, whether virtuous, nonvirtuous, or indeterminate, will cause their own support to be activated by arising and ceasing together with it.

original: rgyu dang rkyen des na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa phyi ma rnams dge ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor ches rgyas pa dang ches sbyangs pa dang ches gsal bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen des na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa phyi ma rnams dge ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor ches rgyas pa dang ches sbyangs pa dang ches gsal bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: By that cause and condition, the later active consciousnesses will arise with a nature that is more developed, more purified, and more clear, whether virtuous and so on.

original: rkyen gyi le'u'i dbang du mdzad nas gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po la rnam par shes pa de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rkyen gyi le'u'i dbang du mdzad nas gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po la rnam par shes pa de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: From the perspective of the chapter on conditions, the text states, ‚ÄúIf the first dependent origination is consciousness,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshe kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed par nye bar gnas pa de'i tshe ni sa bon de la brten nas ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed par nye bar gnas pa de'i tshe ni sa bon de la brten nas ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa yin la /
translated: When the foundation consciousness is present as the analyzer of the nature of things, then the active consciousnesses are based on its seeds.

original: de la yang brten nas ni mngon par 'du bya ba las byung ba'i kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yin pas de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa can rnam par shes pa de dag dang phan tshun rgyu'i rkyen nyid yin
analyzed: de la yang brten nas ni mngon par 'du bya ba las byung ba'i kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yin pas de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa can rnam par shes pa de dag dang phan tshun rgyu'i rkyen nyid yin
translated: And since the foundational consciousness that arises from compositional activity is based on them, these consciousnesses that arise in dependence on each other and that are mutually conditions of each other are the conditions of the first dependent origination.

original: no // des na shugs kyis ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po ni chos thams cad la rgyu'i rkyen yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: no // des na shugs kyis ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po ni chos thams cad la rgyu'i rkyen yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by implication, it explains that the first dependent origination is the causal condition of all phenomena.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni de rnams la mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa dang / bdag po'i rkyen gyi ngo bor yang gnas pa'i phyir de mtshungs pa de ma thag pa la sogs pa'i rkyen nyid du yang brjod par bya ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni de rnams la mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa dang / bdag po'i rkyen gyi ngo bor yang gnas pa'i phyir de mtshungs pa de ma thag pa la sogs pa'i rkyen nyid du yang brjod par bya ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Since foundation consciousness is the equivalent immediately preceding condition, objective condition and dominant condition for those, isn‚Äôt it also described as the equivalent immediately preceding condition and so on?

original: re zhig mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid ni brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: re zhig mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen nyid ni brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: It is not described as the equivalent immediately preceding condition.

original: rnam par shes pa gang zhig mngon du gyur na rnam par shes pa gzhan skye ba'i gags byed pa la 'gags na skyabs 'byed pas skye ba dang mthun par 'gyur ba de ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang zhig mngon du gyur na rnam par shes pa gzhan skye ba'i gags byed pa la 'gags na skyabs 'byed pas skye ba dang mthun par 'gyur ba de ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin na kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni
translated: If a consciousness that obstructs the arising of another consciousness when it manifests is said to be the equivalent immediately preceding condition, then foundation consciousness is not that because it is not like that.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: Foundation consciousness is not like that for active consciousnesses.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa mngon du gyur bzhin du 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa mngon du gyur bzhin du 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Active consciousnesses arise while foundation consciousness manifests.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen nyid du yang brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen nyid du yang brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: It should not be called the objective condition,

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pas mngon sum du mi dmigs pa nyid kyis dmigs pa'i rkyen dngos ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pas mngon sum du mi dmigs pa nyid kyis dmigs pa'i rkyen dngos ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the actual objective condition, since it is not directly perceived by the eye consciousness, etc.

original: bdag po'i rkyen nyid du yang brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen nyid du yang brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: It should not be called the dominant condition,

original: mi sgrib pa'i ngo bo tsam gyis gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi sgrib pa'i ngo bo tsam gyis gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the principal factor, being merely the non-obstructing nature.

original: 'di ni ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par @340b 'byed par nus pa yang ma yin te rten tsam gyis phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par @340b 'byed par nus pa yang ma yin te rten tsam gyis phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not even capable of being distinguished by its own nature, because it is merely a support that benefits.

original: sngar phan tshun rkyen yin par bsgrubs pa'i phyir dang chos mngon par las kyang tshigs su bcad de bstan pa'i phyir grub par byas nas /
analyzed: sngar phan tshun rkyen yin par bsgrubs pa'i phyir dang chos mngon par las kyang tshigs su bcad de bstan pa'i phyir grub par byas nas /
translated: Since it has already been established that they are mutually conditioning factors, and since it is taught in verse in the Abhidharma,

original: gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po la rnam par shes pa de dag phan tshun du rgyu'i rkyen yin na zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po la rnam par shes pa de dag phan tshun du rgyu'i rkyen yin na zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf the consciousnesses that arise in mutual dependence are the causal condition of each other,‚Äù

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gnyis pa la zhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'gro ba can la'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gnyis pa la zhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'gro ba can la'o //
translated: The second dependent origination is in relation to the realms of the desirable and the undesirable.

original: yang ji ltar sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'gro ba 'grub ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'gro ba 'grub ce na /
translated: How is the establishment of the realms of the desirable and the undesirable?

original: sdug bsngal la kun du rmongs pa bdag nyid bde bar bya ba'i phyir 'du byed rnam pa gsum la 'jug ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la kun du rmongs pa bdag nyid bde bar bya ba'i phyir 'du byed rnam pa gsum la 'jug ste /
translated: Out of delusion about suffering, one engages in the three kinds of action in order to make oneself happy.

original: de dag ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams yin no //
translated: These are the formations with ignorance as their condition.

original: de dag kun du spyod pas ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu rnam par shes pa'i sa bon ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba dang mthun par rnam par gzhag pa ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: de dag kun du spyod pas ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu rnam par shes pa'i sa bon ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ba dang mthun par rnam par gzhag pa ni 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: The performance of these actions establishes the seed of future consciousness, which is the future birth of consciousness, in conformity with the result. This is called consciousness with formations as its condition.

original: ; de de ltar rnam par 'jog pa na ming dang gzugs kyi sa bon yang ma 'ongs pa'i ming dang gzugs skye bar bya ba'i phyir rnam par 'jog pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ; de de ltar rnam par 'jog pa na ming dang gzugs kyi sa bon yang ma 'ongs pa'i ming dang gzugs skye bar bya ba'i phyir rnam par 'jog pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: When it is thus established, the seed of name-and-form is also established in order to generate future name-and-form. This is called ‚Äúname-and-form with consciousness as a condition.‚Äù

original: de yang de ltar rnam par 'jog pa ni skye mched drug gi sa bon yang ma 'ongs pa'i skye mched drug skye bar bya ba'i phyir rnam par 'jog par byed pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces bya'o //
analyzed: de yang de ltar rnam par 'jog pa ni skye mched drug gi sa bon yang ma 'ongs pa'i skye mched drug skye bar bya ba'i phyir rnam par 'jog par byed pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces bya'o //
translated: When that is thus established, the seed of the six sense bases is also established in order to generate future six sense bases. This is called ‚Äúsix sense bases with name-and-form as a condition.‚Äù

original: de yang de ltar rnam par 'jog pa na reg pa'i sa bon yang ma 'ongs pa'i reg pa'i skye bar bya ba'i phyir rnam par 'jog par byed pa ni skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang de ltar rnam par 'jog pa na reg pa'i sa bon yang ma 'ongs pa'i reg pa'i skye bar bya ba'i phyir rnam par 'jog par byed pa ni skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When that is thus established, the seed of contact is also established in order to generate future contact. This is called ‚Äúcontact with the six sense bases as a condition.‚Äù

original: de yang de ltar rnam par 'jog pa na tshor ba'i sa bon ma 'ongs pa'i tshor ba skye bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang de ltar rnam par 'jog pa na tshor ba'i sa bon ma 'ongs pa'i tshor ba skye bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: When that is thus established, the seed of feeling is also established in order to generate future feeling.

original: rnam par 'jog par byed na reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'jog par byed na reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: If it is established as a condition, it is called ‚Äúfeeling conditioned by contact.‚Äù
